BOOK I [I]0-i “ Unexpected obstacle . Please do n’t come till thirtieth . [Anna]67-anna . ”[71-darrow] All the way from [Charing Cross]1-charing cross to [Dover]2-dover [the train]167-the train had hammered the words of the telegram into [George Darrow]71-darrow ’s ears , ringing every change of irony on its commonplace syllables : rattling them out like a discharge of musketry , letting them , one by one , drip slowly and coldly into [his]71-darrow brain , or shaking , tossing , transposing them like the dice in some game of [the gods of malice]168-the gods of malice ; and now , as [he]71-darrow emerged from [[his]71-darrow compartment]169-his compartment at [the pier]170-the pier , and stood facing the wind - swept platform and [the angry sea beyond]171-the angry sea beyond , [they]172-they leapt out at [him]71-darrow as if from the crest of the waves , stung and blinded [him]71-darrow with a fresh fury of derision . “ Unexpected obstacle . Please do n’t come till thirtieth . [Anna]67-anna . ”[173-her] [She]173-her had put [him]71-darrow off at the very last moment , and for the second time : put [him]71-darrow off with all [her]173-her sweet reasonableness , and for one of [her]173-her usual “ good ”[173-her] reasons -- [he]71-darrow was certain that this reason , like the other , ( the visit of [[[her]173-her husband]174-her husband ’s uncle ’s widow]175-her husband ’s uncle ’s widow ) would be “ good ”[173-her] ! But it was that very certainty which chilled [him]71-darrow . The fact of [her]173-her dealing so reasonably with [their]176-their case shed an ironic light on the idea that there had been any exceptional warmth in the greeting [she]173-her had given [him]71-darrow after [their]176-their twelve years apart . [They]176-their had found [each other]177-each other again , in [London]3-london , some three months previously , at a dinner at [the American Embassy]178-the american embassy , and when [she]173-her had caught sight of [him]71-darrow [her]173-her smile had been like a red rose pinned on [[her]173-her widow]179-her widow ’s mourning . [He]71-darrow still felt the throb of surprise with which , among the stereotyped faces of [the season ’s diners]180-the season ’s diners , [he]71-darrow had come upon [her]173-her unexpected face , with the dark hair banded above grave eyes ; eyes in which [he]71-darrow had recognized every little curve and shadow as [he]71-darrow would have recognized , after half a life - time , the details of [a room [he]71-darrow had played in as [a child]182-a child]181-a room he had played in as a child . And as , in [the plumed starred crowd]183-the plumed starred crowd , [she]173-her had stood out for [him]71-darrow , slender , secluded and different , so [he]71-darrow had felt , the instant [their]184-their glances met , that [he]71-darrow as sharply detached [himself]71-darrow for [her]173-her . All that and more [her]173-her smile had said ; had said not merely “ [I]173-her remember , ”[173-her] but “ [I]173-her remember just what [you]71-darrow remember ”[173-her] ; almost , indeed , as though [her]173-her memory had aided [his]71-darrow , [her]173-her glance flung back on [their]184-their recaptured moment its morning brightness . Certainly , when [their]184-their distracted Ambassadress -- with the cry : “ Oh , [you]71-darrow know [Mrs. Leath]69-mrs. leath ? That ’s perfect , for [General Farnham]70-general farnham has failed [me”--had]71-darrow[173-her] waved [them]184-their together for the march to [the dining - room]185-the dining - room , [Darrow]71-darrow had felt a slight pressure of the arm on [his]71-darrow , a pressure faintly but unmistakably emphasizing the exclamation : “ Is n’t it wonderful?--In [London]3-london -- in the season -- in [a mob]2279-a mob ? ”[173-her] Little enough , on the part of [most women]186-most women ; but it was a sign of [Mrs. Leath]69-mrs. leath ’s quality that every movement , every syllable , told with [her]173-her . Even in the old days , as [an intent grave - eyed girl]187-an intent grave - eyed girl , [she]173-her had seldom misplaced [her]173-her light strokes ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , on meeting [her]173-her again , had immediately felt how much finer and surer an instrument of expression [she]173-her had become . [Their]184-their evening together had been a long confirmation of this feeling . [She]173-her had talked to [him]71-darrow , shyly yet frankly , of what had happened to [her]173-her during the years when [they]184-their had so strangely failed to meet . [She]173-her had told [him]71-darrow of [her]173-her marriage to [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath , and of [her]173-her subsequent life in [France]4-france , where [[her]173-her husband ’s mother]188-her husband ’s mother , left [a widow]189-a widow in [his]72-fraser leath youth , had been re - married to [the Marquis de Chantelle]73-the marquis de chantelle , and where , partly in consequence of this second union , [the son]190-the son had permanently settled [himself]190-the son . [She]173-her had spoken also , with an intense eagerness of affection , of [[her]173-her little girl]191-her little girl [Effie]74-effie , who was now nine years old , and , in a strain hardly less tender , of [Owen Leath]75-owen , [the charming clever young stepson whom [[her]173-her husband]174-her husband ’s death had left to [her]173-her care]192-the charming clever young stepson whom her husband ’s death had left to her care ... [A porter]194-a porter , stumbling against [Darrow]71-darrow ’s bags , roused [him]71-darrow to the fact that [he]71-darrow still obstructed the platform , inert and encumbering as [his]71-darrow luggage . “ Crossing , [sir]2280-sir ? ”[71-darrow] Was [he]71-darrow crossing ? [He]71-darrow really did n’t know ; but for lack of any more compelling impulse [he]71-darrow followed [the porter]195-the porter to [the luggage van]196-the luggage van , singled out [[his]71-darrow property]197-his property , and turned to march behind [it]197-his property down [the gang - way]198-the gang - way . As the fierce wind shouldered [him]71-darrow , building up a crystal wall against [his]71-darrow efforts , [he]71-darrow felt anew the derision of [his]71-darrow case . “ Nasty weather to cross , [sir]2280-sir , ”[195-the porter] [the porter]195-the porter threw back at [him]71-darrow as [they]200-they beat [their]200-they way down [the narrow walk]201-the narrow walk to [the pier]170-the pier . Nasty weather , indeed ; but luckily , as it had turned out , there was no earthly reason why [Darrow]71-darrow should cross . While [he]71-darrow pushed on in the wake of [his]71-darrow luggage [his]71-darrow thoughts slipped back into the old groove . [He]71-darrow had once or twice run across [the man whom [Anna Summers]67-anna had preferred to [him]71-darrow]203-the man whom anna summers had preferred to him , and since [he]71-darrow had met [her]67-anna again [he]71-darrow had been exercising [his]71-darrow imagination on the picture of what [her]67-anna married life must have been . [[Her]67-anna husband]174-her husband had struck [him]71-darrow as a characteristic specimen of the kind of American as to whom one is not quite clear whether [he]71-darrow lives in [Europe]5-europe in order to cultivate an art , or cultivates an art as a pretext for living in [Europe]5-europe . [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath ’s art was water - colour painting , but [he]76-mr. leath practised it furtively , almost clandestinely , with the disdain of [a man of [the world]206-the world]205-a man of the world for anything bordering on the professional , while [he]76-mr. leath devoted [himself]76-mr. leath more openly , and with religious seriousness , to the collection of enamelled snuff - boxes . [He]76-mr. leath was blond and well - dressed , with the physical distinction that comes from having a straight figure , a thin nose , and the habit of looking slightly disgusted -- as who should not , in a world where authentic snuff - boxes were growing daily harder to find , and the market was flooded with flagrant forgeries ? [Darrow]71-darrow had often wondered what possibilities of communion there could have been between [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath and [[his]76-mr. leath wife]207-his wife . Now [he]71-darrow concluded that there had probably been none . [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s words gave no hint of [[her]75-owen husband]174-her husband ’s having failed to justify [her]75-owen choice ; but [her]75-owen very reticence betrayed [her]75-owen . [She]75-owen spoke of [him]76-mr. leath with a kind of impersonal seriousness , as if [he]76-mr. leath had been a character in a novel or [a figure in history]209-a figure in history ; and what [she]75-owen said sounded as though it had been learned by heart and slightly dulled by repetition . This fact immensely increased [Darrow]71-darrow ’s impression that [his]71-darrow meeting with [her]75-owen had annihilated the intervening years . [She]75-owen , who was always so elusive and inaccessible , had grown suddenly communicative and kind : had opened the doors of [her]75-owen past , and tacitly left [him]71-darrow to draw [his]71-darrow own conclusions . As a result , [he]71-darrow had taken leave of [her]75-owen with the sense that [he]71-darrow was [a being singled out and privileged]210-a being singled out and privileged , to whom [she]75-owen had entrusted something precious to keep . It was [her]75-owen happiness in [their]211-their meeting that [she]75-owen had given [him]71-darrow , had frankly left [him]71-darrow to do with as [he]71-darrow willed ; and the frankness of the gesture doubled the beauty of the gift . [Their]211-their next meeting had prolonged and deepened the impression . [They]211-their had found [each other]177-each other again , a few days later , in [an old country house full of books and pictures]213-an old country house full of books and pictures , in [the soft landscape of [southern England]8-england]214-the soft landscape of southern england . The presence of [a large party]215-a large party , with all its aimless and agitated displacements , had served only to isolate [the pair]216-the pair and give [them]216-the pair ( at least to [the young man]217-the young man ’s fancy ) a deeper feeling of communion , and [their]211-their days there had been like some musical prelude , where the instruments , breathing low , seem to hold back the waves of sound that press against [them]211-their . [Mrs. Leath]75-owen , on this occasion , was no less kind than before ; but [she]75-owen contrived to make [him]71-darrow understand that what was so inevitably coming was not to come too soon . It was not that [she]75-owen showed any hesitation as to the issue , but rather that [she]75-owen seemed to wish not to miss any stage in the gradual reflowering of [their]211-their intimacy . [Darrow]71-darrow , for [his]71-darrow part , was content to wait if [she]75-owen wished it . [He]71-darrow remembered that once , in [America]7-america , when [she]75-owen was [a girl]218-a girl , and [he]71-darrow had gone to stay with [[her]75-owen family]219-her family in [the country]220-the country , [she]75-owen had been out when [he]71-darrow arrived , and [[her]75-owen mother]221-her mother had told [him]71-darrow to look for [her]75-owen in [the garden]222-the garden . [She]75-owen was not in [the garden]222-the garden , but beyond it [he]71-darrow had seen [her]75-owen approaching down [a long shady path]224-a long shady path . Without hastening [her]75-owen step [she]75-owen had smiled and signed to [him]71-darrow to wait ; and charmed by the lights and shadows that played upon [her]75-owen as [she]75-owen moved , and by the pleasure of watching [her]75-owen slow advance toward [him]71-darrow , [he]71-darrow had obeyed [her]75-owen and stood still . And so [she]75-owen seemed now to be walking to [him]71-darrow down the years , the light and shade of old memories and new hopes playing variously on [her]75-owen , and each step giving [him]71-darrow the vision of a different grace . [She]75-owen did not waver or turn aside ; [he]71-darrow knew [she]75-owen would come straight to where [he]71-darrow stood ; but something in [her]75-owen eyes said “ Wait ”[75-owen] , and again [he]71-darrow obeyed and waited . On the fourth day an unexpected event threw out [his]71-darrow calculations . Summoned to [town]225-town by the arrival in [England]8-england of [[her]75-owen husband ’s mother]188-her husband ’s mother , [she]75-owen left without giving [Darrow]71-darrow the chance [he]71-darrow had counted on , and [he]71-darrow cursed [himself]71-darrow for a dilatory blunderer . Still , [his]71-darrow disappointment was tempered by the certainty of being with [her]75-owen again before [she]75-owen left for [France]4-france ; and [they]227-they did in fact see [each other]177-each other in [London]3-london . There , however , the atmosphere had changed with the conditions . [He]71-darrow could not say that [she]75-owen avoided [him]71-darrow , or even that [she]75-owen was a shade less glad to see [him]71-darrow ; but [she]75-owen was beset by family duties and , as [he]71-darrow thought , a little too readily resigned to [them]229-them . [The Marquise de Chantelle]77-the marquise de chantelle , as [Darrow]71-darrow soon perceived , had the same mild formidableness as [the late Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath : a sort of insistent self - effacement before which every one about [her]75-owen gave way . It was perhaps the shadow of [this lady]230-this lady ’s presence -- pervasive even during [her]75-owen actual brief eclipses -- that subdued and silenced [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . [The latter]231-the latter was , moreover , preoccupied about [[her]75-owen stepson]232-her stepson , who , soon after receiving [his]232-her stepson degree at Harvard , had been rescued from a stormy love - affair , and finally , after some months of troubled drifting , had yielded to [[his]232-her stepson step - mother]233-his step - mother ’s counsel and gone up to [Oxford]9-oxford for a year of supplementary study . [Thither Mrs. Leath]69-mrs. leath went once or twice to visit [him]71-darrow , and [her]75-owen remaining days were packed with family obligations : getting , as [she]75-owen phrased it , “ frocks and [governesses]2282-governesses ”[75-owen] for [[[her]75-owen little girl]191-her little girl , who had been left in [France]4-france , and having to devote the remaining hours to long shopping expeditions with [[her]75-owen mother - in - law]236-her mother - in - law]235-her little girl , who had been left in france , and having to devote the remaining hours to long shopping expeditions with her mother - in - law . Nevertheless , during [her]75-owen brief escapes from duty , [Darrow]71-darrow had had time to feel [her]75-owen safe in the custody of [his]71-darrow devotion , set apart for some inevitable hour ; and the last evening , at [the theatre]237-the theatre , between [the overshadowing Marquise]77-the marquise de chantelle and [the unsuspicious Owen]75-owen , [they]238-they had had an almost decisive exchange of words . Now , in the rattle of the wind about [his]71-darrow ears , [Darrow]71-darrow continued to hear the mocking echo of [her]75-owen message : “ Unexpected obstacle . ”[75-owen] In such an existence as [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s , at once so ordered and so exposed , [he]71-darrow knew how small a complication might assume the magnitude of an “ obstacle ; ”[71-darrow] yet , even allowing as impartially as [his]71-darrow state of mind permitted for the fact that , with [[her]75-owen mother - in - law]236-her mother - in - law always , and [[her]75-owen stepson]232-her stepson intermittently , under [her]75-owen roof , [her]75-owen lot involved a hundred small accommodations generally foreign to the freedom of widowhood -- even so , [he]71-darrow could not but think that the very ingenuity bred of such conditions might have helped [her]75-owen to find a way out of them . No , [her]75-owen “ reason ”[75-owen] , whatever it was , could , in this case , be nothing but a pretext ; unless [he]71-darrow leaned to the less flattering alternative that any reason seemed good enough for postponing [him]71-darrow ! Certainly , if [her]75-owen welcome had meant what [he]71-darrow imagined , [she]75-owen could not , for the second time within a few weeks , have submitted so tamely to the disarrangement of [their]241-their plans ; a disarrangement which -- [his]71-darrow official duties considered -- might , for all [she]75-owen knew , result in [his]71-darrow not being able to go to [her]75-owen for months . “ Please do n’t come till thirtieth . ”[75-owen] The thirtieth -- and it was now the fifteenth ! [She]75-owen flung back the fortnight on [his]71-darrow hands as if [he]71-darrow had been [an idler indifferent to dates]242-an idler indifferent to dates , instead of [an active young diplomatist who , to respond to [her]75-owen call , had had to hew [his]71-darrow way through a very jungle of engagements]243-an active young diplomatist who , to respond to her call , had had to hew his way through a very jungle of engagements ! “ Please do n’t come till thirtieth . ”[75-owen] That was all . Not the shadow of an excuse or a regret ; not even the perfunctory “ have written ”[75-owen] with which it is usual to soften such blows . [She]75-owen did n’t want [him]71-darrow , and had taken the shortest way to tell [him]71-darrow so . Even in [his]71-darrow first moment of exasperation it struck [him]71-darrow as characteristic that [she]75-owen should not have padded [her]75-owen postponement with a fib . Certainly [her]75-owen moral angles were not draped ! “ If [I]71-darrow asked [her]75-owen to marry [me]71-darrow , [she]75-owen ’d have refused in the same language . But thank heaven [I]71-darrow have n’t ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow reflected . These considerations , which had been with [him]71-darrow every yard of the way from [London]3-london , reached a climax of irony as [he]71-darrow was drawn into [the crowd on the pier]244-the crowd on the pier . It did not soften [his]71-darrow feelings to remember that , but for [her]75-owen lack of forethought , [he]71-darrow might , at this harsh end of the stormy May day , have been sitting before [his]71-darrow club fire in [London]3-london instead of shivering in the damp human herd on [the pier]170-the pier . Admitting [the sex]246-the sex ’s traditional right to change , [she]75-owen might at least have advised [him]71-darrow of [hers]75-owen by telegraphing directly to [[his]71-darrow rooms]247-his rooms . But in spite of [their]248-their exchange of letters [she]75-owen had apparently failed to note [his]71-darrow address , and [a breathless emissary]249-a breathless emissary had rushed from [the Embassy]250-the embassy to pitch [her]75-owen telegram into [[his]71-darrow compartment]169-his compartment as [the train]167-the train was moving from [the station]253-the station . Yes , [he]71-darrow had given [her]75-owen chance enough to learn where [he]71-darrow lived ; and this minor proof of [her]75-owen indifference became , as [he]71-darrow jammed [his]71-darrow way through [the crowd]254-the crowd , the main point of [his]71-darrow grievance against [her]75-owen and of [his]71-darrow derision of [himself]71-darrow . Half way down [the pier]170-the pier the prod of an umbrella increased [his]71-darrow exasperation by rousing [him]71-darrow to the fact that it was raining . Instantly the narrow ledge became a battle - ground of thrusting , slanting , parrying domes . The wind rose with the rain , and [the harried wretches exposed to this double assault]256-the harried wretches exposed to this double assault wreaked on [[their]256-the harried wretches exposed to this double assault neighbours]257-their neighbours the vengeance [they]256-the harried wretches exposed to this double assault could not take on the elements . [Darrow]71-darrow , whose healthy enjoyment of life made [him]71-darrow in general [a good traveller , tolerant of agglutinated humanity]258-a good traveller , tolerant of agglutinated humanity , felt [himself]71-darrow obscurely outraged by these promiscuous contacts . It was as though [all the people about [him]71-darrow]259-all the people about him had taken [his]71-darrow measure and known [his]71-darrow plight ; as though [they]259-all the people about him were contemptuously bumping and shoving [him]71-darrow like the inconsiderable thing [he]71-darrow had become . “ [She]2283-she does n’t want [you]71-darrow , does n’t want [you]71-darrow , does n’t want [you]71-darrow , ”[259-all the people about him] [their]259-all the people about him umbrellas and [their]259-all the people about him elbows seemed to say . [He]71-darrow had rashly vowed , when the telegram was flung into [his]71-darrow window : “ At any rate [I]71-darrow wo n’t turn back”--as[71-darrow] though it might cause [the sender]260-the sender a malicious joy to have [him]260-the sender retrace [his]260-the sender steps rather than keep on to [Paris]10-paris ! Now [he]71-darrow perceived the absurdity of the vow , and thanked [his]71-darrow stars that [he]71-darrow need not plunge , to no purpose , into the fury of waves outside [the harbour]261-the harbour . With this thought in [his]71-darrow mind [he]71-darrow turned back to look for [[his]71-darrow porter]262-his porter ; but the contiguity of dripping umbrellas made signalling impossible and , perceiving that [he]71-darrow had lost sight of [the man]263-the man , [he]71-darrow scrambled up again to [the platform]264-the platform . As [he]71-darrow reached [it]264-the platform , a descending umbrella caught [him]71-darrow in the collar - bone ; and the next moment , bent sideways by the wind , it turned inside out and soared up , kite - wise , at the end of a helpless female arm . [Darrow]71-darrow caught the umbrella , lowered its inverted ribs , and looked up at the face [it]264-the platform exposed to [him]71-darrow . “ Wait a minute , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said ; “ [you]266-the owner of the umbrella ca n’t stay here . ”[71-darrow] As [he]71-darrow spoke , a surge of [the crowd]254-the crowd drove [the owner of the umbrella]266-the owner of the umbrella abruptly down on [him]71-darrow . [Darrow]71-darrow steadied [her]266-the owner of the umbrella with extended arms , and regaining [her]266-the owner of the umbrella footing [she]266-the owner of the umbrella cried out : “ Oh , dear , oh , dear ! It ’s in ribbons ! ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] [Her]266-the owner of the umbrella lifted face , fresh and flushed in the driving rain , woke in [him]71-darrow a memory of having seen it at a distant time and in a vaguely unsympathetic setting ; but it was no moment to follow up such clues , and the face was obviously one to make its way on its own merits . [Its possessor]267-its possessor had dropped [her]266-the owner of the umbrella bag and bundles to clutch at the tattered umbrella . “ [I]266-the owner of the umbrella bought it only yesterday at [the Stores]2284-the stores ; and -- yes -- it ’s utterly done for ! ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] [she]266-the owner of the umbrella lamented . [Darrow]71-darrow smiled at the intensity of [her]266-the owner of the umbrella distress . It was food for [the moralist]268-the moralist that , side by side with such catastrophes as [his]71-darrow , human nature was still agitating itself over its microscopic woes ! “ Here ’s [mine]71-darrow if [you]266-the owner of the umbrella want it ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow shouted back at [her]266-the owner of the umbrella through the shouting of the gale . The offer caused [the young lady]269-the young lady to look at [him]71-darrow more intently . “ Why , it ’s [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow ! ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] [she]266-the owner of the umbrella exclaimed ; and then , all radiant recognition : “ Oh , thank [you]71-darrow ! [We]270-we ’ll share it , if [you]71-darrow will . ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] [She]266-the owner of the umbrella knew [him]71-darrow , then ; and [he]71-darrow knew [her]266-the owner of the umbrella ; but how and where had [they]270-we met ? [He]71-darrow put aside the problem for subsequent solution , and drawing [her]266-the owner of the umbrella into [a more sheltered corner]271-a more sheltered corner , bade [her]266-the owner of the umbrella wait till [he]71-darrow could find [[his]71-darrow porter]262-his porter . When , a few minutes later , [he]71-darrow came back with [his]71-darrow recovered property , and the news that [the boat]273-the boat would not leave till the tide had turned , [she]266-the owner of the umbrella showed no concern . “ Not for two hours ? How lucky -- then [I]266-the owner of the umbrella can find [my]266-the owner of the umbrella trunk ! ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] Ordinarily [Darrow]71-darrow would have felt little disposed to involve [himself]71-darrow in the adventure of [a young female who had lost [her]274-a young female who had lost her trunk trunk]274-a young female who had lost her trunk ; but at the moment [he]71-darrow was glad of any pretext for activity . Even should [he]71-darrow decide to take [the next up train]275-the next up train from [Dover]2-dover [he]71-darrow still had a yawning hour to fill ; and the obvious remedy was to devote it to the loveliness in distress under [his]71-darrow umbrella . “ [You]266-the owner of the umbrella ’ve lost a trunk ? Let [me]266-the owner of the umbrella see if [I]266-the owner of the umbrella can find it . ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] It pleased [him]71-darrow that [she]266-the owner of the umbrella did not return the conventional “ Oh , WOULD [you]71-darrow ? ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] Instead , [she]266-the owner of the umbrella corrected [him]71-darrow with a laugh--“Not a trunk , but [my]266-the owner of the umbrella trunk ; [I]266-the owner of the umbrella ’ve no other-- ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] and then added briskly : “ [You]71-darrow ’d better first see to getting [your]71-darrow own things on [the boat]273-the boat . ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] This made [him]71-darrow answer , as if to give substance to [his]71-darrow plans by discussing them : “ [I]266-the owner of the umbrella do n’t actually know that [I]266-the owner of the umbrella ’m going over . ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] “ Not going over ? ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] “ Well ... perhaps not by [this boat]2286-this boat . ”[266-the owner of the umbrella] Again [he]71-darrow felt a stealing indecision . “ [I]71-darrow may probably have to go back to [London]3-london . [I’m]71-darrow -- [I’m]71-darrow waiting ... expecting a letter ... (She’ll think [me]71-darrow [a defaulter]2287-a defaulter , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow reflected . ) “ But meanwhile there ’s plenty of time to find [your]276-his companion trunk . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow picked up [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s bundles , and offered [her]276-his companion an arm which enabled [her]276-his companion to press [her]276-his companion slight person more closely under [his]71-darrow umbrella ; and as , thus linked , [they]277-they beat [their]277-they way back to [the platform]264-the platform , pulled together and apart like [marionettes on the wires of the wind]279-marionettes on the wires of the wind , [he]71-darrow continued to wonder where [he]71-darrow could have seen [her]276-his companion . [He]71-darrow had immediately classed [her]276-his companion as [a compatriot]280-a compatriot ; [her]276-his companion small nose , [her]276-his companion clear tints , a kind of sketchy delicacy in [her]276-his companion face , as though [she]276-his companion had been brightly but lightly washed in with water - colour , all confirmed the evidence of [her]276-his companion high sweet voice and of [her]276-his companion quick incessant gestures . [She]276-his companion was clearly [an American]281-an american , but with the loose native quality strained through a closer woof of manners : the composite product of [an enquiring and adaptable race]282-an enquiring and adaptable race . All this , however , did not help [him]71-darrow to fit a name to [her]276-his companion , for just such instances were perpetually pouring through the [London Embassy]11-london embassy , and [the etched and angular American]283-the etched and angular american was becoming rarer than the fluid type . More puzzling than the fact of [his]71-darrow being unable to identify [her]276-his companion was the persistent sense connecting [her]276-his companion with something uncomfortable and distasteful . So pleasant a vision as that gleaming up at [him]71-darrow between wet brown hair and wet brown boa should have evoked only associations as pleasing ; but each effort to fit [her]276-his companion image into [his]71-darrow past resulted in the same memories of boredom and a vague discomfort ... II “ Do n’t [you]71-darrow remember [me]276-his companion now -- at [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s ? ”[276-his companion] [She]276-his companion threw the question at [Darrow]71-darrow across a table of [the quiet coffee - room]284-the quiet coffee - room to which , after a vainly prolonged quest for [her]276-his companion trunk , [he]71-darrow had suggested taking [her]276-his companion for a cup of tea . In this musty retreat [she]276-his companion had removed [her]276-his companion dripping hat , hung it on the fender to dry , and stretched [herself]276-his companion on tiptoe in front of the round eagle - crowned mirror , above the mantel vases of dyed immortelles , while [she]276-his companion ran [her]276-his companion fingers comb - wise through [her]276-his companion hair . The gesture had acted on [Darrow]71-darrow ’s numb feelings as the glow of the fire acted on [his]71-darrow circulation ; and when [he]71-darrow had asked : “ Are n’t [your]276-his companion feet wet , too ? ”[71-darrow] and , after frank inspection of a stout - shod sole , [she]276-his companion had answered cheerfully : “ No -- luckily [I]276-his companion had on [my]276-his companion new boots , ”[276-his companion] [he]71-darrow began to feel that human intercourse would still be tolerable if it were always as free from formality . The removal of [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s hat , besides provoking this reflection , gave [him]71-darrow [his]71-darrow first full sight of [her]276-his companion face ; and this was so favourable that the name [she]276-his companion now pronounced fell on [him]71-darrow with a quite disproportionate shock of dismay . “ Oh , [Mrs. Murrett’s]79-mrs. murrett’s -- was it THERE ? ”[276-his companion] [He]71-darrow remembered [her]276-his companion now , of course : remembered [her]276-his companion as [one of the shadowy sidling presences in the background of [that awful house in [Chelsea]12-chelsea]287-that awful house in chelsea]286-one of the shadowy sidling presences in the background of that awful house in chelsea , [one of the dumb appendages of the shrieking unescapable [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett , into whose talons [he]71-darrow had fallen in the course of [his]71-darrow head - long pursuit of [Lady Ulrica Crispin]80-lady ulrica]288-one of the dumb appendages of the shrieking unescapable mrs. murrett , into whose talons he had fallen in the course of his head - long pursuit of lady ulrica crispin . Oh , the taste of stale follies ! How insipid it was , yet how it clung ! “ [I]276-his companion used to pass [you]71-darrow on the stairs , ”[276-his companion] [she]276-his companion reminded [him]71-darrow . Yes : [he]71-darrow had seen [her]276-his companion slip by -- [he]71-darrow recalled it now -- as [he]71-darrow dashed up to [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room in quest of [Lady Ulrica]80-lady ulrica . The thought made [him]71-darrow steal a longer look . How could such a face have been merged in [the Murrett mob]290-the murrett mob ? Its fugitive slanting lines , that lent themselves to all manner of tender tilts and foreshortenings , had the freakish grace of [some young head of the Italian comedy]291-some young head of the italian comedy . The hair stood up from [her]276-his companion forehead in a boyish elf - lock , and its colour matched [her]276-his companion auburn eyes flecked with black , and the little brown spot on [her]276-his companion cheek , between the ear that was meant to have a rose behind it and the chin that should have rested on a ruff . When [she]276-his companion smiled , the left corner of [her]276-his companion mouth went up a little higher than the right ; and [her]276-his companion smile began in [her]276-his companion eyes and ran down to [her]276-his companion lips in two lines of light . [He]71-darrow had dashed past that to reach [Lady Ulrica Crispin]80-lady ulrica ! “ But of course [you]71-darrow would n’t remember [me]276-his companion , ”[276-his companion] [she]276-his companion was saying . “ [My]276-his companion name is [Viner]81-sophy viner -- [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . ”[276-his companion] Not remember [her]276-his companion ? [The girl]297-the girl had stuff in [her]297-the girl -- [he]296-you saw it ; and [she]82-miss viner seemed to catch the perception in [his]296-you eyes . “ That ’s the kind of education [I]82-miss viner got at [Mrs. Murrett’s]79-mrs. murrett’s -- and [I]82-miss viner never had any other , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner said with a shrug . “ [Good Lord]89-good lord -- were [you]296-you [there]2294-there so long ? ”[82-miss viner] “ Five years . [Darrow]71-darrow , surprised by the change , but accepting [her]82-miss viner rebuff as a phase of what [he]71-darrow guessed to be a confused and tormented mood , rose from [his]71-darrow seat and lifted [her]82-miss viner jacket from the chair - back on which [she]82-miss viner had hung it to dry . As [he]71-darrow held it toward [her]82-miss viner [she]82-miss viner looked up at [him]71-darrow quickly . “ The truth is , [we]2317-we quarrelled , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner broke out , “ and [I]82-miss viner left last night without [my]82-miss viner dinner -- and without [my]82-miss viner salary . ”[82-miss viner] “ Ah-- ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow groaned , with a sharp perception of all the sordid dangers that might attend such a break with [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett . “ And without [a character]2318-a character ! ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner added , as [she]82-miss viner slipped [her]82-miss viner arms into the jacket . “ And without a trunk , as it appears -- but did n’t [you]71-darrow say that , before going , there ’d be time for another look at [the station]253-the station ? ”[82-miss viner] There was time for another look at [the station]253-the station ; but the look again resulted in disappointment , since [her]82-miss viner trunk was nowhere to be found in the huge heap disgorged by [the newly - arrived [London]3-london express]299-the newly - arrived london express . The fact caused [Miss Viner]82-miss viner a moment ’s perturbation ; but [she]82-miss viner promptly adjusted [herself]82-miss viner to the necessity of proceeding on [her]82-miss viner journey , and [her]82-miss viner decision confirmed [Darrow]71-darrow ’s vague resolve to go to [Paris]10-paris instead of retracing [his]71-darrow way to [London]3-london . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner seemed cheered at the prospect of [his]71-darrow company , and sustained by [his]71-darrow offer to telegraph to [Charing Cross]1-charing cross for the missing trunk ; and [he]71-darrow left [her]82-miss viner to wait in the fly while [he]71-darrow hastened back to [the telegraph office]300-the telegraph office . The enquiry despatched , [he]71-darrow was turning away from the desk when another thought struck [him]71-darrow and [he]71-darrow went back and indited a message to [[his]71-darrow servant]301-his servant in [London]3-london : “ If any letters with French post - mark received since departure forward immediately to [Terminus Hotel Gare du Nord Paris]2320-terminus hotel gare du nord paris . ”[71-darrow] Then [he]71-darrow rejoined [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , and [they]302-they drove off through the rain to [the pier]170-the pier . [III]91-iii Almost as soon as [the train]167-the train left [Calais]13-calais [her]82-miss viner head had dropped back into the corner , and [she]82-miss viner had fallen asleep . Sitting opposite , in [the compartment from which [he]71-darrow had contrived to have [other travellers]306-other travellers excluded]305-the compartment from which he had contrived to have other travellers excluded , [Darrow]71-darrow looked at [her]82-miss viner curiously . [He]71-darrow had never seen a face that changed so quickly . A moment since it had danced like a field of daisies in a summer breeze ; now , under the pallid oscillating light of the lamp overhead , it wore the hard stamp of experience , as of a soft thing chilled into shape before its curves had rounded : and it moved [him]71-darrow to see that care already stole upon [her]82-miss viner when [she]82-miss viner slept . The story [she]82-miss viner had imparted to [him]71-darrow in the wheezing shaking cabin , and at [the [Calais]13-calais buffet -- where [he]71-darrow had insisted on offering [her]82-miss viner the dinner [she]82-miss viner had missed at [Mrs. Murrett’s]79-mrs. murrett’s]307-the calais buffet -- where he had insisted on offering her the dinner she had missed at mrs. murrett’s -- had given a distincter outline to [her]82-miss viner figure . From the moment of entering [the [New York]14-new york boarding - school]308-the new york boarding - school to which [a preoccupied guardian]309-a preoccupied guardian had hastily consigned [her]82-miss viner after the death of [[her]82-miss viner parents]310-her parents , [she]82-miss viner had found [herself]82-miss viner alone in [a busy and indifferent world]311-a busy and indifferent world . [Her]82-miss viner youthful history might , in fact , have been summed up in the statement that [everybody]312-everybody had been too busy to look after [her]82-miss viner . [[Her]82-miss viner guardian]313-her guardian , [a drudge in [a big banking house]315-a big banking house]314-a drudge in a big banking house , was absorbed by “ [the office ”]2321-the office ”[316-the guardian] ; [[the guardian]316-the guardian ’s wife]317-the guardian ’s wife , by [her]317-the guardian ’s wife health and [her]317-the guardian ’s wife religion ; and [an elder sister]318-an elder sister , [Laura]92-laura , married , unmarried , remarried , and pursuing , through all these alternating phases , some vaguely “ artistic ”[316-the guardian] ideal on which [the guardian]316-the guardian and [[his]316-the guardian wife]207-his wife looked askance , had ( as [Darrow]71-darrow conjectured ) taken [their]321-their disapproval as a pretext for not troubling [herself]82-miss viner about poor [Sophy]81-sophy viner , to whom -- perhaps for this reason -- [she]81-sophy viner had remained [the incarnation of remote romantic possibilities]322-the incarnation of remote romantic possibilities . In the course of time a sudden “ stroke ”[316-the guardian] of [the guardian]316-the guardian ’s had thrown [his]316-the guardian personal affairs into a state of confusion from which -- after [his]316-the guardian widely lamented death -- it became evident that it would not be possible to extricate [[his]316-the guardian ward]324-his ward ’s inheritance . [No one]325-no one deplored this more sincerely than [[his]316-the guardian widow]326-his widow , who saw in it one more proof of [[her]326-his widow husband]174-her husband ’s life having been sacrificed to the innumerable duties imposed on [him]316-the guardian , and who could hardly -- but for the counsels of religion -- have brought [herself]326-his widow to pardon [the young girl]328-the young girl for [her]326-his widow indirect share in hastening [his]316-the guardian end . [Sophy]81-sophy viner did not resent this point of view . [She]81-sophy viner was really much sorrier for [[her]81-sophy viner guardian]313-her guardian ’s death than for the loss of [her]81-sophy viner insignificant fortune . [The latter]231-the latter had represented only the means of holding [her]81-sophy viner in bondage , and its disappearance was the occasion of [her]81-sophy viner immediate plunge into the wide bright sea of life surrounding [the island]331-the island -- of [her]81-sophy viner captivity . [She]81-sophy viner had first landed -- thanks to the intervention of [the ladies who had directed [her]81-sophy viner education]332-the ladies who had directed her education -- in [[a Fifth Avenue school]333-a fifth avenue school - room]334-a fifth avenue school - room where , for a few months , [she]81-sophy viner acted as a buffer between [three autocratic infants]335-three autocratic infants and [[their]335-three autocratic infants bodyguard of [nurses]337-nurses and [teachers]338-teachers]336-their bodyguard of nurses and teachers . The too - pressing attentions of [[[their]335-three autocratic infants father]339-their father ’s valet]340-their father ’s valet had caused [her]81-sophy viner to fly [this sheltered spot]341-this sheltered spot , against the express advice of [[her]81-sophy viner educational superiors]342-her educational superiors , who implied that , in [their]342-her educational superiors own case , refinement and self - respect had always sufficed to keep the most ungovernable passions at bay . The experience of [[the guardian]316-the guardian ’s widow]344-the guardian ’s widow having been precisely similar , and the deplorable precedent of [Laura]92-laura ’s career being present to all [their]342-her educational superiors minds , [none of [these ladies]346-these ladies]345-none of these ladies felt any obligation to intervene farther in [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s affairs ; and [she]81-sophy viner was accordingly left to [her]81-sophy viner own resources . [A schoolmate from [the Rocky Mountains]15-the rocky mountains , who was taking [[her]81-sophy viner father]348-her father and [mother]349-mother to [Europe]5-europe]347-a schoolmate from the rocky mountains , who was taking her father and mother to europe , had suggested [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s accompanying [them]342-her educational superiors , and “ going round ”[81-sophy viner] with [her]81-sophy viner while [[her]81-sophy viner progenitors]350-her progenitors , in the care of [the courier]351-the courier , nursed [their]350-her progenitors ailments at a fashionable bath . It was then -- after an interval of repose with [compassionate but impecunious American friends in [Paris]10-paris]356-compassionate but impecunious american friends in paris -- that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had been drawn into the turbid current of [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s career . [The impecunious compatriots]357-the impecunious compatriots had found [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett for [her]81-sophy viner , and it was partly on [their]357-the impecunious compatriots account ( because [they]357-the impecunious compatriots were [such dears]358-such dears , and so unconscious , poor confiding things , of what [they]357-the impecunious compatriots were letting [her]81-sophy viner in for ) that [Sophy]81-sophy viner had stuck it out so long in [the dreadful house in [Chelsea]12-chelsea]359-the dreadful house in chelsea . And [she]81-sophy viner had n’t liked to undeceive [them]357-the impecunious compatriots , knowing that to do so would be virtually to throw [herself]81-sophy viner back on [their]357-the impecunious compatriots hands , and feeling , moreover , after [her]81-sophy viner previous experiences , the urgent need of gaining , at any cost , a name for stability ; besides which -- [she]81-sophy viner threw it off with a slight laugh -- no other chance , in all these years , had happened to come to [her]81-sophy viner . [She]81-sophy viner had brushed in this outline of [her]81-sophy viner career with light rapid strokes , and in a tone of fatalism oddly untinged by bitterness . [Darrow]71-darrow perceived that [she]81-sophy viner classified [people]365-people according to [their]365-people greater or less “ luck ”[81-sophy viner] in life , but [she]81-sophy viner appeared to harbour no resentment against the undefined power which dispensed the gift in such unequal measure . Things came [one]2308-one ’s way or [they]365-people did n’t ; and meanwhile [one]2308-one could only look on , and make the most of small compensations , such as watching “ the show ”[78-mrs. murrett] at [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s , and talking over [the Lady Ulricas]95-the lady ulricas and other footlight figures . And at any moment , of course , a turn of the kaleidoscope might suddenly toss a bright spangle into the grey pattern of one ’s days . This light - hearted philosophy was not without charm to [a young man accustomed to more traditional views]368-a young man accustomed to more traditional views . [George Darrow]71-darrow had had a fairly varied experience of [feminine types]369-feminine types , but [the women [he]71-darrow had frequented]370-the women he had frequented had either been pronouncedly “ [ladies ”]2324-ladies ”[370-the women he had frequented] or [they]370-the women he had frequented had not . Grateful to [both]371-both for ministering to the more complex masculine nature , and disposed to assume that [they]371-both had been evolved , if not designed , to that end , [he]71-darrow had instinctively kept [the two groups]372-the two groups apart in [his]71-darrow mind , avoiding that intermediate society which attempts to conciliate both theories of life . “ Bohemianism ”[71-darrow] seemed to [him]71-darrow a cheaper convention than the other two , and [he]71-darrow liked , above all , [people who went as far as [they]373-people who went as far as they could in their own line could in [their]373-people who went as far as they could in their own line own line]373-people who went as far as they could in their own line -- liked [[his]71-darrow “ ladies ”[71-darrow] and [[their]373-people who went as far as they could in their own line rivals]375-their rivals to be equally unashamed of showing for exactly what [they]371-both were]374-his “ ladies ” and their rivals to be equally unashamed of showing for exactly what they were . [He]71-darrow had not indeed -- the fact of [Lady Ulrica]80-lady ulrica was there to remind [him]71-darrow -- been without [his]71-darrow experience of [a third type]376-a third type ; but that experience had left [him]71-darrow with a contemptuous distaste for [the woman who uses the privileges of [one class]378-one class to shelter the customs of another]377-the woman who uses the privileges of one class to shelter the customs of another . As to [young girls]379-young girls , [he]71-darrow had never thought much about [them]379-young girls since [his]71-darrow early love for [the girl who had become [Mrs. Leath]75-owen]380-the girl who had become mrs. leath . That episode seemed , as [he]71-darrow looked back on it , to bear no more relation to reality than a pale decorative design to the confused richness of a summer landscape . [He]71-darrow no longer understood the violent impulses and dreamy pauses of [his]71-darrow own young heart , or the inscrutable abandonments and reluctances of [hers]380-the girl who had become mrs. leath . [He]71-darrow had known a moment of anguish at losing [her]380-the girl who had become mrs. leath -- the mad plunge of youthful instincts against the barrier of fate ; but the first wave of stronger sensation had swept away all but the outline of [their]381-their story , and the memory of [Anna Summers]67-anna had made the image of [the young girl]328-the young girl sacred , but [the class]383-the class uninteresting . Such generalisations belonged , however , to an earlier stage of [his]71-darrow experience . The more [he]71-darrow saw of life the more incalculable [he]71-darrow found it ; and [he]71-darrow had learned to yield to [his]71-darrow impressions without feeling the youthful need of relating them to [others]2314-others . It was [the girl in the opposite seat]385-the girl in the opposite seat who had roused in [him]71-darrow the dormant habit of comparison . [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat was distinguished from [the daughters of wealth]386-the daughters of wealth by [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat avowed acquaintance with the real business of living , a familiarity as different as possible from [their]381-their theoretical proficiency ; yet it seemed to [Darrow]71-darrow that [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat experience had made [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat free without hardness and self - assured without assertiveness . The rush into [Amiens]16-amiens , and the flash of the station lights into [[their]381-their compartment]387-their compartment , broke [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s sleep , and without changing [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat position [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat lifted [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat lids and looked at [Darrow]71-darrow . There was neither surprise nor bewilderment in the look . [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat seemed instantly conscious , not so much of where [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat was , as of the fact that [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat was with [him]71-darrow ; and that fact seemed enough to reassure [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat . [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat did not even turn [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat head to look out ; [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat eyes continued to rest on [him]71-darrow with a vague smile which appeared to light [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat face from within , while [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat lips kept their sleepy droop . Shouts and the hurried tread of [travellers]388-travellers came to [them]381-their through the confusing cross - lights of [the platform]264-the platform . A head appeared at the window , and [Darrow]71-darrow threw [himself]71-darrow forward to defend [their]381-their solitude ; but [the intruder]390-the intruder was only a train hand going [his]71-darrow round of inspection . [He]71-darrow passed on , and the lights and cries of [the station]253-the station dropped away , merged in a wider haze and a hollower resonance , as [the train]167-the train gathered itself up with a long shake and rolled out again into the darkness . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s head sank back against the cushion , pushing out a dusky wave of hair above [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat forehead . [We]2325-we ’re very nearly on time . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow verified the statement by holding up [his]71-darrow watch to the lamp . [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat nodded dreamily . “ It ’s all right . [I]385-the girl in the opposite seat telegraphed [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow that [they]2326-they must n’t think of coming to [the station]253-the station ; but [they]2326-they ’ll have told [the concierge]2328-the concierge to look out for [me]385-the girl in the opposite seat . ”[385-the girl in the opposite seat] “ [You]71-darrow ’ll let [me]385-the girl in the opposite seat drive [you]71-darrow [there]2294-there ? ”[385-the girl in the opposite seat] [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat nodded again , and [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat eyes closed . It was very pleasant to [Darrow]71-darrow that [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat made no effort to talk or to dissemble [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat sleepiness . [He]71-darrow sat watching [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat till the upper lashes met and mingled with the lower , and their blent shadow lay on [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat cheek ; then [he]71-darrow stood up and drew the curtain over the lamp , drowning [the compartment]396-the compartment in a bluish twilight . As [he]71-darrow sank back into [his]71-darrow seat [he]71-darrow thought how differently [Anna Summers]67-anna -- or even [Anna Leath]97-anna -- would have behaved . [She]385-the girl in the opposite seat would not have talked too much ; [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat would not have been either restless or embarrassed ; but [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat adaptability , [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat appropriateness , would not have been nature but “ tact . ”[385-the girl in the opposite seat] The oddness of the situation would have made sleep impossible , or , if weariness had overcome [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat for a moment , [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat would have waked with a start , wondering where [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat was , and how [she]385-the girl in the opposite seat had come [there]2294-there , and if [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat hair were tidy ; and nothing short of hairpins and a glass would have restored [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat self - possession ... The reflection set [him]71-darrow wondering whether [the “ sheltered ”[398-the “ sheltered ” girl] girl]398-the “ sheltered ” girl ’s bringing - up might not unfit [her]385-the girl in the opposite seat for all subsequent contact with life . How much nearer to it had [Mrs. Leath]75-owen been brought by marriage and motherhood , and the passage of fourteen years ? What were all [her]75-owen reticences and evasions but the result of the deadening process of forming [a “ lady ”]2330-a “ lady ”[2330-a “ lady ”] ? The freshness [he]71-darrow had marvelled at was like the unnatural whiteness of flowers forced in the dark . As [he]71-darrow looked back at [their]399-their few days together [he]71-darrow saw that [their]399-their intercourse had been marked , on [her]75-owen part , by the same hesitations and reserves which had chilled [their]399-their earlier intimacy . Once more [they]399-their had had [their]399-their hour together and [she]75-owen had wasted it . As in [her]75-owen girlhood , [her]75-owen eyes had made promises which [her]75-owen lips were afraid to keep . [She]75-owen was still afraid of life , of its ruthlessness , its danger and mystery . [She]75-owen was still [[the petted little girl who can not be left alone in the dark ...]400-the petted little girl who can not be left alone in the dark ...]400-the petted little girl who can not be left alone in the dark ... [His]71-darrow memory flew back to [their]399-their youthful story , and long - forgotten details took shape before [him]71-darrow . How frail and faint the picture was ! They seemed , [he]71-darrow and [she]75-owen , like [the ghostly lovers of [the Grecian Urn]98-the grecian urn]402-the ghostly lovers of the grecian urn , forever pursuing without ever clasping [each other]177-each other . To this day [he]71-darrow did not quite know what had parted [them]399-their : the break had been as fortuitous as the fluttering apart of two seed - vessels on a wave of summer air ... The very slightness , vagueness , of the memory gave it an added poignancy . [He]71-darrow felt the mystic pang of [the parent]404-the parent for [a child which has just breathed and died]405-a child which has just breathed and died . Why had it happened thus , when the least shifting of influences might have made it all so different ? If [she]75-owen had been given to [him]71-darrow then [he]71-darrow would have put warmth in [her]75-owen veins and light in [her]75-owen eyes : would have made [her]75-owen [a woman]406-a woman through and through . Musing thus , [he]71-darrow had the sense of waste that is the bitterest harvest of experience . A love like [his]71-darrow might have given [her]75-owen the divine gift of self - renewal ; and now [he]71-darrow saw [her]75-owen fated to wane into old age repeating the same gestures , echoing the words [she]75-owen had always heard , and perhaps never guessing that , just outside [her]75-owen glazed and curtained consciousness , life rolled away , a vast blackness starred with lights , like the night landscape beyond the windows of [the train]167-the train . The engine lowered its speed for the passage through [a sleeping station]408-a sleeping station . In the light of the platform lamp [Darrow]71-darrow looked across at [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion . [Her]75-owen head had dropped toward one shoulder , and [her]75-owen lips were just far enough apart for the reflection of the upper one to deepen the colour of the other . The jolting of [the train]167-the train had again shaken loose the lock above [her]75-owen ear . It danced on [her]75-owen cheek like the flit of a brown wing over flowers , and [Darrow]71-darrow felt an intense desire to lean forward and put it back behind [her]75-owen ear . [IV]99-iv As [[their]411-their motor - cab]412-their motor - cab , on the way from [the Gare du Nord]413-the gare du nord , turned into the central glitter of [the Boulevard]414-the boulevard , [Darrow]71-darrow had bent over to point out an incandescent threshold . “ There ! ”[71-darrow] Above the doorway , an arch of flame flashed out the name of [a great actress , whose closing performances in a play of unusual originality]415-a great actress , whose closing performances in a play of unusual originality had been the theme of long articles in the [Paris]10-paris papers which [Darrow]71-darrow had tossed into [their]411-their compartment at [Calais]13-calais . “ That ’s what [you]297-the girl must see before [you]297-the girl ’re twenty - four hours older ! ”[71-darrow] [The girl]297-the girl followed [his]71-darrow gesture eagerly . [She]297-the girl was all awake and alive now , as if the heady rumours of [the streets]417-the streets , with their long effervescences of light , had passed into [her]297-the girl veins like wine . “ [Cerdine]100-cerdine ? Is that where [she]297-the girl acts ? ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl put [her]297-the girl head out of the window , straining back for a glimpse of the sacred threshold . As [they]411-their flew past it [she]297-the girl sank into [her]297-the girl seat with a satisfied sigh . “ It ’s delicious enough just to KNOW [she]297-the girl ’s [there]2294-there ! [I]71-darrow ’ve never seen [her]297-the girl , [you]297-the girl know . When [I]71-darrow was here with [Mamie Hoke]93-mamie hoke [we]2332-we never went anywhere but to [the music halls]2333-the music halls , because [she]93-mamie hoke could n’t understand any French ; and when [I]71-darrow came back afterward to [the Farlows]94-the farlows ’ [I]71-darrow was dead broke , and could n’t afford the play , and neither could [they]94-the farlows ; so the only chance [we]2332-we had was when [friends of theirs]2334-friends of theirs invited [us]2332-we -- and once it was to see a tragedy by [a Roumanian lady]2335-a roumanian lady , and the other time it was for ‘ L’Ami Fritz ’ at [the Francais]2336-the francais . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow laughed . “ [You]297-the girl must do better than that now . ‘ Le Vertige ’ is a fine thing , and [Cerdine]100-cerdine gets some wonderful effects out of it . [You]297-the girl must come with [me]71-darrow tomorrow evening to see it -- with [[your]297-the girl friends]2337-your friends , of course.--That is , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow added , “ if there ’s any sort of chance of getting seats . ”[71-darrow] The flash of a street lamp lit up [her]418-i radiant face . “ Oh , will [you]71-darrow really take [us]2338-us ? What fun to think that it ’s tomorrow already ! ”[71-darrow] It was wonderfully pleasant to be able to give such pleasure . [Darrow]71-darrow was not rich , but it was almost impossible for [him]71-darrow to picture the state of persons with tastes and perceptions like [his]71-darrow own , to whom an evening at [the theatre]237-the theatre was an unattainable indulgence . There floated through [his]71-darrow mind an answer of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s to [his]71-darrow enquiry whether [she]418-i had seen the play in question . “ No . [I]418-i meant to , of course , but [one]2308-one is so overwhelmed with things in [Paris]10-paris . And then [I]418-i ’m rather sick of [Cerdine]100-cerdine -- [one]2308-one is always being dragged to see [her]100-cerdine . ”[418-i] That , among [the people [he]71-darrow frequented]420-the people he frequented , was the usual attitude toward such opportunities . There were too many , [they]421-they were a nuisance , [one]2308-one had to defend [one]2308-one ’s self ! [He]71-darrow even remembered wondering , at the moment , whether to a really fine taste the exceptional thing could ever become indifferent through habit ; whether the appetite for beauty was so soon dulled that it could be kept alive only by privation . Here , at any rate , was a fine chance to experiment with such a hunger : [he]71-darrow almost wished [he]71-darrow might stay on in [Paris]10-paris long enough to take the measure of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s receptivity . [She]82-miss viner was still dwelling on [his]71-darrow promise , “ It ’s too beautiful of [you]71-darrow ! Oh , do n’t [you]71-darrow THINK [you]71-darrow ’ll be able to get seats ? ”[82-miss viner] And then , after a pause of brimming appreciation : “ [I]82-miss viner wonder if [you]71-darrow ’ll think [me]82-miss viner horrid?--but it may be [my]82-miss viner only chance ; and if [you]71-darrow ca n’t get places for [[us]2341-us all]2342-us all , would n’t [you]71-darrow perhaps just take [ME]82-miss viner ? After all , [the Farlows]94-the farlows may have seen it ! ”[82-miss viner] [He]71-darrow had not , of course , thought [her]82-miss viner horrid , but only the more engaging , for being so natural , and so unashamed of showing the frank greed of [her]82-miss viner famished youth . “ Oh , [you]82-miss viner shall go somehow ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow had gaily promised [her]82-miss viner ; and [she]82-miss viner had dropped back with a sigh of pleasure as [[their]424-their cab]425-their cab passed into [the dimly - lit streets of [the [Farlows]94-the farlows ’ quarter]94-the farlows]426-the dimly - lit streets of the farlows ’ quarter beyond [the Seine]427-the seine ... [This little passage]428-this little passage came back to [him]71-darrow the next morning , as [he]71-darrow opened [his]71-darrow hotel window on the early roar of [the Northern Terminus]429-the northern terminus . [The girl]297-the girl was there , in [the room next to [him]71-darrow]431-the room next to him . That had been the first point in [his]71-darrow waking consciousness . The second was a sense of relief at the obligation imposed on [him]71-darrow by this unexpected turn of everts . To wake to the necessity of action , to postpone perforce the fruitless contemplation of [his]71-darrow private grievance , was cause enough for gratitude , even if the small adventure in which [he]71-darrow found [himself]71-darrow involved had not , on its own merits , roused an instinctive curiosity to see it through . When [he]71-darrow and [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion , the night before , had reached [the Farlows]94-the farlows ’ door in [the rue de la Chaise]433-the rue de la chaise , it was only to find , after repeated assaults on [its]434-its panels , that [the Farlows]94-the farlows were no longer [there]2294-there . [They]436-they had moved away the week before , not only from [[their]436-they apartment]437-their apartment but from [Paris]10-paris ; and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s breach with [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett had been too sudden to permit [her]82-miss viner letter and telegram to overtake [them]436-they . Both communications , no doubt , still reposed in [a pigeon - hole of [the loge]439-the loge]438-a pigeon - hole of the loge ; but [its custodian]440-its custodian , when drawn from [[his]71-darrow lair]441-his lair , sulkily declined to let [Miss Viner]82-miss viner verify the fact , and only flung out , in return for [Darrow]71-darrow ’s bribe , the statement that [the Americans]101-the americans had gone to [Joigny]19-joigny . To pursue [them]101-the americans [there]2294-there at that hour was manifestly impossible , and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , disturbed but not disconcerted by this new obstacle , had quite simply acceded to [Darrow]71-darrow ’s suggestion that [she]82-miss viner should return for what remained of the night to [the hotel]443-the hotel where [he]71-darrow had sent [his]71-darrow luggage . The drive back through the dark hush before dawn , with the nocturnal blaze of [the Boulevard]414-the boulevard fading around [them]436-they like the false lights of [[a magician]445-a magician ’s palace]446-a magician ’s palace , had so played on [her]82-miss viner impressionability that [she]82-miss viner seemed to give no farther thought to [her]82-miss viner own predicament . [Darrow]71-darrow noticed that [she]82-miss viner did not feel the beauty and mystery of the spectacle as much as its pressure of human significance , all its hidden implications of emotion and adventure . As [they]436-they passed [the shadowy colonnade of [the Francais]20-the francais]447-the shadowy colonnade of the francais , remote and temple - like in the paling lights , [he]71-darrow felt a clutch on [his]71-darrow arm , and heard the cry : “ There are things THERE that [I]82-miss viner want so desperately to see ! ”[82-miss viner] and all the way back to [the hotel]443-the hotel [she]82-miss viner continued to question [him]71-darrow , with shrewd precision and an artless thirst for detail , about the theatrical life of [Paris]10-paris . [He]71-darrow was struck afresh , as [he]71-darrow listened , by the way in which [her]82-miss viner naturalness eased the situation of constraint , leaving to it only a pleasant savour of good fellowship . It was the kind of episode that [one]2308-one might , in advance , have characterized as “ awkward ”[82-miss viner] , yet that was proving , in the event , as much outside such definitions as a sunrise stroll with a dryad in [a dew - drenched forest]450-a dew - drenched forest ; and [Darrow]71-darrow reflected that [mankind]451-mankind would never have needed to invent tact if it had not first invented social complications . It had been understood , with [his]71-darrow good - night to [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , that the next morning [he]71-darrow was to look up [the Joigny trains]452-the joigny trains , and see [her]82-miss viner safely to [the station]253-the station ; but , while [he]71-darrow breakfasted and waited for a time - table , [he]71-darrow recalled again [her]82-miss viner cry of joy at the prospect of seeing [Cerdine]100-cerdine . It was certainly a pity , since [that most elusive and incalculable of [artists]455-artists]454-that most elusive and incalculable of artists was leaving the next week for [South America]21-south america , to miss what might be a last sight of [her]82-miss viner in [her]82-miss viner greatest part ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , having dressed and made the requisite excerpts from the time - table , decided to carry the result of [his]71-darrow deliberations to [[his]71-darrow neighbour]456-his neighbour ’s door . It instantly opened at [his]71-darrow knock , and [she]82-miss viner came forth looking as if [she]82-miss viner had been plunged into some sparkling element which had curled up all [her]82-miss viner drooping tendrils and wrapped [her]82-miss viner in a shimmer of fresh leaves . “ Well , what do [you]71-darrow think of [me]82-miss viner ? ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner cried ; and with a hand at [her]82-miss viner waist [she]82-miss viner spun about as if to show off some miracle of Parisian dress - making . “ [I]82-miss viner think the missing trunk has come -- and that it was worth waiting for ! ”[82-miss viner] “ [You]71-darrow DO like [my]457-my dress ? ”[457-my] “ [I]82-miss viner adore it ! [I]82-miss viner always adore new dresses -- why , [you]71-darrow do n’t mean to say it ’s NOT a new one ? ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner laughed out [her]82-miss viner triumph . “ No , no , no ! [My]82-miss viner trunk has n’t come , and this is only [my]82-miss viner old rag of yesterday -- but [I]82-miss viner never knew the trick to fail ! ”[82-miss viner] And , as [he]457-my stared : “ [You]71-darrow see , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner joyously explained , “ [I]82-miss viner ’ve always had to dress in all kinds of dreary left - overs , and sometimes , when [everybody else]2343-everybody else was smart and new , it used to make [me]82-miss viner awfully miserable . So one day , when [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett dragged [me]82-miss viner down unexpectedly to fill a place at dinner , [I]82-miss viner suddenly thought [I]82-miss viner ’d try spinning around like that , and say to [every one]2344-every one : ‘ WELL , WHAT DO [YOU]2344-every one THINK OF [ME]82-miss viner ? ’ And , do [you]71-darrow know , [they]2344-every one were all taken in , including [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett , who did n’t recognize [my]82-miss viner old turned and dyed rags , and told [me]82-miss viner afterward it was awfully bad form to dress as if [I]82-miss viner were somebody that [people]365-people would expect to know ! And ever since , whenever [I]82-miss viner ’ve particularly wanted to look nice , [I]82-miss viner ’ve just asked [people]365-people what [they]365-people thought of [my]82-miss viner new frock ; and [they]365-people ’re always , always taken in ! ”[82-miss viner] [She]458-her dramatized [her]458-her explanation so vividly that [Darrow]71-darrow felt as if [his]71-darrow point were gained . “ Ah , but this confirms [your]458-her vocation -- of course , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow cried , “ [you]458-her must see [Cerdine]100-cerdine ! ”[71-darrow] and , seeing [her]458-her face fall at this reminder of the change in [her]458-her prospects , [he]71-darrow hastened to set forth [his]71-darrow plan . As [he]71-darrow did so , [he]71-darrow saw how easy it was to explain things to [her]458-her . [She]458-her would either accept [his]71-darrow suggestion , or [she]458-her would not : but at least [she]458-her would waste no time in protestations and objections , or any vain sacrifice to the idols of conformity . The conviction that [one]2308-one could , on any given point , almost predicate this of [her]458-her , gave [him]71-darrow the sense of having advanced far enough in [her]458-her intimacy to urge [his]71-darrow arguments against a hasty pursuit of [[her]458-her friends]460-her friends . Yes , it would certainly be foolish -- [she]458-her at once agreed -- in the case of [such dear indefinite angels as [the Farlows]94-the farlows]461-such dear indefinite angels as the farlows , to dash off after [them]94-the farlows without more positive proof that [they]94-the farlows were established at [Joigny]19-joigny , and so established that [they]94-the farlows could take [her]458-her in . [She]458-her owned it was but too probable that [they]94-the farlows had gone [there]2294-there to “ cut down ”[94-the farlows] , and might be doing so in quarters too contracted to receive [her]458-her ; and it would be unfair , on that chance , to impose [herself]458-her on [them]94-the farlows unannounced . The simplest way of getting farther light on the question would be to go back to [the rue de la Chaise]433-the rue de la chaise , where , at that more conversable hour , [the concierge]2328-the concierge might be less chary of detail ; and [she]458-her could decide on [her]458-her next step in the light of such facts as [he]2328-the concierge imparted . Point by point , [she]458-her fell in with the suggestion , recognizing , in the light of [their]94-the farlows unexplained flight , that [the Farlows]94-the farlows might indeed be in a situation on which one could not too rashly intrude . [Her]458-her concern for [[her]458-her friends]460-her friends seemed to have effaced all thought of [herself]458-her , and this little indication of character gave [Darrow]71-darrow a quite disproportionate pleasure . [She]458-her agreed that it would be well to go at once to [the rue de la Chaise]433-the rue de la chaise , but met [his]2328-the concierge proposal that [they]94-the farlows should drive by the declaration that it was a “ waste ”[2328-the concierge] not to walk in [Paris]10-paris ; so [they]94-the farlows set off on foot through the cheerful tumult of [the streets]417-the streets . The walk was long enough for [him]2328-the concierge to learn many things about [her]458-her . The storm of the previous night had cleared the air , and [Paris]10-paris shone in morning beauty under a sky that was all broad wet washes of white and blue ; but [Darrow]71-darrow again noticed that [her]458-her visual sensitiveness was less keen than [her]458-her feeling for what [he]71-darrow was sure [the good Farlows]468-the good farlows -- whom [he]71-darrow already seemed to know -- would have called “ the human interest . ”[468-the good farlows] [She]458-her seemed hardly conscious of sensations of form and colour , or of any imaginative suggestion , and the spectacle before [them]94-the farlows -- always , in its scenic splendour , so moving to [[her]458-her companion]395-her companion -- broke up , under [her]458-her scrutiny , into a thousand minor points : the things in [the shops]470-the shops , the types of character and manner of occupation shown in the passing faces , the street signs , the names of [the hotels]471-the hotels [they]94-the farlows passed , the motley brightness of [the flower - carts]472-the flower - carts , the identity of [the churches]473-the churches and public buildings that caught [her]458-her eye . But what [she]458-her liked best , [he]71-darrow divined , was the mere fact of being free to walk abroad in the bright air , [her]458-her tongue rattling on as it pleased , while [her]458-her feet kept time to the mighty orchestration of [the city]474-the city ’s sounds . [Her]458-her delight in the fresh air , in the freedom , light and sparkle of the morning , gave [him]71-darrow a sudden insight into [her]458-her stifled past ; nor was it indifferent to [him]71-darrow to perceive how much [his]71-darrow presence evidently added to [her]458-her enjoyment . If only as a sympathetic ear , [he]71-darrow guessed what [he]71-darrow must be worth to [her]458-her . [The girl]297-the girl had been dying for [some one]476-some one to talk to , [some one before whom [she]297-the girl could unfold and shake out to the light [her]297-the girl poor little shut - away emotions]477-some one before whom she could unfold and shake out to the light her poor little shut - away emotions . Years of repression were revealed in [her]458-her sudden burst of confidence ; and the pity [she]458-her inspired made [Darrow]71-darrow long to fill [her]458-her few free hours to the brim . [She]458-her had the gift of rapid definition , and [his]71-darrow questions as to the life [she]458-her had led with [the Farlows]94-the farlows , during the interregnum between the Hoke and [Murrett]78-mrs. murrett eras , called up before [him]71-darrow a queer little corner of Parisian existence . [The Farlows]94-the farlows [themselves]94-the farlows -- [he]71-darrow [a painter]478-a painter , [she]458-her a “ magazine writer”--rose[94-the farlows] before [him]71-darrow in all [their]94-the farlows incorruptible simplicity : [an elderly New England couple , with vague yearnings for enfranchisement , who lived in [Paris]10-paris as if [it]10-paris were [a Massachusetts suburb]480-a massachusetts suburb]479-an elderly new england couple , with vague yearnings for enfranchisement , who lived in paris as if it were a massachusetts suburb , and dwelt hopefully on [the “ higher side ”[458-her] of the Gallic nature]481-the “ higher side ” of the gallic nature . With equal vividness [she]458-her set before [him]71-darrow the component figures of the circle from which [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow drew the “ Inner Glimpses of French Life ”[458-her] appearing over [her]458-her name in [a leading New England]482-a leading new england journal : [the Roumanian lady who had sent [them]94-the farlows tickets for [her]458-her tragedy]483-the roumanian lady who had sent them tickets for her tragedy , [an elderly French gentleman who , on the strength of a week ’s stay at [Folkestone]22-folkestone]484-an elderly french gentleman who , on the strength of a week ’s stay at folkestone , translated English fiction for the provincial press , [a lady from [Wichita]23-wichita]485-a lady from wichita , [Kansas]24-kansas , who advocated free love and the abolition of the corset , [[a clergyman]486-a clergyman ’s widow from [Torquay]25-torquay who had written an “ English Ladies ’ Guide to [Foreign Galleries]2348-foreign galleries]2347-a clergyman ’s widow from torquay who had written an “ english ladies ’ guide to foreign galleries ”[486-a clergyman] and [a Russian sculptor who lived on nuts and was “ almost certainly ”[486-a clergyman] [an anarchist]488-an anarchist]487-a russian sculptor who lived on nuts and was “ almost certainly ” an anarchist . It was this nucleus , and [its]489-its outer ring of [musical , architectural and other American students]490-musical , architectural and other american students , which posed successively to [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow ’s versatile fancy as a centre of “ University Life ”[96-mrs. farlow] , [a “ Salon of [the Faubourg St. Germain]2350-the faubourg st. germain]2349-a “ salon of the faubourg st. germain ”[96-mrs. farlow] , [a group of Parisian “ Intellectuals ”]2351-a group of parisian “ intellectuals ”[96-mrs. farlow] or [a “ Cross - section of [Montmartre]26-montmartre]2352-a “ cross - section of montmartre ”[96-mrs. farlow] ; but even [[her]96-mrs. farlow faculty]491-her faculty for extracting from it the most varied literary effects had not sufficed to create a permanent demand for the “ Inner Glimpses ”[96-mrs. farlow] , and there were days when -- [Mr. Farlow]102-mr. farlow ’s landscapes being equally unmarketable -- a temporary withdrawal to [the country]220-the country ( subsequently utilized as “ Peeps into [Chateau Life]27-chateau life ”[102-mr. farlow] ) became necessary to [the courageous couple]493-the courageous couple . Five years of [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s world , while increasing [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s tenderness for [the Farlows]94-the farlows , had left [her]96-mrs. farlow with few illusions as to [their]94-the farlows power of advancing [her]96-mrs. farlow fortunes ; and [she]96-mrs. farlow did not conceal from [Darrow]71-darrow that [her]96-mrs. farlow theatrical projects were of the vaguest . They hung mainly on the problematical good - will of [an ancient comedienne]494-an ancient comedienne , with whom [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow had a slight acquaintance ( extensively utilized in “ Stars of the French Footlights ”[96-mrs. farlow] and “ Behind the Scenes at [the Francais ”]2353-the francais ”[96-mrs. farlow] ) , and who had once , with signs of approval , heard [Miss Viner]82-miss viner recite the Nuit de Mai . “ But of course [I]297-the girl know how much that ’s worth , ”[297-the girl] [the girl]297-the girl broke off , with one of [her]297-the girl flashes of shrewdness . “ And besides , it is n’t likely that [a poor old fossil like [Mme . Dolle]103-mme . dolle]2354-a poor old fossil like mme . dolle could get [anybody]2297-anybody to listen to [her]103-mme . dolle now , even if [she]103-mme . dolle really thought [I]297-the girl had talent . But [she]103-mme . dolle might introduce [me]297-the girl to [people]365-people ; or at least give [me]297-the girl a few tips .
