If [I]297-the girl could manage to earn enough to pay for lessons [I]297-the girl ’d go straight to some of [the big people]2357-the big people and work with [them]2357-the big people . [I]297-the girl ’m rather hoping [the Farlows]94-the farlows may find [me]297-the girl a chance of that kind -- an engagement with [some American family in [Paris]10-paris who would want to be ‘ gone round ’ with like [the Hokes]104-the hokes , and who ’d leave [me]297-the girl time enough to study]2358-some american family in paris who would want to be ‘ gone round ’ with like the hokes , and who ’d leave me time enough to study . ”[297-the girl] In [the rue de la Chaise]433-the rue de la chaise [they]497-they learned little except the exact address of [the Farlows]94-the farlows , and the fact that [they]497-they had sub - let [[their]497-they flat]498-their flat before leaving . This information obtained , [Darrow]71-darrow proposed to [Miss Viner]82-miss viner that [they]497-they should stroll along [the quays]499-the quays to [a little restaurant looking out on [the Seine]28-the seine]500-a little restaurant looking out on the seine , and there , over [the plat du jour]501-the plat du jour , consider the next step to be taken . The long walk had given [her]82-miss viner cheeks a glow indicative of wholesome hunger , and [she]82-miss viner made no difficulty about satisfying it in [[Darrow]71-darrow ’s company]502-darrow ’s company . Regaining [the river]503-the river [they]497-they walked on in [the direction of [Notre Dame]29-notre dame]504-the direction of notre dame , delayed now and again by [the young man]217-the young man ’s irresistible tendency to linger over the bookstalls , and by [his]217-the young man ever - fresh response to the shifting beauties of the scene . For two years [his]217-the young man eyes had been subdued to the atmospheric effects of [London]3-london , to the mysterious fusion of darkly - piled city and low - lying bituminous sky ; and the transparency of the French air , which left [the green gardens]506-the green gardens and silvery stones so classically clear yet so softly harmonized , struck [him]217-the young man as having a kind of conscious intelligence . Every line of the architecture , every arch of [the bridges]507-the bridges , the very sweep of [the strong bright river]508-the strong bright river between [them]497-they , while contributing to this effect , sent forth each a separate appeal to some sensitive memory ; so that , for [Darrow]71-darrow , a walk through [the [Paris]10-paris streets]509-the paris streets was always like the unrolling of a vast tapestry from which countless stored fragrances were shaken out . It was a proof of the richness and multiplicity of the spectacle that it served , without incongruity , for so different a purpose as the background of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s enjoyment . As a mere drop - scene for [her]82-miss viner personal adventure it was just as much in its place as in the evocation of great perspectives of feeling . For [her]82-miss viner , as [he]217-the young man again perceived when [they]497-they were seated at [their]497-they table in a low window above [the Seine]28-the seine , [Paris]10-paris was “ [Paris]10-paris ”[82-miss viner] by virtue of all [its]10-paris entertaining details , [its]10-paris endless ingenuities of pleasantness . Where else , for instance , could [one]2308-one find the dear little dishes of hors d’oeuvre , the symmetrically - laid anchovies and radishes , the thin golden shells of butter , or the wood strawberries and brown jars of cream that gave to [their]497-they repast the last refinement of rusticity ? Had n’t [he]217-the young man noticed , [she]82-miss viner asked , that cooking always expressed the national character , and that French food was clever and amusing just because [the people]511-the people were ? And in [private houses]512-private houses , everywhere , how the dishes always resembled the talk -- how the very same platitudes seemed to go into [people]365-people ’s mouths and come out of them ? Could n’t [he]217-the young man see just what kind of menu it would make , if [a fairy]514-a fairy waved a wand and suddenly turned the conversation at a [London]3-london dinner into joints and puddings ? [She]82-miss viner always thought it a good sign when [people]365-people liked Irish stew ; it meant that [they]365-people enjoyed changes and surprises , and taking life as it came ; and such a beautiful Parisian version of the dish as the navarin that was just being set before [them]497-they was like the very best kind of talk -- the kind when one could never tell before - hand just what was going to be said ! [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow watched [her]82-miss viner enjoyment of [their]497-they innocent feast , wondered if [her]82-miss viner vividness and vivacity were signs of [her]82-miss viner calling . [She]82-miss viner was the kind of girl in whom [certain people]516-certain people would instantly have recognized the histrionic gift . But experience had led [him]71-darrow to think that , except at the creative moment , the divine flame burns low in its possessors . [The one or two really intelligent actresses [he]71-darrow had known]517-the one or two really intelligent actresses he had known had struck [him]71-darrow , in conversation , as either bovine or primitively “ jolly ”[71-darrow] . [He]71-darrow had a notion that , save in the mind of genius , the creative process absorbs too much of the whole stuff of being to leave much surplus for personal expression ; and [the girl before [him]71-darrow]518-the girl before him , with [her]82-miss viner changing face and flexible fancies , seemed destined to work in life itself rather than in any of its counterfeits . The coffee and liqueurs were already on the table when [her]82-miss viner mind suddenly sprang back to [the Farlows]94-the farlows . [She]82-miss viner jumped up with one of [her]82-miss viner subversive movements and declared that [she]82-miss viner must telegraph at once . [Darrow]71-darrow called for writing materials and room was made at [her]82-miss viner elbow for the parched ink - bottle and saturated blotter of [the Parisian restaurant]519-the parisian restaurant ; but the mere sight of these jaded implements seemed to paralyze [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s faculties . [She]82-miss viner hung over the telegraph - form with anxiously - drawn brow , the tip of the pen - handle pressed against [her]82-miss viner lip ; and at length [she]82-miss viner raised [her]82-miss viner troubled eyes to [Darrow]71-darrow ’s . “ [I]82-miss viner simply ca n’t think how to say it . ”[82-miss viner] “ What -- that [you]82-miss viner ’re staying over to see [Cerdine]100-cerdine ? ”[82-miss viner] “ But AM [I]82-miss viner -- am [I]82-miss viner , really ? ”[82-miss viner] The joy of it flamed over [her]82-miss viner face . [Darrow]71-darrow looked at [his]71-darrow watch . “ [You]82-miss viner could hardly get an answer to [your]82-miss viner telegram in time to take [a train]2359-a train to [Joigny]19-joigny this afternoon , even if [you]82-miss viner found [[your]82-miss viner friends]2337-your friends could have [you]82-miss viner . ”[71-darrow] [She]82-miss viner mused for a moment , tapping [her]82-miss viner lip with the pen . “ But [I]82-miss viner must let [them]2337-your friends know [I]82-miss viner ’m here . [I]82-miss viner must find out as soon as possible if [they]2337-your friends CAN , have [me]82-miss viner . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner laid the pen down despairingly . “ [I]82-miss viner never COULD write a telegram ! ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner sighed . “ Try a letter , then and tell [them]2337-your friends [you]71-darrow ’ll arrive tomorrow . ”[82-miss viner] This suggestion produced immediate relief , and [she]82-miss viner gave an energetic dab at the ink - bottle ; but after another interval of uncertain scratching [she]82-miss viner paused again . “ Oh , it ’s fearful ! [I]82-miss viner do n’t know what [on earth]2361-on earth to say . [I]82-miss viner would n’t for [the world]206-the world have [them]2337-your friends know how beastly [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s been . ”[82-miss viner] [Darrow]71-darrow did not think it necessary to answer . It was no business of [his]71-darrow , after all . [He]71-darrow lit a cigar and leaned back in [his]71-darrow seat , letting [his]71-darrow eyes take [their]520-their fill of indolent pleasure . In the throes of invention [she]82-miss viner had pushed back [her]82-miss viner hat , loosening the stray lock which had invited [his]71-darrow touch the night before . After looking at it for a while [he]71-darrow stood up and wandered to the window . Behind [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow heard [her]82-miss viner pen scrape on . “ [I]82-miss viner do n’t want to worry [them]2337-your friends -- [I’m]82-miss viner so certain [they]2337-your friends ’ve got bothers of [their]2337-your friends own . ”[82-miss viner] The faltering scratches ceased again . “ [I]71-darrow wish [I]71-darrow were n’t such [an idiot]2363-an idiot about writing : all the words get frightened and scurry away when [I]71-darrow try to catch them . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow glanced back at [her]82-miss viner with a smile as [she]82-miss viner bent above [her]82-miss viner task like [a school - girl struggling with a “ composition]2364-a school - girl struggling with a “ composition . ”[82-miss viner] [Her]82-miss viner flushed cheek and frowning brow showed that [her]82-miss viner difficulty was genuine and not an artless device to draw [him]71-darrow to [her]82-miss viner side . [She]82-miss viner was really powerless to put [her]82-miss viner thoughts in writing , and the inability seemed characteristic of [her]82-miss viner quick impressionable mind , and of the incessant come - and - go of [her]82-miss viner sensations . [He]71-darrow thought of [Anna Leath]97-anna ’s letters , or rather of the few [he]71-darrow had received , years ago , from [the girl who had been [Anna Summers]67-anna]521-the girl who had been anna summers . [He]71-darrow saw the slender firm strokes of the pen , recalled the clear structure of the phrases , and , by an abrupt association of ideas , remembered that , at that very hour , just such a document might be awaiting [him]71-darrow at [the hotel]443-the hotel . What if it were there , indeed , and had brought [him]71-darrow a complete explanation of [her]82-miss viner telegram ? The revulsion of feeling produced by this thought made [him]71-darrow look at [the girl]297-the girl with sudden impatience . [She]297-the girl struck [him]71-darrow as positively stupid , and [he]71-darrow wondered how [he]71-darrow could have wasted half [his]71-darrow day with [her]297-the girl , when all the while [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s letter might be lying on [his]71-darrow table . At that moment , if [he]71-darrow could have chosen , [he]71-darrow would have left [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion on the spot ; but [he]71-darrow had [her]297-the girl on [his]71-darrow hands , and must accept the consequences . Some odd intuition seemed to make [her]297-the girl conscious of [his]71-darrow change of mood , for [she]297-the girl sprang from [her]297-the girl seat , crumpling the letter in [her]297-the girl hand . “ [I]297-the girl ’m too stupid ; but [I]297-the girl wo n’t keep [you]71-darrow any longer . [I]297-the girl ’ll go back to [the hotel]443-the hotel and write [there]2294-there . ”[297-the girl] [Her]297-the girl colour deepened , and for the first time , as [their]525-their eyes met , [he]71-darrow noticed a faint embarrassment in [hers]297-the girl . Could it be that [his]71-darrow nearness was , after all , the cause of [her]297-the girl confusion ? The thought turned [his]71-darrow vague impatience with [her]297-the girl into a definite resentment toward [himself]71-darrow . There was really no excuse for [his]71-darrow having blundered into such an adventure . Why had [he]71-darrow not shipped [the girl]297-the girl off to [Joigny]19-joigny by [the evening train]527-the evening train , instead of urging [her]297-the girl to delay , and using [Cerdine]100-cerdine as a pretext ? [Paris]10-paris was full of [[people]365-people [he]71-darrow knew]529-people he knew , and [his]71-darrow annoyance was increased by the thought that [some friend of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s]530-some friend of mrs. leath ’s might see [him]71-darrow at the play , and report [his]71-darrow presence [there]2294-there with [a suspiciously good - looking companion]532-a suspiciously good - looking companion . The idea was distinctly disagreeable : [he]71-darrow did not want [the woman [he]71-darrow adored]533-the woman he adored to think [he]71-darrow could forget [her]533-the woman he adored for a moment . And by this time [he]71-darrow had fully persuaded [himself]71-darrow that a letter from [her]297-the girl was awaiting [him]71-darrow , and had even gone so far as to imagine that its contents might annul [the writer]534-the writer ’s telegraphed injunction , and call [him]71-darrow to [her]297-the girl side at once ... V At [the porter]195-the porter ’s desk a brief “ Pas de lettres ”[195-the porter] fell destructively on the fabric of these hopes . [Mrs. Leath]75-owen had not written -- [she]75-owen had not taken the trouble to explain [her]75-owen telegram . [Darrow]71-darrow turned away with a sharp pang of humiliation . [Her]297-the girl frugal silence mocked [his]71-darrow prodigality of hopes and fears . [He]71-darrow had put [his]71-darrow question to [the porter]195-the porter once before , on returning to [the hotel]443-the hotel after luncheon ; and now , coming back again in the late afternoon , [he]71-darrow was met by the same denial . The second post was in , and had brought [him]71-darrow nothing . A glance at [his]71-darrow watch showed that [he]71-darrow had barely time to dress before taking [Miss Viner]82-miss viner out to dine ; but as [he]71-darrow turned to [the lift]538-the lift a new thought struck [him]71-darrow , and hurrying back into [the hall]539-the hall [he]71-darrow dashed off another telegram to [[his]71-darrow servant]301-his servant : “ Have [you]301-his servant forwarded any letter with French postmark today ? Telegraph answer Terminus . ”[71-darrow] Some kind of reply would be certain to reach [him]71-darrow on [his]71-darrow return from [the theatre]237-the theatre , and [he]71-darrow would then know definitely whether [Mrs. Leath]75-owen meant to write or not . [He]71-darrow hastened up to [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room and dressed with a lighter heart . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s vagrant trunk had finally found its way to [its owner]543-its owner ; and , clad in such modest splendour as it furnished , [she]82-miss viner shone at [Darrow]71-darrow across [their]544-their restaurant table . In the reaction of [his]71-darrow wounded vanity [he]71-darrow found [her]82-miss viner prettier and more interesting than before . [Her]82-miss viner dress , sloping away from the throat , showed the graceful set of [her]82-miss viner head on its slender neck , and the wide brim of [her]82-miss viner hat arched above [her]82-miss viner hair like a dusky halo . Pleasure danced in [her]82-miss viner eyes and on [her]82-miss viner lips , and as [she]82-miss viner shone on [him]71-darrow between the candle - shades [Darrow]71-darrow felt that [he]71-darrow should not be at all sorry to be seen with [her]82-miss viner in public . [He]71-darrow even sent a careless glance about [him]71-darrow in the vague hope that it might fall on [an acquaintance]545-an acquaintance . At [the theatre]237-the theatre [her]82-miss viner vivacity sank into a breathless hush , and [she]82-miss viner sat intent in [her]82-miss viner corner of [[their]547-their baignoire]548-their baignoire , with the gaze of [a neophyte about to be initiated into the sacred mysteries]549-a neophyte about to be initiated into the sacred mysteries . [Darrow]71-darrow placed [himself]71-darrow behind [her]82-miss viner , that [he]71-darrow might catch [her]82-miss viner profile between [himself]71-darrow and [the stage]550-the stage . [He]71-darrow was touched by the youthful seriousness of [her]82-miss viner expression . In spite of the experiences [she]82-miss viner must have had , and of the twenty - four years to which [she]82-miss viner owned , [she]82-miss viner struck [him]71-darrow as intrinsically young ; and [he]71-darrow wondered how so evanescent a quality could have been preserved in the desiccating Murrett air . As the play progressed [he]71-darrow noticed that [her]82-miss viner immobility was traversed by swift flashes of perception . [She]82-miss viner was not missing anything , and [her]82-miss viner intensity of attention when [Cerdine]100-cerdine was on [the stage]550-the stage drew an anxious line between [her]82-miss viner brows . After the first act [she]82-miss viner remained for a few minutes rapt and motionless ; then [she]82-miss viner turned to [[her]82-miss viner companion]395-her companion with a quick patter of questions . [He]71-darrow gathered from [them]553-them that [she]82-miss viner had been less interested in following the general drift of the play than in observing the details of its interpretation . Every gesture and inflection of [the great actress]554-the great actress ’s had been marked and analyzed ; and [Darrow]71-darrow felt a secret gratification in being appealed to as [an authority on the histrionic art]555-an authority on the histrionic art . [His]71-darrow interest in it had hitherto been merely that of [the cultivated young man curious of all forms of artistic expression]556-the cultivated young man curious of all forms of artistic expression ; but in reply to [her]82-miss viner questions [he]71-darrow found things to say about it which evidently struck [his]71-darrow listener as impressive and original , and with which [he]71-darrow [himself]71-darrow was not , on the whole , dissatisfied . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner was much more concerned to hear [his]71-darrow views than to express [her]82-miss viner own , and the deference with which [she]82-miss viner received [his]71-darrow comments called from [him]71-darrow more ideas about the theatre than [he]71-darrow had ever supposed [himself]71-darrow to possess . With the second act [she]82-miss viner began to give more attention to the development of the play , though [her]82-miss viner interest was excited rather by what [she]82-miss viner called “ the story ”[82-miss viner] than by the conflict of character producing it . Oddly combined with [her]82-miss viner sharp apprehension of things theatrical , [her]82-miss viner knowledge of technical “ dodges ”[82-miss viner] and green - room precedents , [her]82-miss viner glibness about “ lines ”[82-miss viner] and “ curtains ”[82-miss viner] , was the primitive simplicity of [her]82-miss viner attitude toward the tale itself , as toward something that was “ really happening ”[82-miss viner] and at which one assisted as at a street - accident or a quarrel overheard in [the next room]557-the next room . [She]82-miss viner wanted to know if [Darrow]71-darrow thought [the lovers]558-the lovers “ really would ”[82-miss viner] be involved in the catastrophe that threatened [them]558-the lovers , and when [he]71-darrow reminded [her]82-miss viner that [his]71-darrow predictions were disqualified by [his]71-darrow having already seen the play , [she]82-miss viner exclaimed : “ Oh , then , please do n’t tell [me]82-miss viner what ’s going to happen ! ”[82-miss viner] and the next moment was questioning [him]71-darrow about [Cerdine]100-cerdine ’s theatrical situation and [her]100-cerdine private history . On the latter point some of [her]82-miss viner enquiries were of a kind that it is not in the habit of [young girls]379-young girls to make , or even to know how to make ; but [her]82-miss viner apparent unconsciousness of the fact seemed rather to reflect on [[her]82-miss viner past associates]560-her past associates than on [herself]82-miss viner . When the second act was over , [Darrow]71-darrow suggested [their]558-the lovers taking a turn in [the foyer]561-the foyer ; and seated on one of [its]561-the foyer cramped red velvet sofas [they]558-the lovers watched [the crowd]254-the crowd surge up and down in a glare of lights and gilding . Then , as [she]82-miss viner complained of the heat , [he]71-darrow led [her]82-miss viner through [the press]563-the press to [the congested cafe at the foot of the stairs]564-the congested cafe at the foot of the stairs , where orangeades were thrust at [them]558-the lovers between the shoulders of [packed consommateurs]565-packed consommateurs and [Darrow]71-darrow , lighting a cigarette while [she]82-miss viner sucked [her]82-miss viner straw , knew the primitive complacency of [the man at whose companion other men]566-the man at whose companion other men stare . On a corner of [their]558-the lovers table lay a smeared copy of a theatrical journal . It caught [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s eye and after poring over the page [she]82-miss viner looked up with an excited exclamation . “ [They]2367-they ’re giving [Oedipe]105-oedipe tomorrow afternoon at [the Francais]20-the francais ! [I]82-miss viner suppose [you]71-darrow ’ve seen it heaps and heaps of times ? ”[82-miss viner] [He]71-darrow smiled back at [her]82-miss viner . “ [You]82-miss viner must see it too . [We]558-the lovers ’ll go tomorrow . ”[71-darrow] [She]82-miss viner sighed at [his]71-darrow suggestion , but without discarding it . “ How can [I]82-miss viner ? [The last train]2368-the last train for [Joigny]19-joigny leaves at four . ”[82-miss viner] “ But [you]71-darrow do n’t know yet that [[your]71-darrow friends]2337-your friends will want [you]71-darrow . ”[82-miss viner] “ [I]82-miss viner shall know tomorrow early . [I]82-miss viner asked [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow to telegraph as soon as [she]96-mrs. farlow got [my]82-miss viner letter . ”[82-miss viner] A twinge of compunction shot through [Darrow]71-darrow . [Her]82-miss viner words recalled to [him]71-darrow that on [their]567-their return to [the hotel]443-the hotel after luncheon [she]82-miss viner had given [him]71-darrow [her]82-miss viner letter to post , and that [he]71-darrow had never thought of it again . No doubt it was still in the pocket of the coat [he]71-darrow had taken off when [he]71-darrow dressed for dinner . In [his]71-darrow perturbation [he]71-darrow pushed back [his]71-darrow chair , and the movement made [her]82-miss viner look up at [him]71-darrow . “ What ’s the matter ? ”[82-miss viner] “ Nothing . Only -- [you]71-darrow know [I]82-miss viner do n’t fancy that letter can have caught this afternoon ’s post . ”[82-miss viner] “ Not caught it ? Why not ? ”[82-miss viner] “ Why , [I]71-darrow ’m afraid it will have been too late . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow bent [his]71-darrow head to light another cigarette . [She]82-miss viner struck [her]82-miss viner hands together with a gesture which , to [his]71-darrow amusement , [he]71-darrow noticed [she]82-miss viner had caught from [Cerdine]100-cerdine . “ Oh , dear , [I]82-miss viner had n’t thought of that ! But surely it will reach [them]2370-them in the morning ? ”[82-miss viner] “ Some time in the morning , [I]82-miss viner suppose . [You]71-darrow know [the French provincial post]2371-the french provincial post is never in a hurry . [I]82-miss viner do n’t believe [your]71-darrow letter would have been delivered this evening in any case . ”[82-miss viner] As this idea occurred to [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow felt [himself]71-darrow almost absolved . “ Perhaps , then , [I]71-darrow ought to have telegraphed ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]82-miss viner ’ll telegraph for [you]71-darrow in the morning if [you]71-darrow say so . ”[82-miss viner] The bell announcing the close of the entr’-acte shrilled through [the cafe]569-the cafe , and [she]82-miss viner sprang to [her]82-miss viner feet . “ Oh , come , come ! [We]2372-we must n’t miss it ! ”[82-miss viner] Instantly forgetful of [the Farlows]94-the farlows , [she]82-miss viner slipped [her]82-miss viner arm through [his]71-darrow and turned to push [her]82-miss viner way back to [the theatre]237-the theatre . As soon as the curtain went up [she]82-miss viner as promptly forgot [[her]82-miss viner companion]395-her companion . Watching [her]82-miss viner from the corner to which [he]71-darrow had returned , [Darrow]71-darrow saw that great waves of sensation were beating deliciously against [her]82-miss viner brain . It was as though every starved sensibility were throwing out feelers to the mounting tide ; as though everything [she]82-miss viner was seeing , hearing , imagining , rushed in to fill the void of all [she]82-miss viner had always been denied . [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow observed [her]82-miss viner , again felt a detached enjoyment in [her]82-miss viner pleasure . [She]82-miss viner was an extraordinary conductor of sensation : [she]82-miss viner seemed to transmit it physically , in emanations that set the blood dancing in [his]71-darrow veins . [He]71-darrow had not often had the opportunity of studying the effects of a perfectly fresh impression on so responsive a temperament , and [he]71-darrow felt a fleeting desire to make its chords vibrate for [his]71-darrow own amusement . At the end of the next act [she]82-miss viner discovered with dismay that in [their]572-their transit to [the cafe]569-the cafe [she]82-miss viner had lost the beautiful pictured programme [he]71-darrow had bought for [her]82-miss viner . [She]82-miss viner wanted to go back and hunt for it , but [Darrow]71-darrow assured [her]82-miss viner that [he]71-darrow would have no trouble in getting [her]82-miss viner another . When [he]71-darrow went out in quest of it [she]82-miss viner followed [him]71-darrow protestingly to the door of the box , and [he]71-darrow saw that [she]82-miss viner was distressed at the thought of [his]71-darrow having to spend an additional franc for [her]82-miss viner . This frugality smote [Darrow]71-darrow by its contrast to [her]82-miss viner natural bright profusion ; and again [he]71-darrow felt the desire to right so clumsy an injustice . When [he]71-darrow returned to the box [she]82-miss viner was still standing in the doorway , and [he]71-darrow noticed that [his]71-darrow were not the only eyes attracted to [her]82-miss viner . Then another impression sharply diverted [his]71-darrow attention . Above the fagged faces of [the Parisian crowd]574-the parisian crowd [he]71-darrow had caught the fresh fair countenance of [Owen Leath]75-owen signalling a joyful recognition . [The young man]217-the young man , slim and eager , had detached [himself]217-the young man from [two companions of [his]217-the young man own type]576-two companions of his own type , and was seeking to push through the press to [[his]217-the young man step - mother ’s friend]577-his step - mother ’s friend . The encounter , to [Darrow]71-darrow , could hardly have been more inopportune ; it woke in [him]71-darrow a confusion of feelings of which only the uppermost was allayed by seeing [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , as if instinctively warned , melt back into the shadow of [their]578-we box . A minute later [Owen Leath]75-owen was at [his]71-darrow side . “ [I]75-owen was sure it was [you]71-darrow ! Such luck to run across [you]71-darrow ! Wo n’t [you]71-darrow come off with [us]578-we to supper after it ’s over ? [Montmartre]26-montmartre , or wherever else [you]71-darrow please . [Those two chaps]2373-those two chaps over there are [friends of mine]2374-friends of mine , at [the Beaux Arts]2375-the beaux arts ; both of [them]2373-those two chaps rather [good fellows]2376-good fellows -- and [we]578-we ’d be so glad---- ”[75-owen] For half a second [Darrow]71-darrow read in [his]71-darrow hospitable eye the termination “ if [you]71-darrow ’d bring [the lady]2377-the lady too ”[71-darrow] ; then it deflected into : “ [We]578-we ’d all be so glad if [you]71-darrow ’d come . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow , excusing [himself]71-darrow with thanks , lingered on for a few minutes ’ chat , in which every word , and every tone of [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s voice , was like a sharp light flashed into aching eyes . [He]71-darrow was glad when the bell called [the audience]580-the audience to [their]580-the audience seats , and [young Leath]75-owen left [him]71-darrow with the friendly question : “ [We]578-we ’ll see [you]71-darrow at [Givre]30-givre later on ? ”[75-owen] When [he]71-darrow rejoined [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , [Darrow]71-darrow ’s first care was to find out , by a rapid inspection of [the house]581-the house , whether [Owen Leath]75-owen ’s seat had given [him]71-darrow a view of [[their]582-their box]583-their box . But [the young man]217-the young man was not visible from [it]583-their box , and [Darrow]71-darrow concluded that [he]71-darrow had been recognized in [the corridor]585-the corridor and not at [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s side . [He]71-darrow scarcely knew why it seemed to [him]71-darrow so important that this point should be settled ; certainly [his]71-darrow sense of reassurance was less due to regard for [Miss Viner]82-miss viner than to the persistent vision of grave offended eyes ... During the drive back to [the hotel]443-the hotel this vision was persistently kept before [him]71-darrow by the thought that the evening post might have brought a letter from [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . Even if no letter had yet come , [[his]71-darrow servant]301-his servant might have telegraphed to say that one was on its way ; and at the thought [his]71-darrow interest in [the girl at [his]71-darrow side]589-the girl at his side again cooled to the fraternal , the almost fatherly . [She]589-the girl at his side was no more to [him]71-darrow , after all , than an appealing young creature to whom it was mildly agreeable to have offered an evening ’s diversion ; and when , as [they]590-they rolled into [the illuminated court of [the hotel]443-the hotel]591-the illuminated court of the hotel , [she]589-the girl at his side turned with a quick movement which brought [her]589-the girl at his side happy face close to [his]71-darrow , [he]71-darrow leaned away , affecting to be absorbed in opening the door of [the cab]593-the cab . At the desk [the night porter , after a vain search through the pigeon - holes]594-the night porter , after a vain search through the pigeon - holes , was disposed to think that a letter or telegram had in fact been sent up for [the gentleman]595-the gentleman ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , at the announcement , could hardly wait to ascend to [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room . [Upstairs]597-upstairs , [he]71-darrow and [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion had [the long dimly - lit corridor]599-the long dimly - lit corridor to [themselves]590-they , and [Sophy]81-sophy viner paused on [her]81-sophy viner threshold , gathering up in one hand the pale folds of [her]81-sophy viner cloak , while [she]81-sophy viner held the other out to [Darrow]71-darrow . “ If the telegram comes early [I]81-sophy viner shall be off by [the first train]2378-the first train ; so [I]81-sophy viner suppose this is good - bye , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said , [her]81-sophy viner eyes dimmed by a little shadow of regret . [Darrow]71-darrow , with a renewed start of contrition , perceived that [he]71-darrow had again forgotten [her]81-sophy viner letter ; and as [their]590-they hands met [he]71-darrow vowed to [himself]71-darrow that the moment [she]81-sophy viner had left [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow would dash down [stairs]600-stairs to post it . “ Oh , [I]71-darrow ’ll see [you]81-sophy viner in the morning , of course ! ”[71-darrow] A tremor of pleasure crossed [her]81-sophy viner face as [he]71-darrow stood before [her]81-sophy viner , smiling a little uncertainly . “ At any rate , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said , “ [I]81-sophy viner want to thank [you]71-darrow now for [my]81-sophy viner good day . ”[81-sophy viner] [He]71-darrow felt in [her]81-sophy viner hand the same tremor [he]71-darrow had seen in [her]81-sophy viner face . “ But it ’s [YOU]81-sophy viner , on the contrary-- ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow began , lifting the hand to [his]71-darrow lips . As [he]71-darrow dropped it , and [their]601-their eyes met , something passed through [hers]81-sophy viner that was like a light carried rapidly behind a curtained window . “ Good night ; [you]81-sophy viner must be awfully tired , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said with a friendly abruptness , turning away without even waiting to see [her]81-sophy viner pass into [[her]81-sophy viner room]602-her room . [He]71-darrow unlocked [his]71-darrow door , and stumbling over the threshold groped in the darkness for the electric button . The light showed [him]71-darrow a telegram on the table , and [he]71-darrow forgot everything else as [he]71-darrow caught it up . “ No letter from [France]4-france , ”[71-darrow] the message read . It fell from [Darrow]71-darrow ’s hand to the floor , and [he]71-darrow dropped into a chair by the table and sat gazing at the dingy drab and olive pattern of the carpet . [She]81-sophy viner had not written , then ; [she]81-sophy viner had not written , and it was manifest now that [she]81-sophy viner did not mean to write . If [she]81-sophy viner had had any intention of explaining [her]81-sophy viner telegram [she]81-sophy viner would certainly , within twenty - four hours , have followed it up by a letter . But [she]81-sophy viner evidently did not intend to explain it , and [her]81-sophy viner silence could mean only that [she]81-sophy viner had no explanation to give , or else that [she]81-sophy viner was too indifferent to be aware that one was needed . [Darrow]71-darrow , face to face with these alternatives , felt a recrudescence of boyish misery . It was no longer [his]71-darrow hurt vanity that cried out . [He]71-darrow told [himself]71-darrow that [he]71-darrow could have borne an equal amount of pain , if only it had left [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s image untouched ; but [he]71-darrow could not bear to think of [her]81-sophy viner as trivial or insincere . The thought was so intolerable that [he]71-darrow felt a blind desire to punish [some one else]603-some one else for the pain it caused [him]71-darrow . As [he]71-darrow sat moodily staring at the carpet its silly intricacies melted into a blur from which the eyes of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen again looked out at [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow saw the fine sweep of [her]81-sophy viner brows , and the deep look beneath them as [she]81-sophy viner had turned from [him]71-darrow on [their]604-their last evening in [London]3-london . “ This will be good - bye , then , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner had said ; and it occurred to [him]71-darrow that [her]81-sophy viner parting phrase had been the same as Sophy [Viner]81-sophy viner ’s . At the thought [he]71-darrow jumped to [his]71-darrow feet and took down from its hook the coat in which [he]71-darrow had left [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s letter . The clock marked the third quarter after midnight , and [he]71-darrow knew it would make no difference if [he]71-darrow went down to the post - box now or early the next morning ; but [he]71-darrow wanted to clear [his]71-darrow conscience , and having found the letter [he]71-darrow went to the door . A sound in [the next room]557-the next room made [him]71-darrow pause . [He]71-darrow had become conscious again that , a few feet off , on the other side of a thin partition , a small keen flame of life was quivering and agitating the air . [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s face came back to [him]71-darrow insistently . It was as vivid now as [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s had been a moment earlier . [He]71-darrow recalled with a faint smile of retrospective pleasure [the girl]297-the girl ’s enjoyment of [her]297-the girl evening , and the innumerable fine feelers of sensation [she]297-the girl had thrown out to its impressions . It gave [him]71-darrow a curiously close sense of [her]297-the girl presence to think that at that moment [she]297-the girl was living over [her]297-the girl enjoyment as intensely as [he]71-darrow was living over [his]71-darrow unhappiness . [His]71-darrow own case was irremediable , but it was easy enough to give [her]297-the girl a few more hours of pleasure . And did [she]297-the girl not perhaps secretly expect it of [him]71-darrow ? After all , if [she]297-the girl had been very anxious to join [[her]297-the girl friends]460-her friends [she]297-the girl would have telegraphed [them]460-her friends on reaching [Paris]10-paris , instead of writing . [He]71-darrow wondered now that [he]71-darrow had not been struck at the moment by so artless a device to gain more time . The fact of [her]297-the girl having practised it did not make [him]71-darrow think less well of [her]297-the girl ; it merely strengthened the impulse to use [his]71-darrow opportunity . [She]297-the girl was starving , [poor child]608-poor child , for a little amusement , a little personal life -- why not give [her]297-the girl the chance of another day in [Paris]10-paris ? If [he]71-darrow did so , should [he]71-darrow not be merely falling in with [her]297-the girl own hopes ? At the thought [his]71-darrow sympathy for [her]297-the girl revived . [She]297-the girl became of absorbing interest to [him]71-darrow as an escape from [himself]71-darrow and an object about which [his]71-darrow thwarted activities could cluster . [He]71-darrow felt less drearily alone because of [her]297-the girl being there , on the other side of the door , and in [his]71-darrow gratitude to [her]297-the girl for giving [him]71-darrow this relief [he]71-darrow began , with indolent amusement , to plan new ways of detaining [her]297-the girl . [He]71-darrow dropped back into [his]71-darrow chair , lit a cigar , and smiled a little at the image of [her]297-the girl smiling face . [He]71-darrow tried to imagine what incident of the day [she]297-the girl was likely to be recalling at that particular moment , and what part [he]71-darrow probably played in it . That it was not a small part [he]71-darrow was certain , and the knowledge was undeniably pleasant . Now and then a sound from [[her]297-the girl room]602-her room brought before [him]71-darrow more vividly the reality of the situation and the strangeness of the vast swarming solitude in which [he]71-darrow and [she]297-the girl were momentarily isolated , amid long lines of [rooms each holding its separate secret]610-rooms each holding its separate secret . The nearness of all these other mysteries enclosing [theirs]611-theirs gave [Darrow]71-darrow a more intimate sense of [the girl]297-the girl ’s presence , and through the fumes of [his]71-darrow cigar [his]71-darrow imagination continued to follow [her]297-the girl to and fro , traced the curve of [her]297-the girl slim young arms as [she]297-the girl raised them to undo [her]297-the girl hair , pictured the sliding down of [her]297-the girl dress to the waist and then to the knees , and the whiteness of [her]297-the girl feet as [she]297-the girl slipped across the floor to bed ... [He]71-darrow stood up and shook [himself]71-darrow with a yawn , throwing away the end of [his]71-darrow cigar . [His]71-darrow glance , in following it , lit on the telegram which had dropped to the floor . The sounds in [the next room]557-the next room had ceased , and once more [he]71-darrow felt alone and unhappy . Opening the window , [he]71-darrow folded [his]71-darrow arms on the sill and looked out on the vast light - spangled mass of [the city]474-the city , and then up at the dark sky , in which [the morning planet]615-the morning planet stood . [VI]107-vi At [the Theatre Francais]616-the theatre francais , the next afternoon , [Darrow]71-darrow yawned and fidgeted in [his]71-darrow seat . The day was warm , [the theatre]237-the theatre crowded and airless , and the performance , it seemed to [him]71-darrow , intolerably bad . [He]71-darrow stole a glance at [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion , wondering if [she]276-his companion shared [his]71-darrow feelings . [Her]276-his companion rapt profile betrayed no unrest , but politeness might have caused [her]276-his companion to feign an interest that [she]276-his companion did not feel . [He]71-darrow leaned back impatiently , stifling another yawn , and trying to fix [his]71-darrow attention on the stage . Great things were going forward there , and [he]71-darrow was not insensible to the stern beauties of the ancient drama . But the interpretation of the play seemed to [him]71-darrow as airless and lifeless as the atmosphere of [the theatre]237-the theatre . [The players]620-the players were the same whom [he]71-darrow had often applauded in those very parts , and perhaps that fact added to the impression of staleness and conventionality produced by [their]620-the players performance . Surely it was time to infuse new blood into the veins of the moribund art . [He]71-darrow had the impression that the ghosts of [actors]621-actors were giving a spectral performance on [the shores of [Styx]31-styx]622-the shores of styx . Certainly it was not the most profitable way for [a young man with [a pretty companion]624-a pretty companion to pass the golden hours of a spring afternoon]623-a young man with a pretty companion to pass the golden hours of a spring afternoon . The freshness of the face at [his]71-darrow side , reflecting the freshness of the season , suggested dapplings of sunlight through new leaves , the sound of a brook in the grass , the ripple of tree - shadows over breezy meadows ... When at length the fateful march of [the cothurns]625-the cothurns was stayed by the single pause in the play , and [Darrow]71-darrow had led [Miss Viner]82-miss viner out on [the balcony overhanging the square before [the theatre]237-the theatre]626-the balcony overhanging the square before the theatre , [he]71-darrow turned to see if [she]82-miss viner shared [his]71-darrow feelings . But the rapturous look [she]82-miss viner gave [him]71-darrow checked the depreciation on [his]71-darrow lips . “ Oh , why did [you]71-darrow bring [me]82-miss viner out here ? [One]2308-one ought to creep away and sit in the dark till it begins again ! ”[82-miss viner] “ Is THAT the way [they]2380-they made [you]71-darrow feel ? ”[82-miss viner] “ Did n’t [they]2380-they _ [YOU?_]71-darrow ... As if [the gods]2381-the gods were there all the while , just behind [them]2380-they , pulling the strings ? ”[82-miss viner] [Her]82-miss viner hands were pressed against the railing , [her]82-miss viner face shining and darkening under the wing - beats of successive impressions . [Darrow]71-darrow smiled in enjoyment of [her]82-miss viner pleasure . After all , [he]71-darrow had felt all that , long ago ; perhaps it was [his]71-darrow own fault , rather than that of [the actors]628-the actors , that the poetry of the play seemed to have evaporated ... But no , [he]71-darrow had been right in judging the performance to be dull and stale : it was simply [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s inexperience , [her]82-miss viner lack of occasions to compare and estimate , that made [her]82-miss viner think it brilliant . “ [I]82-miss viner was afraid [you]82-miss viner were bored and wanted to come away . ”[82-miss viner] “ BORED ? ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner made a little aggrieved grimace . “ [You]82-miss viner mean [you]82-miss viner thought [me]82-miss viner too ignorant and stupid to appreciate it ? ”[82-miss viner] “ No ; not that . ”[82-miss viner] The hand nearest [him]71-darrow still lay on the railing of [the balcony]630-the balcony , and [he]71-darrow covered it for a moment with [his]71-darrow . As [he]71-darrow did so [he]71-darrow saw the colour rise and tremble in [her]82-miss viner cheek . “ Tell [me]71-darrow just what [you]82-miss viner think , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , bending [his]71-darrow head a little , and only half - aware of [his]71-darrow words . [She]82-miss viner did not turn [her]82-miss viner face to [his]71-darrow , but began to talk rapidly , trying to convey something of what [she]82-miss viner felt . But [she]82-miss viner was evidently unused to analyzing [her]82-miss viner aesthetic emotions , and the tumultuous rush of the drama seemed to have left [her]82-miss viner in a state of panting wonder , as though it had been a storm or some other natural cataclysm . [She]82-miss viner had no literary or historic associations to which to attach [her]82-miss viner impressions : [her]82-miss viner education had evidently not comprised a course in Greek literature . But [she]82-miss viner felt what would probably have been unperceived by many [a young lady who had taken a first in classics : the ineluctable fatality of the tale]631-a young lady who had taken a first in classics : the ineluctable fatality of the tale , the dread sway in it of the same mysterious “ luck ”[631-a young lady who had taken a first in classics : the ineluctable fatality of the tale] which pulled the threads of [her]82-miss viner own small destiny . It was not literature to [her]82-miss viner , it was fact : as actual , as near by , as what was happening to [her]82-miss viner at the moment and what the next hour held in store . Seen in this light , the play regained for [Darrow]71-darrow its supreme and poignant reality . [He]71-darrow pierced to the heart of its significance through all the artificial accretions with which [his]71-darrow theories of art and the conventions of the stage had clothed it , and saw it as [he]71-darrow had never seen it : as life . After this there could be no question of flight , and [he]71-darrow took [her]82-miss viner back to [the theatre]237-the theatre , content to receive [his]71-darrow own sensations through the medium of [hers]82-miss viner . But with the continuation of the play , and the oppression of the heavy air , [his]71-darrow attention again began to wander , straying back over the incidents of the morning . [He]71-darrow had been with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner all day , and [he]71-darrow was surprised to find how quickly the time had gone . [She]82-miss viner had hardly attempted , as the hours passed , to conceal [her]82-miss viner satisfaction on finding that no telegram came from [the Farlows]94-the farlows . “ [They]94-the farlows ’ll have written , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner had simply said ; and [her]82-miss viner mind had at once flown on to the golden prospect of an afternoon at [the theatre]237-the theatre . The intervening hours had been disposed of in a stroll through [the lively streets]634-the lively streets , and a repast , luxuriously lingered over , under the chestnut - boughs of [a restaurant in [the Champs Elysees]32-the champs elysees]635-a restaurant in the champs elysees . Everything entertained and interested [her]82-miss viner , and [Darrow]71-darrow remarked , with an amused detachment , that [she]82-miss viner was not insensible to the impression [her]82-miss viner charms produced . Yet there was no hard edge of vanity in [her]82-miss viner sense of [her]82-miss viner prettiness : [she]82-miss viner seemed simply to be aware of it as a note in the general harmony , and to enjoy sounding the note as [a singer]636-a singer enjoys singing . After luncheon , as [they]637-they sat over [their]637-they coffee , [she]82-miss viner had again asked an immense number of questions and delivered [herself]82-miss viner of a remarkable variety of opinions . [Her]82-miss viner questions testified to a wholesome and comprehensive human curiosity , and [her]82-miss viner comments showed , like [her]82-miss viner face and [her]82-miss viner whole attitude , an odd mingling of precocious wisdom and disarming ignorance . When [she]82-miss viner talked to [him]71-darrow about “ life”--the[82-miss viner] word was often on [her]82-miss viner lips -- [she]82-miss viner seemed to [him]71-darrow like [a child playing with a tiger]638-a child playing with a tiger ’s cub ; and [he]71-darrow said to [himself]71-darrow that some day [the child]639-the child would grow up -- and so would the tiger . Meanwhile , such expertness qualified by such candour made it impossible to guess the extent of [her]82-miss viner personal experience , or to estimate its effect on [her]82-miss viner character . [She]82-miss viner might be [any one of a dozen definable types]640-any one of a dozen definable types , or [she]82-miss viner might -- more disconcertingly to [[her]82-miss viner companion]395-her companion and more perilously to [herself]82-miss viner -- be a shifting and uncrystallized mixture of [them]642-them all . [Her]82-miss viner talk , as usual , had promptly reverted to the stage . [She]82-miss viner was eager to learn about every form of dramatic expression which the metropolis of things theatrical had to offer , and [her]82-miss viner curiosity ranged from the official temples of the art to its less hallowed haunts . [Her]82-miss viner searching enquiries about a play whose production , on one of the latter scenes , had provoked a considerable amount of scandal , led [Darrow]71-darrow to throw out laughingly : “ To see THAT [you]82-miss viner ’ll have to wait till [you]82-miss viner ’re married ! ”[71-darrow] and [his]71-darrow answer had sent [her]82-miss viner off at a tangent . “ Oh , [I]82-miss viner never mean to marry , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner had rejoined in a tone of youthful finality . “ [I]82-miss viner seem to have heard that before ! ”[82-miss viner] “ Yes ; from [girls who ’ve only got to choose]2382-girls who ’ve only got to choose ! ”[82-miss viner] [Her]82-miss viner eyes had grown suddenly almost old . “ [I]82-miss viner ’d like [you]71-darrow to see [the only men who ’ve ever wanted to marry]2383-the only men who ’ve ever wanted to marry [me]82-miss viner ! [One]2308-one was [the doctor on [the steamer]2386-the steamer]2385-the doctor on the steamer , when [I]82-miss viner came abroad with [the Hokes]104-the hokes : [he]2308-one ’d been cashiered from the navy for drunkenness . [The other]2387-the other was [a deaf widower with [three grown - up daughters]2389-three grown - up daughters , who kept [a clock - shop in [Bayswater!--Besides]33-bayswater!--besides]2390-a clock - shop in bayswater!--besides]2388-a deaf widower with three grown - up daughters , who kept a clock - shop in bayswater!--besides , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner rambled on , “ [I]82-miss viner ’m not so sure that [I]82-miss viner believe in marriage . [You]643-he see [I]82-miss viner ’m all for self - development and the chance to live [one]2308-one ’s life . [I]82-miss viner ’m awfully modern , [you]643-he know . ”[82-miss viner] It was just when [she]82-miss viner proclaimed [herself]82-miss viner most awfully modern that [she]82-miss viner struck [him]643-he as most helplessly backward ; yet the moment after , without any bravado , or apparent desire to assume an attitude , [she]82-miss viner would propound some social axiom which could have been gathered only in the bitter soil of experience . All these things came back to [him]643-he as [he]643-he sat beside [her]82-miss viner in [the theatre]237-the theatre and watched [her]82-miss viner ingenuous absorption . It was on “ the story ”[82-miss viner] that [her]82-miss viner mind was fixed , and in life also , [he]643-he suspected , it would always be “ the story ”[82-miss viner] , rather than its remoter imaginative issues , that would hold [her]82-miss viner . [He]643-he did not believe there were ever any echoes in [her]82-miss viner soul ... There was no question , however , that what [she]82-miss viner felt was felt with intensity : to the actual , the immediate , [she]82-miss viner spread vibrating strings . When the play was over , and [they]645-they came out once more into the sunlight , [Darrow]71-darrow looked down at [her]82-miss viner with a smile . “ Well ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked . [She]82-miss viner made no answer . [Her]82-miss viner dark gaze seemed to rest on [him]71-darrow without seeing [him]71-darrow . [Her]82-miss viner cheeks and lips were pale , and the loose hair under [her]82-miss viner hat - brim clung to [her]82-miss viner forehead in damp rings . [She]82-miss viner looked like [a young priestess still dazed by the fumes of the cavern]646-a young priestess still dazed by the fumes of the cavern . “ [[You]82-miss viner poor child]2392-you poor child -- it ’s been almost too much for [you]82-miss viner ! ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner shook [her]82-miss viner head with a vague smile . “ Come , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on , putting [his]71-darrow hand on [her]82-miss viner arm , “ let [’s]647-’s jump into [a taxi]2393-a taxi and get some air and sunshine . Look , there are hours of daylight left ; and see what a night it ’s going to be ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow pointed over [their]647-’s heads , to where a white moon hung in the misty blue above the roofs of the [rue de Rivoli]34-rue de rivoli . [She]82-miss viner made no answer , and [he]71-darrow signed to [a motor - cab]648-a motor - cab , calling out to [the driver]649-the driver : “ To [the Bois]2394-the bois ! ”[71-darrow] As [the carriage]650-the carriage turned toward [the Tuileries]651-the tuileries [she]82-miss viner roused [herself]82-miss viner . “ [I]82-miss viner must go first to [the hotel]443-the hotel . There may be a message -- at any rate [I]82-miss viner must decide on something . ”[82-miss viner] [Darrow]71-darrow saw that the reality of the situation had suddenly forced itself upon [her]82-miss viner . “ [I]82-miss viner MUST decide on something , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner repeated . [He]71-darrow would have liked to postpone the return , to persuade [her]82-miss viner to drive directly to [the Bois]2394-the bois for dinner . It would have been easy enough to remind [her]82-miss viner that [she]82-miss viner could not start for [Joigny]19-joigny that evening , and that therefore it was of no moment whether [she]82-miss viner received [the Farlows]94-the farlows ’ answer then or a few hours later ; but for some reason [he]71-darrow hesitated to use this argument , which had come so naturally to [him]71-darrow the day before . After all , [he]71-darrow knew [she]82-miss viner would find nothing at [the hotel]443-the hotel -- so what did it matter if [they]654-they went [there]2294-there ? [The porter]195-the porter , interrogated , was not sure . [He]71-darrow [himself]71-darrow had received nothing for [the lady]2377-the lady , but in [his]71-darrow absence [[his]71-darrow subordinate]658-his subordinate might have sent a letter [upstairs]597-upstairs . [Darrow]71-darrow and [Sophy]81-sophy viner mounted together in [the lift]538-the lift , and [the young man]217-the young man , while [she]82-miss viner went into [[her]82-miss viner room]602-her room , unlocked [his]217-the young man own door and glanced at the empty table . For [him]217-the young man at least no message had come ; and on [her]82-miss viner threshold , a moment later , [she]82-miss viner met [him]217-the young man with the expected : “ No -- there ’s nothing ! ”[82-miss viner] [He]217-the young man feigned an unregretful surprise . “ So much the better ! And now , shall [we]2396-we drive out somewhere ? Or would [you]217-the young man rather take [a boat]2397-a boat to [Bellevue]35-bellevue ? Have [you]217-the young man ever dined [there]2294-there , on [the terrace]2399-the terrace , by moonlight ? It ’s not at all bad . And there ’s no earthly use in sitting here waiting . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner stood before [him]217-the young man in perplexity . “ But when [I]82-miss viner wrote yesterday [I]82-miss viner asked [them]2400-they to telegraph . [I]82-miss viner suppose [they]2400-they ’re horribly hard up , [the poor dears]2401-the poor dears , and [they]2400-they thought a letter would do as well as a telegram . ”[82-miss viner] The colour had risen to [her]82-miss viner face . “ That ’s why [I]82-miss viner wrote instead of telegraphing ; [I]82-miss viner have n’t a penny to spare [myself]82-miss viner ! ”[82-miss viner] Nothing [she]82-miss viner could have said could have filled [her]82-miss viner listener with a deeper contrition . [He]217-the young man felt the red in [his]217-the young man own face as [he]217-the young man recalled the motive with which [he]217-the young man had credited [her]82-miss viner in [his]217-the young man midnight musings . But that motive , after all , had simply been trumped up to justify [his]217-the young man own disloyalty : [he]217-the young man had never really believed in it . The reflection deepened [his]217-the young man confusion , and [he]217-the young man would have liked to take [her]82-miss viner hand in [his]217-the young man and confess the injustice [he]217-the young man had done [her]82-miss viner . [She]82-miss viner may have interpreted [his]217-the young man change of colour as an involuntary protest at being initiated into such shabby details , for [she]82-miss viner went on with a laugh : “ [I]82-miss viner suppose [you]217-the young man can hardly understand what it means to have to stop and think whether [one]2402-one can afford a telegram ? But [I]82-miss viner ’ve always had to consider such things . And [I]82-miss viner must n’t stay [here]2403-here any longer now -- [I]82-miss viner must try to get [a night train]2404-a night train for [Joigny]19-joigny . Even if [the Farlows]94-the farlows ca n’t take [me]82-miss viner in , [I]82-miss viner can go to [the hotel]443-the hotel : it will cost less than staying [here]2403-here . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner paused again and then exclaimed : “ [I]82-miss viner ought to have thought of that sooner ; [I]82-miss viner ought to have telegraphed yesterday ! But [I]82-miss viner was sure [I]82-miss viner should hear from [them]94-the farlows today ; and [I]82-miss viner wanted -- oh , [I]82-miss viner DID so awfully want to stay ! ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner threw a troubled look at [Darrow]71-darrow . “ Do [you]71-darrow happen to remember , ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner asked , “ what time it was when [you]71-darrow posted [my]82-miss viner letter ? ”[82-miss viner] [VII Darrow]108-vii darrow was still standing on [her]82-miss viner threshold . As [she]82-miss viner put the question [he]71-darrow entered [the room]663-the room and closed the door behind [him]71-darrow . [His]71-darrow heart was beating a little faster than usual and [he]71-darrow had no clear idea of what [he]71-darrow was about to do or say , beyond the definite conviction that , whatever passing impulse of expiation moved [him]71-darrow , [he]71-darrow would not be fool enough to tell [her]82-miss viner that [he]71-darrow had not sent [her]82-miss viner letter . [He]71-darrow knew that most wrongdoing works , on the whole , less mischief than its useless confession ; and this was clearly a case where a passing folly might be turned , by [avowal]109-avowal , into a serious offense . “ [I]71-darrow ’m so sorry -- so sorry ; but [you]82-miss viner must let [me]71-darrow help [you]82-miss viner ... [You]82-miss viner will let [me]71-darrow help [you]82-miss viner ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said . [He]71-darrow took [her]82-miss viner hands and pressed them together between [his]71-darrow , counting on a friendly touch to help out the insufficiency of words . [He]71-darrow felt [her]82-miss viner yield slightly to [his]71-darrow clasp , and hurried on without giving [her]82-miss viner time to answer . “ Is n’t it a pity to spoil [our]2407-our good time together by regretting anything [you]71-darrow might have done to prevent [our]2407-our having it ? ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner drew back , freeing [her]82-miss viner hands . [Her]82-miss viner face , losing its look of appealing confidence , was suddenly sharpened by distrust . “ [You]82-miss viner did n’t forget to post [my]71-darrow letter ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow stood before [her]82-miss viner , constrained and ashamed , and ever more keenly aware that the betrayal of [his]71-darrow distress must be a greater offense than its concealment . “ What an insinuation ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow cried , throwing out [his]71-darrow hands with a laugh . [Her]82-miss viner face instantly melted to laughter . “ Well , then -- [I]82-miss viner WON’T be sorry ; [I]82-miss viner wo n’t regret anything except that [our]2408-our good time is over ! ”[82-miss viner] The words were so unexpected that they routed all [his]71-darrow resolves . If [she]82-miss viner had gone on doubting [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow could probably have gone on deceiving [her]82-miss viner ; but [her]82-miss viner unhesitating acceptance of [his]71-darrow word made [him]71-darrow hate the part [he]71-darrow was playing . At the same moment a doubt shot up its serpent - head in [his]71-darrow own bosom . Was it not [he]71-darrow rather than [she]82-miss viner who was childishly trustful ? Was [she]82-miss viner not almost too ready to take [his]71-darrow word , and dismiss once for all the tiresome question of the letter ? Considering what [her]82-miss viner experiences must have been , such trustfulness seemed open to suspicion . But the moment [his]71-darrow eyes fell on [her]82-miss viner [he]71-darrow was ashamed of the thought , and knew it for what it really was : another pretext to lessen [his]71-darrow own delinquency . “ Why should [our]2409-our good time be over ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked . “ Why should n’t it last a little longer ? ”[71-darrow] [She]82-miss viner looked up , [her]82-miss viner lips parted in surprise ; but before [she]82-miss viner could speak [he]71-darrow went on : “ [I]71-darrow want [you]82-miss viner to stay with [me]71-darrow -- [I]71-darrow want [you]82-miss viner , just for a few days , to have all the things [you]82-miss viner ’ve never had . It ’s not always [May]93-mamie hoke and [Paris]10-paris -- why not make the most of [them]2410-them now ? [You]82-miss viner know [me]71-darrow -- [we’re]2411-we’re not [strangers]2412-strangers -- why should n’t [you]82-miss viner treat [me]71-darrow like [a friend]2413-a friend ? ”[71-darrow] While [he]71-darrow spoke [she]82-miss viner had drawn away a little , but [her]82-miss viner hand still lay in [his]71-darrow . [She]82-miss viner was pale , and [her]82-miss viner eyes were fixed on [him]71-darrow in a gaze in which there was neither distrust or resentment , but only an ingenuous wonder . [He]71-darrow was extraordinarily touched by [her]82-miss viner expression . “ Oh , do ! [You]82-miss viner must . Listen : to prove that [I]71-darrow ’m sincere [I]71-darrow ’ll tell [you]82-miss viner ... [I’ll]71-darrow tell [you]82-miss viner [I]71-darrow did n’t post [your]82-miss viner letter ... [I]71-darrow did n’t post it because [I]71-darrow wanted so much to give [you]82-miss viner a few good hours ... and because [I]71-darrow could n’t bear to have [you]82-miss viner go . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow had the feeling that the words were being uttered in spite of [him]71-darrow by [some malicious witness of the scene]664-some malicious witness of the scene , and yet that [he]71-darrow was not sorry to have them spoken . [The girl]297-the girl had listened to [him]71-darrow in silence . [She]297-the girl remained motionless for a moment after [he]71-darrow had ceased to speak ; then [she]297-the girl snatched away [her]297-the girl hand . “ [You]71-darrow did n’t post [my]297-the girl letter ? [You]71-darrow kept it back on purpose ? And [you]71-darrow tell [me]297-the girl so NOW , to prove to [me]297-the girl that [I]297-the girl ’d better put [myself]297-the girl under [your]71-darrow protection ? ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl burst into a laugh that had in it all the piercing echoes of [her]297-the girl Murrett past , and [her]297-the girl face , at the same moment , underwent the same change , shrinking into a small malevolent white mask in which the eyes burned black . “ Thank [you]71-darrow -- thank [you]71-darrow most awfully for telling [me]297-the girl ! And for all [your]71-darrow other kind intentions ! The plan ’s delightful -- really quite delightful , and [I]297-the girl ’m extremely flattered and obliged . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl dropped into a seat beside [her]297-the girl dressing - table , resting [her]297-the girl chin on [her]297-the girl lifted hands , and laughing out at [him]666-him under the elf - lock which had shaken itself down over [her]297-the girl eyes . [Her]297-the girl outburst did not offend [the young man]217-the young man ; its immediate effect was that of allaying [his]217-the young man agitation . The theatrical touch in [her]297-the girl manner made [his]217-the young man offense seem more venial than [he]217-the young man had thought it a moment before . [He]217-the young man drew up a chair and sat down beside [her]297-the girl . “ After all , ”[217-the young man] [he]217-the young man said , in a tone of good - humoured protest , “ [I]217-the young man need n’t have told [you]297-the girl [I]217-the young man ’d kept back [your]297-the girl letter ; and [my]217-the young man telling [you]297-the girl seems rather strong proof that [I]217-the young man had n’t any very nefarious designs on [you]297-the girl . ”[217-the young man] [She]297-the girl met this with a shrug , but [he]217-the young man did not give [her]297-the girl time to answer . “ [My]217-the young man designs , ”[217-the young man] [he]217-the young man continued with a smile , “ were not nefarious . [I]217-the young man saw [you]297-the girl ’d been through a bad time with [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett , and that there did n’t seem to be much fun ahead for [you]297-the girl ; and [I]217-the young man did n’t see -- and [I]217-the young man do n’t yet see -- the harm of trying to give [you]297-the girl a few hours of amusement between a depressing past and a not particularly cheerful future . ”[217-the young man] [He]217-the young man paused again , and then went on , in the same tone of friendly reasonableness : “ The mistake [I]217-the young man made was not to tell [you]297-the girl this at once -- not to ask [you]297-the girl straight out to give [me]217-the young man a day or two , and let [me]217-the young man try to make [you]297-the girl forget all the things that are troubling [you]297-the girl . [I]217-the young man was a fool not to see that if [I]217-the young man ’d put it to [you]297-the girl in that way [you]297-the girl ’d have accepted or refused , as [you]297-the girl chose ; but that at least [you]297-the girl would n’t have mistaken [my]217-the young man intentions.--Intentions ! ”[217-the young man] [He]217-the young man stood up , walked the length of [the room]663-the room , and turned back to where [she]669-her still sat motionless , [her]669-her elbows propped on the dressing - table , [her]669-her chin on [her]669-her hands . “ What rubbish [we]2414-we talk about intentions ! The truth is [I]670-i had n’t any : [I]670-i just liked being with [you]297-the girl . Perhaps [you]297-the girl do n’t know how extraordinarily one can like being with [you]297-the girl ... [I]670-i was depressed and adrift [myself]670-i ; and [you]297-the girl made [me]670-i forget [my]670-i bothers ; and when [I]670-i found [you]297-the girl were going -- and going back to dreariness , as [I]670-i was -- [I]670-i did n’t see why [we]2415-we should n’t have a few hours together first ; so [I]670-i left [your]297-the girl letter in [my]670-i pocket . ”[670-i] [He]670-i saw [her]671-her face melt as [she]671-her listened , and suddenly [she]671-her unclasped [her]671-her hands and leaned to [him]670-i . “ But are [YOU]670-i unhappy too ? Oh , [I]671-her never understood -- [I]671-her never dreamed it ! [I]671-her thought [you]670-i ’d always had everything in [the world]206-the world [you]670-i wanted ! ”[671-her] [Darrow]71-darrow broke into a laugh at this ingenuous picture of [his]71-darrow state . [He]71-darrow was ashamed of trying to better [his]71-darrow case by an appeal to [her]671-her pity , and annoyed with [himself]71-darrow for alluding to a subject [he]71-darrow would rather have kept out of [his]71-darrow thoughts . But [her]671-her look of sympathy had disarmed [him]71-darrow ; [his]71-darrow heart was bitter and distracted ; [she]671-her was near [him]670-i , [her]671-her eyes were shining with compassion -- [he]670-i bent over [her]671-her and kissed [her]671-her hand . “ Forgive [me]670-i -- do forgive [me]670-i , ”[670-i] [he]670-i said . [She]671-her stood up with a smiling head - shake . “ Oh , it ’s not so often that [people]365-people try to give [me]671-her any pleasure -- much less two whole days of it ! [I]671-her sha’n’t forget how kind [you]671-her ’ve been . [I]671-her shall have plenty of time to remember . But this IS good - bye , [you]671-her know . [I]671-her must telegraph at once to say [I]671-her ’m coming . ”[671-her] “ To say [you]671-her ’re coming ? Then [I]670-i ’m not forgiven ? ”[670-i] “ Oh , [you]671-her ’re forgiven -- if that ’s any comfort . ”[671-her] “ It ’s not , the very least , if [your]671-her way of proving it is to go away ! ”[671-her] [She]671-her hung [her]671-her head in meditation . “ But [I]671-her ca n’t stay.--How CAN [I]671-her stay ? ”[671-her] [she]671-her broke out , as if arguing with some unseen monitor . “ Why ca n’t [you]671-her ? [No one]325-no one knows [you]671-her ’re here ... [No one]325-no one need ever know . ”[671-her] [She]671-her looked up , and [their]672-their eyes exchanged meanings for a rapid minute . [Her]671-her gaze was as clear as [a boy]394-a boy ’s . “ Oh , it ’s not THAT , ”[671-her] [she]671-her exclaimed , almost impatiently ; “ it ’s not [people]365-people [I]671-her ’m afraid of ! [They]365-people ’ve never put [themselves]365-people out for [me]671-her -- why on earth should [I]671-her care about [them]365-people ? ”[671-her] [He]674-you liked [her]671-her directness as [he]674-you had never liked it before . “ Well , then , what is it ? Not [ME]671-her , [I]671-her hope ? ”[671-her] “ No , not [you]674-you : [I]671-her like [you]674-you . It ’s the money ! With [me]671-her that ’s always the root of the matter . [I]671-her could never yet afford a treat in [my]671-her life ! ”[671-her] “ Is _ THAT _ all ? ”[674-you] [He]674-you laughed , relieved by [her]671-her naturalness . “ Look here ; since [we]2421-we re talking as [man]2422-man to [man]2422-man -- can’t [you]674-you trust [me]674-you about that too ? ”[674-you] “ Trust [you]674-you ? How do [you]674-you mean ? [You]674-you ’d better not trust [ME]671-her ! ”[671-her] [she]671-her laughed back sharply . “ [I]671-her might never be able to pay up ! ”[671-her] [His]674-you gesture brushed aside the allusion . “ Money may be the root of the matter ; it ca n’t be the whole of it , between [friends]2424-friends . Do n’t [you]674-you think [one friend]2425-one friend may accept a small service from another without looking too far ahead or weighing too many chances ? The question turns entirely on what [you]674-you think of [me]674-you . If [you]674-you like [me]674-you well enough to be willing to take a few days ’ holiday with [me]674-you , just for the pleasure of the thing , and the pleasure [you]674-you ’ll be giving [me]674-you , let ’s shake hands on it . If [you]674-you do n’t like [me]674-you well enough [we]2426-we ’ll shake hands too ; only [I]674-you shall be sorry , ”[674-you] [he]674-you ended . “ Oh , but [I]674-you shall be sorry too ! ”[674-you] [Her]671-her face , as [she]671-her lifted it to [his]674-you , looked so small and young that [Darrow]71-darrow felt a fugitive twinge of compunction , instantly effaced by the excitement of pursuit . “ Well , then ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow stood looking down on [her]671-her , [his]71-darrow eyes persuading [her]671-her . [He]71-darrow was now intensely aware that [his]71-darrow nearness was having an effect which made it less and less necessary for [him]71-darrow to choose [his]71-darrow words , and [he]71-darrow went on , more mindful of the inflections of [his]71-darrow voice than of what [he]71-darrow was actually saying : “ Why on earth should [we]2426-we say good - bye if [we]2426-we ’re both sorry to ? Wo n’t [you]671-her tell [me]71-darrow [your]671-her reason ? It ’s not a bit like [you]671-her to let anything stand in the way of [your]671-her saying just what [you]671-her feel . [You]671-her must n’t mind offending [me]71-darrow , [you]671-her know ! ”[71-darrow] [She]671-her hung before [him]71-darrow like a leaf on the meeting of cross - currents , that the next ripple may sweep forward or whirl back . Then [she]671-her flung up [her]671-her head with the odd boyish movement habitual to [her]671-her in moments of excitement . “ What [I]671-her feel ? Do [you]71-darrow want to know what [I]671-her feel ? That [you]71-darrow ’re giving [me]671-her the only chance [I]671-her ’ve ever had ! ”[671-her] [She]671-her turned about on [her]671-her heel and , dropping into the nearest chair , sank forward , [her]671-her face hidden against the dressing - table . Under the folds of [her]671-her thin summer dress the modelling of [her]671-her back and of [her]671-her lifted arms , and the slight hollow between [her]671-her shoulder - blades , recalled the faint curves of a terra - cotta statuette , [some young image of grace hardly more than sketched in the clay]675-some young image of grace hardly more than sketched in the clay . [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow stood looking at [her]671-her , reflected that [her]671-her character , for all its seeming firmness , its flashing edges of “ opinion ”[71-darrow] , was probably no less immature . [He]71-darrow had not expected [her]671-her to yield so suddenly to [his]71-darrow suggestion , or to confess [her]671-her yielding in that way . At first [he]71-darrow was slightly disconcerted ; then [he]71-darrow saw how [her]671-her attitude simplified [his]71-darrow own . [Her]671-her behaviour had all the indecision and awkwardness of inexperience . It showed that [she]671-her was [a child]182-a child after all ; and all [he]71-darrow could do -- all [he]71-darrow had ever meant to do -- was to give [her]671-her [a child]182-a child ’s holiday to look back to . For a moment [he]71-darrow fancied [she]671-her was crying ; but the next [she]671-her was on [her]671-her feet and had swept round on [him]71-darrow a face [she]671-her must have turned away only to hide the first rush of [her]671-her pleasure . For a while [they]678-they shone on [each other]177-each other without speaking ; then [she]671-her sprang to [him]71-darrow and held out both hands . “ Is it true ? Is it really true ? Is it really going to happen to [ME]671-her ? ”[671-her] [He]71-darrow felt like answering : “ [You]671-her ’re [the very creature to whom it was bound to happen ”]2427-the very creature to whom it was bound to happen ”[671-her] ; but the words had a double sense that made [him]71-darrow wince , and instead [he]71-darrow caught [her]671-her proffered hands and stood looking at [her]671-her across the length of [her]671-her arms , without attempting to bend them or to draw [her]671-her closer . [He]71-darrow wanted [her]671-her to know how [her]671-her words had moved [him]71-darrow ; but [his]71-darrow thoughts were blurred by the rush of the same emotion that possessed [her]671-her , and [his]71-darrow own words came with an effort . [He]71-darrow ended by giving [her]671-her back a laugh as frank as [her]671-her own , and declaring , as [he]71-darrow dropped [her]671-her hands : “ All that and more too -- [you’ll]671-her see ! ”[71-darrow] VIII All day , since the late reluctant dawn , the rain had come down in torrents . It streamed against [Darrow]71-darrow ’s high - perched windows , reduced [their]680-their vast prospect of roofs and chimneys to a black oily huddle , and filled [the room]663-the room with the drab twilight of [an underground aquarium]682-an underground aquarium . [The streams]683-the streams descended with the regularity of a third day ’s rain , when trimming and shuffling are over , and the weather has settled down to do its worst . There were no variations of rhythm , no lyrical ups and downs : the grey lines streaking the panes were as dense and uniform as a page of unparagraphed narrative . [George Darrow]71-darrow had drawn [his]71-darrow armchair to the fire . The time - table [he]71-darrow had been studying lay on the floor , and [he]71-darrow sat staring with dull acquiescence into the boundless blur of rain , which affected [him]71-darrow like a vast projection of [his]71-darrow own state of mind . Then [his]71-darrow eyes travelled slowly about [the room]663-the room . It was exactly ten days since [his]71-darrow hurried unpacking had strewn it with the contents of [his]71-darrow portmanteaux . [His]71-darrow brushes and razors were spread out on the blotched marble of the chest of drawers . A stack of newspapers had accumulated on the centre table under the “ electrolier ”[71-darrow] , and half a dozen paper novels lay on the mantelpiece among cigar - cases and toilet bottles ; but these traces of [his]71-darrow passage had made no mark on the featureless dulness of [the room]663-the room , [its]663-the room look of being the makeshift setting of innumerable transient collocations . There was something sardonic , almost sinister , in its appearance of having deliberately “ made up ”[71-darrow] for its anonymous part , all in noncommittal drabs and browns , with a carpet and paper that [nobody]686-nobody would remember , and chairs and tables as impersonal as [railway porters]687-railway porters . [Darrow]71-darrow picked up the time - table and tossed it on to the table . Then [he]71-darrow rose to [his]71-darrow feet , lit a cigar and went to the window . Through the rain [he]71-darrow could just discover the face of a clock in [a tall building beyond the railway roofs]688-a tall building beyond the railway roofs . [He]71-darrow pulled out [his]71-darrow watch , compared the two time - pieces , and started the hands of [his]71-darrow with such a rush that they flew past the hour and [he]71-darrow had to make [them]689-them repeat the circuit more deliberately . [He]71-darrow felt a quite disproportionate irritation at the trifling blunder . When [he]71-darrow had corrected it [he]71-darrow went back to [his]71-darrow chair and threw [himself]71-darrow down , leaning back [his]71-darrow head against [his]71-darrow hands . Presently [his]71-darrow cigar went out , and [he]71-darrow got up , hunted for the matches , lit it again and returned to [his]71-darrow seat . [The room]663-the room was getting on [his]71-darrow nerves . During the first few days , while the skies were clear , [he]71-darrow had not noticed it , or had felt for it only the contemptuous indifference of [the traveller]691-the traveller toward [a provisional shelter]692-a provisional shelter . But now that [he]71-darrow was leaving [it]663-the room , was looking at it for the last time , it seemed to have taken complete possession of [his]71-darrow mind , to be soaking itself into [him]71-darrow like an ugly indelible blot .
