Every detail pressed itself on [his]71-darrow notice with the familiarity of [an accidental confidant]693-an accidental confidant : whichever way [he]71-darrow turned , [he]71-darrow felt the nudge of a transient intimacy ... The one fixed point in [his]71-darrow immediate future was that [his]71-darrow leave was over and that [he]71-darrow must be back at [[his]71-darrow post in [London]3-london]694-his post in london the next morning . Within twenty - four hours [he]71-darrow would again be in a daylight world of recognized activities , [himself]71-darrow [a busy , responsible , relatively necessary factor in the big whirring social and official machine]695-a busy , responsible , relatively necessary factor in the big whirring social and official machine . That fixed obligation was the fact [he]71-darrow could think of with the least discomfort , yet for some unaccountable reason it was the one on which [he]71-darrow found it most difficult to fix [his]71-darrow thoughts . Whenever [he]71-darrow did so , [the room]663-the room jerked [him]71-darrow back into the circle of [its]663-the room insistent associations . It was extraordinary with what a microscopic minuteness of loathing [he]71-darrow hated it all : the grimy carpet and wallpaper , the black marble mantel - piece , the clock with a gilt allegory under a dusty bell , the high - bolstered brown - counterpaned bed , the framed card of printed rules under the electric light switch , and the door of communication with [the next room]557-the next room . [He]71-darrow hated the door most of all ... At the outset , [he]71-darrow had felt no special sense of responsibility . [He]71-darrow was satisfied that [he]71-darrow had struck the right note , and convinced of [his]71-darrow power of sustaining it . The whole incident had somehow seemed , in spite of its vulgar setting and its inevitable prosaic propinquities , to be enacting itself in [some unmapped region outside the pale of the usual]698-some unmapped region outside the pale of the usual . It was not like anything that had ever happened to [him]71-darrow before , or in which [he]71-darrow had ever pictured [himself]71-darrow as likely to be involved ; but that , at first , had seemed no argument against [his]71-darrow fitness to deal with it . Perhaps but for the three days ’ rain [he]71-darrow might have got away without a doubt as to [his]71-darrow adequacy . The rain had made all the difference . It had thrown the whole picture out of perspective , blotted out the mystery of the remoter planes and the enchantment of the middle distance , and thrust into prominence every commonplace fact of the foreground . It was the kind of situation that was not helped by being thought over ; and by the perversity of circumstance [he]71-darrow had been forced into the unwilling contemplation of its every aspect ... [His]71-darrow cigar had gone out again , and [he]71-darrow threw it into the fire and vaguely meditated getting up to find another . But the mere act of leaving [his]71-darrow chair seemed to call for a greater exertion of the will than [he]71-darrow was capable of , and [he]71-darrow leaned [his]71-darrow head back with closed eyes and listened to the drumming of the rain . A different noise aroused [him]71-darrow . It was the opening and closing of the door leading from [the corridor]585-the corridor into [the adjoining room]700-the adjoining room . [He]71-darrow sat motionless , without opening [his]71-darrow eyes ; but now another sight forced itself under [his]71-darrow lowered lids . It was the precise photographic picture of [that other room]701-that other room . Everything in [it]702-it rose before [him]71-darrow and pressed itself upon [his]71-darrow vision with the same acuity of distinctness as the objects surrounding [him]71-darrow . A step sounded on the floor , and [he]71-darrow knew which way the step was directed , what pieces of furniture it had to skirt , where it would probably pause , and what was likely to arrest it . [He]71-darrow heard another sound , and recognized it as that of a wet umbrella placed in the black marble jamb of the chimney - piece , against the hearth . [He]71-darrow caught the creak of a hinge , and instantly differentiated it as that of the wardrobe against the opposite wall . Then [he]71-darrow heard the mouse - like squeal of a reluctant drawer , and knew it was the upper one in the chest of drawers beside the bed : the clatter which followed was caused by the mahogany toilet - glass jumping on its loosened pivots ... The step crossed the floor again . It was strange how much better [he]71-darrow knew it than [the person to whom it belonged]703-the person to whom it belonged ! Now it was drawing near the door of communication between [the two rooms]704-the two rooms . [He]71-darrow opened [his]71-darrow eyes and looked . The step had ceased and for a moment there was silence . Then [he]71-darrow heard a low knock . [He]71-darrow made no response , and after an interval [he]71-darrow saw that the door handle was being tentatively turned . [He]71-darrow closed [his]71-darrow eyes once more ... The door opened , and the step was in [the room]663-the room , coming cautiously toward [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow kept [his]71-darrow eyes shut , relaxing [his]71-darrow body to feign sleep . There was another pause , then a wavering soft advance , the rustle of a dress behind [his]71-darrow chair , the warmth of two hands pressed for a moment on [his]71-darrow lids . The palms of the hands had the lingering scent of some stuff that [he]71-darrow had bought on the Boulevard ... [He]71-darrow looked up and saw a letter falling over [his]71-darrow shoulder to [his]71-darrow knee ... “ Did [I]71-darrow disturb [you]71-darrow ? [I]71-darrow ’m so sorry ! [They]2428-they gave [me]71-darrow this just now when [I]71-darrow came in . ”[71-darrow] The letter , before [he]71-darrow could catch it , had slipped between [his]71-darrow knees to the floor . It lay there , address upward , at [his]71-darrow feet , and while [he]71-darrow sat staring down at the strong slender characters on the blue - gray envelope an arm reached out from behind to pick it up . “ Oh , don’t -- DON’T ”[71-darrow] broke from [him]71-darrow , and [he]71-darrow bent over and caught the arm . The face above it was close to [his]71-darrow . “ Do n’t what ? ”[71-darrow] ----“take the trouble , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow stammered . [He]71-darrow dropped the arm and stooped down . [His]71-darrow grasp closed over the letter , [he]71-darrow fingered its thickness and weight and calculated the number of sheets it must contain . Suddenly [he]71-darrow felt the pressure of the hand on [his]71-darrow shoulder , and became aware that the face was still leaning over [him]71-darrow , and that in a moment [he]71-darrow would have to look up and kiss it ... [He]71-darrow bent forward first and threw the unopened letter into the middle of the fire . BOOK II IX The light of the October afternoon lay on [an old high - roofed house which enclosed in [its]706-an old high - roofed house which enclosed in its long expanse of brick and yellowish stone the breadth of a grassy court filled with the shadow and sound of limes long expanse of brick and yellowish stone the breadth of [a grassy court filled with the shadow and sound of limes]707-a grassy court filled with the shadow and sound of limes]706-an old high - roofed house which enclosed in its long expanse of brick and yellowish stone the breadth of a grassy court filled with the shadow and sound of limes . From the escutcheoned piers at the entrance of [the court]708-the court [a level drive , also shaded by limes]709-a level drive , also shaded by limes , extended to a white - barred gate beyond which [an equally level avenue of grass , cut through a wood]710-an equally level avenue of grass , cut through a wood , dwindled to a blue - green blur against a sky banked with still white slopes of cloud . In [the court]708-the court , half - way between [house and drive]712-house and drive , [a lady]713-a lady stood . [She]713-a lady held a parasol above [her]713-a lady head , and looked now at [the house]581-the house - front , with [its]581-the house double flight of steps meeting before a glazed door under sculptured trophies , now down [the drive]715-the drive toward the grassy cutting through the wood . [Her]713-a lady air was less of expectancy than of contemplation : [she]713-a lady seemed not so much to be watching for any one , or listening for an approaching sound , as letting the whole aspect of [the place]716-the place sink into [her]713-a lady while [she]713-a lady held [herself]713-a lady open to its influence . Yet it was no less apparent that the scene was not new to [her]713-a lady . There was no eagerness of investigation in [her]713-a lady survey : [she]713-a lady seemed rather to be looking about [her]713-a lady with eyes to which , for some intimate inward reason , details long since familiar had suddenly acquired an unwonted freshness . This was in fact the exact sensation of which [Mrs. Leath]75-owen was conscious as [she]713-a lady came forth from [the house]581-the house and descended into [the sunlit court]718-the sunlit court . [She]713-a lady had come to meet [[her]713-a lady step - son]719-her step - son , who was likely to be returning at that hour from an afternoon ’s shooting in [one of [the more distant plantations]721-the more distant plantations]720-one of the more distant plantations , and [she]713-a lady carried in [her]713-a lady hand the letter which had sent [her]713-a lady in search of [him]719-her step - son ; but with [her]713-a lady first step out of [the house]581-the house all thought of [him]719-her step - son had been effaced by another series of impressions . The scene about [her]713-a lady was known to satiety . [She]713-a lady had seen [Givre]30-givre at all seasons of the year , and for the greater part of every year , since the far - off day of [her]713-a lady marriage ; the day when , ostensibly driving through [its]30-givre gates at [[her]713-a lady husband]174-her husband ’s side , [she]713-a lady had actually been carried [there]2294-there on a cloud of iris - winged visions . The possibilities which [the place]716-the place had then represented were still vividly present to [her]713-a lady . The mere phrase “ [a French chateau ”]2429-a french chateau ”[713-a lady] had called up to [her]713-a lady youthful fancy a throng of romantic associations , poetic , pictorial and emotional ; and the serene face of [the old house seated in [its]726-the old house seated in its park among the poplar - bordered meadows of middle france park among [the poplar - bordered meadows of [middle France]4-france]727-the poplar - bordered meadows of middle france]726-the old house seated in its park among the poplar - bordered meadows of middle france , had seemed , on [her]713-a lady first sight of [it]726-the old house seated in its park among the poplar - bordered meadows of middle france , to hold out to [her]713-a lady a fate as noble and dignified as [its]726-the old house seated in its park among the poplar - bordered meadows of middle france own mien . Though [she]713-a lady could still call up that phase of feeling it had long since passed , and [the house]581-the house had for a time become to [her]713-a lady the very symbol of narrowness and monotony . Then , with the passing of years , [it]581-the house had gradually acquired a less inimical character , had become , not again [a castle of dreams]729-a castle of dreams , evoker of fair images and romantic legend , but the shell of a life slowly adjusted to [[its]581-the house dwelling]730-its dwelling : [the place [one]732-one came back to]731-the place one came back to , [the place where [one]2308-one had [one]2308-one ’s duties , [one]2308-one ’s habits and [one]2308-one ’s books]733-the place where one had one ’s duties , one ’s habits and one ’s books , [the place [one]2308-one would naturally live in till [one]2308-one died]738-the place one would naturally live in till one died : [a dull house]740-a dull house , [an inconvenient house]741-an inconvenient house , of which [one]2308-one knew all the defects , the shabbinesses , the discomforts , but to which [one]2308-one was so used that [one]2308-one could hardly , after so long a time , think [one]2308-one ’s self away from [it]581-the house without suffering a certain loss of identity . Now , as [it]581-the house lay before [her]746-her in the autumn mildness , [its mistress]747-its mistress was surprised at [her]746-her own insensibility . [She]746-her had been trying to see [the house]581-the house through the eyes of [an old friend who , the next morning , would be driving up to [it]581-the house for the first time]749-an old friend who , the next morning , would be driving up to it for the first time ; and in so doing [she]746-her seemed to be opening [her]746-her own eyes upon [it]581-the house after a long interval of blindness . [The court]708-the court was very still , yet full of a latent life : the wheeling and rustling of pigeons about the rectangular yews and across the sunny gravel ; the sweep of rooks above the lustrous greyish - purple slates of the roof , and the stir of the tree - tops as [they]751-they met the breeze which every day , at that hour , came punctually up from [the river]503-the river . Just such a latent animation glowed in [Anna Leath]97-anna . In every nerve and vein [she]97-anna was conscious of that equipoise of bliss which the fearful human heart scarce dares acknowledge . [She]97-anna was not used to strong or full emotions ; but [she]97-anna had always known that [she]97-anna should not be afraid of them . [She]97-anna was not afraid now ; but [she]97-anna felt a deep inward stillness . The immediate effect of the feeling had been to send [her]97-anna forth in quest of [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son . [She]97-anna wanted to stroll back with [him]719-her step - son and have a quiet talk before [they]754-they re - entered [the house]581-the house . It was always easy to talk to [him]719-her step - son , and at this moment [he]719-her step - son was [the one person to whom [she]97-anna could have spoken without fear of disturbing [her]97-anna inner stillness]756-the one person to whom she could have spoken without fear of disturbing her inner stillness . [She]97-anna was glad , for all sorts of reasons , that [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [Effie]74-effie were still at [Ouchy]38-ouchy with [the governess]757-the governess , and that [she]97-anna and [Owen]75-owen had [the house]581-the house to [themselves]754-they . And [she]97-anna was glad that even [he]719-her step - son was not yet in sight . [She]97-anna wanted to be alone a little longer ; not to think , but to let the long slow waves of joy break over [her]97-anna one by one . [She]97-anna walked out of [the court]708-the court and sat down on one of the benches that bordered [the drive]715-the drive . From [her]97-anna seat [she]97-anna had a diagonal view of [the long house - front]761-the long house - front and of [the domed chapel]762-the domed chapel terminating one of the wings . Beyond a gate in [the court - yard]763-the court - yard wall [the flower - garden]764-the flower - garden drew [its]764-the flower - garden dark - green squares and raised [its]764-the flower - garden statues against the yellowing background of [the park]765-the park . In the borders only a few late pinks and crimsons smouldered , but a peacock strutting in the sun seemed to have gathered into [his]719-her step - son out - spread fan all the summer glories of [the place]716-the place . In [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s hand was the letter which had opened [her]97-anna eyes to these things , and a smile rose to [her]97-anna lips at the mere feeling of the paper between [her]97-anna fingers . The thrill it sent through [her]97-anna gave a keener edge to every sense . [She]97-anna felt , saw , breathed the shining world as though a thin impenetrable veil had suddenly been removed from it . Just such a veil , [she]97-anna now perceived , had always hung between [herself]97-anna and life . It had been like the stage gauze which gives an illusive air of reality to the painted scene behind it , yet proves it , after all , to be no more than a painted scene . [She]97-anna had been hardly aware , in [her]97-anna girlhood , of differing from [others]2314-others in this respect . In [the well - regulated well - fed [Summers world]769-summers world]768-the well - regulated well - fed summers world the unusual was regarded as either immoral or ill - bred , and [people with emotions]770-people with emotions were not visited . Sometimes , with a sense of groping in a topsy - turvy universe , [Anna]67-anna had wondered why everybody about [her]97-anna seemed to ignore all the passions and sensations which formed the stuff of great poetry and memorable action . In [a community composed entirely of people like [[her]97-anna parents]310-her parents and [[her]97-anna parents]310-her parents ’ friends]771-a community composed entirely of people like her parents and her parents ’ friends [she]97-anna did not see how the magnificent things [one]2308-one read about could ever have happened . [She]97-anna was sure that if anything of the kind had occurred in [her]97-anna immediate circle [[her]97-anna mother]221-her mother would have consulted [the family clergyman]776-the family clergyman , and [[her]97-anna father]348-her father perhaps even have rung up [the police]778-the police ; and [her]97-anna sense of humour compelled [her]97-anna to own that , in the given conditions , these precautions might not have been unjustified . Little by little the conditions conquered [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna learned to regard the substance of life as a mere canvas for the embroideries of [poet]779-poet and [painter]780-painter , and its little swept and fenced and tended surface as its actual substance . It was in the visioned region of action and emotion that [her]97-anna fullest hours were spent ; but it hardly occurred to [her]97-anna that they might be translated into experience , or connected with anything likely to happen to [a young lady living in [West Fifty - fifth Street]39-west fifty - fifth street]781-a young lady living in west fifty - fifth street . [She]97-anna perceived , indeed , that [other girls]782-other girls , leading outwardly the same life as [herself]97-anna , and seemingly unaware of [her]97-anna world of hidden beauty , were yet possessed of some vital secret which escaped [her]97-anna . There seemed to be a kind of freemasonry between [them]782-other girls ; [they]782-other girls were wider awake than [she]97-anna , more alert , and surer of [their]782-other girls wants if not of [their]782-other girls opinions . [She]97-anna supposed [they]782-other girls were “ cleverer ”[782-other girls] , and accepted [her]97-anna inferiority good - humouredly , half aware , within [herself]97-anna , of a reserve of unused power which [the others]783-the others gave no sign of possessing . This partly consoled [her]97-anna for missing so much of what made [their]782-other girls “ good time ”[784-envious mothers] ; but the resulting sense of exclusion , of being somehow laughingly but firmly debarred from a share of [their]782-other girls privileges , threw [her]97-anna back on [herself]97-anna and deepened the reserve which made [envious mothers]784-envious mothers cite [her]97-anna as a model of ladylike repression . Love , [she]97-anna told [herself]97-anna , would one day release [her]97-anna from this spell of unreality . [She]97-anna was persuaded that the sublime passion was the key to the enigma ; but it was difficult to relate [her]97-anna conception of love to the forms it wore in [her]97-anna experience . [Two or three of [the girls [she]97-anna had envied for [their]782-other girls superior acquaintance with the arts of life]786-the girls she had envied for their superior acquaintance with the arts of life]785-two or three of the girls she had envied for their superior acquaintance with the arts of life had contracted , in the course of time , what were variously described as “ romantic ”[2308-one] or “ foolish ”[2308-one] marriages ; [one]2308-one even made a runaway match , and languished for a while under a cloud of social reprobation . But [his]71-darrow passion swept over [her]97-anna like a wind that shakes the roof of [the forest]792-the forest without reaching its still glades or rippling its hidden pools . [He]71-darrow was extraordinarily intelligent and agreeable , and [her]97-anna heart beat faster when [he]71-darrow was with [her]97-anna . The subversiveness of [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath ’s opinions was enhanced by the distinction of [his]76-mr. leath appearance and the reserve of [his]76-mr. leath manners . [He]76-mr. leath was like [the anarchist with a gardenia in [his]76-mr. leath buttonhole who figures in the higher melodrama]828-the anarchist with a gardenia in his buttonhole who figures in the higher melodrama . Every word , every allusion , every note of [his]76-mr. leath agreeably - modulated voice , gave [Anna]67-anna a glimpse of a society at once freer and finer , which observed the traditional forms but had discarded the underlying prejudices ; whereas [the world [she]67-anna knew]829-the world she knew had discarded many of the forms and kept almost all the prejudices . In such an atmosphere as [his]76-mr. leath [an eager young woman]830-an eager young woman , curious as to all the manifestations of life , yet instinctively desiring that [they]831-they should come to [her]830-an eager young woman in terms of beauty and fine feeling , must surely find the largest scope for self - expression . Study , travel , the contact of [the world]206-the world , the comradeship of a polished and enlightened mind , would combine to enrich [her]67-anna days and form [her]67-anna character ; and it was only in the rare moments when [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath ’s symmetrical blond mask bent over [hers]67-anna , and [his]76-mr. leath kiss dropped on [her]67-anna like a cold smooth pebble , that [she]67-anna questioned the completeness of the joys [he]76-mr. leath offered . There had been a time when the walls on which [her]67-anna gaze now rested had shed a glare of irony on these early dreams . In the first years of [her]67-anna marriage the sober symmetry of [Givre]30-givre had suggested only [[her]67-anna husband]174-her husband ’s neatly - balanced mind . It was a mind , [she]67-anna soon learned , contentedly absorbed in formulating the conventions of the unconventional . [West Fifty - fifth Street]39-west fifty - fifth street was no more conscientiously concerned than [Givre]30-givre with the momentous question of “ what [people]365-people did ”[30-givre] ; it was only the type of deed investigated that was different . [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath collected [his]76-mr. leath social instances with the same seriousness and patience as [his]76-mr. leath snuff - boxes . [He]76-mr. leath exacted a rigid conformity to [his]76-mr. leath rules of non - conformity and [his]76-mr. leath scepticism had the absolute accent of a dogma . [He]76-mr. leath even cherished certain exceptions to [his]76-mr. leath rules as [the book - collector prizes a “ defective ”[76-mr. leath] first edition]834-the book - collector prizes a “ defective ” first edition . The Protestant church - going of [[Anna]67-anna ’s parents]835-anna ’s parents had provoked [his]76-mr. leath gentle sarcasm ; but [he]76-mr. leath prided [himself]76-mr. leath on [[his]76-mr. leath mother]836-his mother ’s devoutness , because [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , in embracing [[her]111-madame de chantelle second husband]837-her second husband ’s creed , had become part of a society which still observes the outward rites of piety . [Anna]67-anna , in fact , had discovered in [[her]67-anna amiable and elegant mother - in - law]838-her amiable and elegant mother - in - law an unexpected embodiment of the [West Fifty - fifth Street ideal]839-west fifty - fifth street ideal . [They]844-they WERE convictions , and therefore unassailable . Nor was any insincerity implied in the fact that they sometimes seemed to coincide with [hers]842-her . There were occasions when [he]174-her husband really did look at things as [she]842-her did ; but for reasons so different as to make the distance between them all the greater . Life , to [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath , was like a walk through [a carefully classified museum]845-a carefully classified museum , where , in moments of doubt , [one]2308-one had only to look at the number and refer to [one]2308-one ’s catalogue ; to [[his]76-mr. leath wife]207-his wife it was like groping about in [a huge dark lumber - room]849-a huge dark lumber - room where the exploring ray of curiosity lit up now some shape of breathing beauty and now a mummy ’s grin . In the first bewilderment of [her]842-her new state these discoveries had had the effect of dropping another layer of gauze between [herself]842-her and reality . [She]842-her seemed farther than ever removed from the strong joys and pangs for which [she]842-her felt [herself]842-her made . [She]842-her did not adopt [[her]842-her husband]174-her husband ’s views , but insensibly [she]842-her began to live [his]174-her husband life . [She]842-her tried to throw a compensating ardour into the secret excursions of [her]842-her spirit , and thus the old vicious distinction between romance and reality was re - established for [her]842-her , and [she]842-her resigned [herself]842-her again to the belief that “ real life ”[842-her] was neither real nor alive . The birth of [[her]842-her little girl]191-her little girl swept away this delusion . At last [she]842-her felt [herself]842-her in contact with the actual business of living : but even this impression was not enduring . Everything but the irreducible crude fact of [child - bearing]852-child - bearing assumed , in [the Leath household]853-the leath household , the same ghostly tinge of unreality . [[Her]842-her husband]174-her husband , at the time , was all that [his]842-her own ideal of [a husband]855-a husband required . [She]842-her even pushed the analogy farther , and descried in [[her]842-her step - son]719-her step - son ’s mind a quaintly - twisted reflection of [[her]842-her husband]174-her husband ’s . [Her]842-her interest in [Owen]75-owen led [her]842-her to think more often of [[his]867-the boy mother]836-his mother , and sometimes [she]842-her would slip away and stand alone before [[her]842-her predecessor]884-her predecessor ’s portrait . [The earth]909-the earth always felt elastic under [her]895-owen ’s mother , and [she]895-owen ’s mother had a conscious joy in treading it ; but never had it been as soft and springy as today . [She]233-his step - mother went on , in the same tone of affectionate persuasion : “ Yes : [I]233-his step - mother must have seemed to [you]910-you too subject to [Givre]30-givre . Perhaps [I]233-his step - mother have been . But [you]910-you know that was not [my]233-his step - mother real object in asking [you]910-you to wait , to say nothing to [[your]910-you grandmother]2466-your grandmother before [her]2466-your grandmother return . ”[233-his step - mother] [He]910-you considered . “ [Your]910-you real object , of course , was to gain time . ”[233-his step - mother] “ Yes -- but for whom ? Why not for [YOU]910-you ? ”[233-his step - mother] “ For [me]910-you ? ”[910-you] [He]910-you flushed up quickly . “ [You]910-you do n’t mean---- ? ”[910-you] [She]233-his step - mother laid [her]233-his step - mother hand on [his]910-you arm and looked gravely into [his]910-you handsome eyes . “ [I]233-his step - mother mean that when [[your]910-you grandmother]2466-your grandmother gets back from [Ouchy]38-ouchy [I]233-his step - mother shall speak to [her----]2466-your grandmother ”[233-his step - mother] “ [You]910-you ’ll speak to [her]2466-your grandmother ... ? ”[233-his step - mother] “ Yes ; if only [you]910-you ’ll promise to give [me]233-his step - mother time---- ”[233-his step - mother] “ Time for [her]2466-your grandmother to send for [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide ? ”[233-his step - mother] “ Oh , [she]2466-your grandmother ’ll undoubtedly send for [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide ! ”[233-his step - mother] The allusion touched a spring of mirth in both [their]915-their minds , and [they]915-their exchanged a laughing look . “ Only [you]916-you must promise not to rush things . To [the aerial listener]921-the aerial listener [her]97-anna words sounded flat and colourless , but to [the self within the ring]922-the self within the ring each one beat with a separate heart . It was the day after [Darrow]71-darrow ’s arrival , and [he]71-darrow had come down early , drawn by the sweetness of the light on the lawns and gardens below [his]71-darrow window . [Anna]97-anna had heard the echo of [his]71-darrow step on the stairs , [his]71-darrow pause in [the stone - flagged hall]923-the stone - flagged hall , [his]71-darrow voice as [he]71-darrow asked [a servant]924-a servant where to find [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna was at [the end of [the house]581-the house]925-the end of the house , in [the brown - panelled sitting - room which [she]97-anna frequented]927-the brown - panelled sitting - room which she frequented at that season because [it]927-the brown - panelled sitting - room which she frequented caught the sunlight first and kept it longest . [She]97-anna stood near the window , in the pale band of brightness , arranging some salmon - pink geraniums in a shallow porcelain bowl . Every sensation of touch and sight was thrice - alive in [her]97-anna . The grey - green fur of the geranium leaves caressed [her]97-anna fingers and the sunlight wavering across the irregular surface of the old parquet floor made it seem as bright and shifting as the brown bed of a stream . [Darrow]71-darrow stood framed in the door - way of [the farthest drawing - room]928-the farthest drawing - room , a light - grey figure against the black and white flagging of [the hall]539-the hall ; then [he]71-darrow began to move toward [her]97-anna down the empty pale - panelled vista , crossing one after another the long reflections which a projecting cabinet or screen cast here and there upon the shining floors . As [he]71-darrow drew nearer , [his]71-darrow figure was suddenly displaced by that of [[her]97-anna husband]174-her husband , whom , from the same point , [she]97-anna had so often seen advancing down the same perspective . Straight , spare , erect , looking to right and left with quick precise turns of the head , and stopping now and then to straighten a chair or alter the position of a vase , [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath used to march toward [her]97-anna through the double file of furniture like [a general reviewing a regiment drawn up for [his]72-fraser leath inspection]931-a general reviewing a regiment drawn up for his inspection . At a certain point , midway across [the second room]932-the second room , [he]71-darrow always stopped before the mantel - piece of pinkish - yellow marble and looked at [himself]71-darrow in the tall garlanded glass that surmounted it . [She]97-anna could not remember that [he]71-darrow had ever found anything to straighten or alter in [his]71-darrow own studied attire , but [she]97-anna had never known [him]71-darrow to omit the inspection when [he]71-darrow passed that particular mirror . When it was over [he]71-darrow continued more briskly on [his]71-darrow way , and the resulting expression of satisfaction was still on [his]71-darrow face when [he]71-darrow entered [the oak sitting - room]933-the oak sitting - room to greet [[his]71-darrow wife]207-his wife ... The spectral projection of this little daily scene hung but for a moment before [Anna]97-anna , but in that moment [she]97-anna had time to fling a wondering glance across the distance between [her]97-anna past and present . Then the footsteps of the present came close , and [she]97-anna had to drop the geraniums to give [her]97-anna hand to [Darrow]71-darrow ... “ Yes , let [us]935-they walk down to [the river]503-the river . ”[935-they] [They]935-they had neither of [them]935-they , as yet , found much to say to [each other]177-each other . [Darrow]71-darrow had arrived late on the previous afternoon , and during the evening [they]935-they had had between [them]935-they [Owen Leath]75-owen and [their]935-they own thoughts . Now [they]935-they were alone for the first time and the fact was enough in itself . Yet [Anna]97-anna was intensely aware that as soon as [they]935-they began to talk more intimately [they]935-they would feel that [they]935-they knew [each other]177-each other less well . [They]935-they passed out onto [the terrace]2399-the terrace and down the steps to [the gravel walk below]939-the gravel walk below . The delicate frosting of dew gave the grass a bluish shimmer , and the sunlight , sliding in emerald streaks along the tree - boles , gathered itself into great luminous blurs at the end of the wood - walks , and hung above [the fields]940-the fields a watery glory like the ring about an autumn moon . “ It ’s good to be [here]2403-here , ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow said . [They]935-they took a turn to the left and stopped for a moment to look back at [the long pink house - front , plainer , friendlier , less adorned than on the side toward [the court]708-the court]941-the long pink house - front , plainer , friendlier , less adorned than on the side toward the court . [The path]947-the path , growing narrower , wound on circuitously through [the woods]2461-the woods , between slender serried trunks twined with ivy . Patches of blue appeared above [them]935-they through the dwindling leaves , and presently the trees drew back and showed [the open fields along [the river]503-the river]951-the open fields along the river . [They]935-they walked on across [the fields]940-the fields to [the tow - path]954-the tow - path . In a curve of the wall some steps led up to [a crumbling pavilion with openings choked with ivy]955-a crumbling pavilion with openings choked with ivy . [Anna]97-anna sat silent , so intensely aware of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s nearness that there was no surprise in the touch [he]71-darrow laid on [her]97-anna hand . But [she]97-anna took no pride in such triumphs . So [he]971-he did . ”[970-you] “ [He]971-he came back and told [me]972-me . [I]972-me think [you]970-you talked to [him]971-he a moment in [a theatre]2503-a theatre . [I]972-me asked if [you]970-you ’d spoken of [my]972-me having put [you]970-you off -- or if [you]970-you ’d sent [me]972-me any message . [He]971-he did n’t remember that [you]970-you had . ”[972-me] “ In a crush -- in [a Paris foyer]2504-a paris foyer ? [[My]972-me dear]2464-my dear ! ”[972-me] “ It was absurd of [me]972-me ! But [Owen]75-owen and [I]972-me have always been on odd kind of brother - and - sister terms . [I]972-me think [he]971-he guessed about [us]2506-us when [he]971-he saw [you]970-you with [me]972-me in [London]3-london . So [he]971-he teased [me]972-me a little and tried to make [me]972-me curious about [you]970-you ; and when [he]971-he saw [he]971-he ’d succeeded [he]971-he told [me]972-me [he]971-he had n’t had time to say much to [you]970-you because [you]970-you were in such a hurry to get back to [the lady [you]970-you were with]2507-the lady you were with . ”[972-me] [He]972-me still held [her]973-her hands , but [she]973-her felt no tremor in [his]972-me , and the blood did not stir in [his]972-me brown cheek . [He]972-me seemed to be honestly turning over [his]972-me memories . “ Yes : and what else did [he]971-he tell [you]973-her ? ”[972-me] “ Oh , not much , except that [she]2507-the lady you were with was awfully pretty . When [I]71-darrow asked [him]971-he to describe [her]2507-the lady you were with [he]971-he said [you]970-you had [her]2507-the lady you were with tucked away in [a baignoire]2508-a baignoire and [he]971-he had n’t actually seen [her]2507-the lady you were with ; but [he]971-he saw the tail of [her]2507-the lady you were with cloak , and somehow knew from that that [she]2507-the lady you were with was pretty . [One DOES]125-one does , [you]970-you know ... [I]71-darrow think [he]971-he said the cloak was pink . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow broke into a laugh . “ Of course it was -- they always are ! So that was at the bottom of [your]71-darrow doubts ? ”[71-darrow] “ Not at first . [I]974-i only laughed . But afterward , when [I]974-i wrote [you]71-darrow and [you]71-darrow did n’t answer----Oh , [you]71-darrow DO see ? ”[974-i] [she]974-i appealed to [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow was looking at [her]974-i gently . “ Yes : [I]71-darrow see . ”[71-darrow] “ It ’s not as if this were a light thing between [us]2509-us . [I]71-darrow want [you]71-darrow to know [me]71-darrow as [I]71-darrow am . If [I]71-darrow thought that at that moment ... when [you]71-darrow were on [your]71-darrow way [here]2403-here , almost---- ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow dropped [her]974-i hand and stood up . “ Yes , yes -- [I]71-darrow understand . ”[71-darrow] “ But do [you]71-darrow ? ”[974-i] [Her]974-i look followed [him]71-darrow . “ [I]974-i ’m not a goose of [a girl]218-a girl . [I]974-i know ... of course [I]974-i KNOW ... but there are things [a woman]406-a woman feels ... when what [she]406-a woman knows does n’t make any difference . It ’s not that [I]974-i want [you]71-darrow to explain -- [I]974-i mean about that particular evening . It ’s only that [I]974-i want [you]71-darrow to have the whole of [my]974-i feeling . [I]974-i did n’t know what it was till [I]974-i saw [you]71-darrow again . [I]974-i never dreamed [I]974-i should say such things to [you]71-darrow ! ”[974-i] “ [I]975-i never dreamed [I]975-i should be here to hear [you]71-darrow say them ! ”[975-i] [He]975-i turned back and lifting a floating end of [her]976-her scarf put [his]975-i lips to it . “ But now that [you]976-her have , [I]975-i know -- [I]975-i know , ”[975-i] [he]975-i smiled down at [her]976-her . “ [You]976-her know ? ”[975-i] “ That this is no light thing between [us]977-their . Now [you]71-darrow may ask [me]975-i anything [you]71-darrow please ! That was all [I]975-i wanted to ask [YOU]71-darrow . ”[975-i] For a long moment [they]977-their looked at [each other]177-each other without speaking . [She]976-her saw the dancing spirit in [his]975-i eyes turn grave and darken to a passionate sternness . [He]975-i stooped and kissed [her]976-her , and [she]976-her sat as if folded in wings . XII It was in the natural order of things that , on the way back to [the house]581-the house , [their]977-their talk should have turned to the future . [Anna]97-anna was not eager to define it . [She]97-anna had an extraordinary sensitiveness to the impalpable elements of happiness , and as [she]97-anna walked at [Darrow]71-darrow ’s side [her]97-anna imagination flew back and forth , spinning luminous webs of feeling between [herself]97-anna and the scene about [her]97-anna . Every heightening of emotion produced for [her]97-anna a new effusion of beauty in visible things , and with it the sense that such moments should be lingered over and absorbed like some unrenewable miracle . [She]97-anna understood [Darrow]71-darrow ’s impatience to see [their]977-their plans take shape . [She]97-anna knew it must be so , [she]97-anna would not have had it otherwise ; but to reach a point where [she]97-anna could fix [her]97-anna mind on [his]71-darrow appeal for dates and decisions was like trying to break [her]97-anna way through the silver tangle of [an April wood]980-an april wood . [Darrow]71-darrow wished to use [his]71-darrow diplomatic opportunities as a means of studying certain economic and social problems with which [he]71-darrow presently hoped to deal in print ; and with this in view [he]71-darrow had asked for , and obtained , a South American appointment . [Anna]97-anna was ready to follow where [he]71-darrow led , and not reluctant to put new sights as well as new thoughts between [herself]97-anna and [her]97-anna past . [She]97-anna had , in a direct way , only [Effie]74-effie and [Effie]74-effie ’s education to consider ; and there seemed , after due reflection , no reason why the most anxious regard for these should not be conciliated with the demands of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s career . [Effie]74-effie , it was evident , could be left to [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s care till [the couple]981-the couple should have organized [their]981-the couple life ; and [she]97-anna might even , as long as [[her]97-anna future step - father]982-her future step - father ’s work retained [him]71-darrow in distant posts , continue to divide [her]97-anna year between [Givre]30-givre and [the antipodes]983-the antipodes . As for [Owen]75-owen , who had reached [his]71-darrow legal majority two years before , and was soon to attain the age fixed for the taking over of [his]71-darrow paternal inheritance , the arrival of this date would reduce [[his]71-darrow step - mother]233-his step - mother ’s responsibility to a friendly concern for [his]71-darrow welfare . This made for the prompt realization of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s wishes , and there seemed no reason why the marriage should not take place within the six weeks that remained of [his]71-darrow leave . [They]981-the couple passed out of the wood - walk into the open brightness of [the garden]222-the garden . The noon sunlight sheeted with gold the bronze flanks of the polygonal yews . Chrysanthemums , russet , saffron and orange , glowed like the efflorescence of [an enchanted forest]986-an enchanted forest ; belts of red begonia purpling to wine - colour ran like smouldering flame among the borders ; and above this outspread tapestry [the house]581-the house extended its harmonious length , the soberness of [its]581-the house lines softened to grace in the luminous misty air . [Darrow]71-darrow stood still , and [Anna]97-anna felt that [his]71-darrow glance was travelling from [her]97-anna to the scene about [them]981-the couple and then back to [her]97-anna face . “ [You]71-darrow ’re sure [you]71-darrow ’re prepared to give up [Givre]30-givre ? [You]71-darrow look so made for [each other]177-each other ! ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [Givre----]126-givre---- ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna broke off suddenly , feeling as if [her]97-anna too careless tone had delivered all [her]97-anna past into [his]71-darrow hands ; and with one of [her]97-anna instinctive movements of recoil [she]97-anna added : “ When [Owen]75-owen marries [I]97-anna shall have to give it up . ”[97-anna] “ When [Owen]75-owen marries ? That ’s looking some distance ahead ! [I]97-anna want to be told that meanwhile [you]71-darrow ’ll have no regrets . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna hesitated . Why did [he]71-darrow press [her]97-anna to uncover to [him]71-darrow [her]97-anna poor starved past ? A vague feeling of loyalty , a desire to spare what could no longer harm [her]97-anna , made [her]97-anna answer evasively : “ There will probably be no ‘ meanwhile . ’ [Owen]75-owen may marry before long . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna had not meant to touch on the subject , for [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son had sworn [her]97-anna to provisional secrecy ; but since the shortness of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s leave necessitated a prompt adjustment of [their]989-their own plans , it was , after all , inevitable that [she]97-anna should give [him]71-darrow at least a hint of [Owen]75-owen ’s . “ [Owen]75-owen marry ? Why , [he]71-darrow always seems like a faun in flannels ! [I]97-anna hope [he]71-darrow ’s found a dryad . There might easily be one left in [these blue - and - gold woods]2514-these blue - and - gold woods . ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna ca n’t tell [you]97-anna yet where [he]71-darrow found [his]71-darrow dryad , but [she]2515-she IS one , [I]97-anna believe : at any rate [she]2515-she ’ll become the [Givre]30-givre woods better than [I]97-anna do . Only there may be difficulties---- ”[97-anna] “ Well ! At that age [they]2516-they ’re not always to be wished away . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna hesitated . “ [Owen]75-owen , at any rate , has made up [his]71-darrow mind to overcome [them]2516-they ; and [I]97-anna ’ve promised to see [him]71-darrow through . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna went on , after a moment ’s consideration , to explain that [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son ’s choice was , for various reasons , not likely to commend itself to [[his]719-her step - son grandmother]991-his grandmother . “ [She]991-his grandmother must be prepared for it , and [I]97-anna ’ve promised to do the preparing . [You]71-darrow know [I]97-anna always HAVE seen [him]71-darrow through things , and [he]71-darrow rather counts on [me]97-anna now . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna fancied that [Darrow]71-darrow ’s exclamation had in it a faint note of annoyance , and wondered if [he]71-darrow again suspected [her]97-anna of seeking a pretext for postponement . “ But once [Owen]75-owen ’s future is settled , [you]71-darrow wo n’t , surely , for the sake of what [you]71-darrow call seeing [him]71-darrow through , ask that [I]71-darrow should go away again without [you]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow drew [her]97-anna closer as [they]992-they walked . “ [Owen]75-owen will understand , if [you]97-anna do n’t . Since [he]71-darrow ’s in the same case [himself]71-darrow [I]71-darrow ’ll throw [myself]71-darrow on [his]71-darrow mercy . [He]71-darrow ’ll see that [I]71-darrow have the first claim on [you]71-darrow ; [he]71-darrow wo n’t even want [you]71-darrow not to see it . ”[71-darrow] “ [Owen]75-owen sees everything : [I]71-darrow ’m not afraid of that . But [his]71-darrow future is n’t settled . [He]71-darrow ’s very young to marry -- too young , [[his]71-darrow grandmother]991-his grandmother is sure to think -- and the marriage [he]71-darrow wants to make is not likely to convince [her]991-his grandmother to the contrary . ”[71-darrow] “ [You]71-darrow do n’t mean that it ’s like [his]71-darrow first choice ? ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , no ! But it ’s not what [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle would call a good match ; it ’s not even what [I]71-darrow call [a wise one]2518-a wise one . ”[71-darrow] “ Yet [you]71-darrow ’re backing [him]71-darrow up ? ”[71-darrow] “ Yet [I]993-i ’m backing [him]71-darrow up . ”[993-i] [She]993-i paused . “ [I]993-i wonder if [you]71-darrow ’ll understand ? What [I]993-i ’ve most wanted for [him]71-darrow , and shall want for [Effie]74-effie , is that [they]2519-they shall always feel free to make [their]2519-they own mistakes , and never , if possible , be persuaded to make [other people]2520-other people ’s . Even if [Owen]75-owen ’s marriage is a mistake , and has to be paid for , [I]993-i believe [he]71-darrow ’ll learn and grow in the paying . Of course [I]993-i ca n’t make [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle see this ; but [I]993-i can remind [her]111-madame de chantelle that , with [his]71-darrow character -- [his]71-darrow big rushes of impulse , [his]71-darrow odd intervals of ebb and apathy -- [she]111-madame de chantelle may drive [him]71-darrow into some worse blunder if [she]111-madame de chantelle thwarts [him]71-darrow now . ”[993-i] “ And [you]993-i mean to break the news to [her]111-madame de chantelle as soon as [she]111-madame de chantelle comes back from [Ouchy]38-ouchy ? ”[71-darrow] “ As soon as [I]994-her see [my]994-her way to it . [She]111-madame de chantelle knows [the girl]297-the girl and likes [her]297-the girl : that ’s [our]2522-our hope . And yet it may , in the end , prove [our]2522-our danger , make it harder for [us]2522-our all , when [she]111-madame de chantelle learns the truth , than if [Owen]75-owen had chosen [a stranger]2523-a stranger . [I]994-her ca n’t tell [you]2524-you more till [I]994-her ’ve told [her]111-madame de chantelle : [I]994-her ’ve promised [Owen]75-owen not to tell [any one]2525-any one . All [I]994-her ask [you]2524-you is to give [me]994-her time , to give [me]994-her a few days at any rate [She]111-madame de chantelle ’s been wonderfully ‘ nice , ’ as [she]111-madame de chantelle would call it , about [you]2524-you , and about the fact of [my]994-her having soon to leave [Givre]30-givre ; but that , again , may make it harder for [Owen]75-owen . At any rate , [you]2524-you can see , ca n’t [you]2524-you , how it makes [me]994-her want to stand by [him]71-darrow ? [You]2524-you see , [I]994-her could n’t bear it if the least fraction of [my]994-her happiness seemed to be stolen from [his]71-darrow -- as if it were a little scrap of happiness that had to be pieced out with [other people]2520-other people ’s ! ”[994-her] [She]994-her clasped [her]994-her hands on [Darrow]71-darrow ’s arm . “ [I]994-her want [our]2527-our life to be like [a house with all the windows lit : [I]994-her ’d like to string lanterns from the roof and chimneys]2528-a house with all the windows lit : i ’d like to string lanterns from the roof and chimneys ! ”[994-her] [She]994-her ended with an inward tremor . All through [her]994-her exposition and [her]994-her appeal [she]994-her had told [herself]994-her that the moment could hardly have been less well chosen . In [[Darrow]71-darrow ’s place]995-darrow ’s place [she]994-her would have felt , as [he]71-darrow doubtless did , that [her]994-her carefully developed argument was only the disguise of an habitual indecision . It was the hour of all others when [she]994-her would have liked to affirm [herself]994-her by brushing aside every obstacle to [his]71-darrow wishes ; yet it was only by opposing [them]996-them that [she]994-her could show the strength of character [she]994-her wanted [him]71-darrow to feel in [her]994-her . But as [she]994-her talked [she]994-her began to see that [Darrow]71-darrow ’s face gave back no reflection of [her]994-her words , that [he]71-darrow continued to wear the abstracted look of [a man who is not listening to what is said to [him]71-darrow]997-a man who is not listening to what is said to him . It caused [her]994-her a slight pang to discover that [his]71-darrow thoughts could wander at such a moment ; then , with a flush of joy [she]994-her perceived the reason . In some undefinable way [she]994-her had become aware , without turning [her]994-her head , that [he]71-darrow was steeped in the sense of [her]994-her nearness , absorbed in contemplating the details of [her]994-her face and dress ; and the discovery made the words throng to [her]994-her lips . [She]994-her felt [herself]994-her speak with ease , authority , conviction . [She]994-her said to [herself]994-her : “ [He]71-darrow does n’t care what [I]994-her say -- it ’s enough that [I]994-her say it -- even if it ’s stupid [he]71-darrow ’ll like [me]994-her better for it ... ”[994-her] [She]994-her knew that every inflexion of [her]994-her voice , every gesture , every characteristic of [[her]994-her person]998-her person -- its very defects , the fact that [her]994-her forehead was too high , that [her]994-her eyes were not large enough , that [her]994-her hands , though slender , were not small , and that the fingers did not taper -- [she]994-her knew that these deficiencies were so many channels through which [her]994-her influence streamed to [him]999-him ; that [she]994-her pleased [him]999-him in spite of them , perhaps because of them ; that [he]999-him wanted [her]994-her as [she]994-her was , and not as [she]994-her would have liked to be ; and for the first time [she]994-her felt in [her]994-her veins the security and lightness of happy love . [They]1000-they reached [the court]708-the court and walked under the limes toward [the house]581-the house . [The hall]539-the hall door stood wide , and through the windows opening on [the terrace]2399-the terrace the sun slanted across the black and white floor , the faded tapestry chairs , and [Darrow]71-darrow ’s travelling coat and cap , which lay among the cloaks and rugs piled on a bench against the wall . The sight of these garments , lying among [her]994-her own wraps , gave [her]994-her a sense of homely intimacy . It was as if [her]994-her happiness came down from the skies and took on the plain dress of daily things . At last [she]994-her seemed to hold it in [her]994-her hand . As [they]1000-they entered [the hall]539-the hall [her]994-her eye lit on an unstamped note conspicuously placed on the table . “ From [Owen]75-owen ! [He]2529-him must have rushed off somewhere in the motor . ”[994-her] [She]994-her felt a secret stir of pleasure at the immediate inference that [she]994-her and [Darrow]71-darrow would probably lunch alone . Then [she]994-her opened the note and stared at it in wonder . “ [Dear]2291-dear , ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen wrote , “ after what [you]2291-dear said yesterday [I]75-owen ca n’t wait another hour , and [I]75-owen ’m off to [Francheuil]42-francheuil , to catch the [Dijon]43-dijon express and travel back with [them]1000-they . Do n’t be frightened ; [I]75-owen wo n’t speak unless it ’s safe to . Trust [me]75-owen for that -- but [I]75-owen had to go . ”[75-owen] [She]994-her looked up slowly . “ [He]2529-him ’s gone to [Dijon]43-dijon to meet [[his]2529-him grandmother]991-his grandmother . Oh , [I]994-her hope [I]994-her have n’t made a mistake ! ”[994-her] “ [You]75-owen ? Why , what have [you]75-owen to do with [his]2529-him going to [Dijon]43-dijon ? ”[994-her] [She]994-her hesitated . “ The day before yesterday [I]994-her told [him]2529-him , for the first time , that [I]994-her meant to see [him]2529-him through , no matter what happened . And [I]994-her ’m afraid [he]2529-him ’s lost [his]2529-him head , and will be imprudent and spoil things . [You]75-owen see , [I]994-her had n’t meant to say a word to [him]2529-him till [I]994-her ’d had time to prepare [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle . ”[994-her] [She]994-her felt that [Darrow]71-darrow was looking at [her]994-her and reading [her]994-her thoughts , and the colour flew to [her]994-her face . “ Yes : it was when [I]71-darrow heard [you]71-darrow were coming that [I]71-darrow told [him]2529-him . [I]71-darrow wanted [him]2529-him to feel as [I]71-darrow felt ... it seemed too unkind to make [him]2529-him wait ! ”[71-darrow] [Her]994-her hand was in [his]71-darrow , and [his]71-darrow arm rested for a moment on [her]994-her shoulder . “ It WOULD have been too unkind to make [him]2529-him wait . ”[71-darrow] [They]1006-they moved side by side toward [the stairs]1007-the stairs . Through the haze of bliss enveloping [her]994-her , [Owen]75-owen ’s affairs seemed curiously unimportant and remote . Nothing really mattered but this torrent of light in [her]994-her veins . [She]994-her put [her]994-her foot on the lowest step , saying : “ It ’s nearly luncheon time -- [I]994-her must take off [my]994-her hat ... ”[994-her] and as [she]994-her started up the stairs [Darrow]71-darrow stood below in [the hall]539-the hall and watched [her]994-her . But the distance between [them]1006-they did not make [him]71-darrow seem less near : it was as if [his]71-darrow thoughts moved with [her]994-her and touched [her]994-her like endearing hands . In [[her]994-her bedroom]1009-her bedroom [she]994-her shut the door and stood still , looking about [her]994-her in a fit of dreamy wonder . [Her]994-her feelings were unlike any [she]994-her had ever known : richer , deeper , more complete . For the first time everything in [her]994-her , from head to foot , seemed to be feeding the same full current of sensation . [She]994-her took off [her]994-her hat and went to the dressing - table to smooth [her]994-her hair . The pressure of the hat had flattened the dark strands on [her]994-her forehead ; [her]994-her face was paler than usual , with shadows about the eyes . [She]994-her felt a pang of regret for the wasted years . “ If [I]994-her look like this today , ”[994-her] [she]994-her said to [herself]994-her , “ what will [he]2532-he think of [me]994-her when [I]994-her ’m ill or worried ? ”[994-her] [She]994-her began to run [her]994-her fingers through [her]994-her hair , rejoicing in its thickness ; then [she]994-her desisted and sat still , resting [her]994-her chin on [her]994-her hands . “ [I]994-her want [him]2532-he to see [me]994-her as [I]994-her am , ”[994-her] [she]994-her thought . Deeper than the deepest fibre of [her]994-her vanity was the triumphant sense that AS [SHE]994-her WAS , with [her]994-her flattened hair , [her]994-her tired pallor , [her]994-her thin sleeves a little tumbled by the weight of [her]994-her jacket , [he]1010-he would like [her]994-her even better , feel [her]994-her nearer , dearer , more desirable , than in all the splendours [she]994-her might put on for [him]1010-he . In the light of this discovery [she]994-her studied [her]994-her face with a new intentness , seeing its defects as [she]994-her had never seen them , yet seeing them through a kind of radiance , as though love were a luminous medium into which [she]994-her had been bodily plunged . [She]994-her was glad now that [she]994-her had confessed [her]994-her doubts and [her]994-her jealousy . [She]994-her divined that [a man in love]1011-a man in love may be flattered by such involuntary betrayals , that there are moments when respect for [his]1011-a man in love liberty appeals to [him]1011-a man in love less than the inability to respect it : moments so propitious that [a woman]406-a woman ’s very mistakes and indiscretions may help to establish [her]406-a woman dominion . The sense of power [she]994-her had been aware of in talking to [Darrow]71-darrow came back with ten - fold force . [She]994-her felt like testing [him]71-darrow by the most fantastic exactions , and at the same moment [she]994-her longed to humble [herself]994-her before [him]71-darrow , to make [herself]994-her the shadow and echo of [his]71-darrow mood . [She]994-her wanted to linger with [him]71-darrow in a world of fancy and yet to walk at [his]71-darrow side in the world of fact . [She]994-her wanted [him]71-darrow to feel [her]994-her power and yet to love [her]994-her for [her]994-her ignorance and humility . [She]994-her felt like [a slave]1013-a slave , and [a goddess]1014-a goddess , and [a girl in [her]1015-a girl in her teens teens]1015-a girl in her teens ... [XIII Darrow]71-darrow , late that evening , threw [himself]71-darrow into an armchair before [his]71-darrow fire and mused . [The room]663-the room was propitious to meditation . The red - veiled lamp , the corners of shadow , the splashes of firelight on the curves of old full - bodied wardrobes and cabinets , gave it an air of intimacy increased by [its]663-the room faded hangings , [its]663-the room slightly frayed and threadbare rugs . Everything in [it]663-the room was harmoniously shabby , with a subtle sought - for shabbiness in which [Darrow]71-darrow fancied [he]71-darrow discerned the touch of [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath . But [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath had grown so unimportant a factor in the scheme of things that these marks of [his]72-fraser leath presence caused [the young man]217-the young man no emotion beyond that of a faint retrospective amusement . The afternoon and evening had been perfect . After a moment of concern over [[her]994-her step - son]719-her step - son ’s departure , [Anna]97-anna had surrendered [herself]97-anna to [her]97-anna happiness with an impetuosity that [Darrow]71-darrow had never suspected in [her]97-anna . Early in the afternoon [they]1019-they had gone out in [the motor]1020-the motor , traversing miles of sober - tinted landscape in which , here and there , a scarlet vineyard flamed , clattering through [the streets of [stony villages]1022-stony villages]1021-the streets of stony villages , coming out on [low slopes above [the river]503-the river]1023-low slopes above the river , or winding through the pale gold of narrow wood - roads with the blue of [clear - cut hills at]1025-clear - cut hills at [their]1019-they end . Over everything lay a faint sunshine that seemed dissolved in the still air , and the smell of wet roots and decaying leaves was merged in the pungent scent of burning underbrush . Once , at the turn of a wall , [they]1019-they stopped [the motor]1020-the motor before [a ruined gateway]1027-a ruined gateway and , stumbling along [a road full of ruts]1028-a road full of ruts , stood before [a little old deserted house]1029-a little old deserted house , fantastically carved and chimneyed , which lay in [a moat under the shade of ancient trees]1030-a moat under the shade of ancient trees . [They]1019-they paced the paths between the trees , found [a mouldy Temple of Love]1031-a mouldy temple of love on [an islet among reeds and plantains]1032-an islet among reeds and plantains , and , sitting on a bench in [the stable - yard]1033-the stable - yard , watched the pigeons circling against the sunset over [their]1019-they cot of patterned brick . Then [the motor]1020-the motor flew on into the dusk ... When [they]1019-they came in [they]1019-they sat beside the fire in [the oak drawing - room]1035-the oak drawing - room , and [Darrow]71-darrow noticed how delicately [her]1036-her head stood out against the sombre panelling , and mused on the enjoyment there would always be in the mere fact of watching [her]1036-her hands as [they]1019-they moved about among the tea - things ... [They]1019-they dined late , and facing [her]1036-her across the table , with [its]1037-its low lights and flowers , [he]71-darrow felt an extraordinary pleasure in seeing [her]1036-her again in evening dress , and in letting [his]71-darrow eyes dwell on the proud shy set of [her]1036-her head , the way [her]1036-her dark hair clasped it , and the girlish thinness of [her]1036-her neck above the slight swell of the breast . [His]71-darrow imagination was struck by the quality of reticence in [her]1036-her beauty . [She]1036-her suggested a fine portrait kept down to a few tones , or a Greek vase on which the play of light is the only pattern . After dinner [they]1019-they went out on [the terrace]2399-the terrace for a look at [the moon - misted park]1039-the moon - misted park . Through the crepuscular whiteness the trees hung in blotted masses . Below [the terrace]2399-the terrace , [the garden]222-the garden drew [its]222-the garden dark diagrams between statues that stood like [muffled conspirators on the edge of the shadow]1042-muffled conspirators on the edge of the shadow . Farther off , [the meadows]1043-the meadows unrolled a silver - shot tissue to the mantling of mist above [the river]503-the river ; and the autumn stars trembled overhead like their own reflections seen in dim water . [He]71-darrow lit [his]71-darrow cigar , and [they]1019-they walked slowly up and down the flags in the languid air , till [he]71-darrow put an arm about [her]1036-her , saying : “ [You]1036-her must n’t stay till [you]1036-her ’re chilled ”[71-darrow] ; then [they]1019-they went back into [the room]663-the room and drew up [their]1019-they chairs to the fire . It seemed only a moment later that [she]1036-her said : “ It must be after eleven , ”[1036-her] and stood up and looked down on [him]71-darrow , smiling faintly . [He]71-darrow sat still , absorbing the look , and thinking : “ There ’ll be evenings and evenings”--till[1036-her] [she]1036-her came nearer , bent over [him]71-darrow , and with a hand on [his]71-darrow shoulder said : “ Good night . ”[1036-her] [He]71-darrow got to [his]71-darrow feet and put [his]71-darrow arms about [her]1036-her . “ Good night , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow answered , and held [her]1036-her fast ; and [they]1019-they gave [each other]177-each other a long kiss of promise and communion . The memory of it glowed in [him]71-darrow still as [he]71-darrow sat over [his]71-darrow crumbling fire ; but beneath [his]71-darrow physical exultation [he]71-darrow felt a certain gravity of mood . [His]71-darrow happiness was in some sort the rallying - point of many scattered purposes . [He]71-darrow summed it up vaguely by saying to [himself]71-darrow that to be loved by [a woman like that]1047-a woman like that made “ all the difference”[71-darrow] ... [He]71-darrow was a little tired of experimenting on life ; [he]71-darrow wanted to “ take a line ”[71-darrow] , to follow things up , to centralize and concentrate , and produce results . Two or three more years of diplomacy -- with [her]1036-her beside [him!--and]1048-him!--and then [their]1019-they real life would begin : study , travel and book - making for [him]71-darrow , and for [her]1036-her -- well , the joy , at any rate , of getting out of an atmosphere of bric - a - brac and card - leaving into the open air of competing activities . The desire for change had for some time been latent in [him]71-darrow , and [his]71-darrow meeting with [Mrs. Leath]75-owen the previous spring had given it a definite direction . With such [a comrade]1049-a comrade to focus and stimulate [his]71-darrow energies [he]71-darrow felt modestly but agreeably sure of “ doing something ”[1049-a comrade] . And under this assurance was the lurking sense that [he]71-darrow was somehow worthy of [his]71-darrow opportunity . [His]71-darrow life , on the whole , had been a creditable affair . Out of modest chances and middling talents [he]71-darrow had built [himself]71-darrow a fairly marked personality , known [some exceptional people]1050-some exceptional people , done a number of interesting and a few rather difficult things , and found [himself]71-darrow , at thirty - seven , possessed of an intellectual ambition sufficient to occupy the passage to a robust and energetic old age . As for the private and personal side of [his]71-darrow life , it had come up to the current standards , and if it had dropped , now and then , below a more ideal measure , even these declines had been brief , parenthetic , incidental . In the recognized essentials [he]71-darrow had always remained strictly within the limit of [his]71-darrow scruples . From this reassuring survey of [his]71-darrow case [he]71-darrow came back to the contemplation of its crowning felicity . [His]71-darrow mind turned again to [his]71-darrow first meeting with [Anna Summers]67-anna and took up one by one the threads of [their]1051-their faintly sketched romance . [He]71-darrow dwelt with pardonable pride on the fact that fate had so early marked [him]71-darrow for the high privilege of possessing [her]67-anna : it seemed to mean that [they]1051-their had really , in the truest sense of the ill - used phrase , been made for each other . Deeper still than all these satisfactions was the mere elemental sense of well - being in [her]67-anna presence . That , after all , was what proved [her]67-anna to be [the woman for [him]71-darrow]1052-the woman for him : the pleasure [he]71-darrow took in the set of [her]67-anna head , the way [her]67-anna hair grew on [her]67-anna forehead and at the nape , [her]67-anna steady gaze when [he]71-darrow spoke , the grave freedom of [her]67-anna gait and gestures . [He]71-darrow recalled every detail of [her]67-anna face , the fine veinings of the temples , the bluish - brown shadows in [her]67-anna upper lids , and the way the reflections of two stars seemed to form and break up in [her]67-anna eyes when [he]71-darrow held [her]67-anna close to [him]71-darrow ... If [he]71-darrow had had any doubt as to the nature of [her]67-anna feeling for [him]71-darrow those dissolving stars would have allayed it . [She]67-anna was reserved , [she]67-anna was shy even , was what the shallow and effusive would call “ cold ”[67-anna] . [She]67-anna was like a picture so hung that it can be seen only at a certain angle : an angle known to no one but [its possessor]267-its possessor . The thought flattered [his]71-darrow sense of [possessorship]809-possessorship ... [He]71-darrow felt that the smile on [his]71-darrow lips would have been fatuous had it had [a witness]1055-a witness . [He]71-darrow was thinking of [her]67-anna look when [she]67-anna had questioned [him]71-darrow about [his]71-darrow meeting with [Owen]75-owen at [the theatre]237-the theatre : less of [her]67-anna words than of [her]67-anna look , and of the effort the question cost [her]67-anna : the reddening of [her]67-anna cheek , the deepening of the strained line between [her]67-anna brows , the way [her]67-anna eyes sought shelter and then turned and drew on [him]71-darrow . Pride and passion were in the conflict -- magnificent qualities in [a wife]1057-a wife ! The sight almost made up for [his]71-darrow momentary embarrassment at the rousing of a memory which had no place in [his]71-darrow present picture of [himself]71-darrow . Yes ! It was worth a good deal to watch that fight between [her]67-anna instinct and [her]67-anna intelligence , and know [one]2308-one ’s self the object of the struggle ... Mingled with these sensations were considerations of another order . [He]71-darrow reflected with satisfaction that [she]67-anna was [the kind of woman with whom one would like to be seen in public]1059-the kind of woman with whom one would like to be seen in public . It would be distinctly agreeable to follow [her]67-anna into [drawing - rooms]1060-drawing - rooms , to walk after [her]67-anna down [the aisle of [a theatre]2503-a theatre]1061-the aisle of a theatre , to get in and out of [trains]1063-trains with [her]67-anna , to say “ [[my]71-darrow wife]2533-my wife ”[71-darrow] of [her]67-anna to all sorts of [people]365-people . [He]71-darrow draped these details in the handsome phrase “ [She]67-anna ’s [a woman to be proud of ”]2534-a woman to be proud of ”[71-darrow] , and felt that this fact somehow justified and ennobled [his]71-darrow instinctive boyish satisfaction in loving [her]67-anna . [He]71-darrow stood up , rambled across [the room]663-the room and leaned out for a while into the starry night . Then [he]71-darrow dropped again into [his]71-darrow armchair with a sigh of deep content . “ Oh , hang it , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow suddenly exclaimed , “ it ’s the best thing that ’s ever happened to [me]71-darrow , anyhow ! ”[71-darrow] The next day was even better . [He]71-darrow felt , and knew [she]67-anna felt , that [they]1066-their had reached a clearer understanding of [each other]177-each other . It was as if , after a swim through bright opposing waves , with a dazzle of sun in [their]1066-their eyes , [they]1066-their had gained [an inlet in the shades of a cliff , where [they]1066-their could float on the still surface and gaze far down into [the depths]1069-the depths]1068-an inlet in the shades of a cliff , where they could float on the still surface and gaze far down into the depths . Now and then , as [they]1066-their walked and talked , [he]71-darrow felt a thrill of youthful wonder at the coincidence of [their]1066-their views and [their]1066-their experiences , at the way [their]1066-their minds leapt to the same point in the same instant . “ The old delusion , [I]71-darrow suppose , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow smiled to [himself]71-darrow . “ Will [Nature]128-nature never tire of the trick ? ”[71-darrow] But [he]71-darrow knew it was more than that . There were moments in [their]1066-their talk when [he]71-darrow felt , distinctly and unmistakably , the solid ground of friendship underneath the whirling dance of [his]71-darrow sensations . “ How [I]71-darrow should like [her]2535-her if [I]71-darrow did n’t love [her]2535-her ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow summed it up , wondering at the miracle of such a union . In the course of the morning a telegram had come from [Owen Leath]75-owen , announcing that [he]71-darrow , [[his]71-darrow grandmother]991-his grandmother and [Effie]74-effie would arrive from [Dijon]43-dijon that afternoon at four . [The station of the main line]1071-the station of the main line was eight or ten miles from [Givre]30-givre , and [Anna]67-anna , soon after three , left in [the motor]1020-the motor to meet [the travellers]1073-the travellers . When [she]67-anna had gone [Darrow]71-darrow started for a walk , planning to get back late , in order that [the reunited family]1074-the reunited family might have the end of the afternoon to [themselves]1074-the reunited family . [He]71-darrow roamed [the country - side]1075-the country - side till long after dark , and the stable - clock of [Givre]30-givre was striking seven as [he]71-darrow walked up [the avenue]1076-the avenue to [the court]708-the court . In [the hall]539-the hall , coming down the stairs , [he]71-darrow encountered [Anna]67-anna . [Her]67-anna face was serene , and [his]71-darrow first glance showed [him]71-darrow that [Owen]75-owen had kept [his]71-darrow word and that none of [her]67-anna forebodings had been fulfilled . [She]67-anna had just come down from [the school - room]1079-the school - room , where [Effie]74-effie and [the governess]757-the governess were having supper ; [the little girl]858-the little girl , [she]67-anna told [him]71-darrow , looked immensely better for [her]858-the little girl Swiss holiday , but was dropping with sleep after the journey , and too tired to make [her]858-the little girl habitual appearance in [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room before being put to bed . [XIV]131-xiv If [Darrow]71-darrow , on entering [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room before dinner , examined [its new occupant]1091-its new occupant with unusual interest , it was more on [Owen Leath]75-owen ’s account than [his]71-darrow own . [Anna]67-anna ’s hints had roused [his]71-darrow interest in [the lad]1092-the lad ’s love affair , and [he]71-darrow wondered what manner of girl [the heroine of the coming conflict]1093-the heroine of the coming conflict might be . [He]71-darrow had guessed that [Owen]75-owen ’s rebellion symbolized for [[his]71-darrow step - mother]233-his step - mother [her]233-his step - mother own long struggle against the Leath conventions , and [he]71-darrow understood that if [Anna]67-anna so passionately abetted [him]71-darrow it was partly because , as [she]67-anna owned , [she]67-anna wanted [his]71-darrow liberation to coincide with [hers]67-anna . [The lady who was to represent , in the impending struggle , the forces of order and tradition]1095-the lady who was to represent , in the impending struggle , the forces of order and tradition was seated by the fire when [Darrow]71-darrow entered . Among the flowers and old furniture of [the large pale - panelled room]1096-the large pale - panelled room , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle had the inanimate elegance of a figure introduced into a “ still - life ”[71-darrow] to give the scale . And this , [Darrow]71-darrow reflected , was exactly what [she]111-madame de chantelle doubtless regarded as [her]111-madame de chantelle chief obligation : [he]71-darrow was sure [she]111-madame de chantelle thought a great deal of “ measure ”[111-madame de chantelle] , and approved of most things only up to a certain point . [She]111-madame de chantelle was [a woman of sixty , with a figure at once young and old - fashioned]1097-a woman of sixty , with a figure at once young and old - fashioned . [One]2308-one saw [her]111-madame de chantelle , younger but [no less invincibly lady]1100-no less invincibly lady - like , leaning on a chair with a fringed back , a curl in [her]111-madame de chantelle neck , a locket on [her]111-madame de chantelle tuckered bosom , toward the end of an embossed morocco album beginning with The Beauties of [the Second Empire]1101-the second empire . [She]111-madame de chantelle received [[her]111-madame de chantelle daughter - in - law ’s suitor]1102-her daughter - in - law ’s suitor with an affability which implied [her]111-madame de chantelle knowledge and approval of [his]1102-her daughter - in - law ’s suitor suit . [Darrow]71-darrow had already guessed [her]111-madame de chantelle to be [a person who would instinctively oppose any suggested changes]1103-a person who would instinctively oppose any suggested changes , and then , after [one]2308-one had exhausted [one]2308-one ’s main arguments , unexpectedly yield to some small incidental reason , and adhere doggedly to [her]111-madame de chantelle new position . [She]111-madame de chantelle boasted of [her]111-madame de chantelle old - fashioned prejudices , talked a good deal of being [a grandmother]1106-a grandmother , and made a show of reaching up to tap [Owen]75-owen ’s shoulder , though [his]1102-her daughter - in - law ’s suitor height was little more than [hers]111-madame de chantelle . [She]111-madame de chantelle was full of a small pale prattle about [the people [she]111-madame de chantelle had seen at [Ouchy]38-ouchy]1107-the people she had seen at ouchy , as to whom [she]111-madame de chantelle had the minute statistical information of a gazetteer , without any apparent sense of personal differences . [She]111-madame de chantelle said to [Darrow]71-darrow : “ [They]1107-the people she had seen at ouchy tell [me]111-madame de chantelle things are very much changed in [America]7-america ... Of course in [my]111-madame de chantelle youth there WAS a Society”[111-madame de chantelle] ... [She]111-madame de chantelle had no desire to return [there]2294-there [she]111-madame de chantelle was sure the standards must be so different . “ There are [charming people]2545-charming people everywhere ... and [one]2308-one must always look on the best side ... but when [one]2308-one has lived among Traditions it ’s difficult to adapt [one]2308-one ’s self to the new ideas ... [She]111-madame de chantelle wandered off to the cooking and the service of [the hotel at [Ouchy]38-ouchy]1109-the hotel at ouchy .
