After dinner [Owen Leath]75-owen wandered into [the next room]557-the next room , where the piano stood , and began to play among the shadows . [[His]1112-his step - mother]233-his step - mother presently joined [him]1112-his , and [Darrow]71-darrow sat alone with [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle . [She]111-madame de chantelle took up the thread of [her]111-madame de chantelle mild chat and carried it on at the same pace as [her]111-madame de chantelle knitting . [Her]111-madame de chantelle conversation resembled the large loose - stranded web between [her]111-madame de chantelle fingers : now and then [she]111-madame de chantelle dropped a stitch , and went on regardless of the gap in the pattern . [Darrow]71-darrow listened with a lazy sense of well - being . In the mental lull of the after - dinner hour , with harmonious memories murmuring through [his]1112-his mind , and the soft tints and shadowy spaces of [the fine old room]1114-the fine old room charming [his]1112-his eyes to indolence , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s discourse seemed not out of place . [He]1112-his could understand that , in the long run , the atmosphere of [Givre]30-givre might be suffocating ; but in [his]1112-his present mood its very limitations had a grace . Presently [he]1112-his found the chance to say a word in [his]1112-his own behalf ; and thereupon measured the advantage , never before particularly apparent to [him]1112-his , of being related to [the Everards of [Albany]44-albany]1115-the everards of albany . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s conception of [[her]111-madame de chantelle native country -- to which [she]111-madame de chantelle had not returned since [her]111-madame de chantelle twentieth year]1116-her native country -- to which she had not returned since her twentieth year -- reminded [him]1112-his of [an ancient geographer]1117-an ancient geographer ’s map of [the Hyperborean regions]1118-the hyperborean regions . It was all a foggy blank , from which only one or two fixed outlines emerged ; and one of these belonged to [the Everards of [Albany]44-albany]1115-the everards of albany . The fact that [they]1115-the everards of albany offered such firm footing -- formed , so to speak , [a friendly territory on which [the opposing powers]1121-the opposing powers could meet and treat]1120-a friendly territory on which the opposing powers could meet and treat -- helped [him]1112-his through the task of explaining and justifying [himself]1112-his as [the successor of [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath]1122-the successor of fraser leath . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle could not resist such incontestable claims . [She]111-madame de chantelle seemed to feel [[her]111-madame de chantelle son]1123-her son ’s hovering and discriminating presence , and [she]111-madame de chantelle gave [Darrow]71-darrow the sense that [he]71-darrow was being tested and approved as a last addition to the Leath Collection . [She]111-madame de chantelle also made [him]71-darrow aware of the immense advantage [he]71-darrow possessed in belonging to the diplomatic profession . [She]111-madame de chantelle spoke of this humdrum calling as a Career , and gave [Darrow]71-darrow to understand that [she]111-madame de chantelle supposed [him]71-darrow to have been seducing [Duchesses]132-duchesses when [he]71-darrow was not negotiating Treaties . [He]71-darrow heard again quaint phrases which [romantic old ladies]1124-romantic old ladies had used in [his]71-darrow youth : “ Brilliant diplomatic society ... social advantages ... the entree everywhere ... nothing else FORMS [a young man]2556-a young man in the same way ... ”[111-madame de chantelle] and [she]111-madame de chantelle sighingly added that [she]111-madame de chantelle could have wished [[her]111-madame de chantelle grandson]1125-her grandson had chosen the same path to glory . [Darrow]71-darrow prudently suppressed [his]71-darrow own view of the profession , as well as the fact that [he]71-darrow had adopted it provisionally , and for reasons less social than sociological ; and the talk presently passed on to the subject of [his]71-darrow future plans . Here again , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s awe of the Career made [her]111-madame de chantelle admit the necessity of [Anna]67-anna ’s consenting to an early marriage . The fact that [Darrow]71-darrow was “ ordered ”[111-madame de chantelle] to [South America]21-south america seemed to put [him]71-darrow in the romantic light of [a young soldier charged to lead a forlorn hope]1126-a young soldier charged to lead a forlorn hope : [she]111-madame de chantelle sighed and said : “ At such moments [a wife]1057-a wife ’s duty is at [[her]1057-a wife husband]174-her husband ’s side . ”[111-madame de chantelle] The problem of [Effie]74-effie ’s future might have disturbed [her]111-madame de chantelle , [she]111-madame de chantelle added ; but since [Anna]67-anna , for a time , consented to leave [the little girl]858-the little girl with [her]111-madame de chantelle , that problem was at any rate deferred . [She]111-madame de chantelle spoke plaintively of the responsibility of looking after [[her]111-madame de chantelle granddaughter]1128-her granddaughter , but [Darrow]71-darrow divined that [she]111-madame de chantelle enjoyed the flavour of the word more than [she]111-madame de chantelle felt the weight of the fact . “ [Effie]74-effie ’s [a perfect child]2559-a perfect child . [She]74-effie ’s more like [[my]111-madame de chantelle son]2560-my son , perhaps , than dear [Owen]75-owen . [She]74-effie ’ll never intentionally give [me]111-madame de chantelle the least trouble . But of course the responsibility will be great ... I’m not sure [I]111-madame de chantelle should dare to undertake it if it were not for [her]74-effie having such a treasure of [a governess]2489-a governess . Has [Anna]67-anna told [you]2562-you about [[our]2563-we little governess]2564-our little governess ? After all the worry [we]2563-we had last year , with [one impossible creature]2565-one impossible creature after another , it seems providential , just now , to have found [her]74-effie . At first [we]2563-we were afraid [she]74-effie was too young ; but now [we]2563-we ’ve the greatest confidence in [her]74-effie . So clever and amusing -- and [SUCH a lady]2566-such a lady ! [I]111-madame de chantelle do n’t say [her]74-effie education ’s all it might be ... no drawing or singing ... but one ca n’t have everything ; and [she]74-effie speaks Italian ... ”[111-madame de chantelle] [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s fond insistence on the likeness between [Effie Leath]74-effie and [[her]74-effie father]348-her father , if not particularly gratifying to [Darrow]71-darrow , had at least increased [his]71-darrow desire to see [the little girl]858-the little girl . It gave [him]71-darrow an odd feeling of discomfort to think that [she]858-the little girl should have any of the characteristics of the late [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath : [he]71-darrow had , somehow , fantastically pictured [her]858-the little girl as the mystical offspring of the early tenderness between [himself]71-darrow and [Anna Summers]67-anna . [His]71-darrow encounter with [Effie]74-effie took place the next morning , on [the lawn below [the terrace]2399-the terrace]1131-the lawn below the terrace , where [he]71-darrow found [her]858-the little girl , in the early sunshine , knocking about golf balls with [[her]858-the little girl brother]1133-her brother . Almost at once , and with infinite relief , [he]71-darrow saw that the resemblance of which [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle boasted was mainly external . Even that discovery was slightly distasteful , though [Darrow]71-darrow was forced to own that [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath ’s straight - featured fairness had lent itself to the production of a peculiarly finished image of childish purity . But it was evident that other elements had also gone to the making of [Effie]74-effie , and that another spirit sat in [her]858-the little girl eyes . [Her]858-the little girl serious handshake , [her]858-the little girl “ pretty ”[858-the little girl] greeting , were worthy of [the Leath]72-fraser leath tradition , and [he]71-darrow guessed [her]858-the little girl to be more malleable than [Owen]75-owen , more subject to the influences of [Givre]30-givre ; but the shout with which [she]858-the little girl returned to [her]858-the little girl romp had in it the note of [[her]858-the little girl mother]221-her mother ’s emancipation . [He]71-darrow had begged a holiday for [her]858-the little girl , and when [Mrs. Leath]75-owen appeared [he]71-darrow and [she]75-owen and [the little girl]858-the little girl went off for a ramble . [Anna]67-anna wished [[her]67-anna daughter]1136-her daughter to have time to make [friends]2424-friends with [Darrow]71-darrow before learning in what relation [he]71-darrow was to stand to [her]858-the little girl ; and [the three]1138-the three roamed [the woods]2461-the woods and [fields]1140-fields till the distant chime of the stable - clock made [them]1138-the three turn back for luncheon . [Effie]74-effie , who was attended by [a shaggy terrier]1141-a shaggy terrier , had picked up two or three subordinate dogs at [the stable]1142-the stable ; and as [she]74-effie trotted on ahead with [[her]74-effie yapping escort]1143-her yapping escort , [Anna]67-anna hung back to throw a look at [Darrow]71-darrow . “ Yes , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow answered it , “ [she]74-effie ’s exquisite ... Oh , [I]67-anna see what [I]67-anna ’m asking of [you]67-anna ! But [she]74-effie ’ll be quite happy [here]2403-here , wo n’t [she]74-effie ? And [you]67-anna must remember it wo n’t be for long ... ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna sighed [her]67-anna acquiescence . “ Oh , [she]74-effie ’ll be happy [here]2403-here . It ’s [her]74-effie nature to be happy . [She]74-effie ’ll apply [herself]74-effie to it , conscientiously , as [she]74-effie does to [her]74-effie lessons , and to what [she]74-effie calls ‘ being good’ ... In a way , [you]71-darrow see , that ’s just what worries [me]67-anna . [Her]74-effie idea of ‘ being good ’ is to please [the person [she]74-effie ’s with]2569-the person she ’s with -- [she]74-effie puts [her]74-effie whole dear little mind on it ! And so , if ever [she]74-effie ’s with [the wrong person----]2570-the wrong person---- ”[67-anna] “ But surely there ’s no danger of that just now ? [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle tells [me]67-anna that [you]71-darrow ’ve at last put [your]71-darrow hand on [a perfect governess----]2571-a perfect governess---- ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna , without answering , glanced away from [him]1144-him toward [[her]67-anna daughter]1136-her daughter . “ It ’s lucky , at any rate , ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow continued , “ that [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle thinks [her]74-effie so . ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [I]67-anna think very highly of [her]74-effie too . ”[67-anna] “ Highly enough to feel quite satisfied to leave [her]74-effie with [Effie]74-effie ? ”[67-anna] “ Yes . [She]74-effie ’s just [the person for [Effie]74-effie]2572-the person for effie . Only , of course , [one]2308-one never knows ... [She]74-effie ’s young , and [she]74-effie might take it into [her]74-effie head to leave [us]1146-us ... ”[67-anna] After a pause [she]67-anna added : “ [I]67-anna ’m naturally anxious to know what [you]71-darrow think of [her]74-effie . ”[67-anna] When [they]1146-us entered [the house]581-the house the hands of the hall clock stood within a few minutes of the luncheon hour . [Anna]67-anna led [Effie]74-effie off to have [her]74-effie hair smoothed and [Darrow]71-darrow wandered into [the oak sitting - room]933-the oak sitting - room , which [he]71-darrow found untenanted . The sun lay pleasantly on [its]933-the oak sitting - room brown walls , on the scattered books and the flowers in old porcelain vases . In [his]71-darrow eyes lingered the vision of [the dark - haired mother]1149-the dark - haired mother mounting the stairs with [[her]1149-the dark - haired mother little fair daughter]1150-her little fair daughter . The contrast between [them]1146-us seemed a last touch of grace in the complex harmony of things . [He]71-darrow stood in the window , looking out at [the park]765-the park , and brooding inwardly upon [his]71-darrow happiness ... [He]71-darrow was roused by [Effie]74-effie ’s voice and the scamper of [her]74-effie feet down the long floors behind [him]71-darrow . “ [Here]2403-here [he]71-darrow is ! Here [he]71-darrow is ! ”[74-effie] [she]74-effie cried , flying over the threshold . [He]71-darrow turned and stooped to [her]74-effie with a smile , and as [she]74-effie caught [his]71-darrow hand [he]71-darrow perceived that [she]74-effie was trying to draw [him]71-darrow toward [some one who had paused behind [her]74-effie in the doorway , and whom [he]71-darrow supposed to be [[her]74-effie mother]221-her mother]1152-some one who had paused behind her in the doorway , and whom he supposed to be her mother . “ HERE [he]71-darrow is ! ”[74-effie] [Effie]74-effie repeated , with [her]74-effie sweet impatience . [The figure in the doorway]1154-the figure in the doorway came forward and [Darrow]71-darrow , looking up , found [himself]71-darrow face to face with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [They]1155-they stood still , a yard or two apart , and looked at [each other]177-each other without speaking . As [they]1155-they paused there , a shadow fell across one of the terrace windows , and [Owen Leath]75-owen stepped whistling into [the room]663-the room . In [his]71-darrow rough shooting clothes , with the glow of exercise under [his]71-darrow fair skin , [he]71-darrow looked extraordinarily light - hearted and happy . [Darrow]71-darrow , with a quick side - glance , noticed this , and perceived also that the glow on [the youth]1158-the youth ’s cheek had deepened suddenly to red . [He]71-darrow too stopped short , and [the three]1138-the three stood there motionless for a barely perceptible beat of time . During its lapse , [Darrow]71-darrow ’s eyes had turned back from [Owen]75-owen ’s face to that of [the girl between [them]1155-they]1160-the girl between them . [He]71-darrow had the sense that , whatever was done , it was [he]71-darrow who must do it , and that it must be done immediately . [He]71-darrow went forward and held out [his]71-darrow hand . “ How do [you]71-darrow do , [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[71-darrow] [She]1160-the girl between them answered : “ How do [you]71-darrow do ? ”[1160-the girl between them] in a voice that sounded clear and natural ; and the next moment [he]71-darrow again became aware of steps behind [him]71-darrow , and knew that [Mrs. Leath]75-owen was in [the room]663-the room . To [his]71-darrow strained senses there seemed to be another just measurable pause before [Anna]67-anna said , looking gaily about [the little group]1162-the little group : “ Has [Owen]75-owen introduced [you]71-darrow ? This is [[Effie]74-effie ’s friend]2575-effie ’s friend , [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . ”[67-anna] [Effie]74-effie , still hanging on [[her]74-effie governess]1163-her governess ’s arm , pressed [herself]74-effie closer with a little gesture of appropriation ; and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner laid [her]82-miss viner hand on [[her]82-miss viner pupil]1164-her pupil ’s hair . [Darrow]71-darrow felt that [Anna]67-anna ’s eyes had turned to [him]71-darrow . “ [I]82-miss viner think [Miss Viner]82-miss viner and [I]82-miss viner have met already -- several years ago in [London]3-london . ”[82-miss viner] “ [I]81-sophy viner remember , ”[81-sophy viner] said [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , in the same clear voice . “ How charming ! Then [we]2576-we ’re [all friends]2577-all friends . But luncheon must be ready , ”[75-owen] said [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . [She]67-anna turned back to the door , and [the little procession]1165-the little procession moved down [the two long drawing - rooms]1166-the two long drawing - rooms , with [Effie]74-effie waltzing on ahead . [XV Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [Anna]67-anna had planned , for the afternoon , a visit to [a remotely situated acquaintance whom the introduction of the motor]1167-a remotely situated acquaintance whom the introduction of the motor had transformed into [a neighbour]1168-a neighbour . [Effie]74-effie was to pay for [her]74-effie morning ’s holiday by an hour or two in [the school - room]1079-the school - room , and [Owen]75-owen suggested that [he]1170-he and [Darrow]71-darrow should betake [themselves]1171-themselves to a distant covert in the desultory quest for pheasants . [Darrow]71-darrow was not [an ardent sportsman]1172-an ardent sportsman , but any pretext for physical activity would have been acceptable at the moment ; and [he]71-darrow was glad both to get away from [the house]581-the house and not to be left to [himself]71-darrow . When [he]1170-he came [downstairs]1174-downstairs [the motor]1020-the motor was at the door , and [Anna]67-anna stood before [the hall]539-the hall mirror , swathing [her]67-anna hat in veils . [She]67-anna turned at the sound of [his]1170-he step and smiled at [him]1170-he for a long full moment . “ [I]67-anna ’d no idea [you]1170-he knew [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , ”[67-anna] [she]67-anna said , as [he]1170-he helped [her]67-anna into [her]67-anna long coat . “ It came back to [me]67-anna , luckily , that [I]67-anna ’d seen [her]67-anna two or three times in [London]3-london , several years ago . [She]67-anna was [secretary , or something of the sort]2578-secretary , or something of the sort , in the background of [a house where [I]67-anna used to dine]2579-a house where i used to dine . ”[67-anna] [He]1170-he loathed the slighting indifference of the phrase , but [he]1170-he had uttered it deliberately , had been secretly practising it all through the interminable hour at the luncheon - table . Now that it was spoken , [he]1170-he shivered at its note of condescension . In such cases [one]2308-one was almost sure to overdo ... But [Anna]67-anna seemed to notice nothing unusual . “ Was [she]67-anna really ? [You]1170-he must tell [me]67-anna all about it -- tell [me]67-anna exactly how [she]67-anna struck [you]1170-he . [I]67-anna ’m so glad it turns out that [you]1170-he know [her]67-anna . ”[67-anna] “ ‘ Know ’ is rather exaggerated : [we]2580-we used to pass each other on the stairs . ”[111-madame de chantelle] [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [Owen]75-owen appeared together as [he]1170-he spoke , and [Anna]67-anna , gathering up [her]67-anna wraps , said : “ [You]1170-he ’ll tell [me]67-anna about that , then . Try and remember everything [you]1170-he can . ”[67-anna] As [he]1170-he tramped through [the woods]2461-the woods at [[his]1170-he young host]1179-his young host ’s side , [Darrow]71-darrow felt the partial relief from thought produced by exercise and the obligation to talk . Little as [he]71-darrow cared for shooting , [he]71-darrow had the habit of concentration which makes it natural for [a man]798-a man to throw [himself]798-a man wholly into whatever business [he]798-a man has in hand , and there were moments of the afternoon when a sudden whirr in the undergrowth , a vivider gleam against the hazy browns and greys of [the woods]2461-the woods , was enough to fill the foreground of [his]71-darrow attention . But all the while , behind these voluntarily emphasized sensations , [his]71-darrow secret consciousness continued to revolve on a loud wheel of thought . For a time it seemed to be sweeping [him]71-darrow through deep gulfs of darkness . [His]71-darrow sensations were too swift and swarming to be disentangled . [He]71-darrow had an almost physical sense of struggling for air , of battling helplessly with material obstructions , as though the russet covert through which [he]71-darrow trudged were the heart of [a maleficent jungle]1182-a maleficent jungle ... Snatches of [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion ’s talk drifted to [him]71-darrow intermittently through the confusion of [his]71-darrow thoughts . [He]71-darrow caught eager self - revealing phrases , and understood that [Owen]75-owen was saying things about [himself]75-owen , perhaps hinting indirectly at the hopes for which [Darrow]71-darrow had been prepared by [Anna]67-anna ’s confidences . [He]71-darrow had already become aware that [the lad]1092-the lad liked [him]71-darrow , and had meant to take the first opportunity of showing that [he]71-darrow reciprocated the feeling . But the effort of fixing [his]71-darrow attention on [Owen]75-owen ’s words was so great that it left no power for more than the briefest and most inexpressive replies . [Young Leath]133-young leath , it appeared , felt that [he]133-young leath had reached a turning - point in [his]133-young leath career , a height from which [he]133-young leath could impartially survey [his]133-young leath past progress and projected endeavour . At one time [he]133-young leath had had musical and literary yearnings , visions of desultory artistic indulgence ; but these had of late been superseded by the resolute determination to plunge into practical life . “ [I]133-young leath do n’t want , [you]71-darrow see , ”[133-young leath] [Darrow]71-darrow heard [him]133-young leath explaining , “ to drift into what [[my]133-young leath grandmother]2474-my grandmother , [poor dear]2582-poor dear , is trying to make of [me]133-young leath : an adjunct of [Givre]30-givre . [I]133-young leath do n’t want -- hang it all!--to slip into collecting sensations as [[my]133-young leath father]2467-my father collected snuff - boxes . [I]133-young leath want [Effie]74-effie to have [Givre]30-givre -- it ’s [[my]133-young leath grandmother]2474-my grandmother ’s , [you]71-darrow know , to do as [she]2474-my grandmother likes with ; and [I]133-young leath ’ve understood lately that if it belonged to [me]133-young leath it would gradually gobble [me]133-young leath up . [I]133-young leath want to get out of it , into a life that ’s big and ugly and struggling . If [I]133-young leath can extract beauty out of THAT , so much the better : that ’ll prove [my]133-young leath vocation . But [I]133-young leath want to MAKE beauty , not be drowned in the ready - made , like a bee in a pot of honey . ”[133-young leath] [Darrow]71-darrow knew that [he]71-darrow was being appealed to for corroboration of these views and for encouragement in the course to which [they]1185-they pointed . To [his]71-darrow own ears [his]71-darrow answers sounded now curt , now irrelevant : at one moment [he]71-darrow seemed chillingly indifferent , at another [he]71-darrow heard [himself]71-darrow launching out on a flood of hazy discursiveness . [He]71-darrow dared not look at [Owen]75-owen , for fear of detecting [the lad]1092-the lad ’s surprise at these senseless transitions . And through the confusion of [his]71-darrow inward struggles and outward loquacity [he]71-darrow heard the ceaseless trip - hammer beat of the question : “ What in [God]90-god ’s name shall [I]75-owen do ? ”[75-owen] ... To get back to [the house]581-the house before [Anna]67-anna ’s return seemed [his]71-darrow most pressing necessity . [He]71-darrow did not clearly know why : [he]71-darrow simply felt that [he]71-darrow ought to be [there]2294-there . At one moment it occurred to [him]71-darrow that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner might want to speak to [him]71-darrow alone -- and again , in the same flash , that it would probably be the last thing [she]82-miss viner would want ... At any rate , [he]71-darrow felt [he]71-darrow ought to try to speak to [HER]82-miss viner ; or at least be prepared to do so , if the chance should occur ... Finally , toward four , [he]71-darrow told [[his]71-darrow companion]276-his companion that [he]71-darrow had some letters on [his]71-darrow mind and must get back to [the house]581-the house and despatch them before [the ladies]1191-the ladies returned . [He]71-darrow left [Owen]75-owen with [the beater]1192-the beater and walked on to [the edge of the covert]1193-the edge of the covert . At [the park]765-the park gates [he]71-darrow struck obliquely through the trees , following a grass avenue at the end of which [he]71-darrow had caught a glimpse of the roof of [the chapel]943-the chapel . A grey haze had blotted out the sun and the still air clung about [him]71-darrow tepidly . At length [the house]581-the house - front raised before [him]71-darrow [its]581-the house expanse of damp - silvered brick , and [he]71-darrow was struck afresh by the high decorum of [its]581-the house calm lines and soberly massed surfaces . It made [him]71-darrow feel , in the turbid coil of [his]71-darrow fears and passions , like a muddy tramp forcing [his]71-darrow way into some pure sequestered shrine ... By and bye , [he]71-darrow knew , [he]71-darrow should have to think the complex horror out , slowly , systematically , bit by bit ; but for the moment it was whirling [him]71-darrow about so fast that [he]71-darrow could just clutch at its sharp spikes and be tossed off again . Only one definite immediate fact stuck in [his]71-darrow quivering grasp . [He]71-darrow must give [the girl]297-the girl every chance -- must hold [himself]71-darrow passive till [she]297-the girl had taken [them]1198-them ... In [the court]708-the court [Effie]74-effie ran up to [him]71-darrow with [her]74-effie leaping terrier . “ [I]71-darrow was coming out to meet [you]71-darrow -- [you]71-darrow and [Owen]75-owen . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner was coming , too , and then [she]82-miss viner could n’t because [she]82-miss viner ’s got such a headache . [I]71-darrow ’m afraid [I]71-darrow gave it to [her]82-miss viner because [I]71-darrow did [my]71-darrow division so disgracefully . It ’s too bad , is n’t it ? But wo n’t [you]71-darrow walk back with [me]71-darrow ? [Nurse]2585-nurse wo n’t mind the least bit ; [she]2585-nurse ’d so much rather go in to tea . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow excused [himself]71-darrow laughingly , on the plea that [he]71-darrow had letters to write , which was much worse than having a headache , and not infrequently resulted in one . “ Oh , then [you]71-darrow can go and write them in [[Owen]75-owen ’s study]2586-owen ’s study . That ’s where [gentlemen]2587-gentlemen always write [their]2587-gentlemen letters . ”[1200-her] [She]1200-her flew on with [her]1200-her dog and [Darrow]71-darrow pursued [his]71-darrow way to [the house]581-the house . [Effie]74-effie ’s suggestion struck [him]71-darrow as useful . [He]71-darrow had pictured [himself]71-darrow as vaguely drifting about [the drawing - rooms]1202-the drawing - rooms , and had perceived the difficulty of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s having to seek [him]71-darrow [there]2294-there ; but [the study]1204-the study , [a small room on the right of [the hall]539-the hall]1205-a small room on the right of the hall , was in easy sight from the staircase , and so situated that there would be nothing marked in [his]71-darrow being found there in talk with [her]1200-her . [He]71-darrow went in , leaving the door open , and sat down at the writing - table . [The room]663-the room was [a friendly heterogeneous place]1208-a friendly heterogeneous place , [the one repository , in [the well - ordered and amply - servanted house , of all [its]663-the room unclassified odds and ends]1210-the well - ordered and amply - servanted house , of all its unclassified odds and ends]1209-the one repository , in the well - ordered and amply - servanted house , of all its unclassified odds and ends : [Effie]74-effie ’s croquet - box and fishing rods , [Owen]75-owen ’s guns and golf - sticks and racquets , [[his]71-darrow step - mother]233-his step - mother ’s flower - baskets and gardening implements , even [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s embroidery frame , and the back numbers of the Catholic Weekly . The early twilight had begun to fall , and presently a slanting ray across the desk showed [Darrow]71-darrow that [a servant]924-a servant was coming across [the hall]539-the hall with a lamp . [He]71-darrow pulled out a sheet of note - paper and began to write at random , while [the man]263-the man , entering , put the lamp at [his]71-darrow elbow and vaguely “ straightened ”[263-the man] the heap of newspapers tossed on the divan . Then [his]263-the man steps died away and [Darrow]71-darrow sat leaning [his]71-darrow head on [his]71-darrow locked hands . Presently another step sounded on the stairs , wavered a moment and then moved past the threshold of [the study]1204-the study . [Darrow]71-darrow got up and walked into [the hall]539-the hall , which was still unlighted . In the dimness [he]71-darrow saw [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner standing by [the hall]539-the hall door in [her]81-sophy viner hat and jacket . [She]81-sophy viner stopped at sight of [him]71-darrow , [her]81-sophy viner hand on the door - bolt , and [they]1218-they stood for a second without speaking . “ Have [you]71-darrow seen [Effie]74-effie ? ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner suddenly asked . “ [She]74-effie went out to meet [you]71-darrow . ”[81-sophy viner] “ [She]74-effie DID meet [me]71-darrow , just now , in [the court]708-the court . [She]74-effie ’s gone on to join [[her]74-effie brother]1133-her brother . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow spoke as naturally as [he]71-darrow could , but [his]71-darrow voice sounded to [his]71-darrow own ears like [an amateur actor ’s in a “ light ”[71-darrow] part]1219-an amateur actor ’s in a “ light ” part . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , without answering , drew back the bolt . [He]71-darrow watched [her]81-sophy viner in silence as the door swung open ; then [he]71-darrow said : “ [She]74-effie has [[her]74-effie nurse]2590-her nurse with [her]74-effie . [She]74-effie wo n’t be long . ”[71-darrow] [She]81-sophy viner stood irresolute , and [he]71-darrow added : “ [I]71-darrow was writing in there -- won’t [you]81-sophy viner come and have a little talk ? Every one ’s out . ”[71-darrow] The last words struck [him]71-darrow as not well - chosen , but there was no time to choose . [She]81-sophy viner paused a second longer and then crossed the threshold of [the study]1204-the study . At luncheon [she]81-sophy viner had sat with [her]81-sophy viner back to the window , and beyond noting that [she]81-sophy viner had grown a little thinner , and had less colour and vivacity , [he]71-darrow had seen no change in [her]81-sophy viner ; but now , as the lamplight fell on [her]81-sophy viner face , its whiteness startled [him]71-darrow . “ Poor thing ... poor thing ... what in heaven ’s name can [she]81-sophy viner suppose ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow wondered . “ Do sit down -- [I]71-darrow want to talk to [you]81-sophy viner , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said and pushed a chair toward [her]81-sophy viner . [She]81-sophy viner did not seem to see it , or , if [she]81-sophy viner did , [she]81-sophy viner deliberately chose another seat . [He]71-darrow came back to [his]71-darrow own chair and leaned [his]71-darrow elbows on the blotter . [She]81-sophy viner faced [him]71-darrow from the farther side of the table . “ [You]81-sophy viner promised to let [me]71-darrow hear from [you]81-sophy viner now and then , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow began awkwardly , and with a sharp sense of [his]71-darrow awkwardness . A faint smile made [her]81-sophy viner face more tragic . “ Did [I]71-darrow ? There was nothing to tell . [I]71-darrow ’ve had no history -- like [the happy countries]2591-the happy countries ... ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow waited a moment before asking : “ [You]81-sophy viner ARE happy [here]2403-here ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]81-sophy viner WAS , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said with a faint emphasis . “ Why do [you]71-darrow say ‘ was ’ ? [You]71-darrow ’re surely not thinking of going ? There ca n’t be [kinder people]2593-kinder people anywhere . ”[81-sophy viner] [Darrow]71-darrow hardly knew what [he]71-darrow was saying ; but [her]81-sophy viner answer came to [him]71-darrow with deadly definiteness . “ [I]81-sophy viner suppose it depends on [you]71-darrow whether [I]81-sophy viner go or stay . ”[81-sophy viner] “ On [me]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow stared at [her]81-sophy viner across [Owen]75-owen ’s scattered papers . “ Good [God]90-god ! What can [you]81-sophy viner think of [me]71-darrow , to say that ? ”[71-darrow] The mockery of the question flashed back at [him]71-darrow from [her]81-sophy viner wretched face . [She]81-sophy viner stood up , wandered away , and leaned an instant in the darkening window - frame . From there [she]81-sophy viner turned to fling back at [him]71-darrow : “ Do n’t imagine [I]81-sophy viner ’m the least bit sorry for anything ! ”[81-sophy viner] [He]71-darrow steadied [his]71-darrow elbows on the table and hid [his]71-darrow face in [his]71-darrow hands . It was harder , oh , damnably harder , than [he]71-darrow had expected ! Arguments , expedients , palliations , evasions , all seemed to be slipping away from [him]71-darrow : [he]71-darrow was left face to face with the mere graceless fact of [his]71-darrow inferiority . [He]71-darrow lifted [his]71-darrow head to ask at random : “ [You]81-sophy viner ’ve been here , then , ever since ? ”[71-darrow] “ Since [June]124-june ; yes . It turned out that [the Farlows]94-the farlows were hunting for [me]81-sophy viner -- all the while -- for this . ”[81-sophy viner] [She]81-sophy viner stood facing [him]71-darrow , [her]81-sophy viner back to the window , evidently impatient to be gone , yet with something still to say , or that [she]81-sophy viner expected to hear [him]71-darrow say . The sense of [her]81-sophy viner expectancy benumbed [him]71-darrow . What in heaven ’s name could [he]71-darrow say to [her]81-sophy viner that was not an offense or a mockery ? “ [Your]81-sophy viner idea of [the theatre]237-the theatre -- [you]81-sophy viner gave that up at once , then ? ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [the theatre]237-the theatre ! ”[81-sophy viner] [She]81-sophy viner gave a little laugh . “ [I]81-sophy viner could n’t wait for [the theatre]237-the theatre . [I]81-sophy viner had to take the first thing that offered ; [I]81-sophy viner took this . ”[81-sophy viner] [He]71-darrow pushed on haltingly : “ [I]71-darrow ’m glad -- extremely glad -- [you’re]81-sophy viner happy here ... [I’d]71-darrow counted on [your]81-sophy viner letting [me]71-darrow know if there was anything [I]71-darrow could do ... [I]71-darrow know [people in that line in [London]3-london]2599-people in that line in london -- [I’m]71-darrow certain [I]71-darrow can manage it for [you]81-sophy viner when [I]71-darrow get back---- ”[71-darrow] [She]1221-she moved up to the table and leaned over it to ask , in a voice that was hardly above a whisper : “ Then [you]1222-he DO want [me]1221-she to leave ? Is that it ? ”[1221-she] [He]1222-he dropped [his]1222-he arms with a groan . “ Good heavens ! How can [you]81-sophy viner think such things ? At the time , [you]81-sophy viner know , [I]1222-he begged [you]81-sophy viner to let [me]1222-he do what [I]1222-he could , but [you]81-sophy viner would n’t hear of it ... and ever since [I]1222-he ’ve been wanting to be of use -- to do something , anything , to help [you]81-sophy viner ... ”[1222-he] [She]1221-she heard [him]1222-he through , motionless , without a quiver of the clasped hands [she]1221-she rested on the edge of the table . “ If [you]1222-he want to help [me]1221-she , then -- [you]1222-he can help [me]1221-she to stay [here]2403-here , ”[1221-she] [she]1221-she brought out with low - toned intensity . Through the stillness of the pause which followed , the bray of a motor - horn sounded far down [the drive]715-the drive . Instantly [she]1221-she turned , with a last white look at [him]1222-he , and fled from [the room]663-the room and up [the stairs]1007-the stairs . [He]1222-he stood motionless , benumbed by the shock of [her]1221-she last words . [She]1221-she was afraid , then -- afraid of [him]1222-he -- sick with fear of [him]1222-he ! The discovery beat [him]1222-he down to a lower depth ... The motor - horn sounded again , close at hand , and [he]1222-he turned and went up to [[his]1222-he room]542-his room . [His]1222-he letter - writing was a sufficient pretext for not immediately joining the party about the tea - table , and [he]1222-he wanted to be alone and try to put a little order into [his]1222-he tumultuous thinking . [Upstairs]597-upstairs , [the room]663-the room held out the intimate welcome of [its]663-the room lamp and fire . Everything in [it]663-the room exhaled the same sense of peace and stability which , two evenings before , had lulled [him]1222-he to complacent meditation . [His]1222-he armchair again invited [him]1222-he from the hearth , but [he]1222-he was too agitated to sit still , and with sunk head and hands clasped behind [his]1222-he back [he]1222-he began to wander up and down [the room]663-the room . [His]1222-he five minutes with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had flashed strange lights into the shadowy corners of [his]1222-he consciousness . [The girl]297-the girl ’s absolute candour , [her]297-the girl hard ardent honesty , was for the moment the vividest point in [his]1222-he thoughts . [He]1222-he wondered anew , as [he]1222-he had wondered before , at the way in which the harsh discipline of life had stripped [her]297-the girl of false sentiment without laying the least touch on [her]297-the girl pride . When [they]1231-they had parted , five months before , [she]297-the girl had quietly but decidedly rejected all [his]1222-he offers of help , even to the suggestion of [his]1222-he trying to further [her]297-the girl theatrical aims : [she]297-the girl had made it clear that [she]297-the girl wished [their]1231-they brief alliance to leave no trace on [their]1231-they lives save that of [its]1232-its own smiling memory . But now that [they]1231-they were unexpectedly confronted in a situation which seemed , to [her]297-the girl terrified fancy , to put [her]297-the girl at [his]1222-he mercy , [her]297-the girl first impulse was to defend [her]297-the girl right to [the place [she]297-the girl had won]1233-the place she had won , and to learn as quickly as possible if [he]1222-he meant to dispute it . While [he]1222-he had pictured [her]297-the girl as shrinking away from [him]1222-he in a tremor of self - effacement [she]297-the girl had watched [his]1222-he movements , made sure of [her]297-the girl opportunity , and come straight down to “ have it out ”[297-the girl] with [him]1222-he . [He]1222-he was so struck by the frankness and energy of the proceeding that for a moment [he]1222-he lost sight of the view of [his]1222-he own character implied in it . “ [Poor thing ... poor thing]2601-poor thing ... poor thing ! ”[1222-he] [he]1222-he could only go on saying ; and with the repetition of the words the picture of [himself]1222-he as [she]297-the girl must see [him]1222-he pitiably took shape again . [He]1222-he understood then , for the first time , how vague , in comparison with [hers]297-the girl , had been [his]1222-he own vision of the part [he]1222-he had played in the brief episode of [their]1234-their relation . The incident had left in [him]1222-he a sense of exasperation and self - contempt , but that , as [he]1222-he now perceived , was chiefly , if not altogether , as it bore on [his]1222-he preconceived ideal of [his]1222-he attitude toward [another woman]1235-another woman . [He]1222-he had fallen below [his]1222-he own standard of sentimental loyalty , and if [he]1222-he thought of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner it was mainly as the chance instrument of [his]1222-he lapse . These considerations were not agreeable to [his]1222-he pride , but they were forced on [him]1222-he by the example of [her]297-the girl valiant common - sense . If [he]1222-he had cut [a sorry figure in the business]1236-a sorry figure in the business , [he]1222-he owed it to [her]297-the girl not to close [his]1222-he eyes to the fact any longer ... But when [he]1222-he opened them , what did [he]1222-he see ? The situation , detestable at best , would yet have been relatively simple if [protecting Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had been the only duty involved in it . The fact that that duty was paramount did not do away with the contingent obligations . It was [Darrow]71-darrow ’s instinct , in difficult moments , to go straight to the bottom of the difficulty ; but [he]1222-he had never before had to take so dark a dive as this , and for the minute [he]1222-he shivered on the brink ... Well , [his]1222-he first duty , at any rate , was to [the girl]297-the girl : [he]1222-he must let [her]297-the girl see that [he]1222-he meant to fulfill it to the last jot , and then try to find out how to square the fulfillment with the other problems already in [his]1222-he path ... [XVI]134-xvi In [the oak room]1238-the oak room [he]1222-he found [Mrs. Leath]75-owen , [[her]297-the girl mother - in - law]236-her mother - in - law and [Effie]74-effie . [The group]1240-the group , as [he]1222-he came toward [it]1241-it down [the long drawing - rooms]1242-the long drawing - rooms , composed itself prettily about the tea - table . The lamps and the fire crossed their gleams on silver and porcelain , on the bright haze of [Effie]74-effie ’s hair and on the whiteness of [Anna]67-anna ’s forehead , as [she]297-the girl leaned back in [her]297-the girl chair behind the tea - urn . [She]297-the girl did not move at [Darrow]71-darrow ’s approach , but lifted to [him]71-darrow a deep gaze of peace and confidence . The look seemed to throw about [him]71-darrow the spell of a divine security : [he]71-darrow felt the joy of [a convalescent]1243-a convalescent suddenly waking to find the sunlight on [his]71-darrow face . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , across [her]111-madame de chantelle knitting , discoursed of [their]1244-their afternoon ’s excursion , with occasional pauses induced by the hypnotic effect of the fresh air ; and [Effie]74-effie , kneeling , on the hearth , softly but insistently sought to implant in [her]74-effie terrier ’s mind some notion of the relation between a vertical attitude and sugar . [Darrow]71-darrow took a chair behind [the little girl]858-the little girl , so that [he]71-darrow might look across at [[her]858-the little girl mother]221-her mother . It was almost a necessity for [him]71-darrow , at the moment , to let [his]71-darrow eyes rest on [Anna]67-anna ’s face , and to meet , now and then , the proud shyness of [her]297-the girl gaze . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle presently enquired what had become of [Owen]75-owen , and a moment later the window behind [her]111-madame de chantelle opened , and [[her]111-madame de chantelle grandson]1125-her grandson , gun in hand , came in from [the terrace]2399-the terrace . As [he]1125-her grandson stood there in the lamp - light , with dead leaves and bits of bramble clinging to [his]1125-her grandson mud - spattered clothes , the scent of the night about [him]1125-her grandson and its chill on [his]1125-her grandson pale bright face , [he]1125-her grandson really had the look of [a young faun]1249-a young faun strayed in from [the forest]792-the forest . [Effie]74-effie abandoned the terrier to fly to [him]1125-her grandson . “ Oh , [Owen]75-owen , where in [the world]206-the world have [you]75-owen been ? [Effie]74-effie pursued [him]1125-her grandson with [her]74-effie blandishments , and for a while [he]1125-her grandson poured out to [her]74-effie a low - voiced stream of nonsense ; then [he]1125-her grandson sat down beside [[his]1125-her grandson step - mother]233-his step - mother and leaned over to help [himself]1125-her grandson to tea . “ Where ’s [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[1125-her grandson] [he]1125-her grandson asked , as [Effie]74-effie climbed up on [him]1125-her grandson . “ Why is n’t [she]82-miss viner here to chain up [this ungovernable infant]2606-this ungovernable infant ? ”[1125-her grandson] “ [Poor Miss Viner]82-miss viner has a headache . [He]1125-her grandson stood up , lit another cigarette , and wandered away to the piano in [the room beyond]1255-the room beyond . From the twilight where [he]1125-her grandson sat a lonely music , borne on fantastic chords , floated to [the group]1240-the group about the tea - table . Under its influence [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s meditative pauses increased in length and frequency , and [Effie]74-effie stretched [herself]74-effie on the hearth , [her]74-effie drowsy head against the dog . Presently [[her]74-effie nurse]2590-her nurse appeared , and [Anna]67-anna rose at the same time . “ Stop a minute in [[my]74-effie sitting - room]2608-my sitting - room on [your]71-darrow way up , ”[74-effie] [she]74-effie paused to say to [Darrow]71-darrow as [she]74-effie went . From [her]74-effie writing - table , where [she]74-effie sat over a pile of letters , [Anna]67-anna lifted [her]74-effie happy smile . [She]67-anna threw [her]67-anna head back , as if surprised at the abruptness of the gesture ; then [her]67-anna face leaned to [his]71-darrow with the slow droop of a flower . [He]71-darrow felt again the sweep of the secret tides , and all [his]71-darrow fears went down in them . [She]67-anna sat down in the sofa - corner by the fire and [he]71-darrow drew an armchair close to [her]67-anna . [His]71-darrow gaze roamed peacefully about [the quiet room]1260-the quiet room . “ It ’s just like [you]67-anna -- it is [you]67-anna , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , as [his]71-darrow eyes came back to [her]67-anna . “ It ’s a good place to be alone in -- [I]71-darrow do n’t think [I]71-darrow ’ve ever before cared to talk with [any one here]2610-any one here . ”[71-darrow] “ Let ’s be quiet , then : it ’s the best way of talking . ”[71-darrow] “ Yes ; but [we]2611-we must save it up till later . [I]71-darrow ’m glad [she]82-miss viner ’s out of it , [poor girl]2617-poor girl ! ”[71-darrow] “ Then [you]71-darrow never really saw anything of [her]82-miss viner [there]2294-there ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]67-anna never had the chance . [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett discouraged any competition on the part of [[her]78-mrs. murrett subordinates]2619-her subordinates . ”[67-anna] “ Especially [such pretty ones]2620-such pretty ones , [I]71-darrow suppose ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow made no comment , and [she]1261-she continued : “ And [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s own opinion -- if [she]78-mrs. murrett ’d offered [you]71-darrow one -- probably would n’t have been of much value ? ”[1261-she] “ Only in so far as [her]78-mrs. murrett disapproval would , on general principles , have been a good mark for [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . But surely , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on after a pause , “ [you]67-anna could have found out about [her]82-miss viner from [the people through whom [you]67-anna first heard of [her]82-miss viner]2621-the people through whom you first heard of her ? ”[71-darrow] [Anna]67-anna smiled . “ Oh , [we]2622-we heard of [her]82-miss viner through [Adelaide Painter--]122-adelaide ; ”[67-anna] and in reply to [his]71-darrow glance of interrogation [she]67-anna explained that [the lady in question]1262-the lady in question was [a spinster of [South Braintree]45-south braintree , [Massachusetts]46-massachusetts , who , having come to [Paris]10-paris some thirty years earlier , to nurse [a brother]1264-a brother through an illness]1263-a spinster of south braintree , massachusetts , who , having come to paris some thirty years earlier , to nurse a brother through an illness , had ever since protestingly and provisionally camped [there]2294-there in a state of contemptuous protestation oddly manifested by [her]1262-the lady in question never taking the slip - covers off [her]1262-the lady in question drawing - room chairs . [[Her]1262-the lady in question long residence on [Gallic soil]1267-gallic soil]1266-her long residence on gallic soil had not mitigated [her]1262-the lady in question hostility toward the creed and customs of the race , but though [she]1262-the lady in question always referred to [the Catholic Church]1268-the catholic church as [the Scarlet Woman]1269-the scarlet woman and took the darkest views of French private life , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle placed great reliance on [her]1262-the lady in question judgment and experience , and in every domestic crisis the irreducible [Adelaide]122-adelaide was immediately summoned to [Givre]30-givre . “ It ’s all the odder because [[my]71-darrow mother - in - law]2623-my mother - in - law , since [her]1262-the lady in question second marriage , has lived so much in [the country]220-the country that [she]1262-the lady in question ’s practically lost sight of all [[her]1262-the lady in question other American friends]2625-her other american friends . Besides which , [you]2626-you can see how completely [she]1262-the lady in question has identified [herself]1262-the lady in question with [Monsieur de Chantelle]116-monsieur de chantelle ’s nationality and adopted French habits and prejudices . Yet when anything goes wrong [she]1262-the lady in question always sends for [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide , who ’s more American than the Stars and Stripes , and might have left [South Braintree]45-south braintree yesterday , if [she]1262-the lady in question had n’t , rather , brought it over with [her]1262-the lady in question in [her]1262-the lady in question trunk . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow laughed . “ Well , then , if [South Braintree]45-south braintree vouches for [Miss Viner----]2627-miss viner---- ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , but only indirectly . When [we]2628-we had that odious adventure with [Mademoiselle Grumeau]136-mademoiselle grumeau , who ’d been so highly recommended by [[Monsieur de Chantelle]116-monsieur de chantelle ’s aunt]2629-monsieur de chantelle ’s aunt , [the Chanoinesse]137-the chanoinesse , [Adelaide]122-adelaide was of course sent for , and [she]122-adelaide said at once : ‘ [I]1262-the lady in question ’m not the least bit surprised . [I]1262-the lady in question ’ve always told [you]71-darrow that what [you]71-darrow wanted for [Effie]74-effie was [a sweet American girl]2630-a sweet american girl , and [not one of these nasty foreigners]2631-not one of these nasty foreigners . ’ Unluckily [she]1262-the lady in question could n’t , at the moment , put [her]1262-the lady in question hand on [a sweet American]2632-a sweet american ; but [she]1262-the lady in question presently heard of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner through [the Farlows]94-the farlows , [an excellent couple who live in [the Quartier Latin]47-the quartier latin and write about French life for the American papers]2633-an excellent couple who live in the quartier latin and write about french life for the american papers . [I]1262-the lady in question was only too thankful to find [anyone who was vouched for by [decent people]2635-decent people]2634-anyone who was vouched for by decent people ; and so far [I]1262-the lady in question ’ve had no cause to regret [my]1262-the lady in question choice . But [I]1262-the lady in question know , after all , very little about [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ; and there are all kinds of reasons why [I]1262-the lady in question want , as soon as possible , to find out more -- to find out all [I]1262-the lady in question can . ”[1262-the lady in question] “ Since [you]1262-the lady in question ’ve got to leave [Effie]74-effie [I]71-darrow understand [your]1262-the lady in question feeling in that way . But is there , in such a case , any recommendation worth half as much as [your]1262-the lady in question own direct experience ? ”[71-darrow] “ No ; and it ’s been so favourable that [I]1262-the lady in question was ready to accept it as conclusive . Only , naturally , when [I]1262-the lady in question found [you]1262-the lady in question ’d known [her]82-miss viner in [London]3-london [I]1262-the lady in question was in hopes [you]1262-the lady in question ’d give [me]1262-the lady in question some more specific reasons for liking [her]82-miss viner as much as [I]1262-the lady in question do . ”[1262-the lady in question] “ [I]1262-the lady in question ’m afraid [I]1262-the lady in question can give [you]1262-the lady in question nothing more specific than [my]1262-the lady in question general vague impression that [she]82-miss viner seems very plucky and extremely nice . ”[1262-the lady in question] “ [You]1262-the lady in question do n’t , at any rate , know anything specific to the contrary ? ”[71-darrow] “ To the contrary ? How should [I]1262-the lady in question ? [I]1262-the lady in question ’m not conscious of ever having heard [any one]2525-any one say two words about [her]82-miss viner . [I]1262-the lady in question only infer that [she]82-miss viner must have pluck and character to have stuck it out so long at [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s . ”[1262-the lady in question] “ Yes , poor thing ! [She]82-miss viner has pluck , certainly ; and pride , too ; which must have made it all the harder . ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna rose to [her]67-anna feet . “ [You]1270-i do n’t know how glad [I]1270-i am that [your]1270-i impression ’s on the whole so good . [I]1270-i particularly wanted [you]67-anna to like [her]82-miss viner . ”[1270-i] [He]1270-i drew [her]67-anna to [him]1270-i with a smile . “ On that condition [I]1270-i ’m prepared to love even [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide . ”[1270-i] “ [I]1270-i almost hope [you]1270-i wo nt have the chance to -- [poor Adelaide]122-adelaide ! [Her]82-miss viner appearance [here]2403-here always coincides with a catastrophe . ”[1270-i] “ Oh , then [I]1270-i must manage to meet [her]82-miss viner elsewhere . ”[1270-i] [He]1270-i held [Anna]67-anna closer , saying to [himself]1270-i , as [he]1270-i smoothed back the hair from [her]67-anna forehead : “ What does anything matter but just THIS?--Must [I]1270-i go now ? ”[1270-i] [he]1270-i added aloud . [She]67-anna answered absently : “ It must be time to dress ”[67-anna] ; then [she]67-anna drew back a little and laid [her]67-anna hands on [his]1270-i shoulders . “ [My]67-anna love -- oh , [[my]67-anna dear love]2638-my dear love ! ”[67-anna] [she]67-anna said . It came to [him]1270-i that they were the first words of endearment [he]1270-i had heard [her]67-anna speak , and their rareness gave [them]1271-them a magic quality of reassurance , as though no danger could strike through such a shield . A knock on the door made [them]1271-them draw apart . [Anna]67-anna lifted [her]67-anna hand to [her]67-anna hair and [Darrow]71-darrow stooped to examine a photograph of [Effie]74-effie on the writing - table . “ Come in ! ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna said . The door opened and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner entered . Seeing [Darrow]71-darrow , [she]81-sophy viner drew back . “ Do come in , [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna repeated , looking at [her]81-sophy viner kindly . [The girl]297-the girl , a quick red in [her]297-the girl cheeks , still hesitated on the threshold . “ [I]297-the girl ’m so sorry ; but [Effie]74-effie has mislaid [her]74-effie Latin grammar , and [I]297-the girl thought [she]74-effie might have left it [here]2403-here . [I]297-the girl need it to prepare for tomorrow ’s lesson . ”[297-the girl] “ Is this it ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow asked , picking up a book from the table . “ Oh , thank [you]297-the girl ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow held it out to [her]297-the girl and [she]297-the girl took it and moved to the door . “ Wait a minute , please , [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna said ; and as [the girl]297-the girl turned back , [she]297-the girl went on with [her]297-the girl quiet smile : “ [Effie]74-effie told [us]2640-us [you]82-miss viner ’d gone to [[your]82-miss viner room]2641-your room with a headache . [You]82-miss viner must n’t sit up over tomorrow ’s lessons if [you]82-miss viner do n’t feel well . ”[297-the girl] [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s blush deepened . “ But [you]82-miss viner see [I]297-the girl have to . Latin ’s one of [my]297-the girl weak points , and there ’s generally only one page of this book between [me]297-the girl and [Effie]74-effie . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl threw the words off with a half - ironic smile . “ Do excuse [my]297-the girl disturbing [you]82-miss viner , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl added . “ [You]82-miss viner did n’t disturb [me]67-anna , ”[67-anna] [Anna]67-anna answered . [Darrow]71-darrow perceived that [she]297-the girl was looking intently at [the girl]297-the girl , as though struck by something tense and tremulous in [her]297-the girl face , [her]297-the girl voice , [her]297-the girl whole mien and attitude . “ [You]297-the girl DO look tired . [You]297-the girl ’d much better go straight to bed . [Her]297-the girl glance , making a swift circuit of [the room]663-the room , dwelt for an appreciable instant on the intimate propinquity of arm - chair and sofa - corner ; then [she]297-the girl turned back to the door . BOOK III XVII At dinner that evening [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s slender monologue was thrown out over gulfs of silence . [Owen]75-owen was still in the same state of moody abstraction as when [Darrow]71-darrow had left [him]297-the girl at the piano ; and even [Anna]67-anna ’s face , to [[her]67-anna friend]1276-her friend ’s vigilant eye , revealed not , perhaps , a personal preoccupation , but a vague sense of impending disturbance . [She]67-anna smiled , [she]67-anna bore a part in the talk , [her]67-anna eyes dwelt on [Darrow]71-darrow ’s with their usual deep reliance ; but beneath the surface of [her]67-anna serenity [his]71-darrow tense perceptions detected a hidden stir . [He]71-darrow was sufficiently self - possessed to tell [himself]71-darrow that it was doubtless due to causes with which [he]71-darrow was not directly concerned . [He]71-darrow knew the question of [Owen]75-owen ’s marriage was soon to be raised , and the abrupt alteration in [the young man]217-the young man ’s mood made it seem probable that [he]71-darrow was [himself]71-darrow the centre of the atmospheric disturbance . For a moment it occurred to [Darrow]71-darrow that [Anna]67-anna might have employed [her]67-anna afternoon in preparing [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle for [[her]67-anna grandson]1125-her grandson ’s impending announcement ; but a glance at [the elder lady]1279-the elder lady ’s unclouded brow showed that [he]71-darrow must seek elsewhere the clue to [Owen]75-owen ’s taciturnity and [[his]217-the young man step - mother]233-his step - mother ’s concern . Possibly [Anna]67-anna had found reason to change [her]67-anna own attitude in the matter , and had made the change known to [Owen]75-owen . But this , again , was negatived by the fact that , during the afternoon ’s shooting , [young Leath]75-owen had been in a mood of almost extravagant expansiveness , and that , from the moment of [his]217-the young man late return to [the house]581-the house till just before dinner , there had been , to [Darrow]71-darrow ’s certain knowledge , no possibility of a private talk between [himself]217-the young man and [[his]217-the young man step - mother]233-his step - mother . This obscured , if it narrowed , the field of conjecture ; and [Darrow]71-darrow ’s gropings threw [him]71-darrow back on the conclusion that [he]71-darrow was probably reading too much significance into the moods of [a lad [he]71-darrow hardly knew , and who had been described to [him]71-darrow as subject to sudden changes of humour]1283-a lad he hardly knew , and who had been described to him as subject to sudden changes of humour . As to [Anna]67-anna ’s fancied perturbation , it might simply be due to the fact that [she]67-anna had decided to plead [Owen]75-owen ’s cause the next day , and had perhaps already had a glimpse of the difficulties awaiting [her]67-anna . But [Darrow]71-darrow knew that [he]71-darrow was too deep in [his]71-darrow own perplexities to judge the mental state of those about [him]71-darrow . It might be , after all , that the variations [he]71-darrow felt in the currents of communication were caused by [his]71-darrow own inward tremor . Such , at any rate , was the conclusion [he]71-darrow had reached when , shortly after [the two ladies]1284-the two ladies left [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room , [he]71-darrow bade [Owen]75-owen good - night and went up to [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room . Ever since the rapid self - colloquy which had followed on [his]71-darrow first sight of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , [he]71-darrow had known there were other questions to be faced behind the one immediately confronting [him]71-darrow . On the score of that one , at least , [his]71-darrow mind , if not easy , was relieved . [He]71-darrow had done what was possible to reassure [the girl]297-the girl , and [she]297-the girl had apparently recognized the sincerity of [his]71-darrow intention . [He]71-darrow had patched up as decent a conclusion as [he]71-darrow could to an incident that should obviously have had no sequel ; but [he]71-darrow had known all along that with the securing of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s peace of mind only a part of [his]71-darrow obligation was discharged , and that with that part [his]71-darrow remaining duty was in conflict . It had been [his]71-darrow first business to convince [the girl]297-the girl that [their]1289-their secret was safe with [him]71-darrow ; but it was far from easy to square this with the equally urgent obligation of safe - guarding [Anna]67-anna ’s responsibility toward [[her]67-anna child]1290-her child . [Darrow]71-darrow was not much afraid of accidental disclosures . Both [he]71-darrow and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had too much at stake not to be on [their]1289-their guard . The fear that beset [him]71-darrow was of another kind , and had a profounder source . [He]71-darrow wanted to do all [he]71-darrow could for [the girl]297-the girl , but the fact of having had to urge [Anna]67-anna to confide [Effie]74-effie to [her]67-anna was peculiarly repugnant to [him]71-darrow . [His]71-darrow own ideas about [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner were too mixed and indeterminate for [him]71-darrow not to feel the risk of such an experiment ; yet [he]71-darrow found [himself]71-darrow in the intolerable position of appearing to press it on [the woman [he]71-darrow desired above all others]1292-the woman he desired above all others to protect ... Till late in the night [his]71-darrow thoughts revolved in a turmoil of indecision . [His]71-darrow pride was humbled by the discrepancy between what [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had been to [him]71-darrow and what [he]71-darrow had thought of [her]297-the girl . This discrepancy , which at the time had seemed to simplify the incident , now turned out to be its most galling complication . The bare truth , indeed , was that [he]71-darrow had hardly thought of [her]297-the girl at all , either at the time or since , and that [he]71-darrow was ashamed to base [his]71-darrow judgement of [her]297-the girl on [his]71-darrow meagre memory of [their]1293-their adventure . The essential cheapness of the whole affair -- as far as [his]71-darrow share in it was concerned -- came home to [him]71-darrow with humiliating distinctness . [He]71-darrow would have liked to be able to feel that , at the time at least , [he]71-darrow had staked something more on it , and had somehow , in the sequel , had a more palpable loss to show . But the plain fact was that [he]71-darrow had n’t spent a penny on it ; which was no doubt the reason of the prodigious score it had since been rolling up . At any rate , beat about the case as [he]71-darrow would , it was clear that [he]71-darrow owed it to [Anna]67-anna -- and incidentally to [his]71-darrow own peace of mind -- to find some way of securing [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s future without leaving [her]297-the girl installed at [Givre]30-givre when [he]71-darrow and [[his]71-darrow wife]207-his wife should depart for [[their]1293-their new post]1295-their new post . The night brought no aid to the solving of this problem ; but it gave [him]71-darrow , at any rate , the clear conviction that no time was to be lost . [His]71-darrow first step must be to obtain from [Miss Viner]82-miss viner the chance of another and calmer talk ; and [he]71-darrow resolved to seek it at the earliest hour . [He]71-darrow had gathered that [Effie]74-effie ’s lessons were preceded by an early scamper in [the park]765-the park , and conjecturing that [[her]74-effie governess]1163-her governess might be with [her]74-effie [he]71-darrow betook [himself]71-darrow the next morning to [the terrace]2399-the terrace , whence [he]71-darrow wandered on to [the gardens]1299-the gardens and [the walks beyond]1300-the walks beyond . The atmosphere was still and pale . The muffled sunlight gleamed like gold tissue through grey gauze , and [the beech alleys]1301-the beech alleys tapered away to a blue haze blent of sky and forest . It was one of those elusive days when the familiar forms of things seem about to dissolve in a prismatic shimmer . The stillness was presently broken by joyful barks , and [Darrow]71-darrow , tracking the sound , overtook [Effie]74-effie flying down one of [the long alleys at the head of [her]74-effie pack]1302-the long alleys at the head of her pack . Beyond [her]74-effie [he]71-darrow saw [Miss Viner]82-miss viner seated near the stone - rimmed basin beside which [he]71-darrow and [Anna]67-anna had paused on [their]1303-their first walk to [the river]503-the river . [The girl]297-the girl , coming forward at [his]71-darrow approach , returned [his]71-darrow greeting almost gaily . [His]71-darrow first glance showed [him]71-darrow that [she]297-the girl had regained [her]297-the girl composure , and the change in [her]297-the girl appearance gave [him]71-darrow the measure of [her]297-the girl fears . For the first time [he]71-darrow saw in [her]297-the girl again the sidelong grace that had charmed [his]71-darrow eyes in [Paris]10-paris ; but [he]71-darrow saw it now as in a painted picture . “ Shall [we]1307-we sit down a minute ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked , as [Effie]74-effie trotted off . [The girl]297-the girl looked away from [him]71-darrow . “ [I]297-the girl ’m afraid there ’s not much time ; [we]1307-we must be back at lessons at half - past nine . ”[297-the girl] “ But it ’s barely ten minutes past . Let ’s at least walk a little way toward [the river]503-the river . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl glanced down the long walk ahead of [them]1307-we and then back in the direction of [the house]581-the house . “ If [you]71-darrow like , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl said in a low voice , with one of [her]297-the girl quick fluctuations of colour ; but instead of taking the way [he]71-darrow proposed [she]297-the girl turned toward a narrow path which branched off obliquely through the trees . [Darrow]71-darrow was struck , and vaguely troubled , by the change in [her]297-the girl look and tone . There was in [them]1309-them an undefinable appeal , whether for help or forbearance [he]71-darrow could not tell . Then it occurred to [him]71-darrow that there might have been something misleading in [his]71-darrow so pointedly seeking [her]297-the girl , and [he]71-darrow felt a momentary constraint . To ease it [he]71-darrow made an abrupt dash at the truth . “ [I]71-darrow came out to look for [you]297-the girl because [our]1307-we talk of yesterday was so unsatisfactory . [I]71-darrow want to hear more about [you]297-the girl -- about [your]297-the girl plans and prospects . [I]71-darrow ’ve been wondering ever since why [you]297-the girl ’ve so completely given up the theatre . ”[71-darrow] [Her]297-the girl face instantly sharpened to distrust . “ [I]297-the girl had to live , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl said in an off - hand tone . “ [I]297-the girl understand perfectly that [you]71-darrow should like it here -- for a time . ”[297-the girl] [His]71-darrow glance strayed down the gold - roofed windings ahead of [them]1310-them . “ It ’s delightful : [you]297-the girl could n’t be better placed . Only [I]297-the girl wonder a little at [your]297-the girl having so completely given up any idea of a different future . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl waited for a moment before answering : “ [I]297-the girl suppose [I]297-the girl ’m less restless than [I]297-the girl used to be . ”[297-the girl] “ It ’s certainly natural that [you]297-the girl should be less restless here than at [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s ; yet somehow [I]297-the girl do n’t seem to see [you]297-the girl permanently given up to forming [the young]2643-the young . ”[297-the girl] “ What -- exactly -- DO [you]71-darrow seem to see [me]297-the girl permanently given up to ? [You]71-darrow know [you]71-darrow warned [me]297-the girl rather emphatically against [the theatre]237-the theatre . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl threw off the statement without impatience , as though [they]1310-them were discussing together the fate of [a third person in whom both were benevolently interested]1311-a third person in whom both were benevolently interested . [Darrow]71-darrow considered [his]71-darrow reply . “ If [I]297-the girl did , it was because [you]297-the girl so emphatically refused to let [me]297-the girl help [you]297-the girl to a start . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl stopped short and faced [him]71-darrow “ And [you]71-darrow think [I]297-the girl may let [you]71-darrow now ? ”[297-the girl] [Darrow]71-darrow felt the blood in [his]71-darrow cheek . [He]71-darrow could not understand [her]297-the girl attitude -- if indeed [she]297-the girl had consciously taken one , and [her]297-the girl changes of tone did not merely reflect the involuntary alternations of [her]297-the girl mood . It humbled [him]71-darrow to perceive once more how little [he]71-darrow had to guide [him]71-darrow in [his]71-darrow judgment of [her]297-the girl . [He]71-darrow said to [himself]71-darrow : “ If [I]71-darrow ’d ever cared a straw for [her]297-the girl [I]71-darrow should know how to avoid hurting [her]297-the girl now”--and[71-darrow] [his]71-darrow insensibility struck [him]71-darrow as no better than [a vulgar obtuseness]1312-a vulgar obtuseness . But [he]71-darrow had a fixed purpose ahead and could only push on to it . “ [I]71-darrow hope , at any rate , [you]71-darrow ’ll listen to [my]71-darrow reasons . There ’s been time , on both sides , to think them over since---- ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow caught [himself]71-darrow back and hung helpless on the “ since ”[71-darrow] : whatever words [he]71-darrow chose , [he]71-darrow seemed to stumble among reminders of [their]1313-their past . [She]297-the girl walked on beside [him]71-darrow , [her]297-the girl eyes on the ground . “ Then [I]297-the girl ’m to understand -- definitely -- that [you]71-darrow DO renew [your]71-darrow offer ? ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl asked “ With all [my]297-the girl heart ! If [you]71-darrow ’ll only let [me----]2645-me---- ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl raised a hand , as though to check [him]71-darrow . “ It ’s extremely friendly of [you]71-darrow -- [I]297-the girl DO believe [you]71-darrow mean it as [a friend]2413-a friend -- but [I]297-the girl do n’t quite understand why , finding [me]297-the girl , as [you]71-darrow say , so well placed here , [you]71-darrow should show more anxiety about [my]297-the girl future than at a time when [I]297-the girl was actually , and rather desperately , adrift . ”[297-the girl] “ Oh , no , not more ! ”[297-the girl] “ If [you]71-darrow show any at all , it must , at any rate , be for different reasons.--In fact , it can only be , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl went on , with one of [her]297-the girl disconcerting flashes of astuteness , “ for one of two reasons ; either because [you]71-darrow feel [you]71-darrow ought to help [me]297-the girl , or because , for some reason , [you]71-darrow think [you]71-darrow owe it to [Mrs. Leath]75-owen to let [her]75-owen know what [you]71-darrow know of [me]297-the girl . ”[297-the girl] [Darrow]71-darrow stood still in [the path]947-the path . Behind [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow heard [Effie]74-effie ’s call , and at [the child]639-the child ’s voice [he]71-darrow saw [Sophy]81-sophy viner turn [her]81-sophy viner head with the alertness of [one who is obscurely on the watch]1316-one who is obscurely on the watch . The look was so fugitive that [he]71-darrow could not have said wherein it differed from [her]81-sophy viner normal professional air of having [[her]81-sophy viner pupil]1164-her pupil on [her]81-sophy viner mind . [Effie]74-effie sprang past [them]1318-them , and [Darrow]71-darrow took up [the girl]297-the girl ’s challenge . “ What [you]71-darrow suggest about [Mrs. Leath]75-owen is hardly worth answering . As to [my]81-sophy viner reasons for wanting to help [you]71-darrow , a good deal depends on the words one uses to define rather indefinite things . It ’s true enough that [I]81-sophy viner want to help [you]71-darrow ; but the wish is n’t due to ... to any past kindness on [your]71-darrow part , but simply to [my]81-sophy viner own interest in [you]71-darrow . Why not put it that [our]1318-them friendship gives [me]81-sophy viner the right to intervene for what [I]81-sophy viner believe to be [your]71-darrow benefit ? ”[81-sophy viner] [She]81-sophy viner took a few hesitating steps and then paused again . [Darrow]71-darrow noticed that [she]81-sophy viner had grown pale and that there were rings of shade about [her]81-sophy viner eyes . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve known [Mrs. Leath]75-owen a long time ? ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner asked [him]71-darrow suddenly . [He]71-darrow paused with a sense of approaching peril . “ A long time -- yes . ”[71-darrow] “ [She]75-owen told [me]81-sophy viner [you]71-darrow were [friends]2424-friends -- [great friends]2648-great friends ”[81-sophy viner] “ Yes , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow admitted , “ [we]2424-friends ’re [great friends]2648-great friends . ”[71-darrow] “ Then [you]71-darrow might naturally feel [yourself]71-darrow justified in telling [her]75-owen that [you]71-darrow do n’t think [I]71-darrow ’m [the right person]2650-the right person for [Effie]74-effie . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow uttered a sound of protest , but [she]81-sophy viner disregarded it . “ [I]81-sophy viner do n’t say [you]71-darrow ’d LIKE to do it . [You]71-darrow would n’t : [you]71-darrow ’d hate it . And the natural alternative would be to try to persuade [me]81-sophy viner that [I]81-sophy viner ’d be better off somewhere else than here . But supposing that failed , and [you]71-darrow saw [I]81-sophy viner was determined to stay ? THEN [you]71-darrow might think it [your]71-darrow duty to tell [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . ”[81-sophy viner] [She]81-sophy viner laid the case before [him]71-darrow with a cold lucidity . “ [I]81-sophy viner should , in [your]71-darrow place , [I]81-sophy viner believe , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner ended with a little laugh . “ [I]71-darrow should n’t feel justified in telling [her]75-owen , behind [your]71-darrow back , if [I]71-darrow thought [you]71-darrow unsuited for [the place]716-the place ; but [I]71-darrow should certainly feel justified , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow rejoined after a pause , “ in telling [YOU]71-darrow if [I]71-darrow thought [the place]716-the place unsuited to [you]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] “ And that ’s what [you]71-darrow ’re trying to tell [me]1320-she now ? ”[1320-she] “ Yes ; but not for the reasons [you]71-darrow imagine . ”[71-darrow] “ What , then , are [your]71-darrow reasons , if [you]71-darrow please ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]1320-she ’ve already implied [them]2653-them in advising [you]71-darrow not to give up all idea of [the theatre]237-the theatre . [You]71-darrow ’re too various , too gifted , too personal , to tie [yourself]71-darrow down , at [your]71-darrow age , to the dismal drudgery of teaching . ”[1320-she] “ And is THAT what [you]71-darrow ’ve told [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ? ”[1320-she] [She]1320-she rushed the question out at [him]71-darrow as if [she]1320-she expected to trip [him]71-darrow up over it . [He]71-darrow was moved by the simplicity of the stratagem . “ [I]71-darrow ’ve told [her]75-owen exactly nothing , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow replied . “ And what -- exactly -- do [you]71-darrow mean by ‘ nothing ’ ? [You]71-darrow and [she]75-owen were talking about [me]71-darrow when [I]71-darrow came into [[her]75-owen sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room yesterday . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow felt [his]71-darrow blood rise at the thrust . “ [I]71-darrow ’ve told [her]75-owen , simply , that [I]71-darrow ’d seen [you]71-darrow once or twice at [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s . ”[71-darrow] “ And not that [you]71-darrow ’ve ever seen [me]71-darrow since ? ”[71-darrow] “ And not that [I]71-darrow ’ve ever seen [you]71-darrow since ... ”[71-darrow] “ And [she]75-owen believes [you]71-darrow -- [she]75-owen completely believes [you]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow uttered a protesting exclamation , and [his]71-darrow flush reflected itself in [the girl]297-the girl ’s cheek . “ Oh , [I]71-darrow beg [your]71-darrow pardon ! [I]71-darrow did n’t mean to ask [you]71-darrow that . ”[71-darrow] [She]297-the girl halted , and again cast a rapid glance behind and ahead of [her]297-the girl . Then [she]297-the girl held out [her]297-the girl hand . “ Well , then , thank [you]71-darrow -- and let [me]297-the girl relieve [your]71-darrow fears . [I]297-the girl sha’n’t be [[Effie]74-effie ’s governess]2656-effie ’s governess much longer . ”[297-the girl] At the announcement , [Darrow]71-darrow tried to merge [his]71-darrow look of relief into the expression of friendly interest with which [he]71-darrow grasped [her]297-the girl hand . “ [You]297-the girl really do agree with [me]297-the girl , then ? And [you]297-the girl ’ll give [me]297-the girl a chance to talk things over with [you]297-the girl ? ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl shook [her]297-the girl head with a faint smile . “ [I]297-the girl ’m not thinking of the stage . [I]297-the girl ’ve had another offer : that ’s all . ”[297-the girl] The relief was hardly less great . After all , [his]71-darrow personal responsibility ceased with [her]297-the girl departure from [Givre]30-givre . “ [You]297-the girl ’ll tell [me]297-the girl about that , then -- won’t [you]297-the girl ? ”[297-the girl] [Her]297-the girl smile flickered up . “ Oh , [you]297-the girl ’ll hear about it soon ... [I]297-the girl must catch [Effie]74-effie now and drag [her]74-effie back to the blackboard . ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl walked on for a few yards , and then paused again and confronted [him]71-darrow . “ [I]297-the girl ’ve been odious to [you]71-darrow -- and not quite honest , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl broke out suddenly . “ Not quite honest ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow repeated , caught in a fresh wave of wonder . “ [I]71-darrow mean , in seeming not to trust [you]297-the girl .
