It ’s come over [me]71-darrow again as [we]1322-them talked that , at heart , [I]71-darrow ’ve always KNOWN [I]71-darrow could ... ”[71-darrow] [Her]297-the girl colour rose in a bright wave , and [her]297-the girl eyes clung to [his]71-darrow for a swift instant of reminder and appeal . For the same space of time the past surged up in [him]71-darrow confusedly ; then a veil dropped between [them]1322-them . “ Here ’s [Effie]74-effie now ! ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl exclaimed . [He]71-darrow turned and saw [the little girl]858-the little girl trotting back to [them]1322-them , [her]858-the little girl hand in [Owen Leath]75-owen ’s . Even through the stir of [his]71-darrow subsiding excitement [Darrow]71-darrow was at once aware of the change effected by [the young man]217-the young man ’s approach . For a moment Sophy [Viner]81-sophy viner ’s cheeks burned redder ; then they faded to the paleness of white petals . [She]297-the girl lost , however , nothing of the bright bravery which it was [her]297-the girl way to turn on the unexpected . Perhaps [no one less familiar with [her]297-the girl face than [Darrow]71-darrow]1325-no one less familiar with her face than darrow would have discerned the tension of the smile [she]81-sophy viner transferred from [himself]71-darrow to [Owen Leath]75-owen , or have remarked that [her]297-the girl eyes had hardened from misty grey to a shining darkness . But [[her]297-the girl observer]1326-her observer was less struck by this than by the corresponding change in [Owen Leath]75-owen . The latter , when [he]71-darrow came in sight , had been laughing and talking unconcernedly with [Effie]74-effie ; but as [his]71-darrow eye fell on [Miss Viner]82-miss viner [his]71-darrow expression altered as suddenly as [hers]82-miss viner . The change , for [Darrow]71-darrow , was less definable ; but , perhaps for that reason , it struck [him]71-darrow as more sharply significant . Only -- just what did it signify ? [Owen]75-owen , like [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , had the kind of face which seems less the stage on which emotions move than the very stuff [they]1327-they work in . In moments of excitement [his]71-darrow odd irregular features seemed to grow fluid , to unmake and remake themselves like the shadows of clouds on [a stream]1328-a stream . [Darrow]71-darrow , through the rapid flight of the shadows , could not seize on any specific indication of feeling : [he]71-darrow merely perceived that [the young man]217-the young man was unaccountably surprised at finding [him]71-darrow with [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , and that the extent of [his]71-darrow surprise might cover all manner of implications . [Darrow]71-darrow ’s first idea was that [Owen]75-owen , if [he]71-darrow suspected that the conversation was not the result of an accidental encounter , might wonder at [[his]71-darrow step - mother ’s suitor being engaged , at such an hour , in private talk with [[her]82-miss viner little girl ’s governess]1331-her little girl ’s governess]1330-his step - mother ’s suitor being engaged , at such an hour , in private talk with her little girl ’s governess . The thought was so disturbing that , as [the three]1138-the three turned back to [the house]581-the house , [he]71-darrow was on the point of saying to [Owen]75-owen : “ [I]71-darrow came out to look for [[your]75-owen mother]2436-your mother . ”[71-darrow] But , in the contingency [he]71-darrow feared , even so simple a phrase might seem like an awkward attempt at explanation ; and [he]71-darrow walked on in silence at [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s side . Presently [he]71-darrow was struck by the fact that [Owen Leath]75-owen and [the girl]297-the girl were silent also ; and this gave a new turn to [his]71-darrow thoughts . Silence may be as variously shaded as speech ; and that which enfolded [Darrow]71-darrow and [[his]71-darrow two companions]1335-his two companions seemed to [his]71-darrow watchful perceptions to be quivering with cross - threads of communication . At first [he]71-darrow was aware only of those that centred in [his]71-darrow own troubled consciousness ; then it occurred to [him]71-darrow that an equal activity of intercourse was going on outside of it . Something was in fact passing mutely and rapidly between [young Leath]75-owen and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ; but what it was , and whither it tended , [Darrow]71-darrow , when [they]1336-they reached [the house]581-the house , was but just beginning to divine ... XVIII [Anna Leath]97-anna , from [the terrace]2399-the terrace , watched the return of [the little group]1162-the little group . [She]97-anna looked down on [them]1336-they , as [they]1336-they advanced across [the garden]222-the garden , from the serene height of [her]97-anna unassailable happiness . There [they]1336-they were , coming toward [her]97-anna in the mild morning light , [[her]97-anna child]1290-her child , [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son , [[her]97-anna promised husband]1343-her promised husband : [the three beings who filled [her]97-anna life]1344-the three beings who filled her life . [She]97-anna smiled a little at the happy picture [they]1336-they presented , [Effie]74-effie ’s gambols encircling it in a moving frame within which [the two men]1345-the two men came slowly forward in the silence of friendly understanding . It seemed part of the deep intimacy of the scene that [they]1345-the two men should not be talking to [each other]177-each other , and it did not till afterward strike [her]97-anna as odd that neither of [them]1345-the two men apparently felt it necessary to address a word to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [Anna]97-anna [herself]97-anna , at the moment , was floating in the mid - current of felicity , on a tide so bright and buoyant that [she]97-anna seemed to be one with its warm waves . The first rush of bliss had stunned and dazzled [her]97-anna ; but now that , each morning , [she]97-anna woke to the calm certainty of its recurrence , [she]97-anna was growing used to the sense of security it gave . “ [I]97-anna feel as if [I]97-anna could trust [my]97-anna happiness to carry [me]97-anna ; as if it had grown out of [me]97-anna like wings . ”[97-anna] So [she]97-anna phrased it to [Darrow]71-darrow , as , later in the morning , [they]1345-the two men paced [the garden - paths]1347-the garden - paths together . [His]71-darrow answering look gave [her]97-anna the same assurance of safety . The evening before [he]71-darrow had seemed preoccupied , and the shadow of [his]71-darrow mood had faintly encroached on the great golden orb of [their]1345-the two men blessedness ; but now it was uneclipsed again , and hung above [them]1345-the two men high and bright as the sun at noon . Upstairs in [[her]97-anna sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room , that afternoon , [she]97-anna was thinking of these things . The morning mists had turned to rain , compelling the postponement of an excursion in which [the whole party]1349-the whole party were to have joined . [Effie]74-effie , with [[her]74-effie governess]1163-her governess , had been despatched in the motor to do some shopping at [Francheuil]42-francheuil ; and [Anna]97-anna had promised [Darrow]71-darrow to join [him]71-darrow , later in the afternoon , for a quick walk in the rain . [He]71-darrow had gone to [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room after luncheon to get some belated letters off [his]71-darrow conscience ; and when [he]71-darrow had left [her]97-anna [she]97-anna had continued to sit in the same place , [her]97-anna hands crossed on [her]97-anna knees , [her]97-anna head slightly bent , in an attitude of brooding retrospection . As [she]97-anna looked back at [her]97-anna past life , it seemed to [her]97-anna to have consisted of one ceaseless effort to pack into each hour enough to fill out its slack folds ; but now each moment was like a [miser]1352-miser ’s bag stretched to bursting with pure gold . [She]97-anna was roused by the sound of [Owen]75-owen ’s step in [the gallery outside [[her]97-anna room]602-her room]1353-the gallery outside her room . [It]1355-it paused at [her]97-anna door and in answer to [his]71-darrow knock [she]97-anna called out “ Come in ! ”[97-anna] As the door closed behind [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna was struck by [his]71-darrow look of pale excitement , and an impulse of compunction made [her]97-anna say : “ [You]71-darrow ’ve come to ask [me]97-anna why [I]97-anna have n’t spoken to [[your]71-darrow grandmother]2466-your grandmother ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow sent about [him]71-darrow a glance vaguely reminding [her]97-anna of the strange look with which [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had swept [the room]663-the room the night before ; then [his]71-darrow brilliant eyes came back to [her]97-anna . “ [I]71-darrow ’ve spoken to [her]2466-your grandmother [myself]71-darrow , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said . [Anna]97-anna started up , incredulous . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve spoken to [her]2466-your grandmother ? When ? ”[97-anna] “ Just now . [I]97-anna left [her]2466-your grandmother to come [here]2403-here . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna ’s first feeling was one of annoyance . There was really something comically incongruous in this boyish surrender to impulse on the part of [a young man so eager to assume the responsibilities of life]1357-a young man so eager to assume the responsibilities of life . [She]97-anna looked at [him]71-darrow with a faintly veiled amusement . “ [You]71-darrow asked [me]97-anna to help [you]71-darrow and [I]97-anna promised [you]71-darrow [I]97-anna would . It was hardly worth while to work out such an elaborate plan of action if [you]71-darrow intended to take the matter out of [my]97-anna hands without telling [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , do n’t take that tone with [me]71-darrow ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow broke out , almost angrily . “ That tone ? What tone ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna stared at [his]71-darrow quivering face . “ [I]97-anna might , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna pursued , still half - laughing , “ more properly make that request of [YOU]71-darrow ! ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen reddened and [his]71-darrow vehemence suddenly subsided . “ [I]97-anna meant that [I]97-anna HAD to speak -- that ’s all . [You]71-darrow do n’t give [me]97-anna a chance to explain ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna looked at [him]71-darrow gently , wondering a little at [her]97-anna own impatience . “ [Owen]75-owen ! Do n’t [I]97-anna always want to give [you]71-darrow every chance ? It ’s because [I]97-anna DO that [I]97-anna wanted to talk to [[your]71-darrow grandmother]2466-your grandmother first -- that [I]97-anna was waiting and watching for the right moment ... ”[97-anna] “ The right moment ? So was [I.]97-anna That ’s why [I]71-darrow ’ve spoken . ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow voice rose again and took the sharp edge it had in moments of high pressure . [[His]71-darrow step - mother]233-his step - mother turned away and seated [herself]233-his step - mother in [her]233-his step - mother sofa - corner . “ Oh , [[my]233-his step - mother dear]2464-my dear , it ’s not a privilege to quarrel over ! [You]71-darrow ’ve taken a load off [my]233-his step - mother shoulders . Sit down and tell [me]233-his step - mother all about it . ”[233-his step - mother] [He]71-darrow stood before [her]233-his step - mother , irresolute . “ [I]71-darrow ca n’t sit down , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said . “ Walk about , then . Only tell [me]71-darrow : [I]71-darrow ’m impatient . ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow immediate response was to throw [himself]71-darrow into the armchair at [her]233-his step - mother side , where [he]71-darrow lounged for a moment without speaking , [his]71-darrow legs stretched out , [his]71-darrow arms locked behind [his]71-darrow thrown - back head . [Anna]97-anna , [her]97-anna eyes on [his]71-darrow face , waited quietly for [him]71-darrow to speak . “ Well -- of course it was just what [one]2308-one expected . ”[97-anna] “ [She]233-his step - mother takes it so badly , [you]71-darrow mean ? ”[97-anna] “ All the heavy batteries were brought up : [[my]97-anna father]2467-my father , [Givre]30-givre , [Monsieur de Chantelle]116-monsieur de chantelle , the throne and the altar . Even [[my]97-anna poor mother]2442-my poor mother was dragged out of oblivion and armed with imaginary protests . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna sighed out [her]97-anna sympathy . “ Well -- [you]71-darrow were prepared for all that ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna thought [I]97-anna was , till [I]97-anna began to hear [her]233-his step - mother say it . Then it sounded so incredibly silly that [I]97-anna told [her]233-his step - mother so . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , [Owen]75-owen -- [Owen]75-owen ! ”[97-anna] “ Yes : [I]97-anna know . [I]97-anna was [a fool]2665-a fool ; but [I]97-anna could n’t help it . ”[97-anna] “ And [you]71-darrow ’ve mortally offended [her]233-his step - mother , [I]97-anna suppose ? That ’s exactly what [I]97-anna wanted to prevent . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna laid a hand on [his]1359-i shoulder . “ [[You]1359-i tiresome boy]2666-you tiresome boy , not to wait and let [me]97-anna speak for [you]1359-i ! ”[97-anna] [He]1359-i moved slightly away , so that [her]97-anna hand slipped from its place . “ [You]97-anna do n’t understand , ”[1359-i] [he]1359-i said , frowning . “ [I]1359-i do n’t see how [I]1359-i can , till [you]97-anna explain . If [you]97-anna thought the time had come to tell [[your]97-anna grandmother]2466-your grandmother , why not have asked [me]1359-i to do it ? [I]1359-i had [my]1359-i reasons for waiting ; but if [you]97-anna ’d told [me]1359-i to speak [I]1359-i should have done so , naturally . ”[1359-i] [He]1359-i evaded [her]97-anna appeal by a sudden turn . “ What WERE [your]97-anna reasons for waiting ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna did not immediately answer . [[Her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son ’s eyes were on [her]97-anna face , and under [his]1359-i gaze [she]97-anna felt a faint disquietude . “ [I]1359-i was feeling [my]1359-i way ... [I]1359-i wanted to be absolutely sure ... ”[1359-i] “ Absolutely sure of what ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna delayed again for a just perceptible instant . “ Why , simply of [OUR]2668-our side of the case . ”[97-anna] “ But [you]97-anna told [me]1359-i [you]97-anna were , the other day , when [we]2668-our talked it over before [they]2669-they came back from [Ouchy]38-ouchy . ”[1359-i] “ Oh , [[my]1359-i dear]2464-my dear -- if [you]97-anna think that , in such a complicated matter , every day , every hour , does n’t more or less modify [one]2308-one ’s surest sureness ! ”[1359-i] “ That ’s just what [I]97-anna ’m driving at . [I]97-anna want to know what has modified [yours]97-anna . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna made a slight gesture of impatience . “ What does it matter , now the thing ’s done ? [I]97-anna do n’t know that [I]97-anna could give any clear reason ... ”[97-anna] [He]1361-his got to [his]1361-his feet and stood looking down on [her]97-anna with a tormented brow . “ But it ’s absolutely necessary that [you]97-anna should . ”[1361-his] At [his]1361-his tone [her]97-anna impatience flared up . “ It ’s not necessary that [I]97-anna should give [you]1361-his any explanation whatever , since [you]1361-his ’ve taken the matter out of [my]97-anna hands . All [I]97-anna can say is that [I]97-anna was trying to help [you]1361-his : that no other thought ever entered [my]97-anna mind . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna paused a moment and then added : “ If [you]1361-his doubted it , [you]1361-his were right to do what [you]1361-his ’ve done . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , [I]1361-his never doubted [YOU]97-anna ! ”[1361-his] [he]1361-his retorted , with a fugitive stress on the pronoun . [His]1361-his face had cleared to its old look of trust . “ Do n’t be offended if [I]1361-his ’ve seemed to , ”[1361-his] [he]1361-his went on . “ [I]1361-his ca n’t quite explain [myself]1361-his , either ... it ’s all a kind of tangle , is n’t it ? That ’s why [I]1361-his thought [I]1361-his ’d better speak at once ; or rather why [I]1361-his did n’t think at all , but just suddenly blurted the thing out---- ”[1361-his] [Anna]97-anna gave [him]1361-his back [his]1361-his look of conciliation . “ Well , the how and why do n’t much matter now . The point is how to deal with [[your]1361-his grandmother]2466-your grandmother . [You]1361-his ’ve not told [me]97-anna what [she]2466-your grandmother means to do . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , [she]2466-your grandmother means to send for [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide . ”[97-anna] The name drew a faint note of mirth from [him]1361-his and relaxed both [their]1362-their faces to a smile . “ Perhaps , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna added , “ it ’s really the best thing for [us]1362-their all . ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen shrugged [his]1361-his shoulders . “ It ’s too preposterous and humiliating . Dragging [that woman]2673-that woman into [our]1362-their secrets---- ! ”[1361-his] “ This could hardly be a secret much longer . ”[1361-his] [He]1361-his had moved to the hearth , where [he]1361-his stood pushing about the small ornaments on the mantel - shelf ; but at [her]97-anna answer [he]1361-his turned back to [her]97-anna . “ [You]97-anna have n’t , of course , spoken of it to [any one]2525-any one ? ”[1361-his] “ No ; but [I]97-anna intend to now . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna paused for [his]1361-his reply , and as it did not come [she]97-anna continued : “ If [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide ’s to be told there ’s no possible reason why [I]97-anna should n’t tell [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen abruptly set down the little statuette between [his]1361-his fingers . “ None whatever : [I]97-anna want [every one]2344-every one to know . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna smiled a little at [his]1361-his over - emphasis , and was about to meet it with a word of banter when [he]1361-his continued , facing [her]97-anna : “ [You]97-anna have n’t , as yet , said a word to [him]1361-his ? ”[1361-his] “ [I]1361-his ’ve told [him]1361-his nothing , except what the discussion of [our]2676-our own plans -- [his]1361-his and [mine]1361-his -- obliged [me]1361-his to : that [you]97-anna were thinking of marrying , and that [I]1361-his was n’t willing to leave [France]4-france till [I]1361-his ’d done what [I]1361-his could to see [you]97-anna through . ”[1361-his] At [her]97-anna first words the colour had rushed to [his]1361-his forehead ; but as [she]97-anna continued [she]97-anna saw [his]1361-his face compose itself and [his]1361-his blood subside . “ [You]97-anna ’re a brick , [[my]1361-his dear]2464-my dear ! ”[1361-his] [he]1361-his exclaimed . “ [You]97-anna had [my]1361-his word , [you]97-anna know . ”[1361-his] “ Yes ; yes -- [I]1361-his know . ”[1361-his] [His]1361-his face had clouded again . “ And that ’s all -- positively all -- [you’ve]97-anna ever said to [him]1361-his ? ”[1361-his] “ Positively all . But why do [you]97-anna ask ? ”[1361-his] [He]1361-his had a moment ’s embarrassed hesitation . “ It was understood , was n’t it , that [[my]1361-his grandmother]2474-my grandmother was to be the first to know ? ”[1361-his] “ Well -- and so [she]2474-my grandmother has been , has n’t [she]2474-my grandmother , since [you]97-anna ’ve told [her]2474-my grandmother ? ”[1361-his] [He]1361-his turned back to [his]1361-his restless shifting of the knick - knacks . “ And [you]97-anna ’re sure that nothing [you]97-anna ’ve said to [Darrow]71-darrow could possibly have given [him]71-darrow a hint---- ? ”[1361-his] “ Nothing [I]1361-his ’ve said to [him]71-darrow -- certainly . ”[1361-his] [He]1361-his swung about on [her]1363-her . “ Why do [you]97-anna put it in that way ? ”[1361-his] “ In what way ? ”[1361-his] “ Why -- as if [you]97-anna thought [some one else]603-some one else might have spoken ... ”[1361-his] “ [Some one else]603-some one else ? Who else ? ”[1363-her] [She]1363-her rose to [her]1363-her feet . “ What on earth , [[my]1363-her dear boy]2681-my dear boy , can [you]1361-his be driving at ? ”[1363-her] “ [I]1361-his ’m trying to find out whether [you]1361-his think [he]71-darrow knows anything definite . ”[1361-his] “ Why should [I]1361-his think so ? Do [YOU]1361-his ? ”[1361-his] “ [I]1363-her do n’t know . [I]1363-her want to find out . ”[1363-her] [She]1363-her laughed at [his]1361-his obstinate insistence . “ To test [my]1363-her veracity , [I]1363-her suppose ? ”[1363-her] At the sound of a step in [the gallery]1364-the gallery [she]1363-her added : “ Here [he]71-darrow is -- [you]1361-his can ask [him]71-darrow [yourself]1361-his . ”[1363-her] [She]1363-her met [Darrow]71-darrow ’s knock with an invitation to enter , and [he]1361-his came into [the room]663-the room and paused between [herself]1363-her and [Owen]75-owen . [She]1363-her was struck , as [he]1361-his stood there , by the contrast between [his]1361-his happy careless good - looks and [[her]1363-her step - son]719-her step - son ’s frowning agitation . [Darrow]71-darrow met [her]1363-her eyes with a smile . “ Am [I]71-darrow too soon ? Or is [our]1367-the two walk given up ? ”[71-darrow] “ No ; [I]1363-her was just going to get ready . ”[1363-her] [She]1363-her continued to linger between [the two]1367-the two , looking slowly from one to the other . “ But there ’s something [we]1367-the two want to tell [you]71-darrow first : [Owen]75-owen is engaged to [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . ”[1363-her] The sense of an indefinable interrogation in [Owen]75-owen ’s mind made [her]1363-her , as [she]1363-her spoke , fix [her]1363-her eyes steadily on [Darrow]71-darrow . [He]1361-his had paused just opposite the window , so that , even in the rainy afternoon light , [his]1361-his face was clearly open to [her]1363-her scrutiny . For a second , immense surprise was alone visible on it : so visible that [she]1363-her half turned to [[her]1363-her step - son]719-her step - son , with a faint smile for [his]1361-his refuted suspicions . Why , [she]1363-her wondered , should [Owen]75-owen have thought that [Darrow]71-darrow had already guessed [his]1361-his secret , and what , after all , could be so disturbing to [him]1361-his in this not improbable contingency ? At any rate , [his]1361-his doubt must have been dispelled : there was nothing feigned about [Darrow]71-darrow ’s astonishment . When [her]1363-her eyes turned back to [him]1361-his [he]1361-his was already crossing to [Owen]75-owen with outstretched hand , and [she]1363-her had , through an unaccountable faint flutter of misgiving , a mere confused sense of [their]1369-their exchanging the customary phrases . [Her]1363-her next perception was of [Owen]75-owen ’s tranquillized look , and of [his]1361-his smiling return of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s congratulatory grasp . [She]1363-her had the eerie feeling of having been overswept by a shadow which there had been no cloud to cast ... A moment later [Owen]75-owen had left [the room]663-the room and [she]1363-her and [Darrow]71-darrow were alone . [He]1361-his had turned away to the window and stood staring out into the down - pour . “ [You]1361-his ’re surprised at [Owen]75-owen ’s news ? ”[1363-her] [she]1363-her asked . “ Yes : [I]1361-his am surprised , ”[1361-his] [he]1361-his answered . “ [You]1361-his had n’t thought of its being [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[1361-his] “ Why should [I]1361-his have thought of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[1361-his] “ [You]1363-her see now why [I]1361-his wanted so much to find out what [you]1363-her knew about [her]82-miss viner . ”[1361-his] [He]1361-his made no comment , and [she]1363-her pursued : “ Now that [you]1361-his DO know it ’s [she]82-miss viner , if there ’s anything---- ”[1363-her] [He]1361-his moved back into [the room]663-the room and went up to [her]1363-her . [His]1361-his face was serious , with a slight shade of annoyance . “ What on earth should there be ? As [I]1361-his told [you]1363-her , [I]1361-his ’ve never in [my]1361-his life heard [any one]2525-any one say two words about [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . ”[1361-his] [Anna]97-anna made no answer and [they]1372-they continued to face [each other]177-each other without moving . For the moment [she]1363-her had ceased to think about [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner and [Owen]75-owen : the only thought in [her]1363-her mind was that [Darrow]71-darrow was alone with [her]1363-her , close to [her]1363-her , and that , for the first time , [their]1372-they hands and lips had not met . [He]71-darrow glanced back doubtfully at the window . “ It ’s pouring . Perhaps [you]1363-her ’d rather not go out ? ”[71-darrow] [She]1363-her hesitated , as if waiting for [him]71-darrow to urge [her]1363-her . “ [I]1363-her suppose [I]1363-her ’d better not . [I]1363-her ought to go at once to [[my]1363-her mother - in - law]2623-my mother - in - law -- [Owen]75-owen ’s just been telling [her]2623-my mother - in - law , ”[1363-her] [she]1363-her said . “ Ah . ”[1363-her] [Darrow]71-darrow hazarded a smile . “ That accounts for [my]71-darrow having , on [my]71-darrow way up , heard [some one]476-some one telephoning for [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ! ”[71-darrow] At the allusion [they]1372-they laughed together , vaguely , and [Anna]97-anna moved toward the door . [He]71-darrow held it open for [her]1363-her and followed [her]1363-her out . [XIX]139-xix [He]71-darrow left [her]1363-her at the door of [[Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s sitting - room]1374-madame de chantelle ’s sitting - room , and plunged out alone into the rain . The wind flung about the stripped tree - tops of [the avenue]1076-the avenue and dashed the stinging streams into [his]71-darrow face . [He]71-darrow walked to the gate and then turned into [the high - road]1376-the high - road and strode along in the open , buffeted by slanting gusts . [The evenly ridged fields]1377-the evenly ridged fields were a blurred waste of mud , and the russet coverts which [he]71-darrow and [Owen]75-owen had shot through the day before shivered desolately against a driving sky . [Darrow]71-darrow walked on and on , indifferent to the direction [he]71-darrow was taking . [His]71-darrow thoughts were tossing like the tree - tops . [Anna]97-anna ’s announcement had not come to [him]71-darrow as a complete surprise : that morning , as [he]71-darrow strolled back to [the house]581-the house with [Owen Leath]75-owen and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , [he]71-darrow had had a momentary intuition of the truth . But it had been no more than an intuition , the merest faint cloud - puff of surmise ; and now it was an attested fact , darkening over the whole sky . In respect of [his]71-darrow own attitude , [he]71-darrow saw at once that the discovery made no appreciable change . If [he]71-darrow had been bound to silence before , [he]71-darrow was no less bound to it now ; the only difference lay in the fact that what [he]71-darrow had just learned had rendered [his]71-darrow bondage more intolerable . Hitherto [he]71-darrow had felt for [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s defenseless state a sympathy profoundly tinged with compunction . But now [he]71-darrow was half - conscious of an obscure indignation against [her]81-sophy viner . Superior as [he]71-darrow had fancied [himself]71-darrow to ready - made judgments , [he]71-darrow was aware of cherishing the common doubt as to the disinterestedness of [the woman who tries to rise above [her]81-sophy viner past]1379-the woman who tries to rise above her past . No wonder [she]81-sophy viner had been sick with fear on meeting [him]71-darrow ! It was in [his]71-darrow power to do [her]81-sophy viner more harm than [he]71-darrow had dreamed ... Assuredly [he]71-darrow did not want to harm [her]81-sophy viner ; but [he]71-darrow did desperately want to prevent [her]81-sophy viner marrying [Owen Leath]75-owen . [He]71-darrow tried to get away from the feeling , to isolate and exteriorize it sufficiently to see what motives it was made of ; but it remained a mere blind motion of [his]71-darrow blood , the instinctive recoil from the thing that no amount of arguing can make “ straight . ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow tramp , prolonged as it was , carried [him]71-darrow no nearer to enlightenment ; and after trudging through [two or three sallow mud - stained villages]1380-two or three sallow mud - stained villages [he]71-darrow turned about and wearily made [his]71-darrow way back to [Givre]30-givre . As [he]71-darrow walked up [the black avenue]1381-the black avenue , making for the lights that twinkled through [its]1381-the black avenue pitching branches , [he]71-darrow had a sudden realisation of [his]71-darrow utter helplessness . [He]71-darrow might think and combine as [he]71-darrow would ; but there was nothing , absolutely nothing , that [he]71-darrow could do ... [He]71-darrow dropped [his]71-darrow wet coat in [the vestibule]1382-the vestibule and began to mount the stairs to [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room . But on [the landing]1384-the landing [he]71-darrow was overtaken by [a sober - faced maid who , in tones discreetly lowered]1385-a sober - faced maid who , in tones discreetly lowered , begged [him]71-darrow to be so kind as to step , for a moment , into [[the Marquise]1386-the marquise ’s sitting - room]1387-the marquise ’s sitting - room . Somewhat disconcerted by the summons , [he]71-darrow followed [its bearer]1388-its bearer to the door at which , a couple of hours earlier , [he]71-darrow had taken leave of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . [It]1389-it opened to admit [him]71-darrow to [a large lamp - lit room which [he]71-darrow immediately perceived to be empty]1390-a large lamp - lit room which he immediately perceived to be empty ; and the fact gave [him]71-darrow time to note , even through [his]71-darrow disturbance of mind , the interesting degree to which [[Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s apartment]1391-madame de chantelle ’s apartment “ dated ”[111-madame de chantelle] and completed [her]111-madame de chantelle . [Its]1391-madame de chantelle ’s apartment looped and corded curtains , [its]1391-madame de chantelle ’s apartment purple satin upholstery , the Sevres jardinieres , the rosewood fire - screen , the little velvet tables edged with lace and crowded with silver knick - knacks and simpering miniatures , reconstituted an almost perfect setting for the blonde beauty of the ’ sixties . [Darrow]71-darrow wondered that [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath ’s filial respect should have prevailed over [his]71-darrow aesthetic scruples to the extent of permitting such an anachronism among the eighteenth century graces of [Givre]30-givre ; but a moment ’s reflection made it clear that , to [[its]1391-madame de chantelle ’s apartment late owner]1392-its late owner , the attitude would have seemed exactly in the traditions of [the place]716-the place . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s emergence from [an inner room]1394-an inner room snatched [Darrow]71-darrow from these irrelevant musings . [She]111-madame de chantelle was already beaded and bugled for the evening , and , save for a slight pinkness of the eye - lids , [her]111-madame de chantelle elaborate appearance revealed no mark of agitation ; but [Darrow]71-darrow noticed that , in recognition of the solemnity of the occasion , [she]111-madame de chantelle pinched a lace handkerchief between [her]111-madame de chantelle thumb and forefinger . [She]111-madame de chantelle plunged at once into the centre of the difficulty , appealing to [him]71-darrow , in the name of all [the Everards]130-everards , to descend there with [her]111-madame de chantelle to the rescue of [[her]111-madame de chantelle darling]1395-her darling . [She]111-madame de chantelle was n’t , [she]111-madame de chantelle was sure , addressing [herself]111-madame de chantelle in vain to [one whose person , whose “ tone , ”[111-madame de chantelle] whose traditions so brilliantly declared [his]71-darrow indebtedness to the principles [she]111-madame de chantelle besought [him]71-darrow to defend]1396-one whose person , whose “ tone , ” whose traditions so brilliantly declared his indebtedness to the principles she besought him to defend . [Her]111-madame de chantelle own reception of [Darrow]71-darrow , the confidence [she]111-madame de chantelle had at once accorded [him]71-darrow , must have shown [him]71-darrow that [she]111-madame de chantelle had instinctively felt [their]1397-their unanimity of sentiment on these fundamental questions . [She]111-madame de chantelle had in fact recognized in [him]71-darrow [the one person whom , without pain to [her]111-madame de chantelle maternal piety , [she]111-madame de chantelle could welcome as [[her]111-madame de chantelle son ’s successor]1399-her son ’s successor]1398-the one person whom , without pain to her maternal piety , she could welcome as her son ’s successor ; and it was almost as to [[Owen]75-owen ’s father]1400-owen ’s father that [she]111-madame de chantelle now appealed to [Darrow]71-darrow to aid in rescuing [the wretched boy]1401-the wretched boy . “ Do n’t think , please , that [I]111-madame de chantelle ’m casting the least reflection on [Anna]97-anna , or showing any want of sympathy for [her]97-anna , when [I]111-madame de chantelle say that [I]111-madame de chantelle consider [her]97-anna partly responsible for what ’s happened . [Anna]97-anna is ‘ modern’--I believe that ’s what it ’s called when [you]2685-you read unsettling books and admire hideous pictures . Indeed , ”[111-madame de chantelle] [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle continued , leaning confidentially forward , “ [I]111-madame de chantelle [myself]111-madame de chantelle have always more or less lived in that atmosphere : [[my]111-madame de chantelle son]2560-my son , [you]2685-you know , was very revolutionary . Only [he]2560-my son did n’t , of course , apply [his]2560-my son ideas : they were purely intellectual . That ’s what [dear Anna]97-anna has always failed to understand . And [I]111-madame de chantelle ’m afraid [she]97-anna ’s created the same kind of confusion in [Owen]75-owen ’s mind -- led [him]2560-my son to mix up things [you]2685-you read about with things [you]2685-you do ... [You]2685-you know , of course , that [she]97-anna sides with [him]2560-my son in this wretched business ? ”[111-madame de chantelle] Developing at length upon this theme , [she]111-madame de chantelle finally narrowed down to the point of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s intervention . “ [[My]111-madame de chantelle grandson]2687-my grandson , [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow , calls [me]111-madame de chantelle illogical and uncharitable because [my]111-madame de chantelle feelings toward [Miss Viner]82-miss viner have changed since [I]111-madame de chantelle ’ve heard this news . Well ! [You]2685-you ’ve known [her]97-anna , it appears , for some years : [Anna]97-anna tells [me]111-madame de chantelle [you]2685-you used to see [her]97-anna when [she]97-anna was [a companion]2688-a companion , or [secretary]2689-secretary or something , to a dreadfully vulgar [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett . And [I]111-madame de chantelle ask [you]2685-you as [a friend]2413-a friend , [I]111-madame de chantelle ask [you]2685-you as [one of [US]2692-us]2691-one of us , to tell [me]111-madame de chantelle if [you]2685-you think [a girl who has had to knock about [the world]206-the world in that kind of position , and at the orders of [all kinds of people]2695-all kinds of people , is fitted to be [[Owen]75-owen ’s wife]2696-owen ’s wife]2693-a girl who has had to knock about the world in that kind of position , and at the orders of all kinds of people , is fitted to be owen ’s wife . [I]111-madame de chantelle ’m not implying anything against [her]97-anna ! [I]111-madame de chantelle LIKED [the girl]297-the girl , [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow ... But what ’s that got to do with it ? [I]111-madame de chantelle do n’t want [her]97-anna to marry [[my]111-madame de chantelle grandson]2687-my grandson . If [I]111-madame de chantelle ’d been looking for [a wife for [Owen]75-owen]2699-a wife for owen , [I]111-madame de chantelle should n’t have applied to [the Farlows]94-the farlows to find [me]111-madame de chantelle one . That ’s what [Anna]97-anna wo n’t understand ; and what [you]71-darrow must help [me]111-madame de chantelle to make [her]97-anna see . ”[111-madame de chantelle] [Darrow]71-darrow , to this appeal , could oppose only the repeated assurance of [his]71-darrow inability to interfere . [He]71-darrow tried to make [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle see that the very position [he]71-darrow hoped to take in [the household]1402-the household made [his]71-darrow intervention the more hazardous . [He]71-darrow brought up the usual arguments , and sounded the expected note of sympathy ; but [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s alarm had dispelled [her]111-madame de chantelle habitual imprecision , and , though [she]111-madame de chantelle had not many reasons to advance , [her]111-madame de chantelle argument clung to its point like a frightened sharp - clawed animal . “ Well , then , ”[111-madame de chantelle] [she]111-madame de chantelle summed up , in response to [his]71-darrow repeated assertions that [he]71-darrow saw no way of helping [her]111-madame de chantelle , “ [you]71-darrow can , at least , even if [you]71-darrow wo n’t say a word to [the others]783-the others , tell [me]71-darrow frankly and fairly -- and quite between [ourselves]2701-ourselves -- [your]71-darrow personal opinion of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , since [you]71-darrow ’ve known [her]82-miss viner so much longer than [we]2701-ourselves have . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow protested that , if [he]71-darrow had known [her]111-madame de chantelle longer , [he]71-darrow had known [her]111-madame de chantelle much less well , and that [he]71-darrow had already , on this point , convinced [Anna]97-anna of [his]71-darrow inability to pronounce an opinion . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle drew a deep sigh of intelligence . “ [Your]71-darrow opinion of [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett is enough ! [I]111-madame de chantelle do n’t suppose [you]71-darrow pretend to conceal THAT ? And heaven knows what [other unspeakable people [she]82-miss viner ’s been mixed up with]2702-other unspeakable people she ’s been mixed up with . [The only friends [she]82-miss viner can produce]2703-the only friends she can produce are called [Hoke]93-mamie hoke ... Don’t try to reason with [me]111-madame de chantelle , [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow . There are feelings that go deeper than facts ... And [I]111-madame de chantelle KNOW [she]82-miss viner thought of studying for the stage ... ”[111-madame de chantelle] [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle raised the corner of [her]111-madame de chantelle lace handkerchief to [her]111-madame de chantelle eyes . “ [I]111-madame de chantelle ’m old - fashioned -- like [my]111-madame de chantelle furniture , ”[111-madame de chantelle] [she]111-madame de chantelle murmured . “ And [I]111-madame de chantelle thought [I]111-madame de chantelle could count on [you]71-darrow , [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow ... ”[111-madame de chantelle] When [Darrow]71-darrow , that night , regained [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room , [he]71-darrow reflected with a flash of irony that each time [he]71-darrow entered [it]542-his room [he]71-darrow brought a fresh troop of perplexities to trouble [its]542-his room serene seclusion . Since the day after [his]71-darrow arrival , only forty - eight hours before , when [he]71-darrow had set [his]71-darrow window open to the night , and [his]71-darrow hopes had seemed as many as its stars , each evening had brought its new problem and its renewed distress . But nothing , as yet , had approached the blank misery of mind with which [he]71-darrow now set [himself]71-darrow to face the fresh questions confronting [him]71-darrow . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had not shown [herself]81-sophy viner at dinner , so that [he]71-darrow had had no glimpse of [her]81-sophy viner in [her]81-sophy viner new character , and no means of divining the real nature of the tie between [herself]81-sophy viner and [Owen Leath]75-owen . One thing , however , was clear : whatever [her]81-sophy viner real feelings were , and however much or little [she]81-sophy viner had at stake , if [she]81-sophy viner had made up [her]81-sophy viner mind to marry [Owen]75-owen [she]81-sophy viner had more than enough skill and tenacity to defeat any arts that poor [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle could oppose to [her]81-sophy viner . [Darrow]71-darrow [himself]71-darrow was in fact [the only person who might possibly turn [her]81-sophy viner from [her]81-sophy viner purpose]1404-the only person who might possibly turn her from her purpose : [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , at haphazard , had hit on the surest means of saving [Owen]75-owen -- if to prevent [his]71-darrow marriage were to save [him]71-darrow ! [Darrow]71-darrow , on this point , did not pretend to any fixed opinion ; one feeling alone was clear and insistent in [him]71-darrow : [he]71-darrow did not mean , if [he]71-darrow could help it , to let the marriage take place . How [he]71-darrow was to prevent it [he]71-darrow did not know : to [his]71-darrow tormented imagination every issue seemed closed . For a fantastic instant [he]71-darrow was moved to follow [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s suggestion and urge [Anna]97-anna to withdraw [her]97-anna approval . If [his]71-darrow reticence , [his]71-darrow efforts to avoid the subject , had not escaped [her]97-anna , [she]97-anna had doubtless set them down to the fact of [his]71-darrow knowing more , and thinking less , of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner than [he]71-darrow had been willing to admit ; and [he]71-darrow might take advantage of this to turn [her]97-anna mind gradually from the project . Yet how do so without betraying [his]71-darrow insincerity ? If [he]71-darrow had had nothing to hide [he]71-darrow could easily have said : “ It ’s one thing to know nothing against [the girl]297-the girl , it ’s another to pretend that [I]71-darrow think [her]297-the girl a good match for [Owen]75-owen . ”[71-darrow] But could [he]71-darrow say even so much without betraying more ? It was not [Anna]97-anna ’s questions , or [his]71-darrow answers to them , that [he]71-darrow feared , but what might cry aloud in the intervals between [them]1405-them . [He]71-darrow understood now that ever since [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s arrival at [Givre]30-givre [he]71-darrow had felt in [Anna]97-anna the lurking sense of something unexpressed , and perhaps inexpressible , between [the girl]297-the girl and [himself]71-darrow ... When at last [he]71-darrow fell asleep [he]71-darrow had fatalistically committed [his]71-darrow next step to the chances of the morrow . The first that offered itself was an encounter with [Mrs. Leath]75-owen as [he]71-darrow descended the stairs the next morning . [She]97-anna had come down already hatted and shod for a dash to [the park lodge]1407-the park lodge , where [one of [[the gatekeeper]1409-the gatekeeper ’s children]1410-the gatekeeper ’s children had had an accident]1408-one of the gatekeeper ’s children had had an accident . In [her]97-anna compact dark dress [she]97-anna looked more than usually straight and slim , and [her]97-anna face wore the pale glow it took on at any call on [her]97-anna energy : a kind of warrior brightness that made [her]97-anna small head , with [its]97-anna strong chin and close - bound hair , like that of [an amazon in a frieze]1411-an amazon in a frieze . It was [their]1412-their first moment alone since [she]97-anna had left [him]71-darrow , the afternoon before , at [[her]97-anna mother]221-her mother - in - law ’s door ; and after a few words about [the injured child]1414-the injured child [their]1412-their talk inevitably reverted to [Owen]75-owen . [Anna]97-anna spoke with a smile of [her]97-anna “ scene ”[97-anna] with [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , who belonged , poor dear , to [a generation when “ scenes ”[1415-a generation when “ scenes ” ( in the ladylike and lachrymal sense of the term] ( in the ladylike and lachrymal sense of the term]1415-a generation when “ scenes ” ( in the ladylike and lachrymal sense of the term ) were the tribute which sensibility was expected to pay to [the unusual]1416-the unusual . [Their]1412-their conversation had been , in every detail , so exactly what [Anna]97-anna had foreseen that it had clearly not made much impression on [her]97-anna ; but [she]97-anna was eager to know the result of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s encounter with [[her]97-anna mother - in - law]236-her mother - in - law . “ [She]236-her mother - in - law told [me]97-anna [she]236-her mother - in - law ’d sent for [you]71-darrow : [she]236-her mother - in - law always ‘ sends for ’ [people]365-people in emergencies . That again , [I]97-anna suppose , is [DE L’EPOQUE]140-de l’epoque . And [failing Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide , who ca n’t get [here]2403-here till this afternoon , there was [no one]325-no one but poor [you]71-darrow to turn to . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna put it all lightly , with a lightness that seemed to [his]71-darrow tight - strung nerves slightly , undefinably over - done . But [he]71-darrow was so aware of [his]71-darrow own tension that [he]71-darrow wondered , the next moment , whether anything would ever again seem to [him]71-darrow quite usual and insignificant and in the common order of things . As [they]1418-they hastened on through the drizzle in which the storm of the night was weeping itself out , [Anna]97-anna drew close under [his]71-darrow umbrella , and at the pressure of [her]97-anna arm against [his]71-darrow [he]71-darrow recalled [his]71-darrow walk up [the Dover pier]1419-the dover pier with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . The memory gave [him]71-darrow a startled vision of the inevitable occasions of contact , confidence , familiarity , which [his]71-darrow future relationship to [the girl]297-the girl would entail , and the countless chances of betrayal that every one of [them]1421-them involved . “ Do tell [me]97-anna just what [you]97-anna said , ”[97-anna] [he]71-darrow heard [Anna]97-anna pleading ; and with sudden resolution [he]71-darrow affirmed : “ [I]71-darrow quite understand [[your]97-anna mother - in - law]2500-your mother - in - law ’s feeling as [she]2500-your mother - in - law does . ”[71-darrow] The words , when uttered , seemed a good deal less significant than they had sounded to [his]71-darrow inner ear ; and [Anna]97-anna replied without surprise : “ Of course . It ’s inevitable that [she]2500-your mother - in - law should . But [we]2709-we shall bring [her]2500-your mother - in - law round in time . ”[97-anna] Under the dripping dome [she]97-anna raised [her]97-anna face to [his]71-darrow . “ Do n’t [you]71-darrow remember what [you]71-darrow said the day before yesterday ? ‘ Together [we]2709-we ca n’t fail to pull it off for [him]71-darrow ! ’ [I]97-anna ’ve told [Owen]75-owen that , so [you]71-darrow ’re pledged and there ’s no going back . ”[97-anna] The day before yesterday ! Was it possible that , no longer ago , life had seemed a sufficiently simple business for [a sane man]1422-a sane man to hazard such assurances ? “ [Anna]97-anna , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow questioned [her]97-anna abruptly , “ why are [you]97-anna so anxious for this marriage ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna stopped short to face [him]71-darrow . “ Why ? But surely [I]97-anna ’ve explained to [you]71-darrow -- or rather [I]97-anna ’ve hardly had to , [you]71-darrow seemed so in sympathy with [my]97-anna reasons ! ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna did n’t know , then , who it was that [Owen]75-owen wanted to marry . ”[97-anna] The words were out with a spring and [he]71-darrow felt a clearer air in [his]71-darrow brain . But [her]97-anna logic hemmed [him]71-darrow in . “ [You]71-darrow knew yesterday ; and [you]71-darrow assured [me]97-anna then that [you]71-darrow had n’t a word to say---- ”[97-anna] “ Against [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[97-anna] The name , once uttered , sounded on and on in [his]71-darrow ears . “ Of course not . But that does n’t necessarily imply that [I]97-anna think [her]97-anna a good match for [Owen]75-owen . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna made no immediate answer . When [she]97-anna spoke it was to question : “ Why do n’t [you]71-darrow think [her]97-anna a good match for [Owen]75-owen ? ”[97-anna] “ Well -- [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s reasons seem to [me]97-anna not quite as negligible as [you]71-darrow think . ”[97-anna] “ [You]71-darrow mean the fact that [she]97-anna ’s been [[Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett ’s secretary]2710-mrs. murrett ’s secretary , and that [the people who employed [her]97-anna before]2711-the people who employed her before were called [Hoke]93-mamie hoke ? For , as far as [Owen]75-owen and [I]97-anna can make out , these are the gravest charges against [her]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ Still , [one]2308-one can understand that the match is not what [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle had dreamed of . ”[1424-she] “ Oh , perfectly -- if that ’s all [you]1425-he mean . ”[97-anna] [The lodge]1423-the lodge was in sight , and [she]1424-she hastened [her]1424-she step . [He]1425-he strode on beside [her]1424-she in silence , but at the gate [she]1424-she checked [him]1425-he with the question : “ Is it really all [you]1425-he mean ? ”[1424-she] “ Of course , ”[1425-he] [he]1425-he heard [himself]1425-he declare . “ Oh , then [I]1424-she think [I]1424-she shall convince [you]1424-she -- even if [I]1424-she ca n’t , like [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , summon [all the Everards]2713-all the everards to [my]1424-she aid ! ”[1424-she] [She]1424-she lifted to [him]1425-he the look of happy laughter that sometimes brushed [her]1424-she with a gleam of spring . [Darrow]71-darrow watched [her]1424-she hasten along [the path between the dripping chrysanthemums]1426-the path between the dripping chrysanthemums and enter [the lodge]1423-the lodge . After [she]1424-she had gone in [he]1425-he paced up and down outside in the drizzle , waiting to learn if [she]1424-she had any message to send back to [the house]581-the house ; and after the lapse of a few minutes [she]1424-she came out again . [The child]639-the child , [she]1424-she said , was badly , though not dangerously , hurt , and [the village doctor , who was already on hand]1430-the village doctor , who was already on hand , had asked that [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon , already summoned from [Francheuil]42-francheuil , should be told to bring with [him]1425-he certain needful appliances . [Owen]75-owen had started by motor to fetch [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon , but there was still time to communicate with [the latter]231-the latter by telephone . [The doctor]1434-the doctor furthermore begged for an immediate provision of such bandages and disinfectants as [Givre]30-givre itself could furnish , and [Anna]97-anna bade [Darrow]71-darrow address [himself]71-darrow to [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , who would know where to find the necessary things , and would direct [one of [the servants]1436-the servants]1435-one of the servants to bicycle with [them]1437-them to [the lodge]1423-the lodge . [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow hurried off on this errand , had at once perceived the opportunity it offered of a word with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . What that word was to be [he]71-darrow did not know ; but now , if ever , was the moment to make it urgent and conclusive . It was unlikely that [he]71-darrow would again have such a chance of unobserved talk with [her]82-miss viner . [He]71-darrow had supposed [he]71-darrow should find [her]82-miss viner with [[her]82-miss viner pupil]1164-her pupil in [the school - room]1079-the school - room ; but [he]71-darrow learned from [a servant]924-a servant that [Effie]74-effie had gone to [Francheuil]42-francheuil with [[her]74-effie step - brother]1442-her step - brother , and that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner was still in [[her]82-miss viner room]602-her room . [Darrow]71-darrow sent [her]82-miss viner word that [he]71-darrow was the bearer of a message from [the lodge]1423-the lodge , and a moment later [he]71-darrow heard [her]82-miss viner coming down the stairs . [XX]141-xx For a second , as [she]82-miss viner approached [him]71-darrow , the quick tremor of [her]82-miss viner glance showed [her]82-miss viner all intent on the same thought as [himself]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow transmitted [his]71-darrow instructions with mechanical precision , and [she]82-miss viner answered in the same tone , repeating [his]71-darrow words with the intensity of attention of [a child not quite sure of understanding]1445-a child not quite sure of understanding . Then [she]82-miss viner disappeared up the stairs . [Darrow]71-darrow lingered on in [the hall]539-the hall , not knowing if [she]82-miss viner meant to return , yet inwardly sure [she]82-miss viner would . At length [he]71-darrow saw [her]82-miss viner coming down in [her]82-miss viner hat and jacket . The rain still streaked the window panes , and , in order to say something , [he]71-darrow said : “ [You]82-miss viner ’re not going to [the lodge]1423-the lodge [yourself]82-miss viner ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]71-darrow ’ve sent one of [the men]2715-the men ahead with the things ; but [I]71-darrow thought [Mrs. Leath]75-owen might need [me]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] “ [She]75-owen did n’t ask for [you]71-darrow , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow returned , wondering how [he]71-darrow could detain [her]82-miss viner ; but [she]82-miss viner answered decidedly : “ [I]82-miss viner ’d better go . ”[82-miss viner] [He]71-darrow held open the door , picked up [his]71-darrow umbrella and followed [her]82-miss viner out . As [they]1447-they went down [the steps]1448-the steps [she]82-miss viner glanced back at [him]71-darrow . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve forgotten [your]71-darrow mackintosh . ”[82-miss viner] “ [I]82-miss viner sha’n’t need it . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner had no umbrella , and [he]71-darrow opened [his]71-darrow and held it out to [her]82-miss viner . [She]82-miss viner rejected it with a murmur of thanks and walked on through the thin drizzle , and [he]71-darrow kept the umbrella over [his]71-darrow own head , without offering to shelter [her]82-miss viner . Rapidly and in silence [they]1447-they crossed [the court]708-the court and began to walk down [the avenue]1076-the avenue . [They]1447-they had traversed a third of [its]1076-the avenue length before [Darrow]71-darrow said abruptly : “ Would n’t it have been fairer , when [we]1447-they talked together yesterday , to tell [me]71-darrow what [I]71-darrow ’ve just heard from [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ? ”[71-darrow] “ Fairer---- ? ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner stopped short with a startled look . “ If [I]82-miss viner ’d known that [your]71-darrow future was already settled [I]82-miss viner should have spared [you]71-darrow [my]82-miss viner gratuitous suggestions . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner walked on , more slowly , for a yard or two . “ [I]82-miss viner could n’t speak yesterday . [I]82-miss viner meant to have told [you]71-darrow today . ”[82-miss viner] “ Oh , [I]82-miss viner ’m not reproaching [you]71-darrow for [your]71-darrow lack of confidence . Only , if [you]71-darrow HAD told [me]82-miss viner , [I]82-miss viner should have been more sure of [your]71-darrow really meaning what [you]71-darrow said to [me]82-miss viner yesterday . ”[82-miss viner] [She]82-miss viner did not ask [him]1451-his to what [he]1451-his referred , and [he]1451-his saw that [her]82-miss viner parting words to [him]1451-his lived as vividly in [her]82-miss viner memory as in [his]1451-his . “ Is it so important that [you]1451-his should be sure ? ”[82-miss viner] [she]82-miss viner finally questioned . “ Not to [you]82-miss viner , naturally , ”[1451-his] [he]1451-his returned with involuntary asperity . It was incredible , yet it was a fact , that for the moment [his]1451-his immediate purpose in seeking to speak to [her]82-miss viner was lost under a rush of resentment at counting for so little in [her]82-miss viner fate . Of what stuff , then , was [his]1451-his feeling for [her]82-miss viner made ? A few hours earlier [she]82-miss viner had touched [his]1451-his thoughts as little as [his]1451-his senses ; but now [he]1451-his felt old sleeping instincts stir in [him]1451-his ... A rush of rain dashed against [his]1451-his face , and , catching [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s hat , strained it back from [her]82-miss viner loosened hair . [She]82-miss viner put [her]82-miss viner hands to [her]82-miss viner head with a familiar gesture ... [He]1451-his came closer and held [his]1451-his umbrella over [her]82-miss viner ... At [the lodge]1423-the lodge [he]1451-his waited while [she]82-miss viner went in . The rain continued to stream down on [him]1451-his and [he]1451-his shivered in the dampness and stamped [his]1451-his feet on the flags . It seemed to [him]1451-his that a long time elapsed before the door opened and [she]82-miss viner reappeared . [He]1451-his glanced into [the house]581-the house for a glimpse of [Anna]97-anna , but obtained none ; yet the mere sense of [her]82-miss viner nearness had completely altered [his]1451-his mood . [The child]639-the child , [Sophy]81-sophy viner told [him]1451-his , was doing well ; but [Mrs. Leath]75-owen had decided to wait till [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon came . [Darrow]71-darrow , as [they]1456-they turned away , looked through the gates , and saw [[the doctor]1434-the doctor ’s old - fashioned carriage]1458-the doctor ’s old - fashioned carriage by [the roadside]1459-the roadside . “ Let [me]71-darrow tell [[the doctor]1434-the doctor ’s boy]2717-the doctor ’s boy to drive [you]75-owen back , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow suggested ; but [Sophy]81-sophy viner answered : “ No ; [I]71-darrow ’ll walk , ”[71-darrow] and [he]71-darrow moved on toward [the house]581-the house at [her]75-owen side . [She]75-owen expressed no surprise at [his]71-darrow not remaining at [the lodge]1423-the lodge , and again [they]1456-they walked on in silence through the rain . [She]75-owen had accepted the shelter of [his]71-darrow umbrella , but [she]75-owen kept [herself]75-owen at such a carefully measured distance that even the slight swaying movements produced by [their]1456-they quick pace did not once bring [her]75-owen arm in touch with [his]71-darrow ; and , noticing this , [he]71-darrow perceived that every drop of [her]75-owen blood must be alive to [his]71-darrow nearness . “ What [I]71-darrow meant just now , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow began , “ was that [you]75-owen ought to have been sure of [my]71-darrow good wishes . ”[71-darrow] [She]75-owen seemed to weigh the words . “ Sure enough for what ? ”[75-owen] “ To trust [me]75-owen a little farther than [you]71-darrow did . ”[75-owen] “ [I]75-owen ’ve told [you]71-darrow that yesterday [I]75-owen was n’t free to speak . ”[75-owen] “ Well , since [you]71-darrow are now , may [I]75-owen say a word to [you]71-darrow ? ”[75-owen] [She]75-owen paused perceptibly , and when [she]75-owen spoke it was in so low a tone that [he]71-darrow had to bend [his]71-darrow head to catch [her]75-owen answer . “ [I]75-owen ca n’t think what [you]71-darrow can have to say . ”[75-owen] “ It ’s not easy to say here , at any rate . And indoors [I]71-darrow sha’n’t know where to say it . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow glanced about [him]71-darrow in the rain . “ Let ’s walk over to [the spring - house]2718-the spring - house for a minute . ”[71-darrow] To the right of [the drive]715-the drive , under a clump of trees , [a little stucco pavilion crowned by a balustrade rose on arches of mouldering brick over a flight of steps that led down to a spring]1463-a little stucco pavilion crowned by a balustrade rose on arches of mouldering brick over a flight of steps that led down to a spring . Other steps curved up to a door above . [Darrow]71-darrow mounted these , and opening the door entered [a small circular room hung with loosened strips of painted paper whereon spectrally faded Mandarins]1464-a small circular room hung with loosened strips of painted paper whereon spectrally faded mandarins executed elongated gestures . Some black and gold chairs with straw seats and an unsteady table of cracked lacquer stood on the floor of red - glazed tile . [Sophy]81-sophy viner had followed [him]71-darrow without comment . [He]71-darrow closed the door after [her]75-owen , and [she]75-owen stood motionless , as though waiting for [him]71-darrow to speak . “ Now [we]1465-we can talk quietly , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , looking at [her]75-owen with a smile into which [he]71-darrow tried to put an intention of the frankest friendliness . [She]75-owen merely repeated : “ [I]75-owen ca n’t think what [you]71-darrow can have to say . ”[75-owen] [Her]75-owen voice had lost the note of half - wistful confidence on which [their]1465-we talk of the previous day had closed , and [she]75-owen looked at [him]71-darrow with a kind of pale hostility . [Her]75-owen tone made it evident that [his]71-darrow task would be difficult , but it did not shake [his]71-darrow resolve to go on . [He]71-darrow sat down , and mechanically [she]75-owen followed [his]71-darrow example . The table was between [them]1465-we and [she]75-owen rested [her]75-owen arms on its cracked edge and [her]75-owen chin on [her]75-owen interlocked hands . [He]71-darrow looked at [her]75-owen and [she]75-owen gave [him]71-darrow back [his]71-darrow look . “ Have [you]75-owen nothing to say to [ME]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked at length . A faint smile lifted , in the remembered way , the left corner of [her]75-owen narrowed lips . “ About [my]75-owen marriage ? ”[75-owen] “ About [your]71-darrow marriage . ”[75-owen] [She]75-owen continued to consider [him]71-darrow between half - drawn lids . “ What can [I]75-owen say that [Mrs. Leath]75-owen has not already told [you]71-darrow ? ”[75-owen] “ [Mrs. Leath]75-owen has told [me]75-owen nothing whatever but the fact -- and [her]75-owen pleasure in it . ”[75-owen] “ Well ; are n’t those the two essential points ? ”[75-owen] “ The essential points to [YOU]71-darrow ? [I]75-owen should have thought---- ”[75-owen] “ Oh , to [YOU]71-darrow , [I]75-owen meant , ”[75-owen] [she]75-owen put in keenly . [He]71-darrow flushed at the retort , but steadied [himself]71-darrow and rejoined : “ The essential point to [me]71-darrow is , of course , that [you]71-darrow should be doing what ’s really best for [you]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [She]75-owen sat silent , with lowered lashes . At length [she]75-owen stretched out [her]75-owen arm and took up from the table a little threadbare Chinese hand - screen . [She]75-owen turned its ebony stem once or twice between [her]75-owen fingers , and as [she]75-owen did so [Darrow]71-darrow was whimsically struck by the way in which [their]1466-their evanescent slight romance was symbolized by the fading lines on the frail silk . “ Do [you]71-darrow think [my]75-owen engagement to [Mr. Leath]76-mr. leath not really best for [me]75-owen ? ”[75-owen] [she]75-owen asked at length . [Darrow]71-darrow , before answering , waited long enough to get [his]71-darrow words into the tersest shape -- not without a sense , as [he]71-darrow did so , of [his]71-darrow likeness to [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon deliberately poising [his]71-darrow lancet for a clean incision . “ [I]71-darrow ’m not sure , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow replied , “ of its being the best thing for either of [you]75-owen . ”[71-darrow] [She]75-owen took the stroke steadily , but a faint red swept [her]75-owen face like the reflection of a blush . [She]75-owen continued to keep [her]75-owen lowered eyes on the screen . “ From whose point of view do [you]71-darrow speak ? ”[75-owen] “ Naturally , that of [the persons most concerned]2719-the persons most concerned . ”[71-darrow] “ From [Owen]75-owen ’s , then , of course ? [You]71-darrow do n’t think [me]71-darrow a good match for [him]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] “ From [yours]75-owen , first of all . [I]71-darrow do n’t think [him]71-darrow a good match for [you]75-owen . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow brought the answer out abruptly , [his]71-darrow eyes on [her]75-owen face . It had grown extremely pale , but as the meaning of [his]71-darrow words shaped itself in [her]75-owen mind [he]71-darrow saw a curious inner light dawn through [her]75-owen set look . [She]75-owen lifted [her]75-owen lids just far enough for a veiled glance at [him]71-darrow , and a smile slipped through them to [her]75-owen trembling lips . For a moment the change merely bewildered [him]71-darrow ; then it pulled [him]71-darrow up with a sharp jerk of apprehension . “ [I]71-darrow do n’t think [him]71-darrow a good match for [you]75-owen , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow stammered , groping for the lost thread of [his]71-darrow words . [She]75-owen threw a vague look about [the chilly rain - dimmed room]1468-the chilly rain - dimmed room . “ And [you]71-darrow ’ve brought [me]75-owen here to tell [me]75-owen why ? ”[75-owen] The question roused [him]71-darrow to the sense that [their]1469-their minutes were numbered , and that if [he]71-darrow did not immediately get to [his]71-darrow point there might be no other chance of making it . “ [My]71-darrow chief reason is that [I]71-darrow believe [he]71-darrow ’s too young and inexperienced to give [you]75-owen the kind of support [you]75-owen need . ”[71-darrow] At [his]71-darrow words [her]75-owen face changed again , freezing to a tragic coldness . [She]75-owen stared straight ahead of [her]75-owen , perceptibly struggling with the tremor of [her]75-owen muscles ; and when [she]75-owen had controlled it [she]75-owen flung out a pale - lipped pleasantry . “ But [you]71-darrow see [I]75-owen ’ve always had to support [myself]75-owen ! ”[75-owen] “ [He]71-darrow ’s [a boy]394-a boy , ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow pushed on , “ [a charming , wonderful boy]2721-a charming , wonderful boy ; but with no more notion than [a boy]394-a boy how to deal with the inevitable daily problems ... the trivial stupid unimportant things that life is chiefly made up of . ”[71-darrow] “ [I]75-owen ’ll deal with them for [him]71-darrow , ”[75-owen] [she]75-owen rejoined . “ They ’ll be more than ordinarily difficult . ”[75-owen] [She]75-owen shot a challenging glance at [him]71-darrow . “ [You]71-darrow must have some special reason for saying so . ”[75-owen] “ Only [my]71-darrow clear perception of the facts . ”[71-darrow] “ What facts do [you]71-darrow mean ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow hesitated . “ [You]75-owen must know better than [I]71-darrow , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow returned at length , “ that the way wo n’t be made easy to [you]75-owen . ”[71-darrow] “ [Mrs. Leath]75-owen , at any rate , has made it so . ”[71-darrow] “ [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle will not . ”[71-darrow] “ How do [YOU]71-darrow know that ? ”[75-owen] [she]75-owen flung back . [He]71-darrow paused again , not sure how far it was prudent to reveal [himself]71-darrow in the confidence of [the household]1402-the household . Then , to avoid involving [Anna]97-anna , [he]71-darrow answered : “ [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle sent for [me]71-darrow yesterday . ”[71-darrow] “ Sent for [you]71-darrow -- to talk to [you]71-darrow about [me]75-owen ? ”[75-owen] The colour rose to [her]75-owen forehead and [her]75-owen eyes burned black under lowered brows . “ By what right , [I]75-owen should like to know ? What have [you]75-owen to do with [me]75-owen , or with anything in [the world]206-the world that concerns [me]75-owen ? ”[75-owen] [Darrow]71-darrow instantly perceived what dread suspicion again possessed [her]75-owen , and the sense that it was not wholly unjustified caused [him]71-darrow a passing pang of shame . But it did not turn [him]71-darrow from [his]71-darrow purpose . “ [I]75-owen ’m [an old friend of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s]2724-an old friend of mrs. leath ’s . It ’s not unnatural that [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle should talk to [me]75-owen . ”[75-owen] [She]75-owen dropped the screen on the table and stood up , turning on [him]71-darrow the same small mask of wrath and scorn which had glared at [him]71-darrow , in [Paris]10-paris , when [he]71-darrow had confessed to [his]71-darrow suppression of [her]75-owen letter . [She]75-owen walked away a step or two and then came back . “ May [I]75-owen ask what [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle said to [you]71-darrow ? ”[75-owen] “ [She]111-madame de chantelle made it clear that [she]111-madame de chantelle should not encourage the marriage . ”[75-owen] “ And what was [her]111-madame de chantelle object in making that clear to [YOU]71-darrow ? ”[75-owen] [Darrow]71-darrow hesitated . “ [I]75-owen suppose [she]111-madame de chantelle thought---- ”[75-owen] “ That [she]111-madame de chantelle could persuade [you]71-darrow to turn [Mrs. Leath]75-owen against [me]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow was silent , and [she]75-owen pressed [him]71-darrow : “ Was that it ? ”[75-owen] “ That was it . ”[75-owen] “ But if [you]71-darrow don’t -- if [you]71-darrow keep [your]71-darrow promise---- ”[75-owen] “ [My]75-owen promise ? ”[75-owen] “ To say nothing ... nothing whatever ... ”[75-owen] [Her]75-owen strained look threw a haggard light along the pause . As [she]75-owen spoke , the whole odiousness of the scene rushed over [him]71-darrow . “ Of course [I]75-owen shall say nothing ... [you]75-owen know that ... ”[75-owen] [He]71-darrow leaned to [her]75-owen and laid [his]71-darrow hand on [hers]75-owen . “ [You]75-owen know [I]71-darrow would n’t for [the world]206-the world ... ”[71-darrow] [She]75-owen drew back and hid [her]75-owen face with a sob . Then [she]75-owen sank again into [her]75-owen seat , stretched [her]75-owen arms across the table and laid [her]75-owen face upon them . [He]71-darrow sat still , overwhelmed with compunction . After a long interval , in which [he]71-darrow had painfully measured the seconds by [her]75-owen hard - drawn breathing , [she]75-owen looked up at [him]71-darrow with a face washed clear of bitterness . “ Do n’t suppose [I]75-owen do n’t know what [you]71-darrow must have thought of [me]75-owen ! ”[75-owen] The cry struck [him]71-darrow down to a lower depth of self - abasement . “ [[My]71-darrow poor child]2726-my poor child , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow felt like answering , “ the shame of it is that [I]71-darrow ’ve never thought of [you]2726-my poor child at all ! ”[71-darrow] But [he]71-darrow could only uselessly repeat : “ [I]71-darrow ’ll do anything [I]71-darrow can to help [you]2726-my poor child . ”[71-darrow] [She]75-owen sat silent , drumming the table with [her]75-owen hand . [He]71-darrow saw that [her]75-owen doubt of [him]71-darrow was allayed , and the perception made [him]71-darrow more ashamed , as if [her]75-owen trust had first revealed to [him]71-darrow how near [he]71-darrow had come to not deserving it . Suddenly [she]75-owen began to speak . “ [You]71-darrow think , then , [I]75-owen ’ve no right to marry [him]71-darrow ? ”[75-owen] “ No right ? God forbid ! [I]75-owen only meant---- ”[75-owen] “ That [you]71-darrow ’d rather [I]75-owen did n’t marry [any friend of yours]2727-any friend of yours . ”[75-owen] [She]75-owen brought it out deliberately , not as a question , but as a mere dispassionate statement of fact . [Darrow]71-darrow in turn stood up and wandered away helplessly to the window . [He]71-darrow stood staring out through [its]1471-its small discoloured panes at the dim brown distances ; then [he]71-darrow moved back to the table . “ [I]71-darrow ’ll tell [you]75-owen exactly what [I]71-darrow meant . [You]75-owen ’ll be wretched if [you]75-owen marry [a man [you]75-owen ’re not in love with]2728-a man you ’re not in love with . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow knew the risk of misapprehension that [he]71-darrow ran , but [he]71-darrow estimated [his]71-darrow chances of success as precisely in proportion to [his]71-darrow peril . If certain signs meant what [he]71-darrow thought [they]1472-they did , [he]71-darrow might yet -- at what cost [he]71-darrow would not stop to think -- make [his]71-darrow past pay for [his]71-darrow future . [The girl]297-the girl , at [his]71-darrow words , had lifted [her]297-the girl head with a movement of surprise . [Her]297-the girl eyes slowly reached [his]71-darrow face and rested there in a gaze of deep interrogation . [He]71-darrow held the look for a moment ; then [his]71-darrow own eyes dropped and [he]71-darrow waited . At length [she]297-the girl began to speak . “ [You]71-darrow ’re mistaken -- [you’re]71-darrow quite mistaken . ”[297-the girl] [He]71-darrow waited a moment longer . “ Mistaken---- ? ”[71-darrow] “ In thinking what [you]71-darrow think . [I]297-the girl ’m as happy as if [I]297-the girl deserved it ! ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl suddenly proclaimed with a laugh . [She]297-the girl stood up and moved toward the door . “ NOW are [you]71-darrow satisfied ? ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl asked , turning [her]297-the girl vividest face to [him]71-darrow from the threshold . XXI Down [the avenue]1076-the avenue there came to [them]1475-their , with the opening of the door , the voice of [Owen]75-owen ’s motor . It was the signal which had interrupted [their]1475-their first talk , and again , instinctively , [they]1475-their drew apart at the sound . Without a word [Darrow]71-darrow turned back into [the room]663-the room , while [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner went down the steps and walked back alone toward [the court]708-the court . At luncheon the presence of [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon , and the non - appearance of [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle -- who had excused [herself]111-madame de chantelle on the plea of a headache -- combined to shift the conversational centre of gravity ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , under shelter of the necessarily impersonal talk , had time to adjust [his]71-darrow disguise and to perceive that [the others]783-the others were engaged in the same re - arrangement . It was the first time that [he]71-darrow had seen [young Leath]75-owen and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner together since [he]71-darrow had learned of [their]1475-their engagement ; but neither revealed more emotion than befitted the occasion . It was evident that [Owen]75-owen was deeply under [the girl]297-the girl ’s charm , and that at the least sign from [her]297-the girl [his]71-darrow bliss would have broken bounds ; but [her]297-the girl reticence was justified by the tacitly recognized fact of [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s disapproval . This also visibly weighed on [Anna]97-anna ’s mind , making [her]97-anna manner to [Sophy]81-sophy viner , if no less kind , yet a trifle more constrained than if the moment of final understanding had been reached . [So Darrow]71-darrow interpreted the tension perceptible under the fluent exchange of commonplaces in which [he]71-darrow was diligently sharing . But [he]71-darrow was more and more aware of [his]71-darrow inability to test the moral atmosphere about [him]71-darrow : [he]71-darrow was like a man in fever testing another ’s temperature by the touch . After luncheon [Anna]97-anna , who was to motor [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon [home]1482-home , suggested to [Darrow]71-darrow that [he]71-darrow should accompany [them]1483-their . [Effie]74-effie was also of [the party]1484-the party ; and [Darrow]71-darrow inferred that [Anna]97-anna wished to give [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son a chance to be alone with [[his]719-her step - son betrothed]1486-his betrothed . On the way back , after [the surgeon]1431-the surgeon had been left at [his]1431-the surgeon door , [the little girl]858-the little girl sat between [[her]858-the little girl mother]221-her mother and [Darrow]71-darrow , and [her]858-the little girl presence kept [their]1483-their talk from taking a personal turn . [Darrow]71-darrow knew that [Mrs. Leath]75-owen had not yet told [Effie]74-effie of the relation in which [he]71-darrow was to stand to [her]858-the little girl . The premature divulging of [Owen]75-owen ’s plans had thrown [their]1483-their own into the background , and by common consent [they]1483-their continued , in [the little girl]858-the little girl ’s presence , on terms of an informal friendliness . The sky had cleared after luncheon , and to prolong [their]1483-their excursion [they]1483-their returned by way of [the ivy - mantled ruin which was to have been the scene of the projected picnic]1491-the ivy - mantled ruin which was to have been the scene of the projected picnic . This circuit brought [them]1483-their back to [the park]765-the park gates not long before sunset , and as [Anna]97-anna wished to stop at [the lodge]1423-the lodge for news of [the injured child]1414-the injured child [Darrow]71-darrow left [her]97-anna there with [Effie]74-effie and walked on alone to [the house]581-the house . [He]71-darrow had the impression that [she]97-anna was slightly surprised at [his]71-darrow not waiting for [her]97-anna ; but [his]71-darrow inner restlessness vented itself in an intense desire for bodily movement . [He]71-darrow would have liked to walk [himself]71-darrow into a state of torpor ; to tramp on for hours through the moist winds and the healing darkness and come back staggering with fatigue and sleep . But [he]71-darrow had no pretext for such a flight , and [he]71-darrow feared that , at such a moment , [his]71-darrow prolonged absence might seem singular to [Anna]97-anna . As [he]71-darrow approached [the house]581-the house , the thought of [her]97-anna nearness produced a swift reaction of mood . It was as if an intenser vision of [her]97-anna had scattered [his]71-darrow perplexities like morning mists . At this moment , wherever [she]97-anna was , [he]71-darrow knew [he]71-darrow was safely shut away in [her]97-anna thoughts , and the knowledge made every other fact dwindle away to a shadow . [He]71-darrow and [she]97-anna loved [each other]177-each other , and [their]1498-their love arched over [them]1498-their open and ample as the day : in all [its]1499-its sunlit spaces there was no cranny for a fear to lurk . In a few minutes [he]71-darrow would be in [her]97-anna presence and would read [his]71-darrow reassurance in [her]97-anna eyes . And presently , before dinner , [she]97-anna would contrive that [they]1498-their should have an hour by [themselves]1498-their in [[her]97-anna sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room , and [he]71-darrow would sit by the hearth and watch [her]97-anna quiet movements , and the way the bluish lustre on [her]97-anna hair purpled a little as [she]97-anna bent above the fire . [A carriage]1501-a carriage drove out of [the court]708-the court as [he]71-darrow entered [it]708-the court , and in [the hall]539-the hall [his]71-darrow vision was dispelled by the exceedingly substantial presence of [a lady in a waterproof and a tweed hat]1504-a lady in a waterproof and a tweed hat , who stood firmly planted in the centre of a pile of luggage , as to which [she]97-anna was giving involved but lucid directions to [the footman who had just admitted [her]97-anna]1505-the footman who had just admitted her .
