[She]97-anna went on with these directions regardless of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s entrance , merely fixing [her]97-anna small pale eyes on [him]71-darrow while [she]97-anna proceeded , in a deep contralto voice , and a fluent French pronounced with the purest [Boston]48-boston accent , to specify the destination of [her]97-anna bags ; and this enabled [Darrow]71-darrow to give [her]97-anna back a gaze protracted enough to take in all the details of [[her]97-anna plain thick - set person]1506-her plain thick - set person , from the square sallow face beneath bands of grey hair to the blunt boot - toes protruding under [her]97-anna wide walking skirt . [She]97-anna submitted to this scrutiny with no more evidence of surprise than a monument examined by [a tourist]1507-a tourist ; but when the fate of [her]97-anna luggage had been settled [she]97-anna turned suddenly to [Darrow]71-darrow and , dropping [her]97-anna eyes from [his]71-darrow face to [his]71-darrow feet , asked in trenchant accents : “ What sort of boots have [you]71-darrow got on ? ”[97-anna] Before [he]71-darrow could summon [his]71-darrow wits to the consideration of this question [she]97-anna continued in a tone of suppressed indignation : “ Until [Americans]101-the americans get used to the fact that [France]4-france is under water for half the year [they]101-the americans ’re perpetually risking [their]101-the americans lives by not being properly protected . [I]97-anna suppose [you]71-darrow ’ve been tramping through all this nasty clammy mud as if [you]71-darrow ’d been taking a stroll on [Boston Common]49-boston common . ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow , with a laugh , affirmed [his]71-darrow previous experience of French dampness , and the degree to which [he]71-darrow was on [his]71-darrow guard against it ; but [the lady , with a contemptuous snort]1508-the lady , with a contemptuous snort , rejoined : “ [[You]71-darrow [young men]2730-young men]2729-you young men are all alike---- “[1508-the lady , with a contemptuous snort] ; to which [she]97-anna appended , after another hard look at [him]71-darrow : “ [I]97-anna suppose [you]71-darrow ’re [George Darrow]71-darrow ? [I]97-anna used to know [one of [[your]71-darrow mother]2436-your mother ’s cousins , who married [a Tunstall of [Mount Vernon Street]50-mount vernon street]2733-a tunstall of mount vernon street]2731-one of your mother ’s cousins , who married a tunstall of mount vernon street . [My]97-anna name is [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide . Have [you]71-darrow been in [Boston]48-boston lately ? No ? [I]97-anna ’m sorry for that . [I]97-anna hear there have been [several new houses built at the lower end of [Commonwealth Avenue]51-commonwealth avenue]2734-several new houses built at the lower end of commonwealth avenue and [I]97-anna hoped [you]71-darrow could tell [me]97-anna about [them]2734-several new houses built at the lower end of commonwealth avenue . [I]97-anna have n’t been [there]2294-there for thirty years [myself]97-anna . ”[97-anna] [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s arrival at [Givre]30-givre produced the same effect as the wind ’s hauling around to the north after days of languid weather . When [Darrow]71-darrow joined [the group]1240-the group about the tea - table [she]138-miss painter had already given a tingle to the air . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle still remained invisible above stairs ; but [Darrow]71-darrow had the impression that even through [her]138-miss painter drawn curtains and bolted doors a stimulating whiff must have entered . [Anna]97-anna was in [her]97-anna usual seat behind the tea - tray , and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner presently led in [[her]81-sophy viner pupil]1164-her pupil . [Owen]75-owen was also there , seated , as usual , a little apart from [the others]783-the others , and following [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s massive movements and equally substantial utterances with a smile of secret intelligence which gave [Darrow]71-darrow the idea of [his]71-darrow having been in clandestine parley with [the enemy]1512-the enemy . [Darrow]71-darrow further took note that [the girl]297-the girl and [[her]297-the girl suitor]823-her suitor perceptibly avoided [each other]177-each other ; but this might be a natural result of the tension [Miss Painter]138-miss painter had been summoned to relieve . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner would evidently permit no recognition of the situation save that which it lay with [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle to accord ; but meanwhile [Miss Painter]138-miss painter had proclaimed [her]138-miss painter tacit sense of it by summoning [the girl]297-the girl to a seat at [her]138-miss painter side . [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow continued to observe [the newcomer]1517-the newcomer , who was perched on [her]1517-the newcomer arm - chair like a granite image on the edge of [a cliff]1518-a cliff , was aware that , in a more detached frame of mind , [he]71-darrow would have found an extreme interest in studying and classifying [Miss Painter]138-miss painter . It was not that [she]1517-the newcomer said anything remarkable , or betrayed any of those unspoken perceptions which give significance to the most commonplace utterances . [She]1517-the newcomer talked of the lateness of [her]1517-the newcomer train , of an impending crisis in international politics , of the difficulty of buying English tea in [Paris]10-paris and of the enormities of which [French servants]1519-french servants were capable ; and [her]1517-the newcomer views on these subjects were enunciated with a uniformity of emphasis implying complete unconsciousness of any difference in their interest and importance . [She]1517-the newcomer always applied to the French race the distant epithet of “ [those people]2736-those people ”[1517-the newcomer] , but [she]1517-the newcomer betrayed an intimate acquaintance with [many of [its members]1521-its members]1520-many of its members , and an encyclopaedic knowledge of the domestic habits , financial difficulties and private complications of [various persons of social importance]1522-various persons of social importance . Yet , as [she]1517-the newcomer evidently felt no incongruity in [her]1517-the newcomer attitude , so [she]1517-the newcomer revealed no desire to parade [her]1517-the newcomer familiarity with the fashionable , or indeed any sense of it as a fact to be paraded . It was evident that [the titled ladies whom [she]1517-the newcomer spoke of as [Mimi]93-mamie hoke or [Simone]142-simone or [Odette]143-odette]1523-the titled ladies whom she spoke of as mimi or simone or odette were as much “ [those people]2736-those people ”[1517-the newcomer] to [her]1517-the newcomer as the bonne who tampered with [her]1517-the newcomer tea and steamed the stamps off [her]1517-the newcomer letters ( “ when , by a miracle , [I]1517-the newcomer do n’t put them in the box [myself]1517-the newcomer . ”[1517-the newcomer] ) [Her]1517-the newcomer whole attitude was of a vast grim tolerance of things - as - they - came , as though [she]1517-the newcomer had been some wonderful automatic machine which recorded facts but had not yet been perfected to the point of sorting or labelling them . All this , as [Darrow]71-darrow was aware , still fell short of accounting for the influence [she]1517-the newcomer obviously exerted on [the persons in contact with [her]1517-the newcomer]1524-the persons in contact with her . It brought a slight relief to [his]71-darrow state of tension to go on wondering , while [he]71-darrow watched and listened , just where the mystery lurked . Perhaps , after all , it was in the fact of [her]1517-the newcomer blank insensibility , an insensibility so devoid of egotism that it had no hardness and no grimaces , but rather the freshness of a simpler mental state . After living , as [he]71-darrow had , as [they]1525-they all had , for the last few days , in an atmosphere perpetually tremulous with echoes and implications , it was restful and fortifying merely to walk into the big blank area of [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s mind , so vacuous for all its accumulated items , so echoless for all its vacuity . [His]71-darrow hope of a word with [Anna]97-anna before dinner was dispelled by [her]97-anna rising to take [Miss Painter]138-miss painter up to [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ; and [he]71-darrow wandered away to [[his]71-darrow own room]1526-his own room , leaving [Owen]75-owen and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner engaged in working out a picture - puzzle for [Effie]74-effie . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle -- possibly as the result of [[her]111-madame de chantelle friend]1276-her friend ’s ministrations -- was able to appear at the dinner - table , rather pale and pink - nosed , and casting tenderly reproachful glances at [[her]111-madame de chantelle grandson]1125-her grandson , who faced [them]1525-they with impervious serenity ; and the situation was relieved by the fact that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , as usual , had remained in [the school - room]1079-the school - room with [[her]82-miss viner pupil]1164-her pupil . [Darrow]71-darrow conjectured that the real clash of arms would not take place till the morrow ; and wishing to leave [the field]1531-the field open to [the contestants]1532-the contestants [he]71-darrow set out early on a solitary walk . It was nearly luncheon - time when [he]71-darrow returned from [it]1533-it and came upon [Anna]97-anna just emerging from [the house]581-the house . [She]97-anna had on [her]97-anna hat and jacket and was apparently coming forth to seek [him]71-darrow , for [she]97-anna said at once : “ [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle wants [you]71-darrow to go up to [her]111-madame de chantelle . ”[97-anna] “ To go up to [her]111-madame de chantelle ? Now ? ”[97-anna] “ That ’s the message [she]111-madame de chantelle sent . [She]111-madame de chantelle appears to rely on [you]71-darrow to do something . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna added with a smile : “ Whatever it is , let ’s have it over ! ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow , through [his]71-darrow rising sense of apprehension , wondered why , instead of merely going for a walk , [he]71-darrow had not jumped into [the first train]2378-the first train and got out of the way till [Owen]75-owen ’s affairs were finally settled . “ But what in the name of goodness can [I]71-darrow do ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow protested , following [Anna]97-anna back into [the hall]539-the hall . “ [I]71-darrow do n’t know . But [Owen]75-owen seems so to rely on [you]97-anna , too---- ”[71-darrow] “ [Owen]75-owen ! Is [HE]2738-he to be [there]2294-there ? ”[97-anna] “ No . But [you]97-anna know [I]97-anna told [him]2738-he [he]2738-he could count on [you]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ But [I]71-darrow ’ve said to [[your]97-anna mother - in - law]2500-your mother - in - law all [I]71-darrow could . ”[71-darrow] “ Well , then [you]97-anna can only repeat it . ”[97-anna] This did not seem to [Darrow]71-darrow to simplify [his]71-darrow case as much as [she]97-anna appeared to think ; and once more [he]71-darrow had a movement of recoil . “ There ’s no possible reason for [my]71-darrow being mixed up in this affair ! ”[71-darrow] [Anna]97-anna gave [him]71-darrow a reproachful glance . “ Not the fact that [I]97-anna am ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna reminded [him]71-darrow ; but even this only stiffened [his]71-darrow resistance . “ Why should [you]71-darrow be , either -- to this extent ? ”[97-anna] The question made [her]97-anna pause . [She]97-anna glanced about [the hall]539-the hall , as if to be sure [they]1538-they had it to [themselves]1538-they ; and then , in a lowered voice : “ [I]97-anna do n’t know , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna suddenly confessed ; “ but , somehow , if [THEY’RE]1538-they not happy [I]97-anna feel as if [we]1538-they should n’t be . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , well-- ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow acquiesced , in the tone of [the man who perforce yields to so lovely an unreasonableness]1539-the man who perforce yields to so lovely an unreasonableness . Escape was , after all , impossible , and [he]71-darrow could only resign [himself]71-darrow to being led to [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s door . Within , among the bric - a - brac and furbelows , [he]71-darrow found [Miss Painter]138-miss painter seated in a redundant purple armchair with the incongruous air of [a horseman bestriding a heavy mount]1540-a horseman bestriding a heavy mount . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle sat opposite , still a little wan and disordered under [her]111-madame de chantelle elaborate hair , and clasping the handkerchief whose visibility symbolized [her]111-madame de chantelle distress . On [the young man]217-the young man ’s entrance [she]111-madame de chantelle sighed out a plaintive welcome , to which [she]111-madame de chantelle immediately appended : “ [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow , [I]111-madame de chantelle ca n’t help feeling that at heart [you]71-darrow ’re with [me]111-madame de chantelle ! ”[111-madame de chantelle] The directness of the challenge made it easier for [Darrow]71-darrow to protest , and [he]71-darrow reiterated [his]71-darrow inability to give an opinion on either side . “ But [Anna]97-anna declares [you]71-darrow have -- on [hers]97-anna ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow could not restrain a smile at this faint flaw in an impartiality so scrupulous . Every evidence of feminine inconsequence in [Anna]97-anna seemed to attest [her]97-anna deeper subjection to the most inconsequent of passions . [He]71-darrow had certainly promised [her]97-anna [his]71-darrow help -- but before [he]71-darrow knew what [he]71-darrow was promising . [He]71-darrow met [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s appeal by replying : “ If there were anything [I]71-darrow could possibly say [I]71-darrow should want it to be in [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s favour . ”[71-darrow] “ [You]71-darrow ’d want it to be -- yes ! [The poor old Duchess]2778-the poor old duchess is in a fearful state -- so afraid [her]2778-the poor old duchess son’ll lose [Mrs. Pond]147-mrs. pond ! When [I]138-miss painter think that [Gisele]146-gisele is [[old Bradford Wagstaff]148-old bradford wagstaff ’s grand - daughter]2779-old bradford wagstaff ’s grand - daughter , [I]138-miss painter ’m thankful [he]71-darrow ’s safe in [Mount Auburn]52-mount auburn ! ”[138-miss painter] XXII It was not until late that afternoon that [Darrow]71-darrow could claim [his]71-darrow postponed hour with [Anna]97-anna . When at last [he]71-darrow found [her]97-anna alone in [[her]97-anna sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room it was with a sense of liberation so great that [he]71-darrow sought no logical justification of it . [He]71-darrow simply felt that all [their]1548-their destinies were in [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s grasp , and that , resistance being useless , [he]71-darrow could only enjoy the sweets of surrender . [Anna]97-anna [herself]97-anna seemed as happy , and for more explicable reasons . [She]97-anna had assisted , after luncheon , at another debate between [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [[her]111-madame de chantelle confidant]1549-her confidant , and had surmised , when [she]97-anna withdrew from it , that victory was permanently perched on [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s banners . “ [I]138-miss painter do n’t know how [she]97-anna does it , unless it ’s by the dead weight of [her]97-anna convictions . [She]97-anna detests the French so that [she]97-anna ’d back up [Owen]75-owen even if [she]97-anna knew nothing -- or knew too much -- of [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . [She]97-anna somehow regards the match as a protest against the corruption of European morals . [I]138-miss painter told [Owen]75-owen that was [his]71-darrow great chance , and [he]71-darrow ’s made the most of it . ”[138-miss painter] “ What [a tactician]2780-a tactician [you]1550-i are ! [You]1550-i make [me]1550-i feel that [I]1550-i hardly know the rudiments of diplomacy , ”[1550-i] [Darrow]71-darrow smiled at [her]1550-i , abandoning [himself]71-darrow to a perilous sense of well - being . [She]1550-i gave [him]71-darrow back [his]71-darrow smile . “ [I]1550-i ’m afraid [I]1550-i think nothing short of [my]1550-i own happiness is worth wasting any diplomacy on ! ”[1550-i] “ That ’s why [I]71-darrow mean to resign from the service of [[my]71-darrow country]2781-my country , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow rejoined with a laugh of deep content . The feeling that both resistance and apprehension were vain was working like wine in [his]71-darrow veins . [He]71-darrow had done what [he]71-darrow could to deflect the course of events : now [he]71-darrow could only stand aside and take [his]71-darrow chance of safety . Underneath this fatalistic feeling was the deep sense of relief that [he]71-darrow had , after all , said and done nothing that could in the least degree affect the welfare of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . That fact took a millstone off [his]71-darrow neck . Meanwhile [he]71-darrow gave [himself]71-darrow up once more to the joy of [Anna]97-anna ’s presence . [They]1551-they had not been alone together for two long days , and [he]71-darrow had [the lover]1552-the lover ’s sense that [he]71-darrow had forgotten , or at least underestimated , the strength of the spell [she]97-anna cast . Once more [her]97-anna eyes and [her]97-anna smile seemed to bound [his]71-darrow world . [He]71-darrow felt that [their]1551-they light would always move with [him]71-darrow as the sunset moves before [a ship]1553-a ship at [sea]1554-sea . The next day [his]71-darrow sense of security was increased by a decisive incident . It became known to [the expectant household]1555-the expectant household that [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle had yielded to the tremendous impact of [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s determination and that [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had been “ sent for ”[111-madame de chantelle] to [the purple satin sitting - room]1556-the purple satin sitting - room . At luncheon , [Owen]75-owen ’s radiant countenance proclaimed the happy sequel , and [Darrow]71-darrow , when [the party]1484-the party had moved back to [the oak - room]1558-the oak - room for coffee , deemed it discreet to wander out alone to [the terrace]2399-the terrace with [his]71-darrow cigar . The conclusion of [Owen]75-owen ’s romance brought [his]71-darrow own plans once more to the front . [Anna]97-anna had promised that [she]97-anna would consider dates and settle details as soon as [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [[her]111-madame de chantelle grandson]1125-her grandson had been reconciled , and [Darrow]71-darrow was eager to go into the question at once , since it was necessary that the preparations for [his]71-darrow marriage should go forward as rapidly as possible . [Anna]97-anna , [he]71-darrow knew , would not seek any farther pretext for delay ; and [he]71-darrow strolled up and down contentedly in the sunshine , certain that [she]97-anna would come out and reassure [him]71-darrow as soon as [the reunited family]1074-the reunited family had claimed [its]1074-the reunited family due share of [her]97-anna attention . But when [she]97-anna finally joined [him]71-darrow [her]97-anna first word was for [the younger lovers]1562-the younger lovers . “ [I]97-anna want to thank [you]71-darrow for what [you]71-darrow ’ve done for [Owen]75-owen , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna began , with [her]97-anna happiest smile . “ Who -- [I]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow laughed . “ Are [you]97-anna confusing [me]71-darrow with [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ? ”[71-darrow] “ Perhaps [I]97-anna ought to say for [ME]97-anna , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna corrected [herself]97-anna . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve been even more of a help to [us]2782-us than [Adelaide]122-adelaide . ”[97-anna] “ [[My]71-darrow dear child]2441-my dear child ! What on earth have [I]71-darrow done ? ”[71-darrow] “ [You]71-darrow ’ve managed to hide from [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle that [you]71-darrow do n’t really like [poor Sophy]81-sophy viner . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow felt the pallour in [his]71-darrow cheek . “ Not like [her]81-sophy viner ? What put such an idea into [your]97-anna head ? ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , it ’s more than an idea -- it ’s a feeling . But what difference does it make , after all ? [You]71-darrow saw [her]81-sophy viner in such a different setting that it ’s natural [you]71-darrow should be a little doubtful . [You]1563-you do n’t know what a weight is off [my]1564-i mind ! With [Sophy]81-sophy viner here for good , [I]1564-i shall feel so differently about leaving [Effie]74-effie . [She]74-effie knows , of course , nothing of what ’s been happening ; and [I]1564-i want [her]74-effie to be told first about [YOU]1565-he . ”[1564-i] [Effie]74-effie , sought throughout [the house]581-the house , was presently traced to [the school - room]1079-the school - room , and [thither Darrow]71-darrow mounted with [Anna]97-anna . [He]1565-he had never seen [her]74-effie so alight with happiness , and [he]1565-he had caught [her]74-effie buoyancy of mood . [He]1565-he kept repeating to [himself]1565-he : “ It ’s over -- it ’s over , ”[1565-he] as if some monstrous midnight hallucination had been routed by the return of day . As [they]1568-they approached [the school - room]1079-the school - room door the terrier ’s barks came to [them]1568-they through laughing remonstrances . “ [She]74-effie ’s giving [him]71-darrow [his]71-darrow dinner , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna whispered , [her]97-anna hand in [Darrow]71-darrow ’s . “ Do n’t forget the gold - fish ! ”[97-anna] [they]1568-they heard another voice call out . [Darrow]71-darrow halted on the threshold . “ Oh -- not now ! ”[71-darrow] “ Not now ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna mean -- [she’d]74-effie rather have [you]71-darrow tell [her]74-effie first . [I]97-anna ’ll wait for [you]1568-they both [downstairs]1174-downstairs . ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow was aware that [she]97-anna glanced at [him]71-darrow intently . “ As [you]71-darrow please . [I]97-anna ’ll bring [her]74-effie down at once . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna opened the door , and as [she]97-anna went in [he]71-darrow heard [her]97-anna say : “ No , [Sophy]81-sophy viner , do n’t go ! [I]97-anna want [you]71-darrow both . ”[97-anna] The rest of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s day was a succession of empty and agitating scenes . On [his]71-darrow way down to [Givre]30-givre , before [he]71-darrow had seen [Effie Leath]74-effie , [he]71-darrow had pictured somewhat sentimentally the joy of the moment when [he]71-darrow should take [her]74-effie in [his]71-darrow arms and receive [her]74-effie first filial kiss . Everything in [him]71-darrow that egotistically craved for rest , stability , a comfortably organized middle - age , all the home - building instincts of [the man who has sufficiently wooed and wandered]1570-the man who has sufficiently wooed and wandered , combined to throw a charm about the figure of [the child who might -- who should -- have been [his]71-darrow]1571-the child who might -- who should -- have been his . [Effie]74-effie came to [him]71-darrow trailing the cloud of glory of [his]71-darrow first romance , giving [him]71-darrow back the magic hour [he]71-darrow had missed and mourned . And how different the realization of [his]71-darrow dream had been ! [The child]639-the child ’s radiant welcome , [her]639-the child unquestioning acceptance of , [this new figure in [the family group]1574-the family group]1573-this new figure in the family group , had been all that [he]71-darrow had hoped and fancied . If [Mother]149-mother was so awfully happy about it , and [Owen]75-owen and [Granny]150-granny , too , how nice and cosy and comfortable it was going to be for all of [them]1575-them , [her]639-the child beaming look seemed to say ; and then , suddenly , the small pink fingers [he]71-darrow had been kissing were laid on the one flaw in the circle , on the one point which must be settled before [Effie]74-effie could , with complete unqualified assurance , admit [the new - comer]1576-the new - comer to full equality with [the other gods of [her]639-the child Olympus]1577-the other gods of her olympus . “ And is [Sophy]81-sophy viner awfully happy about it too ? ”[639-the child] [she]639-the child had asked , loosening [her]639-the child hold on [Darrow]71-darrow ’s neck to tilt back [her]639-the child head and include [[her]639-the child mother]221-her mother in [her]639-the child questioning look . “ Why , dearest , did n’t [you]71-darrow see [she]639-the child was ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna had exclaimed , leaning to [the group]1240-the group with radiant eyes . “ [I]639-the child think [I]639-the child should like to ask [her]639-the child , ”[639-the child] [the child]639-the child rejoined , after a minute ’s shy consideration ; and as [Darrow]71-darrow set [her]639-the child down [[her]639-the child mother]221-her mother laughed : “ Do , [darling]2790-darling , do ! Run off at once , and tell [her]639-the child [we]1240-the group expect [her]639-the child to be awfully happy too . ”[221-her mother] The scene had been succeeded by others less poignant but almost as trying . [Darrow]71-darrow cursed [his]71-darrow luck in having , at such a moment , to run the gauntlet of [a houseful of [interested observers]1583-interested observers]1582-a houseful of interested observers . The state of being “ engaged ”[71-darrow] , in itself an absurd enough predicament , even to [a man only intermittently exposed]1584-a man only intermittently exposed , became intolerable under the continuous scrutiny of [a small circle quivering with participation]1585-a small circle quivering with participation . [Darrow]71-darrow was furthermore aware that , though the case of [the other couple]1586-the other couple ought to have made [his]71-darrow own less conspicuous , it was rather [they]1587-they who found a refuge in the shadow of [his]71-darrow prominence . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , though [she]111-madame de chantelle had consented to [Owen]75-owen ’s engagement and formally welcomed [[his]71-darrow betrothed]1486-his betrothed , was nevertheless not sorry to show , by [her]111-madame de chantelle reception of [Darrow]71-darrow , of what finely - shaded degrees of cordiality [she]111-madame de chantelle was capable . [Miss Painter]138-miss painter , having won the day for [Owen]75-owen , was also free to turn [her]138-miss painter attention to [the newer candidate for [her]138-miss painter sympathy]1589-the newer candidate for her sympathy ; and [Darrow]71-darrow and [Anna]97-anna found [themselves]1590-themselves immersed in a warm bath of sentimental curiosity . It was a relief to [Darrow]71-darrow that [he]71-darrow was under a positive obligation to end [his]71-darrow visit within the next forty - eight hours . When [he]71-darrow left [London]3-london , [[his]71-darrow Ambassador]1591-his ambassador had accorded [him]71-darrow a ten days ’ leave . [His]71-darrow fate being definitely settled and openly published [he]71-darrow had no reason for asking to have the time prolonged , and when it was over [he]71-darrow was to return to [his]71-darrow post till the time fixed for taking up [his]71-darrow new duties . [Anna]97-anna and [he]71-darrow had therefore decided to be married , in [Paris]10-paris , a day or two before the departure of [the steamer]2386-the steamer which was to take [them]1590-themselves to [South America]21-south america ; and [Anna]97-anna , shortly after [his]71-darrow return to [England]8-england , was to go up to [Paris]10-paris and begin [her]97-anna own preparations . In honour of the double betrothal [Effie]74-effie and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner were to appear that evening at dinner ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , on leaving [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room , met [the little girl]858-the little girl springing down [the stairs]1007-the stairs , [her]858-the little girl white ruffles and coral - coloured bows making [her]858-the little girl look like a daisy with [her]858-the little girl yellow hair for its centre . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner was behind [her]81-sophy viner pupil , and as [she]858-the little girl came into the light [Darrow]71-darrow noticed a change in [her]858-the little girl appearance and wondered vaguely why [she]858-the little girl looked suddenly younger , more vivid , more like the little luminous ghost of [his]71-darrow [Paris]10-paris memories . Then it occurred to [him]71-darrow that it was the first time [she]858-the little girl had appeared at dinner since [his]71-darrow arrival at [Givre]30-givre , and the first time , consequently , that [he]71-darrow had seen [her]858-the little girl in evening dress . [She]858-the little girl was still at the age when the least adornment embellishes ; and no doubt the mere uncovering of [her]858-the little girl young throat and neck had given [her]858-the little girl back [her]858-the little girl former brightness . But a second glance showed a more precise reason for [his]71-darrow impression . Vaguely though [he]71-darrow retained such details , [he]71-darrow felt sure [she]858-the little girl was wearing the dress [he]71-darrow had seen [her]858-the little girl in every evening in [Paris]10-paris . It was a simple enough dress , black , and transparent on the arms and shoulders , and [he]71-darrow would probably not have recognized it if [she]858-the little girl had not called [his]71-darrow attention to it in [Paris]10-paris by confessing that [she]858-the little girl had n’t any other . “ The same dress ? That proves that [she]858-the little girl ’s forgotten ! ”[858-the little girl] was [his]71-darrow first half - ironic thought ; but the next moment , with a pang of compunction , [he]71-darrow said to [himself]71-darrow that [she]858-the little girl had probably put it on for the same reason as before : simply because [she]858-the little girl had n’t any other . [He]71-darrow looked at [her]858-the little girl in silence , and for an instant , above [Effie]74-effie ’s bobbing head , [she]858-the little girl gave [him]71-darrow back [his]71-darrow look in a full bright gaze . “ Oh , there ’s [Owen]75-owen ! ”[74-effie] [Effie]74-effie cried , and whirled away down [the gallery]1364-the gallery to the door from which [[her]858-the little girl step - brother]1442-her step - brother was emerging . As [Owen]75-owen bent to catch [her]858-the little girl , [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner turned abruptly back to [Darrow]71-darrow . “ [You]71-darrow , too ? ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said with a quick laugh . “ [I]81-sophy viner did n’t know---- ”[81-sophy viner] And as [Owen]75-owen came up to [them]1598-them [she]81-sophy viner added , in a tone that might have been meant to reach [his]71-darrow ear : “ [I]81-sophy viner wish [you]71-darrow all the luck that [we]1598-them can spare ! ”[81-sophy viner] About the dinner - table , which [Effie]74-effie , with [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s aid , had lavishly garlanded , [the little party]1599-the little party had an air of somewhat self - conscious festivity . In spite of flowers , champagne and a unanimous attempt at ease , there were frequent lapses in the talk , and moments of nervous groping for new subjects . [Miss Painter]138-miss painter alone seemed not only unaffected by the general perturbation but as tightly sealed up in [her]138-miss painter unconsciousness of it as a diver in [his]71-darrow bell . To [Darrow]71-darrow ’s strained attention even [Owen]75-owen ’s gusts of gaiety seemed to betray an inward sense of insecurity . After dinner , however , at the piano , [he]71-darrow broke into a mood of extravagant hilarity and flooded [the room]663-the room with the splash and ripple of [his]71-darrow music . [Darrow]71-darrow , sunk in a sofa corner in the lee of [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s granite bulk , smoked and listened in silence , [his]71-darrow eyes moving from [one figure]1601-one figure to another . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , in [her]111-madame de chantelle armchair near the fire , clasped [[her]111-madame de chantelle little granddaughter]1602-her little granddaughter to [her]111-madame de chantelle with the gesture of a drawing - room [Niobe]151-niobe , and [Anna]97-anna , seated near [them]1603-them , had fallen into one of the attitudes of vivid calm which seemed to [Darrow]71-darrow to express [her]111-madame de chantelle inmost quality . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , after moving uncertainly about [the room]663-the room , had placed [herself]81-sophy viner beyond [Mrs. Leath]75-owen , in a chair near the piano , where [she]81-sophy viner sat with head thrown back and eyes attached to [the musician]1605-the musician , in the same rapt fixity of attention with which [she]81-sophy viner had followed [the players at the Francais]1606-the players at the francais . The accident of [her]81-sophy viner having fallen into the same attitude , and of [her]81-sophy viner wearing the same dress , gave [Darrow]71-darrow , as [he]71-darrow watched [her]81-sophy viner , a strange sense of double consciousness . To escape from it , [his]71-darrow glance turned back to [Anna]97-anna ; but from the point at which [he]71-darrow was placed [his]71-darrow eyes could not take in the one face without the other , and that renewed the disturbing duality of the impression . Suddenly [Owen]75-owen broke off with a crash of chords and jumped to [his]71-darrow feet . “ What ’s the use of this , with such a moon to say it for [us]2791-us ? ”[75-owen] Behind the uncurtained window a low golden orb hung like a ripe fruit against the glass . “ Yes -- let ’s go out and listen , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna answered . [Owen]75-owen threw open the window , and with [his]71-darrow gesture a fold of the heavy star - sprinkled sky seemed to droop into [the room]663-the room like a drawn - in curtain . The air that entered with it had a frosty edge , and [Anna]97-anna bade [Effie]74-effie run to [the hall]539-the hall for wraps . [Darrow]71-darrow said : “ [You]97-anna must have one too , ”[71-darrow] and started toward the door ; but [Sophy]81-sophy viner , following [[her]81-sophy viner pupil]1164-her pupil , cried back : “ [We]1138-the three ’ll bring things for [everybody]312-everybody . ”[81-sophy viner] [Owen]75-owen had followed [her]81-sophy viner , and in a moment [the three]1138-the three reappeared , and [the party]1484-the party went out on [the terrace]2399-the terrace . The deep blue purity of the night was unveiled by mist , and the moonlight rimmed the edges of the trees with a silver blur and blanched to unnatural whiteness the statues against [their]1138-the three walls of shade . [Darrow]71-darrow and [Anna]97-anna , with [Effie]74-effie between [them]1138-the three , strolled to [the farther corner of [the terrace]2399-the terrace]1613-the farther corner of the terrace . Below [them]1138-the three , between the fringes of [the park]765-the park , [the lawn]1616-the lawn sloped dimly to [the fields above [the river]503-the river]1617-the fields above the river . For a few minutes [they]1138-the three stood silently side by side , touched to peace beneath the trembling beauty of the sky . When [they]1138-the three turned back , [Darrow]71-darrow saw that [Owen]75-owen and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , who had gone down the steps to [the garden]222-the garden , were also walking in the direction of [the house]581-the house . As [they]1138-the three advanced , [Sophy]81-sophy viner paused in a patch of moonlight , between the sharp shadows of the yews , and [Darrow]71-darrow noticed that [she]81-sophy viner had thrown over [her]81-sophy viner shoulders a long cloak of some light colour , which suddenly evoked [her]81-sophy viner image as [she]81-sophy viner had entered [the restaurant at [his]71-darrow side]1621-the restaurant at his side on the night of [their]1138-the three first dinner in [Paris]10-paris . A moment later [they]1138-the three were all together again on [the terrace]2399-the terrace , and when [they]1138-the three re - entered [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room [the older ladies]1624-the older ladies were on [their]1624-the older ladies way to bed . [Effie]74-effie , emboldened by the privileges of the evening , was for coaxing [Owen]75-owen to round it off with a game of forfeits or some such reckless climax ; but [Sophy]81-sophy viner , resuming [her]81-sophy viner professional role , sounded the summons to bed . In [[her]81-sophy viner pupil]1164-her pupil ’s wake [she]81-sophy viner made [her]81-sophy viner round of good - nights ; but when [she]81-sophy viner proffered [her]81-sophy viner hand to [Anna]97-anna , [the latter]231-the latter ignoring the gesture held out both arms . “ Good - night , [dear child]2793-dear child , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said impulsively , and drew [the girl]297-the girl to [her]81-sophy viner kiss . BOOK IV XXIII The next day was [Darrow]71-darrow ’s last at [Givre]30-givre and , foreseeing that the afternoon and evening would have to be given to [the family]871-the family , [he]71-darrow had asked [Anna]97-anna to devote an early hour to the final consideration of [their]1629-their plans . [He]71-darrow was to meet [her]97-anna in [the brown sitting - room]1630-the brown sitting - room at ten , and [they]1629-their were to walk down to [the river]503-the river and talk over [their]1629-their future in [the little pavilion abutting on the wall of [the park]765-the park]1632-the little pavilion abutting on the wall of the park . It was just a week since [his]71-darrow arrival at [Givre]30-givre , and [Anna]97-anna wished , before [he]71-darrow left , to return to [the place where [they]1629-their had sat on [their]1629-their first afternoon together]1634-the place where they had sat on their first afternoon together . [Her]97-anna sensitiveness to the appeal of inanimate things , to the colour and texture of whatever wove itself into the substance of [her]97-anna emotion , made [her]97-anna want to hear [Darrow]71-darrow ’s voice , and to feel [his]71-darrow eyes on [her]97-anna , in the spot where bliss had first flowed into [her]97-anna heart . That bliss , in the interval , had wound itself into every fold of [her]97-anna being . Passing , in the first days , from a high shy tenderness to the rush of a secret surrender , it had gradually widened and deepened , to flow on in redoubled beauty . [She]97-anna thought [she]97-anna now knew exactly how and why [she]97-anna loved [Darrow]71-darrow , and [she]97-anna could see [her]97-anna whole sky reflected in the deep and tranquil current of [her]97-anna love . Early the next day , in [[her]97-anna sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room , [she]97-anna was glancing through the letters which it was [Effie]74-effie ’s morning privilege to carry up to [her]97-anna . [Effie]74-effie meanwhile circled inquisitively about [the room]663-the room , where there was always something new to engage [her]74-effie infant fancy ; and [Anna]97-anna , looking up , saw [her]74-effie suddenly arrested before a photograph of [Darrow]71-darrow which , the day before , had taken its place on the writing - table . [Anna]97-anna held out [her]97-anna arms with a faint blush . “ [You]74-effie do like [him]71-darrow , do n’t [you]74-effie , [dear]2291-dear ? ”[97-anna] “ Oh , most awfully , [dearest]2795-dearest , ”[74-effie] [Effie]74-effie , against [her]97-anna breast , leaned back to assure [her]97-anna with a limpid look . “ And so do [Granny]150-granny and [Owen]75-owen -- and [I]74-effie DO think [Sophy]81-sophy viner does too , ”[74-effie] [she]74-effie added , after a moment ’s earnest pondering . “ [I]74-effie hope so , ”[74-effie] [Anna]97-anna laughed . [She]97-anna checked the impulse to continue : “ Has [she]150-granny talked to [you]74-effie about [him]71-darrow , that [you]74-effie ’re so sure ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna did not know what had made the question spring to [her]97-anna lips , but [she]97-anna was glad [she]97-anna had closed them before pronouncing it . Nothing could have been more distasteful to [her]97-anna than to clear up such obscurities by turning on them the tiny flame of [[her]97-anna daughter]1136-her daughter ’s observation . And what , after all , now that [Owen]75-owen ’s happiness was secured , did it matter if there were certain reserves in [Darrow]71-darrow ’s approval of [his]71-darrow marriage ? A knock on the door made [Anna]97-anna glance at the clock . “ There ’s [Nurse]135-nurse to carry [you]74-effie off . ”[97-anna] “ It ’s [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s knock , ”[858-the little girl] [the little girl]858-the little girl answered , jumping down to open the door ; and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner in fact stood on the threshold . “ Come in , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna said with a smile , instantly remarking how pale [she]858-the little girl looked . “ May [Effie]74-effie go out for a turn with [Nurse]2585-nurse ? ”[297-the girl] [the girl]297-the girl asked . “ [I]297-the girl should like to speak to [you]81-sophy viner a moment . ”[297-the girl] “ Of course . This ought to be [YOUR]81-sophy viner holiday , as yesterday was [Effie]74-effie ’s . Run off , [dear]2291-dear , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna added , stooping to kiss [the little girl]858-the little girl . When the door had closed [she]97-anna turned back to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner with a look that sought [her]97-anna confidence . “ [I]97-anna ’m so glad [you]81-sophy viner came , [[my]97-anna dear]2464-my dear . [We]2799-we ’ve got so many things to talk about , just [you]81-sophy viner and [I]97-anna together . ”[97-anna] The confused intercourse of the last days had , in fact , left little time for any speech with [Sophy]81-sophy viner but such as related to [her]81-sophy viner marriage and the means of overcoming [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s opposition to it . [Anna]97-anna had exacted of [Owen]75-owen that [no one]325-no one , not even [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , should be given a hint of [her]81-sophy viner own projects till all contingent questions had been disposed of . [She]97-anna had felt , from the outset , a secret reluctance to intrude [her]97-anna securer happiness on the doubts and fears of [the young pair]1642-the young pair . From the sofa - corner to which [she]97-anna had dropped back [she]97-anna pointed to [Darrow]71-darrow ’s chair . “ Come and sit by [me]97-anna , [dear]2291-dear . [I]97-anna wanted to see [you]2291-dear alone . There ’s so much to say that [I]97-anna hardly know where to begin . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna leaned forward , [her]97-anna hands clasped on the arms of the sofa , [her]97-anna eyes bent smilingly on [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s . As [she]97-anna did so , [she]97-anna noticed that [the girl]297-the girl ’s unusual pallour was partly due to the slight veil of powder on [her]297-the girl face . The discovery was distinctly disagreeable . [Anna]97-anna had never before noticed , on [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s part , any recourse to cosmetics , and , much as [she]97-anna wished to think [herself]97-anna exempt from old - fashioned prejudices , [she]97-anna suddenly became aware that [she]97-anna did not like [[her]97-anna daughter]1136-her daughter ’s governess to have a powdered face . Then [she]97-anna reflected that [the girl who sat opposite [her]97-anna]1645-the girl who sat opposite her was no longer [[Effie]74-effie ’s governess]2656-effie ’s governess , but [[her]97-anna own future daughter - in - law]1647-her own future daughter - in - law ; and [she]97-anna wondered whether [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had chosen this odd way of celebrating [her]297-the girl independence , and whether , as [Mrs. Owen Leath]75-owen , [she]82-miss viner would present to [the world]206-the world a bedizened countenance . This idea was scarcely less distasteful than the other , and for a moment [Anna]97-anna continued to consider [her]1136-her daughter without speaking . Then , in a flash , the truth came to [her]97-anna : [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had powdered [her]82-miss viner face because [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had been crying . [Anna]97-anna leaned forward impulsively . “ [[My]97-anna dear child]2441-my dear child , what ’s the matter ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna saw [the girl]297-the girl ’s blood rush up under the white mask , and hastened on : “ Please do n’t be afraid to tell [me]97-anna . [I]97-anna do so want [you]2441-my dear child to feel that [you]2441-my dear child can trust [me]97-anna as [Owen]75-owen does . And [you]2441-my dear child know [you]2441-my dear child must n’t mind if , just at first , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle occasionally relapses . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna spoke eagerly , persuasively , almost on a note of pleading . [She]97-anna had , in truth , so many reasons for wanting [Sophy]81-sophy viner to like [her]97-anna : [her]97-anna love for [Owen]75-owen , [her]97-anna solicitude for [Effie]74-effie , and [her]97-anna own sense of [the girl]297-the girl ’s fine mettle . [She]97-anna had always felt a romantic and almost humble admiration for [those members of [her]97-anna sex who , from force of will , or the constraint of circumstances , had plunged into the conflict from which fate had so persistently excluded [her]97-anna]1651-those members of her sex who , from force of will , or the constraint of circumstances , had plunged into the conflict from which fate had so persistently excluded her . There were even moments when [she]97-anna fancied [herself]97-anna vaguely to blame for [her]97-anna immunity , and felt that [she]97-anna ought somehow to have affronted the perils and hardships which refused to come to [her]97-anna . And now , as [she]97-anna sat looking at [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , so small , so slight , so visibly defenceless and undone , [she]97-anna still felt , through all the superiority of [her]97-anna worldly advantages and [her]97-anna seeming maturity , the same odd sense of ignorance and inexperience . [She]97-anna could not have said what there was in [the girl]297-the girl ’s manner and expression to give [her]97-anna this feeling , but [she]97-anna was reminded , as [she]97-anna looked at [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , of [the other girls [she]97-anna had known in [her]97-anna youth]1653-the other girls she had known in her youth , [the girls who seemed possessed of a secret [she]97-anna had missed]1654-the girls who seemed possessed of a secret she had missed . Yes , [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had [their]1653-the other girls she had known in her youth look -- almost the obscurely menacing look of [Kitty Mayne]113-kitty mayne ... [Anna]97-anna , with an inward smile , brushed aside the image of [this forgotten rival]1655-this forgotten rival . But [she]97-anna had felt , deep down , a twinge of the old pain , and [she]97-anna was sorry that , even for the flash of a thought , [[Owen]75-owen ’s betrothed]1656-owen ’s betrothed should have reminded [her]97-anna of so different [a woman]406-a woman ... [She]97-anna laid [her]97-anna hand on [the girl]297-the girl ’s . “ When [[his]1656-owen ’s betrothed grandmother]991-his grandmother sees how happy [Owen]75-owen is [she]991-his grandmother ’ll be quite happy [herself]991-his grandmother . If it ’s only that , do n’t be distressed . Just trust to [Owen]75-owen -- and the future . ”[97-anna] [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , with an almost imperceptible recoil of [[her]81-sophy viner whole slight person]1659-her whole slight person , had drawn [her]81-sophy viner hand from under the palm enclosing it . “ That ’s what [I]81-sophy viner wanted to talk to [you]97-anna about -- the future . ”[81-sophy viner] “ Of course ! [We]2803-we ’ve all so many plans to make -- and to fit into each other ’s . Please let ’s begin with [yours]97-anna . ”[297-the girl] [The girl]297-the girl paused a moment , [her]297-the girl hands clasped on the arms of [her]297-the girl chair , [her]297-the girl lids dropped under [Anna]97-anna ’s gaze ; then [she]297-the girl said : “ [I]297-the girl should like to make no plans at all ... just yet ... ”[297-the girl] “ No plans ? ”[297-the girl] “ No -- [I]297-the girl should like to go away ... [[my]297-the girl friends]2804-my friends [the Farlows]94-the farlows would let [me]297-the girl go to [them]2804-my friends ... ”[297-the girl] [Her]297-the girl voice grew firmer and [she]297-the girl lifted [her]297-the girl eyes to add : “ [I]297-the girl should like to leave today , if [you]97-anna do n’t mind . ”[297-the girl] [Anna]97-anna listened with a rising wonder . “ [You]297-the girl want to leave [Givre]30-givre at once ? ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl gave the idea a moment ’s swift consideration . “ [You]297-the girl prefer to be with [[your]297-the girl friends]2337-your friends till [your]297-the girl marriage ? [I]297-the girl understand that -- but surely [you]297-the girl need n’t rush off today ? There are so many details to discuss ; and before long , [you]297-the girl know , [I]297-the girl shall be going away too . ”[297-the girl] “ Yes , [I]297-the girl know . ”[297-the girl] [The girl]297-the girl was evidently trying to steady [her]297-the girl voice . “ But [I]297-the girl should like to wait a few days -- to have a little more time to [myself]297-the girl . ”[297-the girl] [Anna]97-anna continued to consider [her]297-the girl kindly . It was evident that [she]297-the girl did not care to say why [she]297-the girl wished to leave [Givre]30-givre so suddenly , but [her]297-the girl disturbed face and shaken voice betrayed a more pressing motive than the natural desire to spend the weeks before [her]297-the girl marriage under [[her]297-the girl old friends]1662-her old friends ’ roof . Since [she]297-the girl had made no response to the allusion to [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , [Anna]97-anna could but conjecture that [she]297-the girl had had a passing disagreement with [Owen]75-owen ; and if this were so , random interference might do more harm than good . “ [[My]297-the girl dear child]2441-my dear child , if [you]2441-my dear child really want to go at once [I]297-the girl sha’n’t , of course , urge [you]2441-my dear child to stay . [I]297-the girl suppose [you]2441-my dear child have spoken to [Owen]75-owen ? ”[297-the girl] “ No . Not yet ... ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna threw an astonished glance at [her]297-the girl . “ [You]2441-my dear child mean to say [you]2441-my dear child have n’t told [him]2807-him ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna wanted to tell [you]2441-my dear child first . [I]97-anna thought [I]97-anna ought to , on account of [Effie]74-effie . ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna look cleared as [she]97-anna put forth this reason . “ Oh , [Effie!--]152-effie!-- ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna ’s smile brushed away the scruple . “ [Owen]75-owen has a right to ask that [you]2441-my dear child should consider [him]2807-him before [you]2441-my dear child think of [[his]2807-him sister]2808-his sister ... Of course [you]2441-my dear child shall do just as [you]2441-my dear child wish , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna went on , after another thoughtful interval . “ Oh , thank [you]97-anna , ”[97-anna] [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner murmured and rose to [her]81-sophy viner feet . [Anna]97-anna rose also , vaguely seeking for some word that should break down [the girl]297-the girl ’s resistance . “ [You]81-sophy viner ’ll tell [Owen]75-owen at once ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna finally asked . [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , instead of replying , stood before [her]97-anna in manifest uncertainty , and as [she]82-miss viner did so there was a light tap on the door , and [Owen Leath]75-owen walked into [the room]663-the room . [Anna]97-anna ’s first glance told [her]97-anna that [his]1665-his face was unclouded . [He]1665-his met [her]97-anna greeting with [his]1665-his happiest smile and turned to lift [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s hand to [his]1665-his lips . The perception that [he]1665-his was utterly unconscious of any cause for [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s agitation came to [[his]1665-his step - mother]233-his step - mother with a sharp thrill of surprise . “ [Darrow]71-darrow ’s looking for [you]97-anna , ”[1665-his] [he]1665-his said to [her]97-anna . “ [He]71-darrow asked [me]1665-his to remind [you]97-anna that [you]97-anna ’d promised to go for a walk with [him]71-darrow . ”[1665-his] [Anna]97-anna glanced at the clock . “ [I]97-anna ’ll go down presently . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna waited and looked again at [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , whose troubled eyes seemed to commit their message to [her]97-anna . “ [You]97-anna ’d better tell [Owen]75-owen , [[my]81-sophy viner dear]2464-my dear . ”[81-sophy viner] [Owen]75-owen ’s look also turned on [the girl]297-the girl . “ Tell [me]75-owen what ? Why , what ’s happened ? ”[75-owen] [Anna]97-anna summoned a laugh to ease the vague tension of the moment . “ Do n’t look so startled ! Nothing , except that [Sophy]81-sophy viner proposes to desert [us]2810-us for a while for [the Farlows]94-the farlows . ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen ’s brow cleared . “ [I]1668-his was afraid [she]297-the girl ’d run off before long . ”[1668-his] [He]1668-his glanced at [Anna]97-anna . “ Do please keep [her]297-the girl here as long as [you]97-anna can ! ”[1668-his] [Sophy]81-sophy viner intervened : “ [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s already given [me]81-sophy viner leave to go . ”[81-sophy viner] “ Already ? To go when ? ”[81-sophy viner] “ Today , ”[81-sophy viner] said [Sophy]81-sophy viner in a low tone , [her]81-sophy viner eyes on [Anna]97-anna ’s . “ Today ? Why on earth should [you]1668-his go today ? ”[81-sophy viner] [Owen]75-owen dropped back a step or two , flushing and paling under [his]1668-his bewildered frown . [His]1668-his eyes seemed to search [the girl]297-the girl more closely . “ Something ’s happened . ”[1668-his] [He]1668-his too looked at [[his]1668-his step - mother]233-his step - mother . “ [I]1668-his suppose [she]297-the girl must have told [you]97-anna what it is ? ”[1668-his] [Anna]97-anna was struck by the suddenness and vehemence of [his]1668-his appeal . It was as though some smouldering apprehension had lain close under the surface of [his]1668-his security . “ [She]297-the girl ’s told [me]75-owen nothing except that [she]297-the girl wishes to be with [[her]297-the girl friends]460-her friends . It ’s quite natural that [she]297-the girl should want to go to [them]460-her friends . ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen visibly controlled [himself]75-owen . “ Of course -- quite natural . ”[1668-his] [He]1668-his spoke to [Sophy]81-sophy viner . “ But why did n’t [you]81-sophy viner tell [me]1668-his so ? Why did [you]81-sophy viner come first to [[my]1668-his step - mother]2812-my step - mother ? ”[1668-his] [Anna]97-anna intervened with [her]97-anna calm smile . “ That seems to [me]97-anna quite natural , too . [Sophy]81-sophy viner was considerate enough to tell [me]97-anna first because of [Effie]74-effie . ”[97-anna] [He]1668-his weighed it . “ Very well , then : that ’s quite natural , as [you]97-anna say . And of course [she]74-effie must do exactly as [she]74-effie pleases . ”[1668-his] [He]1668-his still kept [his]1668-his eyes on [the girl]297-the girl . “ Tomorrow , ”[1668-his] [he]1668-his abruptly announced , “ [I]1668-his shall go up to [Paris]10-paris to see [you]297-the girl . ”[1668-his] “ Oh , no -- no ! ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl protested . [Owen]75-owen turned back to [Anna]97-anna . “ NOW do [you]97-anna say that nothing ’s happened ? ”[75-owen] Under the influence of [his]1668-his agitation [Anna]97-anna felt a vague tightening of the heart . [She]97-anna seemed to [herself]97-anna like some one in [a dark room about whom unseen presences are groping]1672-a dark room about whom unseen presences are groping . “ If it ’s anything that [Sophy]81-sophy viner wishes to tell [you]97-anna , no doubt [she]81-sophy viner ’ll do so . [I]97-anna ’m going down now , and [I]97-anna ’ll leave [you]97-anna here to talk it over by [yourselves]97-anna . ”[97-anna] As [she]97-anna moved to the door [the girl]297-the girl caught up with [her]97-anna . “ But there ’s nothing to tell : why should there be ? [I]297-the girl ’ve explained that [I]297-the girl simply want to be quiet . ”[297-the girl] [Her]297-the girl look seemed to detain [Mrs. Leath]75-owen . [Owen]75-owen broke in : “ Is that why [I]75-owen may n’t go up tomorrow ? ”[75-owen] “ Not tomorrow ! ”[297-the girl] “ Then when may [I]297-the girl ? ”[297-the girl] “ Later ... in a little while ... a few days ... ”[75-owen] “ In how many days ? ”[297-the girl] “ [Owen]75-owen ! ”[297-the girl] [[his]1674-he step - mother]233-his step - mother interposed ; but [he]1674-he seemed no longer aware of [her]233-his step - mother . “ If [you]297-the girl go away today , the day that [our]1367-the two engagement ’s made known , it ’s only fair , ”[1674-he] [he]1674-he persisted , “ that [you]297-the girl should tell [me]1674-he when [I]1674-he am to see [you]297-the girl . ”[1674-he] [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s eyes wavered between [the two]1367-the two and dropped down wearily . “ It ’s [you]297-the girl who are not fair -- when [I]81-sophy viner ’ve said [I]81-sophy viner wanted to be quiet . ”[81-sophy viner] “ But why should [my]81-sophy viner coming disturb [you]297-the girl ? [I]81-sophy viner ’m not asking now to come tomorrow . Is n’t that what [you]75-owen ’re going away for ? ”[1677-his] [Anna]97-anna felt the contagion of [his]1677-his excitement . [She]97-anna looked at [Sophy]81-sophy viner , who stood motionless , [her]81-sophy viner lips set , [her]81-sophy viner whole face drawn to a silent fixity of resistance . “ [You]97-anna ought to speak , [[my]81-sophy viner dear]2464-my dear -- [you]97-anna ought to answer [him]1677-his . ”[81-sophy viner] “ [I]97-anna only ask [him]1677-his to wait---- ”[97-anna] “ Yes , ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen , broke in , “ and [you]97-anna wo n’t say how long ! ”[371-both] [Both]371-both instinctively addressed [themselves]371-both to [Anna]97-anna , who stood , nearly as shaken as [themselves]371-both , between the double shock of [their]371-both struggle . [She]97-anna looked again from [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s inscrutable eyes to [Owen]75-owen ’s stormy features ; then [she]97-anna said : “ What can [I]97-anna do , when there ’s clearly something between [you]75-owen that [I]97-anna do n’t know about ? ”[97-anna] “ Oh , if it WERE between [us]371-both ! Ca n’t [you]75-owen see it ’s outside of [us]371-both -- outside of [her]233-his step - mother , dragging at [her]233-his step - mother , dragging [her]233-his step - mother away from [me]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen wheeled round again upon [[his]1683-him step - mother]233-his step - mother . [Anna]97-anna turned from [him]1683-him to [the girl]297-the girl . “ Is it true that [you]75-owen want to break [your]75-owen engagement ? If [you]75-owen do , [you]75-owen ought to tell [him]1683-him now . ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen burst into a laugh . “ [She]233-his step - mother does n’t dare to -- [she]233-his step - mother ’s afraid [I]75-owen ’ll guess the reason ! ”[75-owen] A faint sound escaped from [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s lips , but [she]81-sophy viner kept them close on whatever answer [she]81-sophy viner had ready . “ If [she]233-his step - mother does n’t wish to marry [you]1686-you , why should [she]233-his step - mother be afraid to have [you]1686-you know the reason ? ”[81-sophy viner] “ [She]233-his step - mother ’s afraid to have [YOU]1686-you know it -- not [me]81-sophy viner ! ”[81-sophy viner] “ To have [ME]1686-you know it ? ”[1686-you] [He]1686-you laughed again , and [Anna]97-anna , at [his]1686-you laugh , felt a sudden rush of indignation . “ [Owen]75-owen , [you]75-owen must explain what [you]75-owen mean ! ”[1686-you] [He]1686-you looked at [her]97-anna hard before answering ; then : “ Ask [Darrow]71-darrow ! ”[1686-you] [he]1686-you said . “ [Owen]75-owen -- [Owen]75-owen ! ”[1686-you] [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner murmured . [XXIV Anna]97-anna stood looking from one to the other . It had become apparent to [her]97-anna in a flash that [Owen]75-owen ’s retort , though it startled [Sophy]81-sophy viner , did not take [her]97-anna by surprise ; and the discovery shot its light along dark distances of fear . The immediate inference was that [Owen]75-owen had guessed the reason of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s disapproval of [his]71-darrow marriage , or that , at least , [he]71-darrow suspected [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner of knowing and dreading it . This confirmation of [her]97-anna own obscure doubt sent a tremor of alarm through [Anna]97-anna . For a moment [she]97-anna felt like exclaiming : “ All this is really no business of [mine]97-anna , and [I]97-anna refuse to have [you]81-sophy viner mix [me]97-anna up in it-- ”[97-anna] but [her]97-anna secret fear held [her]97-anna fast . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner was the first to speak . “ [I]81-sophy viner should like to go now , ”[81-sophy viner] [she]81-sophy viner said in a low voice , taking a few steps toward the door . [Her]81-sophy viner tone woke [Anna]97-anna to the sense of [her]97-anna own share in the situation . “ [I]97-anna quite agree with [you]97-anna , [[my]97-anna dear]2464-my dear , that it ’s useless to carry on this discussion . But since [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow ’s name has been brought into it , for reasons which [I]97-anna fail to guess , [I]97-anna want to tell [you]97-anna that [you]97-anna ’re both mistaken if [you]97-anna think [he]71-darrow ’s not in sympathy with [your]97-anna marriage . If that ’s what [Owen]75-owen means to imply , the idea ’s a complete delusion . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna spoke the words deliberately and incisively , as if hoping that the sound of their utterance would stifle the whisper in [her]97-anna bosom . [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s only answer was a vague murmur , and a movement that brought [her]97-anna nearer to the door ; but before [she]97-anna could reach it [Owen]75-owen had placed [himself]75-owen in [her]97-anna way . “ [I]1687-i do n’t mean to imply what [you]97-anna think , ”[1687-i] [he]1687-i said , addressing [[his]1687-i step - mother]233-his step - mother but keeping [his]1687-i eyes on [the girl]297-the girl . “ [I]1687-i do n’t say [Darrow]71-darrow does n’t like [our]2817-our marriage ; [I]1687-i say it ’s [Sophy]81-sophy viner who ’s hated it since [Darrow]71-darrow ’s been [here]2403-here ! ”[1687-i] [He]1687-i brought out the charge in a tone of forced composure , but [his]1687-i lips were white and [he]1687-i grasped the doorknob to hide the tremor of [his]1687-i hand . [Anna]97-anna ’s anger surged up with [her]97-anna fears . “ [You]1687-i ’re absurd , [Owen]75-owen ! [I]1687-i do n’t know why [I]1687-i listen to [you]75-owen . Why should [Sophy]81-sophy viner dislike [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow , and if [she]81-sophy viner does , why should that have anything to do with [her]81-sophy viner wishing to break [her]81-sophy viner engagement ? ”[1687-i] “ [I]798-a man do n’t say [she]81-sophy viner dislikes [him]71-darrow ! [I]798-a man do n’t say [she]81-sophy viner likes [him]71-darrow ; [I]798-a man do n’t know what it is [they]1691-they say to [each other]177-each other when [they]1691-they ’re shut up together alone . ”[798-a man] “ Shut up together alone ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna stared . [Owen]75-owen seemed like [a man]798-a man in delirium ; such an exhibition was degrading to [them]1691-they all . But [he]798-a man pushed on without seeing [her]97-anna look . “ Yes -- the first evening [she]81-sophy viner came , in [the study]1204-the study ; the next morning , early , in [the park]765-the park ; yesterday , again , in the spring - house , when [you]2822-you were at [the lodge]1423-the lodge with [the doctor]1434-the doctor ... [I]798-a man do n’t know what [they]1691-they say to [each other]177-each other , but [they]1691-they ’ve taken every chance [they]1691-they could to say it ... and to say it when [they]1691-they thought that [no one]325-no one saw [them]1691-they . ”[798-a man] [Anna]97-anna longed to silence [him]798-a man , but no words came to [her]97-anna . It was as though all [her]97-anna confused apprehensions had suddenly taken definite shape . There was “ something”--yes[798-a man] , there was “ something”[798-a man] ... [Darrow]71-darrow ’s reticences and evasions had been more than a figment of [her]97-anna doubts . The next instant brought a recoil of pride . [She]97-anna turned indignantly on [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son . “ [I]97-anna do n’t half understand what [you]798-a man ’ve been saying ; but what [you]798-a man seem to hint is so preposterous , and so insulting both to [Sophy]81-sophy viner and to [me]97-anna , that [I]97-anna see no reason why [we]2827-we should listen to [you]798-a man any longer . ”[97-anna] Though [her]97-anna tone steadied [Owen]75-owen , [she]97-anna perceived at once that it would not deflect [him]798-a man from [his]798-a man purpose . [He]798-a man spoke less vehemently , but with all the more precision . “ How can it be preposterous , since it ’s true ? Or insulting , since [I]798-a man do n’t know , any more than [YOU]798-a man , the meaning of what [I]798-a man ’ve been seeing ? If [you]798-a man ’ll be patient with [me]798-a man [I]798-a man ’ll try to put it quietly . What [I]798-a man mean is that [Sophy]81-sophy viner has completely changed since [she]81-sophy viner met [Darrow]71-darrow here , and that , having noticed the change , [I]798-a man ’m hardly to blame for having tried to find out its cause . ”[798-a man] [Anna]97-anna made an effort to answer [him]798-a man with the same composure . “ [You]798-a man ’re to blame , at any rate , for so recklessly assuming that [you]798-a man HAVE found it out . [You]798-a man seem to forget that , till [they]2828-they met here , [Sophy]81-sophy viner and [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow hardly knew [each other]177-each other . ”[97-anna] “ If so , it ’s all the stranger that [they]2828-they ’ve been so often closeted together ! ”[798-a man] “ [Owen]75-owen , [Owen--]154-owen-- ”[297-the girl] [the girl]297-the girl sighed out . [He]798-a man turned [his]798-a man haggard face to [her]297-the girl . “ Can [I]798-a man help [it]2830-it , if [I]798-a man ’ve seen and known what [I]798-a man was n’t meant to ? For God ’s sake give [me]798-a man a reason -- any reason [I]798-a man can decently make out with ! Is it [my]798-a man fault if , the day after [you]75-owen arrived , when [I]798-a man came back late through [the garden]222-the garden , the curtains of [the study]1204-the study had n’t been drawn , and [I]798-a man saw [you]75-owen there alone with [Darrow]71-darrow ? ”[798-a man] [Anna]97-anna laughed impatiently . “ Really , [Owen]75-owen , if [you]75-owen make it a grievance that [two people who are staying in [the same house]2834-the same house]2833-two people who are staying in the same house should be seen talking together---- ! ”[97-anna] “ [They]2833-two people who are staying in the same house were not talking . That ’s the point---- ”[798-a man] “ Not talking ? How do [you]75-owen know ? [You]75-owen could hardly hear [them]2833-two people who are staying in the same house from [the garden]222-the garden ! ”[1694-i] “ No ; but [I]1694-i could see . [HE]1694-i was sitting at [my]1694-i desk , with [his]1694-i face in [his]1694-i hands . [SHE]81-sophy viner was standing in the window , looking away from [him]1694-i ... ”[1694-i] [He]1694-i waited , as if for [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s answer ; but still [she]81-sophy viner neither stirred nor spoke . “ That was the first time , ”[1694-i] [he]1694-i went on ; “ and the second was the next morning in [the park]765-the park . It was natural enough , [their]2833-two people who are staying in the same house meeting [there]2294-there . [Sophy]81-sophy viner had gone out with [Effie]74-effie , and [Effie]74-effie ran back to look for [me]1694-i . [She]74-effie told [me]1694-i [she]74-effie ’d left [Sophy]81-sophy viner and [Darrow]71-darrow in [the path that leads to [the river]503-the river]2838-the path that leads to the river , and presently [we]2840-us saw [them]2833-two people who are staying in the same house ahead of [us]2840-us . [They]2833-two people who are staying in the same house did n’t see [us]2840-us at first , because [they]2833-two people who are staying in the same house were standing looking at [each other]177-each other ; and this time [they]2833-two people who are staying in the same house were not speaking either . [We]2840-us came up close before [they]2833-two people who are staying in the same house heard [us]2840-us , and all that time [they]2833-two people who are staying in the same house never spoke , or stopped looking at [each other]177-each other . After that [I]1694-i began to wonder ; and so [I]1694-i watched [them]2833-two people who are staying in the same house . ”[1694-i] “ Oh , [Owen]75-owen ! ”[1694-i] “ Oh , [I]97-anna only had to wait . Yesterday , when [I]97-anna motored [you]75-owen and [the doctor]1434-the doctor back from [the lodge]1423-the lodge , [I]97-anna saw [Sophy]81-sophy viner coming out of [the spring - house]2718-the spring - house . [I]97-anna supposed [she]81-sophy viner ’d taken shelter from the rain , and when [you]75-owen got out of [the motor]1020-the motor [I]97-anna strolled back down [the avenue]1076-the avenue to meet [her]81-sophy viner . But [she]81-sophy viner ’d disappeared -- [she]81-sophy viner must have taken a short cut and come into [the house]581-the house by the side door . [I]97-anna do n’t know why [I]97-anna went on to [the spring - house]2718-the spring - house ; [I]97-anna suppose it was what [you]75-owen ’d call spying . [I]97-anna went up the steps and found [the room]663-the room empty ; but two chairs had been moved out from the wall and were standing near the table ; and one of the Chinese screens that lie on it had dropped to the floor . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna sounded a faint note of irony . “ Really ? [Sophy’d]155-sophy’d gone [there]2294-there for shelter , and [she]81-sophy viner dropped a screen and moved a chair ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]297-the girl said two chairs---- ”[297-the girl] “ Two ? What damning evidence -- of [I]297-the girl do n’t know what ! ”[297-the girl] “ Simply of the fact that [Darrow’d]156-darrow’d been [there]2294-there with [her]81-sophy viner . As [I]97-anna looked out of the window [I]97-anna saw [him]156-darrow’d close by , walking away . [He]156-darrow’d must have turned the corner of [the spring - house]2718-the spring - house just as [I]97-anna got to the door . ”[97-anna] There was another silence , during which [Anna]97-anna paused , not only to collect [her]97-anna own words but to wait for [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s ; then , as [the girl]297-the girl made no sign , [she]297-the girl turned to [her]297-the girl . “ [I]297-the girl ’ve absolutely nothing to say to all this ; but perhaps [you]297-the girl ’d like [me]297-the girl to wait and hear [your]297-the girl answer ? ”[297-the girl] [Sophy]81-sophy viner raised [her]81-sophy viner head with a quick flash of colour . “ [I]81-sophy viner ’ve no answer either -- except that [Owen]75-owen must be mad . ”[81-sophy viner] In the interval since [she]81-sophy viner had last spoken [she]81-sophy viner seemed to have regained [her]81-sophy viner self - control , and [her]81-sophy viner voice rang clear , with a cold edge of anger . [Anna]97-anna looked at [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son . [He]719-her step - son had grown extremely pale , and [his]719-her step - son hand fell from the door with a discouraged gesture . “ That ’s all then ? [You]297-the girl wo n’t give [me]719-her step - son any reason ? ”[719-her step - son] “ [I]75-owen did n’t suppose it was necessary to give [you]97-anna or [any one else]2854-any one else a reason for talking with [a friend of [Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s under [[Mrs. Leath]75-owen ’s own roof]2856-mrs. leath ’s own roof]2855-a friend of mrs. leath ’s under mrs. leath ’s own roof . ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen hardly seemed to feel the retort : [he]719-her step - son kept [his]719-her step - son dogged stare on [her]97-anna face . “ [I]719-her step - son wo n’t ask for one , then . [He]719-her step - son had left the threshold and was advancing toward [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner with a motion of desperate appeal ; but as [he]719-her step - son did so there was a knock on the door . A moment ’s silence fell on [the three]1138-the three ; then [Anna]97-anna said : “ Come in ! ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow came into [the room]663-the room . Seeing [the three]1138-the three together , [he]71-darrow looked rapidly from one to the other ; then [he]71-darrow turned to [Anna]97-anna with a smile . “ [I]71-darrow came up to see if [you]97-anna were ready ; but please send [me]71-darrow off if [I]71-darrow ’m not wanted . ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow look , [his]71-darrow voice , the simple sense of [his]71-darrow presence , restored [Anna]97-anna ’s shaken balance . By [Owen]75-owen ’s side [he]719-her step - son looked so strong , so urbane , so experienced , that [the lad]1092-the lad ’s passionate charges dwindled to mere boyish vapourings . A moment ago [she]97-anna had dreaded [Darrow]71-darrow ’s coming ; now [she]97-anna was glad that [he]71-darrow was there . [She]97-anna turned to [him]71-darrow with sudden decision . “ Come in , please ; [I]97-anna want [you]71-darrow to hear what [Owen]75-owen has been saying . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna caught a murmur from [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , but disregarded it . An illuminating impulse urged [her]97-anna on . [She]97-anna , habitually so aware of [her]97-anna own lack of penetration , [her]97-anna small skill in reading hidden motives and detecting secret signals , now felt [herself]97-anna mysteriously inspired . [She]97-anna addressed [herself]97-anna to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . “ It ’s much better for [you]71-darrow both that this absurd question should be cleared up now . ”[97-anna] Then , turning to [Darrow]71-darrow , [she]97-anna continued : “ For some reason that [I]97-anna do n’t pretend to guess , [Owen]75-owen has taken it into [his]71-darrow head that [you]71-darrow ’ve influenced [Miss Viner]82-miss viner to break [her]82-miss viner engagement . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna spoke slowly and deliberately , because [she]97-anna wished to give time and to gain it ; time for [Darrow]71-darrow and [Sophy]81-sophy viner to receive the full impact of what [she]97-anna was saying , and time to observe its full effect on [them]1703-them . [She]97-anna had said to [herself]97-anna : “ If there ’s nothing between [them]1703-them , [they]1703-them ’ll look at [each other]177-each other ; if there IS something , [they]1703-them wo n’t ; ”[97-anna] and as [she]97-anna ceased to speak [she]97-anna felt as if all [her]97-anna life were in [her]97-anna eyes . [Sophy]81-sophy viner , after a start of protest , remained motionless , [her]81-sophy viner gaze on the ground . [Darrow]71-darrow , [his]71-darrow face grown grave , glanced slowly from [Owen Leath]75-owen to [Anna]97-anna . With [his]71-darrow eyes on the latter [he]71-darrow asked : “ Has [Miss Viner]82-miss viner broken [her]82-miss viner engagement ? ”[71-darrow] A moment ’s silence followed [his]71-darrow question ; then [the girl]297-the girl looked up and said : “ Yes ! ”[297-the girl] [Owen]75-owen , as [she]97-anna spoke , uttered a smothered exclamation and walked out of [the room]663-the room . [She]97-anna continued to stand in the same place , without appearing to notice [his]71-darrow departure , and without vouchsafing an additional word of explanation ; then , before [Anna]97-anna could find a cry to detain [her]97-anna , [she]97-anna too turned and went out . “ For [God]90-god ’s sake , what ’s happened ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow asked ; but [Anna]97-anna , with a drop of the heart , was saying to [herself]97-anna that [he]71-darrow and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had not looked at [each other]177-each other . XXV [Anna]97-anna stood in the middle of [the room]663-the room , [her]97-anna eyes on the door . [Darrow]71-darrow ’s questioning gaze was still on [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna with a quick - drawn breath : “ If only [he]71-darrow does n’t come near [me]97-anna ! ”[97-anna] It seemed to [her]97-anna that [she]97-anna had been suddenly endowed with the fatal gift of reading the secret sense of every seemingly spontaneous look and movement , and that in [his]71-darrow least gesture of affection [she]97-anna would detect a cold design . For a moment longer [he]71-darrow continued to look at [her]97-anna enquiringly ; then [he]71-darrow turned away and took up [his]71-darrow habitual stand by the mantel - piece . [She]97-anna drew a deep breath of relief . “ Wo n’t [you]97-anna please explain ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said . “ [I]71-darrow ca n’t explain : [I]71-darrow do n’t know . [I]71-darrow did n’t even know -- till [she]2859-she told [you]97-anna -- that [she]2859-she really meant to break [her]2859-she engagement . What kind of influence ? ”[1708-i] “ [He]1709-he does n’t say . ”[1708-i] [Darrow]71-darrow again seemed to turn over the facts [she]1710-she gave [him]71-darrow . [His]71-darrow face remained grave , but without the least trace of discomposure . “ And what does [Miss Viner]82-miss viner say ? ”[71-darrow] “ [She]82-miss viner says it ’s perfectly natural that [she]82-miss viner should occasionally talk to [[my]1708-i friends]2804-my friends when [she]82-miss viner ’s under [my]1708-i roof -- and refuses to give [him]1709-he any other explanation . ”[1708-i] “ That at least is perfectly natural ! ”[71-darrow] [Anna]97-anna felt [her]97-anna cheeks flush as [she]97-anna answered : “ Yes -- but there is something---- ”[97-anna] “ Something---- ? ”[1708-i] “ Some reason for [her]82-miss viner sudden decision to break [her]82-miss viner engagement . [He]1709-he ’s romantic and extravagant : [he]1709-he ca n’t live on the interest of [his]1709-he feelings . [He]1709-he worships [Sophy]81-sophy viner and [she]81-sophy viner seemed to be fond of [him]1709-he . If [she]81-sophy viner ’s changed it ’s been very sudden . Then [he]71-darrow halted before [her]1720-her . “ Why ca n’t [you]1720-her tell [her]81-sophy viner this [yourself]1720-her ? ”[71-darrow] “ Do n’t [you]1720-her see ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow eyed [her]1720-her intently , and [she]1720-her pressed on : “ [You]71-darrow must have guessed that [Owen]75-owen ’s jealous of [you]71-darrow . ”[1720-her] “ Jealous of [me]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] The blood flew up under [his]71-darrow brown skin . “ Blind with it -- what else would drive [him]1718-i to this folly ? And [I]71-darrow ca n’t have [her]81-sophy viner think [me]71-darrow jealous too ! [I]71-darrow ’ve said all [I]71-darrow could , short of making [her]81-sophy viner think so ; and [she]81-sophy viner ’s refused a word more to either of [us]2879-us .
