[I]71-darrow ca n’t , at any rate , appeal to [her]81-sophy viner on such a ground as that ! ”[71-darrow] [Anna]97-anna laid [her]97-anna hand on [his]71-darrow arm . “ Appeal to [her]81-sophy viner on the ground that [I]97-anna ’m almost [[Owen]75-owen ’s mother]895-owen ’s mother , and that any estrangement between [you]71-darrow and [him]71-darrow would kill [me]97-anna . [She]81-sophy viner knows what [he]71-darrow is -- [she’ll]81-sophy viner understand . Tell [her]81-sophy viner to say anything , do anything , [she]81-sophy viner wishes ; but not to go away without speaking , not to leave THAT between [us]2881-us when [she]81-sophy viner goes ! ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna drew back a step and lifted [her]97-anna face to [his]71-darrow , trying to look into [his]71-darrow eyes more deeply than [she]97-anna had ever looked ; but before [she]97-anna could discern what they expressed [he]71-darrow had taken hold of [her]97-anna hands and bent [his]71-darrow head to kiss them . “ [You]71-darrow ’ll see [her]81-sophy viner ? [You]71-darrow ’ll see [her]81-sophy viner ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna entreated ; and [he]71-darrow answered : “ [I]71-darrow ’ll do anything in [the world]206-the world [you]97-anna want [me]71-darrow to . ”[71-darrow] [XXVI Darrow]71-darrow waited alone in [the sitting - room]1721-the sitting - room . [No place]1722-no place could have been more distasteful as the scene of the talk that lay before [him]71-darrow ; but [he]71-darrow had acceded to [Anna]97-anna ’s suggestion that it would seem more natural for [her]97-anna to summon [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner than for [him]71-darrow to go in search of [her]97-anna . As [his]71-darrow troubled pacings carried [him]71-darrow back and forth a relentless hand seemed to be tearing away all the tender fibres of association that bound [him]71-darrow to [the peaceful room]1723-the peaceful room . Here , in [this very place]1724-this very place , [he]71-darrow had drunk [his]71-darrow deepest draughts of happiness , had had [his]71-darrow lips at the fountain - head of its overflowing rivers ; but now that source was poisoned and [he]71-darrow would taste no more of an untainted cup . For a moment [he]71-darrow felt an actual physical anguish ; then [his]71-darrow nerves hardened for the coming struggle . [He]71-darrow had no notion of what awaited [him]71-darrow ; but after the first instinctive recoil [he]71-darrow had seen in a flash the urgent need of another word with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [He]71-darrow had been insincere in letting [Anna]97-anna think that [he]71-darrow had consented to speak because [she]97-anna asked it . In reality [he]71-darrow had been feverishly casting about for the pretext [she]97-anna had given [him]71-darrow ; and for some reason this trivial hypocrisy weighed on [him]71-darrow more than all [his]71-darrow heavy burden of deceit . At length [he]71-darrow heard a step behind [him]71-darrow and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner entered . When [she]97-anna saw [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna paused on the threshold and half drew back . “ [I]97-anna was told that [Mrs. Leath]75-owen had sent for [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ [Mrs. Leath]75-owen DID send for [you]71-darrow . [She]75-owen ’ll be [here]2403-here presently ; but [I]71-darrow asked [her]75-owen to let [me]71-darrow see [you]71-darrow first . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow spoke very gently , and there was no insincerity in [his]71-darrow gentleness . [He]71-darrow was profoundly moved by the change in [the girl]297-the girl ’s appearance . At sight of [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna had forced a smile ; but it lit up [her]97-anna wretchedness like a candle - flame held to a dead face . [She]97-anna made no reply , and [Darrow]71-darrow went on : “ [You]97-anna must understand [my]97-anna wanting to speak to [you]97-anna , after what [I]97-anna was told just now . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna interposed , with a gesture of protest : “ [I]97-anna ’m not responsible for [Owen]75-owen ’s ravings ! ”[97-anna] “ Of course---- ”[71-darrow] . [He]71-darrow broke off and [they]1726-they stood facing [each other]177-each other . [She]97-anna lifted a hand and pushed back [her]97-anna loose lock with the gesture that was burnt into [his]71-darrow memory ; then [she]97-anna looked about [her]97-anna and dropped into the nearest chair . “ Well , [you]71-darrow ’ve got what [you]71-darrow wanted , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said . “ What do [you]71-darrow mean by what [I]97-anna wanted ? ”[97-anna] “ [My]97-anna engagement ’s broken -- [you]71-darrow heard [me]97-anna say so . ”[97-anna] “ Why do [you]71-darrow say that ’s what [I]97-anna wanted ? All [I]97-anna wished , from the beginning , was to advise [you]71-darrow , to help [you]71-darrow as best [I]97-anna could---- ”[97-anna] “ That ’s what [you]71-darrow ’ve done , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna rejoined . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve convinced [me]97-anna that it ’s best [I]97-anna should n’t marry [him]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow broke into a despairing laugh . “ At the very moment when [you]71-darrow ’d convinced [me]71-darrow to the contrary ! ”[71-darrow] “ Had [I]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna smile flickered up . “ Well , [I]97-anna really believed it till [you]71-darrow showed [me]97-anna ... warned [me]97-anna ... ”[97-anna] “ Warned [you]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] “ That [I]71-darrow ’d be miserable if [I]71-darrow married [a man [I]71-darrow did n’t love]2884-a man i did n’t love . ”[71-darrow] “ Do n’t [you]71-darrow love [him]2884-a man i did n’t love ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna made no answer , and [Darrow]71-darrow started up and walked away to the other end of [the room]663-the room . [He]71-darrow stopped before the writing - table , where [his]71-darrow photograph , well - dressed , handsome , self - sufficient -- the portrait of [a man of [the world]206-the world]205-a man of the world , confident of [his]71-darrow ability to deal adequately with the most delicate situations -- offered its huge fatuity to [his]71-darrow gaze . [He]71-darrow turned back to [her]97-anna . “ It ’s rather hard on [Owen]75-owen , is n’t it , that [you]71-darrow should have waited until now to tell [him]2884-a man i did n’t love ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna reflected a moment before answering . “ [I]97-anna told [him]2884-a man i did n’t love as soon as [I]97-anna knew . ”[97-anna] “ Knew that [you]71-darrow could n’t marry [him]2884-a man i did n’t love ? ”[71-darrow] “ Knew that [I]97-anna could never live [here]2403-here with [him]2884-a man i did n’t love . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna looked about [the room]663-the room , as though the very walls must speak for [her]97-anna . It was worth every penny it cost . [My]1739-i mistake was in being ashamed , just at first , of its having cost such a lot . [I]1739-i tried to carry it off as a joke -- to talk of it to [myself]1739-i as an ‘ adventure ’ . [I]1739-i ’d always wanted adventures , and [you]1738-you ’d given [me]1739-i one , and [I]1739-i tried to take [your]1738-you attitude about it , to ‘ play the game ’ and convince [myself]1739-i that [I]1739-i had n’t risked any more on it than [you]1738-you . Then , when [I]1739-i met [you]1738-you again , [I]1739-i suddenly saw that [I]1739-i HAD risked more , but that [I]1739-i ’d won more , too -- such worlds ! [I]1739-i ’d been trying all the while to put everything [I]1739-i could between [us]2895-us ; now [I]1739-i want to sweep everything away . [I]1739-i ’d been trying to forget how [you]1738-you looked ; now [I]1739-i want to remember [you]1738-you always . [I]1739-i ’ve made [my]1739-i choice -- that ’s all : [I]1739-i ’ve had [you]1738-you and [I]1739-i mean to keep [you]1738-you . ”[1739-i] [Her]1740-her face was shining like [her]1740-her eyes . “ To keep [you]1738-you hidden away here , ”[1740-her] [she]1740-her ended , and put [her]1740-her hand upon [her]1740-her breast . After [she]1740-her had left [him]1741-him , [Darrow]71-darrow continued to sit motionless , staring back into [their]1742-their past . Hitherto it had lingered on the edge of [his]71-darrow mind in a vague pink blur , like one of the little rose - leaf clouds that a setting sun drops from its disk . Now it was a huge looming darkness , through which [his]71-darrow eyes vainly strained . The whole episode was still obscure to [him]71-darrow , save where here and there , as [they]1742-their talked , some phrase or gesture or intonation of [the girl]297-the girl ’s had lit up a little spot in the night . [She]1740-her had said : “ [I]1740-her wonder what [your]71-darrow feeling for [me]1740-her was ? ”[1740-her] and [he]71-darrow found [himself]71-darrow wondering too ... [He]71-darrow remembered distinctly enough that [he]71-darrow had not meant the perilous passion -- even in its most transient form -- to play a part in [their]1742-their relation . In that respect [his]71-darrow attitude had been above reproach . [She]1740-her was [an unusually original and attractive creature , to whom [he]71-darrow had wanted to give a few days of harmless pleasuring , and who was alert and expert enough to understand [his]71-darrow intention and spare [him]71-darrow the boredom of hesitations and misinterpretations]1744-an unusually original and attractive creature , to whom he had wanted to give a few days of harmless pleasuring , and who was alert and expert enough to understand his intention and spare him the boredom of hesitations and misinterpretations . That had been [his]71-darrow first impression , and [her]1740-her subsequent demeanour had justified it . [She]1740-her had been , from the outset , just the frank and easy comrade [he]71-darrow had expected to find [her]1740-her . Was it [he]71-darrow , then , who , in the sequel , had grown impatient of the bounds [he]71-darrow had set [himself]71-darrow ? Was it [his]71-darrow wounded vanity that , seeking balm for its hurt , yearned to dip deeper into the healing pool of [her]1740-her compassion ? In [his]71-darrow confused memory of the situation [he]71-darrow seemed not to have been guiltless of such yearnings ... Yet for the first few days the experiment had been perfectly successful . [Her]1740-her enjoyment had been unclouded and [his]71-darrow pleasure in it undisturbed . It was very gradually -- [he]71-darrow seemed to see -- that a shade of lassitude had crept over [their]1745-their intercourse . Perhaps it was because , when [her]1740-her light chatter about [people]365-people failed , [he]71-darrow found [she]1740-her had no other fund to draw on , or perhaps simply because of the sweetness of [her]1740-her laugh , or of the charm of the gesture with which , one day in [the woods of [Marly]53-marly]1747-the woods of marly , [she]1740-her had tossed off [her]1740-her hat and tilted back [her]1740-her head at the call of a cuckoo ; or because , whenever [he]71-darrow looked at [her]1740-her unexpectedly , [he]71-darrow found that [she]1740-her was looking at [him]71-darrow and did not want [him]71-darrow to know it ; or perhaps , in varying degrees , because of all these things , that there had come a moment when no word seemed to fly high enough or dive deep enough to utter the sense of well - being each gave to the other , and the natural substitute for speech had been a kiss . The kiss , at all events , had come at the precise moment to save [their]1745-their venture from disaster . [They]1745-their had reached the point when [her]1740-her amazing reminiscences had begun to flag , when [her]1740-her future had been exhaustively discussed , [her]1740-her theatrical prospects minutely studied , [her]1740-her quarrel with [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett retold with the last amplification of detail , and when , perhaps conscious of [her]1740-her exhausted resources and [his]71-darrow dwindling interest , [she]1740-her had committed the fatal error of saying that [she]1740-her could see [he]71-darrow was unhappy , and entreating [him]71-darrow to tell [her]1740-her why ... From the brink of estranging confidences , and from the risk of unfavourable comparisons , [his]71-darrow gesture had snatched [her]1740-her back to safety ; and as soon as [he]71-darrow had kissed [her]1740-her [he]71-darrow felt that [she]1740-her would never bore [him]71-darrow again . [She]1740-her was one of the elemental creatures whose emotion is all in [their]1748-their pulses , and who become inexpressive or sentimental when [they]1748-their try to turn sensation into speech . [His]71-darrow caress had restored [her]1740-her to [her]1740-her natural place in the scheme of things , and [Darrow]71-darrow felt as if [he]71-darrow had clasped a tree and a nymph had bloomed from it ... The mere fact of not having to listen to [her]1740-her any longer added immensely to [her]1740-her charm . [She]1740-her continued , of course , to talk to [him]71-darrow , but it did n’t matter , because [he]71-darrow no longer made any effort to follow [her]1740-her words , but let [her]1740-her voice run on as a musical undercurrent to [his]71-darrow thoughts . [She]1740-her had n’t a drop of poetry in [her]1740-her , but [she]1740-her had some of the qualities that create it in others ; and in moments of heat the imagination does not always feel the difference ... Lying beside [her]1740-her in the shade , [Darrow]71-darrow felt [her]1740-her presence as a part of the charmed stillness of [the summer woods]1749-the summer woods , as the element of vague well - being that suffused [his]71-darrow senses and lulled to sleep the ache of wounded pride . All [he]71-darrow asked of [her]1740-her , as yet , was a touch on the hand or on the lips -- and that [she]1740-her should let [him]71-darrow go on lying there through the long warm hours , while a black - bird ’s song throbbed like a fountain , and the summer wind stirred in the trees , and close by , between the nearest branches and the brim of [his]71-darrow tilted hat , [a slight white figure]1750-a slight white figure gathered up all the floating threads of joy ... [He]71-darrow recalled , too , having noticed , as [he]71-darrow lay staring at a break in the tree - tops , a stream of mares’-tails coming up the sky . [He]71-darrow had said to [himself]71-darrow : “ It will rain to - morrow , ”[71-darrow] and the thought had made the air seem warmer and the sun more vivid on [her]1740-her hair ... Perhaps if the mares’-tails had not come up the sky [their]1751-they adventure might have had no sequel . But the cloud brought rain , and next morning [he]71-darrow looked out of [his]71-darrow window into a cold grey blur . [They]1751-they had planned an all - day excursion down [the Seine]28-the seine , to [the two Andelys]1752-the two andelys and [Rouen]54-rouen , and now , with the long hours on [their]1751-they hands , [they]1751-they were both a little at a loss ... There was [the Louvre]1753-the louvre , of course , and [the Luxembourg]55-the luxembourg ; but [he]71-darrow had tried looking at pictures with [her]1740-her , [she]1740-her had first so persistently admired the worst things , and then so frankly lapsed into indifference , that [he]71-darrow had no wish to repeat the experiment . So [they]1751-they went out , aimlessly , and took a cold wet walk , turning at length into [the deserted arcades of [the Palais Royal]1755-the palais royal]1754-the deserted arcades of the palais royal , and finally drifting into one of [[its]1755-the palais royal equally deserted restaurants]1756-its equally deserted restaurants , where [they]1751-they lunched alone and somewhat dolefully , served by [a wan old waiter with the look of a castaway who has given up watching for a sail ...]1757-a wan old waiter with the look of a castaway who has given up watching for a sail ... It was odd how [the waiter]1758-the waiter ’s face came back to [him]71-darrow ... Perhaps but for the rain it might never have happened ; but what was the use of thinking of that now ? [He]71-darrow tried to turn [his]71-darrow thoughts to more urgent issues ; but , by a strange perversity of association , every detail of the day was forcing itself on [his]71-darrow mind with an insistence from which there was no escape . Reluctantly [he]71-darrow relived the long wet walk back to [the hotel]443-the hotel , after a tedious hour at a cinematograph show on [the Boulevard]414-the boulevard . It was still raining when [they]1751-they withdrew from this stale spectacle , but [she]1740-her had obstinately refused to take [a cab]1761-a cab , had even , on the way , insisted on loitering under the dripping awnings of shop - windows and poking into [draughty passages]1762-draughty passages , and finally , when [they]1751-they had nearly reached [their]1751-they destination , had gone so far as to suggest that [they]1751-they should turn back to hunt up some show [she]1740-her had heard of in [a theatre at [the Batignolles]56-the batignolles]1763-a theatre at the batignolles . But at that [he]71-darrow had somewhat irritably protested : [he]71-darrow remembered that , for the first time , [they]1751-they were both rather irritable , and vaguely disposed to resist [one another]1764-one another ’s suggestions . [His]71-darrow feet were wet , and [he]71-darrow was tired of walking , and sick of the smell of [stuffy unaired theatres]1765-stuffy unaired theatres , and [he]71-darrow had said [he]71-darrow must really get back to write some letters -- and so [they]1751-they had kept on to [the hotel]443-the hotel ... XXVII [Darrow]71-darrow had no idea how long [he]71-darrow had sat [there]2294-there when [he]71-darrow heard [Anna]97-anna ’s hand on the door . The effort of rising , and of composing [his]71-darrow face to meet [her]97-anna , gave [him]71-darrow a factitious sense of self - control . [He]71-darrow said to [himself]71-darrow : “ [I]71-darrow must decide on something---- ”[71-darrow] and that lifted [him]71-darrow a hair ’s breadth above the whirling waters . [She]97-anna came in with a lighter step , and [he]71-darrow instantly perceived that something unforeseen and reassuring had happened . “ [She]97-anna ’s been with [me]97-anna . [She]97-anna came and found [me]97-anna on [the terrace]2399-the terrace . [We]2897-we ’ve had a long talk and [she]97-anna ’s explained everything . [I]97-anna feel as if [I]97-anna ’d never known [her]97-anna before ! ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna voice was so moved and tender that it checked [his]71-darrow start of apprehension . “ [She]97-anna ’s explained---- ? ”[97-anna] “ It ’s natural , is n’t it , that [she]97-anna should have felt a little sore at the kind of inspection [she]97-anna ’s been subjected to ? Oh , not from [you]71-darrow -- [I]97-anna do n’t mean that ! But [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s opposition -- and [her]97-anna sending for [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide ! [She]97-anna told [me]97-anna frankly [she]97-anna did n’t care to owe [[her]97-anna husband]174-her husband to [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide ... [She]97-anna thinks now that [her]97-anna annoyance at feeling [herself]97-anna so talked over and scrutinized may have shown itself in [her]97-anna manner to [Owen]75-owen , and set [him]174-her husband imagining the insane things [he]174-her husband did ... [I]97-anna understand all [she]97-anna must have felt , and [I]97-anna agree with [her]97-anna that it ’s best [she]97-anna should go away for a while . [She]97-anna ’s made [me]97-anna , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna summed up , “ feel as if [I]97-anna ’d been dreadfully thick - skinned and obtuse ! ”[97-anna] “ [YOU]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] “ Yes . As if [I]97-anna ’d treated [her]97-anna like the bric - a - brac that used to be sent down here ‘ on approval , ’ to see if it would look well with the other pieces . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna added , with a sudden flush of enthusiasm : “ [I]97-anna ’m glad [she]97-anna ’s got it in [her]97-anna to make one feel like that ! ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna seemed to wait for [Darrow]71-darrow to agree with [her]97-anna , or to put some other question , and [he]71-darrow finally found voice to ask : “ Then [you]97-anna think it ’s not a final break ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]97-anna hope not -- [I’ve]97-anna never hoped it more ! [I]97-anna had a word with [Owen]75-owen , too , after [I]97-anna left [her]97-anna , and [I]97-anna think [he]71-darrow understands that [he]71-darrow must let [her]97-anna go without insisting on any positive promise . [She]97-anna ’s excited ... [he]71-darrow must let [her]97-anna calm down ... ”[97-anna] Again [she]97-anna waited , and [Darrow]71-darrow said : “ Surely [you]97-anna can make [him]71-darrow see that . ”[71-darrow] “ [She]97-anna ’ll help [me]97-anna to -- [she]97-anna ’s to see [him]71-darrow , of course , before [she]97-anna goes . [She]97-anna starts immediately , by the way , with [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide , who is motoring over to [Francheuil]42-francheuil to catch the one o’clock express -- and who , of course , knows nothing of all this , and is simply to be told that [Sophy]81-sophy viner has been sent for by [the Farlows]94-the farlows . ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow mutely signed [his]71-darrow comprehension , and [she]97-anna went on : “ [Owen]75-owen is particularly anxious that neither [Adelaide]122-adelaide nor [[his]71-darrow grandmother]991-his grandmother should have the least inkling of what ’s happened . The need of shielding [Sophy]81-sophy viner will help [him]71-darrow to control [himself]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow ’s coming to [his]71-darrow senses , [poor boy]2900-poor boy ; [he]71-darrow ’s ashamed of [his]71-darrow wild talk already . [He]71-darrow asked [me]97-anna to tell [you]97-anna so ; no doubt [he]71-darrow ’ll tell [you]97-anna so [himself]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow made a movement of protest . “ Oh , as to that -- the thing ’s not worth another word . ”[71-darrow] “ Or another thought , either ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna brightened . “ Promise [me]97-anna [you]71-darrow wo n’t even think of it -- promise [me]97-anna [you]71-darrow wo n’t be hard on [him]71-darrow ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow was finding it easier to smile back at [her]97-anna . “ Why should [you]97-anna think it necessary to ask [my]71-darrow indulgence for [Owen]75-owen ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna hesitated a moment , [her]97-anna eyes wandering from [him]71-darrow . Then they came back with a smile . “ Perhaps because [I]97-anna need it for [myself]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ For [yourself]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna mean , because [I]97-anna understand better how [one]2308-one can torture [one]2308-one ’s self over unrealities . ”[97-anna] As [Darrow]71-darrow listened , the tension of [his]71-darrow nerves began to relax . [Her]97-anna gaze , so grave and yet so sweet , was like a deep pool into which [he]71-darrow could plunge and hide [himself]71-darrow from the hard glare of [his]71-darrow misery . As this ecstatic sense enveloped [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow found it more and more difficult to follow [her]97-anna words and to frame an answer ; but what did anything matter , except that [her]97-anna voice should go on , and the syllables fall like soft touches on [his]71-darrow tortured brain ? “ Do n’t [you]71-darrow know , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna continued , “ the bliss of waking from a bad dream in [one ’s own quiet room]2903-one ’s own quiet room , and going slowly over all the horror without being afraid of it any more ? That ’s what [I]97-anna ’m doing now . And that ’s why [I]97-anna understand [Owen]75-owen ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna broke off , and [he]71-darrow felt [her]97-anna touch on [his]71-darrow arm . “ BECAUSE [I’D]97-anna DREAMED THE HORROR TOO ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow understood [her]97-anna then , and stammered : “ [You]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] “ Forgive [me]97-anna ! And let [me]97-anna tell [you]71-darrow ! ... It will help [you]71-darrow to understand [Owen]75-owen ... There WERE little things ... little signs ... once [I]97-anna had begun to watch for them : [your]71-darrow reluctance to speak about [her]75-owen ... [her]75-owen reserve with [you]71-darrow ... a sort of constraint [we]2904-we ’d never seen in [her]75-owen before ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna laughed up at [him]71-darrow , and with [her]97-anna hands in [his]71-darrow [he]71-darrow contrived to say : “ NOW [you]97-anna understand why ? ”[97-anna] “ Oh , [I]97-anna understand ; of course [I]97-anna understand ; and [I]97-anna want [you]97-anna to laugh at [me]97-anna -- with [me]97-anna ! Because there were other things too ... crazier things still ... There was even -- last night on [the terrace]2399-the terrace -- [her]75-owen pink cloak ... ”[97-anna] “ [Her]75-owen pink cloak ? ”[97-anna] Now [he]71-darrow honestly wondered , and as [she]97-anna saw it [she]97-anna blushed . “ [You]71-darrow ’ve forgotten about the cloak ? The pink cloak that [Owen]75-owen saw [you]71-darrow with at the play in [Paris]10-paris ? Yes ... yes ... [I]97-anna was mad enough for that ! ... It does [me]97-anna good to laugh about it now ! But [you]71-darrow ought to know that [I]97-anna ’m going to be [a jealous woman]2906-a jealous woman ... [a ridiculously jealous woman]2907-a ridiculously jealous woman ... [you]71-darrow ought to be warned of it in time ... ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow had dropped [her]97-anna hands , and [she]97-anna leaned close and lifted [her]97-anna arms to [his]71-darrow neck with one of [her]97-anna rare gestures of surrender . “ [I]97-anna do n’t know why it is ; but it makes [me]97-anna happier now to have been so foolish ! ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna lips were parted in a noiseless laugh and the tremor of [her]97-anna lashes made their shadow move on [her]97-anna cheek . [He]71-darrow looked at [her]97-anna through a mist of pain and saw all [her]97-anna offered beauty held up like a cup to [his]71-darrow lips ; but as [he]71-darrow stooped to it a darkness seemed to fall between [them]1768-them , [her]97-anna arms slipped from [his]71-darrow shoulders and [she]97-anna drew away from [him]71-darrow abruptly . “ But [she]97-anna WAS with [you]71-darrow , then ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna exclaimed ; and then , as [he]71-darrow stared at [her]97-anna : “ Oh , do n’t say no ! Only go and look at [your]97-anna eyes ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow stood speechless , and [she]97-anna pressed on : “ Do n’t deny it -- oh , do n’t deny it ! What will be left for [me]97-anna to imagine if [you]71-darrow do ? Do n’t [you]71-darrow see how every single thing cries it out ? [Owen]75-owen sees it -- [he]71-darrow saw it again just now ! When [I]97-anna told [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna ’d relented , and would see [him]71-darrow , [he]71-darrow said : ‘ Is that [Darrow]71-darrow ’s doing too ? ’ ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow took the onslaught in silence . [He]71-darrow might have spoken , have summoned up the usual phrases of banter and denial ; [he]71-darrow was not even certain that they might not , for the moment , have served [their]1769-their purpose if [he]71-darrow could have uttered them without being seen . But [he]71-darrow was as conscious of what had happened to [his]71-darrow face as if [he]71-darrow had obeyed [Anna]97-anna ’s bidding and looked at [himself]71-darrow in the glass . [He]71-darrow knew [he]71-darrow could no more hide from [her]97-anna what was written there than [he]71-darrow could efface from [his]71-darrow soul the fiery record of what [he]71-darrow had just lived through . There before [him]71-darrow , staring [him]71-darrow in the eyes , and reflecting itself in all [his]71-darrow lineaments , was the overwhelming fact of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s passion and of the act by which [she]97-anna had attested it . [Anna]97-anna was talking again , hurriedly , feverishly , and [his]71-darrow soul was wrung by the anguish in [her]97-anna voice . “ Do speak at last -- [you]71-darrow must speak ! [I]97-anna do n’t want to ask [you]71-darrow to harm [the girl]297-the girl ; but [you]71-darrow must see that [your]71-darrow silence is doing [her]297-the girl more harm than [your]71-darrow answering [my]97-anna questions could . [You]71-darrow ’re leaving [me]97-anna only the worst things to think of [her]297-the girl ... [she]297-the girl ’d see that [herself]297-the girl if [she]297-the girl were here . What worse injury can [you]71-darrow do [her]297-the girl than to make [me]97-anna hate [her]297-the girl -- to make [me]97-anna feel [she]297-the girl ’s plotted with [you]71-darrow to deceive [us]2909-us ? ”[97-anna] “ Oh , not that ! ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow heard [his]71-darrow own voice before [he]71-darrow was aware that [he]71-darrow meant to speak . “ Yes ; [I]71-darrow did see [her]297-the girl in [Paris]10-paris , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on after a pause ; “ but [I]71-darrow was bound to respect [her]297-the girl reason for not wanting it known . ”[71-darrow] [Anna]97-anna paled . “ It was [she]297-the girl at [the theatre]237-the theatre that night ? ”[71-darrow] “ [I]71-darrow was with [her]297-the girl at [the theatre]237-the theatre one night . ”[71-darrow] “ Why should [she]297-the girl have asked [you]71-darrow not to say so ? ”[71-darrow] “ [She]297-the girl did n’t wish it known that [I]71-darrow ’d met [her]297-the girl . ”[71-darrow] “ Why should n’t [she]297-the girl have wished it known ? ”[71-darrow] “ [She]297-the girl had quarrelled with [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett and come over suddenly to [Paris]10-paris , and [she]297-the girl did n’t want [the Farlows]94-the farlows to hear of it . [I]71-darrow came across [her]297-the girl by accident , and [she]297-the girl asked [me]71-darrow not to speak of having seen [her]297-the girl . ”[71-darrow] “ Because of [her]297-the girl quarrel ? Because [she]297-the girl was ashamed of [her]297-the girl part in it ? ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , no . There was nothing for [her]297-the girl to be ashamed of . But [the Farlows]94-the farlows had found the place for [her]297-the girl , and [she]297-the girl did n’t want [them]94-the farlows to know how suddenly [she]297-the girl ’d had to leave , and how badly [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett had behaved . [She]297-the girl was in a terrible plight -- [the woman]2912-the woman had even kept back [her]297-the girl month ’s salary . [She]297-the girl knew [the Farlows]94-the farlows would be awfully upset , and [she]297-the girl wanted more time to prepare [them]94-the farlows . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow heard [himself]71-darrow speak as though the words had proceeded from other lips . [His]71-darrow explanation sounded plausible enough , and [he]71-darrow half - fancied [Anna]97-anna ’s look grew lighter . [She]97-anna waited a moment , as though to be sure [he]71-darrow had no more to add ; then [she]97-anna said : “ But [the Farlows]94-the farlows DID know ; [they]94-the farlows told [me]97-anna all about it when [they]94-the farlows sent [her]297-the girl to [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow flushed as if [she]97-anna had laid a deliberate trap for [him]71-darrow . “ [They]94-the farlows may know NOW ; [they]94-the farlows did n’t then---- ”[97-anna] “ That ’s no reason for [her]297-the girl continuing now to make a mystery of having met [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] “ It ’s the only reason [I]97-anna can give [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] “ Then [I]97-anna ’ll go and ask [her]297-the girl for one [myself]97-anna . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna turned and took a few steps toward the door . “ [Anna]97-anna ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow started to follow [her]97-anna , and then checked [himself]71-darrow . “ Do n’t do that ! ”[71-darrow] “ Why not ? ”[97-anna] “ It ’s not like [you]71-darrow ... not generous ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna stood before [him]71-darrow straight and pale , but under [her]97-anna rigid face [he]71-darrow saw the tumult of [her]97-anna doubt and misery . “ [I]97-anna do n’t want to be ungenerous ; [I]97-anna do n’t want to pry into [her]297-the girl secrets . But things ca n’t be left like this . Would n’t it be better for [me]97-anna to go to [her]297-the girl ? Surely [she]297-the girl ’ll understand -- [she’ll]297-the girl explain ... It may be some mere trifle [she]297-the girl ’s concealing : something that would horrify [the Farlows]94-the farlows , but that [I]97-anna should n’t see any harm in ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna paused , [her]97-anna eyes searching [his]71-darrow face . “ A love affair , [I]97-anna suppose ... that ’s it ? [You]71-darrow met [her]297-the girl with [some man at [the theatre]237-the theatre]2913-some man at the theatre -- and [she]297-the girl was frightened and begged [you]71-darrow to fib about it ? Those poor young things that have to go about among [us]2915-us like machines -- oh , if [you]71-darrow knew how [I]97-anna pity [them]94-the farlows ! ”[97-anna] “ If [you]71-darrow pity [her]297-the girl , why not let [her]297-the girl go ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna stared . “ Let [her]297-the girl go -- go for good , [you]71-darrow mean ? Is that the best [you]71-darrow can say for [her]297-the girl ? ”[97-anna] “ Let things take [their]94-the farlows course . After all , it ’s between [herself]297-the girl and [Owen]75-owen . ”[97-anna] “ And [you]71-darrow and [me]71-darrow -- and [Effie]74-effie , if [Owen]75-owen marries [her]297-the girl , and [I]71-darrow leave [[my]71-darrow child]2916-my child with [them]2917-them ! Do n’t [you]71-darrow see the impossibility of what [you]71-darrow ’re asking ? [We]2918-we ’re all bound together in this coil . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow turned away with a groan . “ Oh , let [her]297-the girl go -- let [her]297-the girl go . ”[71-darrow] “ Then there IS something -- something really bad ? [She]297-the girl WAS with [some one]476-some one when [you]71-darrow met [her]297-the girl ? Some one with whom [she]297-the girl was---- ”[1770-she] [She]1770-she broke off , and [he]71-darrow saw [her]1770-she struggling with new thoughts . “ If it ’s THAT , of course ... Oh , do n’t [you]71-darrow see , ”[1770-she] [she]1770-she desperately appealed to [him]71-darrow , “ that [I]1770-she must find out , and that it ’s too late now for [you]71-darrow not to speak ? Do n’t be afraid that [I]1770-she ’ll betray [you]71-darrow ... [I’ll]1770-she never , never let [a soul]2920-a soul suspect . But [I]1770-she must know the truth , and surely it ’s best for [her]297-the girl that [I]1770-she should find it out from [you]71-darrow . ”[1770-she] [Darrow]71-darrow waited a moment ; then [he]71-darrow said slowly : “ What [you]1770-she imagine ’s mere madness . [She]297-the girl was at [the theatre]237-the theatre with [me]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] “ With [you]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow saw a tremor pass through [her]1770-she , but [she]1770-she controlled it instantly and faced [him]71-darrow straight and motionless as a wounded creature in the moment before it feels its wound . “ Why should [you]1770-she both have made a mystery of that ? ”[1770-she] “ [I]71-darrow ’ve told [you]1770-she the idea was not [mine]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow cast about . “ [She]297-the girl may have been afraid that [Owen----]121-owen---- ”[71-darrow] “ But that was not a reason for [her]297-the girl asking [you]71-darrow to tell [me]1770-she that [you]71-darrow hardly knew [her]297-the girl -- that [you]71-darrow had n’t even seen [her]297-the girl for years . ”[1770-she] [She]1770-she broke off and the blood rose to [her]1770-she face and forehead . “ Even if [SHE]297-the girl had other reasons , there could be only one reason for [your]71-darrow obeying her---- ”[1770-she] Silence fell between [them]1771-them , a silence in which [the room]663-the room seemed to become suddenly resonant with voices . [Darrow]71-darrow ’s gaze wandered to the window and [he]71-darrow noticed that the gale of two days before had nearly stripped the tops of the lime - trees in [the court]708-the court . [Anna]97-anna had moved away and was resting [her]97-anna elbows against the mantel - piece , [her]97-anna head in [her]97-anna hands . As [she]97-anna stood there [he]71-darrow took in with a new intensity of vision little details of [her]97-anna appearance that [his]71-darrow eyes had often cherished : the branching blue veins in the backs of [her]97-anna hands , the warm shadow that [her]97-anna hair cast on [her]97-anna ear , and the colour of the hair itself , dull black with a tawny under - surface , like the wings of certain birds . [He]71-darrow felt it to be useless to speak . After a while [she]97-anna lifted [her]97-anna head and said : “ [I]97-anna shall not see [her]97-anna again before [she]97-anna goes . ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow made no answer , and turning to [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna added : “ That is why [she]97-anna ’s going , [I]97-anna suppose ? Because [she]97-anna loves [you]71-darrow and wo n’t give [you]71-darrow up ? ”[97-anna] [Darrow]71-darrow waited . The paltriness of conventional denial was so apparent to [him]71-darrow that even if it could have delayed discovery [he]71-darrow could no longer have resorted to it . Under all [his]71-darrow other fears was the dread of dishonouring the hour . “ [She]97-anna HAS given [me]71-darrow up , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said at last . XXVIII When [he]71-darrow had gone out of [the room]663-the room [Anna]97-anna stood where [he]71-darrow had left [her]97-anna . “ [I]97-anna must believe [him]71-darrow ! [I]97-anna must believe [him]71-darrow ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said . A moment before , at the moment when [she]97-anna had lifted [her]97-anna arms to [his]71-darrow neck , [she]97-anna had been wrapped in a sense of complete security . All the spirits of doubt had been exorcised , and [her]97-anna love was once more the clear habitation in which every thought and feeling could move in blissful freedom . And then , as [she]97-anna raised [her]97-anna face to [Darrow]71-darrow ’s and met [his]71-darrow eyes , [she]97-anna had seemed to look into the very ruins of [his]71-darrow soul . That was the only way [she]97-anna could express it . It was as though [he]71-darrow and [she]97-anna had been looking at two sides of the same thing , and the side [she]97-anna had seen had been all light and life , and [his]71-darrow a place of graves ... [She]97-anna did n’t now recall [who had spoken first , or even , very clearly , what had been said]1775-who had spoken first , or even , very clearly , what had been said . It seemed to [her]97-anna only a moment later that [she]97-anna had found [herself]97-anna standing at the other end of [the room]663-the room -- [the room which had suddenly grown so small that , even with [its]1777-the room which had suddenly grown so small that , even with its length between them length between [them]1778-them]1777-the room which had suddenly grown so small that , even with its length between them , [she]97-anna felt as if [he]71-darrow touched [her]97-anna -- crying out to [him]71-darrow “ It IS because of [you]71-darrow [she]97-anna ’s going ! ”[71-darrow] and reading the avowal in [his]71-darrow face . That was [his]71-darrow secret , then , [THEIR]1778-them secret : [he]71-darrow had met [the girl in [Paris]10-paris]1779-the girl in paris and helped [her]1779-the girl in paris in [her]1779-the girl in paris straits -- lent [her]1779-the girl in paris money , [Anna]97-anna vaguely conjectured -- and [she]97-anna had fallen in love with [him]71-darrow , and on meeting [him]71-darrow again had been suddenly overmastered by [her]97-anna passion . [Anna]97-anna , dropping back into [her]97-anna sofa - corner , sat staring these facts in the face . [The girl]297-the girl had been in a desperate plight -- frightened , penniless , outraged by what had happened , and not knowing ( with [a woman like [Mrs. Murrett]78-mrs. murrett]1781-a woman like mrs. murrett ) what fresh injury might impend ; and [Darrow]71-darrow , meeting [her]297-the girl in this distracted hour , had pitied , counselled , been kind to [her]297-the girl , with the fatal , the inevitable result . There were the facts as [Anna]97-anna made them out : that , at least , was [their]1782-their external aspect , was as much of them as [she]97-anna had been suffered to see ; and into the secret intricacies [they]1782-their might cover [she]97-anna dared not yet project [her]97-anna thoughts . “ [I]97-anna must believe [him]71-darrow ... [I]97-anna must believe [him]71-darrow ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna kept on repeating the words like a talisman . It was natural , after all , that [he]71-darrow should have behaved as [he]71-darrow had : defended [the girl]297-the girl ’s piteous secret to the last . [She]97-anna too began to feel the contagion of [his]71-darrow pity -- the stir , in [her]97-anna breast , of feelings deeper and more native to [her]97-anna than the pains of jealousy . From the security of [her]97-anna blessedness [she]97-anna longed to lean over with compassionate hands ... But [Owen]75-owen ? What was [Owen]75-owen ’s part to be ? [She]97-anna owed [herself]97-anna first to [him]71-darrow -- [she]97-anna was bound to protect [him]71-darrow not only from all knowledge of the secret [she]97-anna had surprised , but also -- and chiefly!--from its consequences . Yes : [the girl]297-the girl must go -- there could be no doubt of it -- [Darrow]71-darrow [himself]71-darrow had seen it from the first ; and at the thought [she]97-anna had a wild revulsion of relief , as though [she]97-anna had been trying to create in [her]97-anna heart the delusion of a generosity [she]97-anna could not feel ... The one fact on which [she]97-anna could stay [her]97-anna mind was that [Sophy]81-sophy viner was leaving immediately ; would be out of [the house]581-the house within an hour . Once [she]81-sophy viner was gone , it would be easier to bring [Owen]75-owen to the point of understanding that the break was final ; if necessary , to work upon [the girl]297-the girl to make [him]71-darrow see it . But that , [Anna]97-anna was sure , would not be necessary . It was clear that [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner was leaving [Givre]30-givre with no thought of ever seeing it again ... Suddenly , as [she]97-anna tried to put some order in [her]97-anna thoughts , [she]97-anna heard [Owen]75-owen ’s call at the door : “ [Mother!----]158-mother!---- ”[75-owen] a name [he]71-darrow seldom gave [her]97-anna . There was a new note in [his]71-darrow voice : the note of a joyous impatience . It made [her]97-anna turn hastily to the glass to see what face [she]97-anna was about to show [him]71-darrow ; but before [she]97-anna had had time to compose it [he]71-darrow was in [the room]663-the room and [she]97-anna was caught in a [school - boy]1788-school - boy hug . “ It ’s all right ! [It]2922-it ’s all right ! And it ’s all [your]97-anna doing ! [I]71-darrow want to do the worst kind of penance -- bell and candle and the rest . [I]71-darrow ’ve been through it with [HER]97-anna , and now [she]97-anna hands [me]71-darrow on to [you]97-anna , and [you]97-anna ’re to call [me]71-darrow any names [you]97-anna please . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow freed [her]97-anna with [his]71-darrow happy laugh . “ [I]71-darrow ’m to be stood in the corner till next week , and then [I]71-darrow ’m to go up to see [her]97-anna . And [she]97-anna says [I]71-darrow owe it all to [you]97-anna ! ”[71-darrow] “ To [me]71-darrow ? ”[71-darrow] It was the first phrase [she]97-anna found to clutch at as [she]97-anna tried to steady [herself]97-anna in the eddies of [his]71-darrow joy . “ Yes : [you]97-anna were so patient , and so dear to [her]97-anna ; and [you]97-anna saw at once what a damned ass [I]97-anna ’d been ! ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna tried a smile , and it seemed to pass muster with [him]71-darrow , for [he]71-darrow sent it back in a broad beam . “ That ’s not so difficult to see ? No , [I]71-darrow admit it does n’t take a microscope . But [you]97-anna were so wise and wonderful -- [you]97-anna always are . [I]71-darrow ’ve been mad these last days , simply mad -- [you]97-anna and [she]97-anna might well have washed [your]97-anna hands of [me]71-darrow ! And instead , it ’s all right -- all right ! ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna drew back a little , trying to keep the smile on [her]97-anna lips and not let [him]71-darrow get the least glimpse of what it hid . Now if ever , indeed , it behoved [her]97-anna to be wise and wonderful ! “ [I]97-anna ’m so glad , [dear]2291-dear ; so glad . If only [you]71-darrow ’ll always feel like that about [me]97-anna ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna stopped , hardly knowing what [she]97-anna said , and aghast at the idea that [her]97-anna own hands should have retied the knot [she]97-anna imagined to be broken . But [she]97-anna saw [he]71-darrow had something more to say ; something hard to get out , but absolutely necessary to express . [He]71-darrow caught [her]97-anna hands , pulled [her]97-anna close , and , with [his]71-darrow forehead drawn into its whimsical smiling wrinkles , “ Look here , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow cried , “ if [Darrow]71-darrow wants to call [me]71-darrow [a damned ass]2924-a damned ass too [you]97-anna ’re not to stop [him]71-darrow ! ”[71-darrow] It brought [her]97-anna back to a sharper sense of [her]97-anna central peril : of the secret to be kept from [him]71-darrow at whatever cost to [her]97-anna racked nerves . “ Oh , [you]97-anna know , [he]71-darrow does n’t always wait for orders ! ”[71-darrow] On the whole it sounded better than [she]97-anna ’d feared . “ [You]97-anna mean [he]71-darrow ’s called [me]71-darrow one already ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow accepted the fact with [his]71-darrow gayest laugh . “ Well , that saves a lot of trouble ; now [we]2925-we can pass to the order of the day---- ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow broke off and glanced at the clock--“which is , [you]97-anna know , [dear]2291-dear , that [she]297-the girl ’s starting in about an hour ; [she]297-the girl and [Adelaide]122-adelaide must already be snatching a hasty sandwich . [You]97-anna ’ll come down to bid [them]1790-them good - bye ? ”[71-darrow] “ Yes -- of course . ”[71-darrow] There had , in fact , grown upon [her]97-anna while [he]71-darrow spoke the urgency of seeing [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner again before [she]97-anna left . The thought was deeply distasteful : [Anna]97-anna shrank from encountering [the girl]297-the girl till [she]97-anna had cleared a way through [her]97-anna own perplexities . But it was obvious that since [they]1790-them had separated , barely an hour earlier , the situation had taken a new shape . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had apparently reconsidered [her]81-sophy viner decision to break amicably but definitely with [Owen]75-owen , and stood again in [their]1790-them path , a menace and a mystery ; and confused impulses of resistance stirred in [Anna]97-anna ’s mind . What on earth has happened since [I]1791-he saw [you]97-anna ? ”[1791-he] [He]1791-he looked about [the room]663-the room , as if seeking the clue to [her]97-anna agitation , and in [her]97-anna dread of what [he]1791-he might guess [she]97-anna answered : “ What has happened is simply that [I]97-anna ’m rather tired . Will [you]1791-he ask [Sophy]81-sophy viner to come up and see [me]97-anna here ? ”[97-anna] While [she]97-anna waited [she]97-anna tried to think what [she]97-anna should say when [the girl]297-the girl appeared ; but [she]97-anna had never been more conscious of [her]97-anna inability to deal with the oblique and the tortuous . [She]97-anna had lacked the hard teachings of experience , and an instinctive disdain for whatever was less clear and open than [her]97-anna own conscience had kept [her]97-anna from learning anything of the intricacies and contradictions of other hearts . [She]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [I]97-anna must find out---- ”[97-anna] yet everything in [her]97-anna recoiled from the means by which [she]97-anna felt it must be done ... [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner appeared almost immediately , dressed for departure , [her]81-sophy viner little bag on [her]81-sophy viner arm . [She]81-sophy viner was still pale to the point of haggardness , but with a light upon [her]81-sophy viner that struck [Anna]97-anna with surprise . Or was it , perhaps , that [she]97-anna was looking at [the girl with new eyes]1794-the girl with new eyes : seeing [her]297-the girl , for the first time , not as [[Effie]74-effie ’s governess]2656-effie ’s governess , not as [[Owen]75-owen ’s bride]1796-owen ’s bride , but as the embodiment of that unknown peril lurking in the background of [every woman]1797-every woman ’s thoughts about [[her]1797-every woman lover]1798-her lover ? [Anna]97-anna , at any rate , with a sudden sense of estrangement , noted in [her]297-the girl graces and snares never before perceived . It was only the flash of a primitive instinct , but it lasted long enough to make [her]97-anna ashamed of the darknesses it lit up in [her]97-anna heart ... [She]97-anna signed to [Sophy]81-sophy viner to sit down on the sofa beside [her]97-anna . “ [I]97-anna asked [you]81-sophy viner to come up to [me]97-anna because [I]97-anna wanted to say good - bye quietly , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna explained , feeling [her]97-anna lips tremble , but trying to speak in a tone of friendly naturalness . [The girl]297-the girl ’s only answer was a faint smile of acquiescence , and [Anna]97-anna , disconcerted by [her]297-the girl silence , went on : “ [You]81-sophy viner ’ve decided , then , not to break [your]81-sophy viner engagement ? ”[97-anna] [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner raised [her]81-sophy viner head with a look of surprise . Had [she]97-anna ever spoken so to [any one]2525-any one before ? [She]97-anna felt frightened , as though [her]97-anna very nature had changed without [her]97-anna knowing it ... Feeling [the girl]297-the girl ’s astonished gaze still on [her]97-anna , [she]97-anna continued : “ The suddenness of the change has naturally surprised [me]97-anna . [She]97-anna did not understand [the girl]297-the girl ’s attitude , the edge of irony in [her]297-the girl short syllables , the plainly premeditated determination to lay the burden of proof on [[her]297-the girl interlocutor]1804-her interlocutor . [Anna]97-anna felt the sudden need to lift [their]1805-their intercourse above this mean level of defiance and distrust . [She]97-anna looked appealingly at [Sophy]81-sophy viner . “ Is n’t it best that [we]1805-their should speak quite frankly ? It ’s this change on [your]297-the girl part that perplexes [me]97-anna . [You]297-the girl can hardly be surprised at that . It ’s true , [I]97-anna asked [you]297-the girl not to break with [Owen]75-owen too abruptly -- and [I]97-anna asked it , believe [me]97-anna , as much for [your]297-the girl sake as for [his]2928-his : [I]97-anna wanted [you]297-the girl to take time to think over the difficulty that seems to have arisen between [you]297-the girl . [You]81-sophy viner might have known ... [Anna]97-anna stood motionless , silenced by the shock of [the avowal]1807-the avowal . [She]97-anna too was trembling , less with anger than with a confused compassion . But the feeling was so blent with [others]2314-others , less generous and more obscure , that [she]97-anna found no words to express it , and [the two women]1809-the two women faced [each other]177-each other without speaking . “ [I]81-sophy viner ’d better go , ”[81-sophy viner] [Sophy]81-sophy viner murmured at length with lowered head . The words roused in [Anna]97-anna a latent impulse of compunction . [The girl]297-the girl looked so young , so exposed and desolate ! And what thoughts must [she]297-the girl be hiding in [her]297-the girl heart ! It was impossible that [they]1809-the two women should part in such a spirit . “ [I]81-sophy viner want [you]97-anna to know that [no one]325-no one said anything ... Of course not : do [you]97-anna suppose [I]81-sophy viner thought [he]71-darrow did ? [You]97-anna found it out , that ’s all -- [I]81-sophy viner knew [you]97-anna would . In [your]97-anna place [I]81-sophy viner should have guessed it sooner . ”[81-sophy viner] The words were spoken simply , without irony or emphasis ; but they went through [Anna]97-anna like a sword . Yes , [the girl]297-the girl would have had divinations , promptings that [she]297-the girl had not had ! [She]97-anna felt half envious of such a sad precocity of wisdom . “ [I]97-anna ’m so sorry ... so sorry ... ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna murmured . “ Things happen that way . Now [I]97-anna ’d better go . [I]97-anna ’d like to say good - bye to [Effie]74-effie . ”[97-anna] “ Oh---- ”[1813-effie ’s mother] it broke in a cry from [[Effie]74-effie ’s mother]1813-effie ’s mother . “ Not like this -- [you]97-anna must n’t ! There was another silence , during which passionate impulses of magnanimity warred in [Anna]97-anna with [her]97-anna doubts and dreads . [Happy women]2934-happy women understand best ! ”[81-sophy viner] [Anna]97-anna drew near and touched [the girl]297-the girl ’s hand ; then [she]97-anna began again , pouring all [her]97-anna soul into the broken phrases : “ It ’s terrible now ... [She]297-the girl cried silently , continuously , abundantly , as though [Anna]97-anna ’s touch had released the waters of some deep spring of pain ; then , as [Anna]97-anna , moved and half afraid , leaned over [her]297-the girl with a sound of pity , [she]97-anna stood up and turned away . “ [You]297-the girl ’re going , then -- for good -- like this ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna moved toward [her]297-the girl and stopped . [He]71-darrow was good to [me]297-the girl -- [no one]325-no one ever was so good ! ”[297-the girl] The door - handle turned , and [Anna]97-anna heard [her]297-the girl go . XXIX [Her]297-the girl first thought was : “ [He]71-darrow ’s going too in a few hours -- [I]297-the girl need n’t see [him]71-darrow again before [he]71-darrow leaves ... ”[297-the girl] At that moment the possibility of having to look in [Darrow]71-darrow ’s face and hear [him]71-darrow speak seemed to [her]297-the girl more unendurable than anything else [she]297-the girl could imagine . Then , on the next wave of feeling , came the desire to confront [him]71-darrow at once and wring from [him]71-darrow [she]297-the girl knew not what : avowal , denial , justification , anything that should open some channel of escape to the flood of [her]297-the girl pent - up anguish . [She]297-the girl had told [Owen]75-owen [she]297-the girl was tired , and this seemed a sufficient reason for remaining [upstairs]597-upstairs when the motor came to the door and [Miss Painter]138-miss painter and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner were borne off in it ; sufficient also for sending word to [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle that [she]297-the girl would not come down till after luncheon . Having despatched [[her]297-the girl maid]1821-her maid with this message , [she]297-the girl lay down on [her]297-the girl sofa and stared before [her]1821-her maid into darkness ... [She]297-the girl had been unhappy before , and the vision of old miseries flocked like hungry ghosts about [her]297-the girl fresh pain : [she]297-the girl recalled [her]297-the girl youthful disappointment , the failure of [her]297-the girl marriage , the wasted years that followed ; but those were negative sorrows , denials and postponements of life . [She]297-the girl seemed in no way related to [[their]1822-their shadowy victim]1823-their shadowy victim , [she]297-the girl who was stretched on this fiery rack of the irreparable . [She]297-the girl had suffered before -- yes , but lucidly , reflectively , elegiacally : now [she]297-the girl was suffering as a hurt animal must , blindly , furiously , with the single fierce animal longing that the awful pain should stop ... [She]297-the girl heard [[her]297-the girl maid]1821-her maid knock , and [she]297-the girl hid [her]297-the girl face and made no answer . The knocking continued , and the discipline of habit at length made [her]297-the girl lift [her]297-the girl head , compose [her]297-the girl face and hold out [her]297-the girl hand to the note [the woman]2912-the woman brought [her]297-the girl . It was a word from [Darrow--“May]159-darrow--“may [I]297-the girl see you?”--and[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl said at once , in a voice that sounded thin and empty : “ Ask [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow to come up . ”[297-the girl] [The maid]1826-the maid enquired if [she]297-the girl wished to have [her]297-the girl hair smoothed first , and [she]297-the girl answered that it did n’t matter ; but when the door had closed , the instinct of pride drew [her]297-the girl to [her]297-the girl feet and [she]297-the girl looked at [herself]297-the girl in the glass above the mantelpiece and passed [her]297-the girl hands over [her]297-the girl hair . [Her]297-the girl eyes were burning and [her]297-the girl face looked tired and thinner ; otherwise [she]297-the girl could see no change in [her]297-the girl appearance , and [she]297-the girl wondered that at such a moment [her]297-the girl body should seem as unrelated to the self that writhed within [her]297-the girl [as if it had been a statue or a picture]1827-as if it had been a statue or a picture . [The maid]1826-the maid reopened the door to show in [Darrow]71-darrow , and [he]71-darrow paused a moment on the threshold , as if waiting for [Anna]97-anna to speak . [He]71-darrow was extremely pale , but [he]71-darrow looked neither ashamed nor uncertain , and [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna , with a perverse thrill of appreciation : “ [He]71-darrow ’s as proud as [I]71-darrow am . ”[71-darrow] Aloud [she]97-anna asked : “ [You]71-darrow wanted to see [me]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] “ Naturally , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow replied in a grave voice . “ Do n’t ! It ’s useless . [I]71-darrow know everything . Nothing [you]71-darrow can say will help . ”[71-darrow] At the direct affirmation [he]71-darrow turned even paler , and [his]71-darrow eyes , which [he]71-darrow kept resolutely fixed on [her]97-anna , confessed [his]71-darrow misery . “ [You]71-darrow allow [me]71-darrow no voice in deciding that ? ”[71-darrow] “ Deciding what ? ”[71-darrow] “ That there ’s nothing more to be said ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow waited for [her]97-anna to answer , and then went on : “ [I]71-darrow do n’t even know what [you]71-darrow mean by ‘ everything ’ . ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [I]97-anna do n’t know what more there is ! [I]97-anna know enough . [I]97-anna implored [her]97-anna to deny it , and [she]97-anna couldn’t ... What can [you]71-darrow and [I]97-anna have to say to [each other]177-each other ? ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna voice broke into a sob . The animal anguish was upon [her]97-anna again -- just a blind cry against [her]97-anna pain ! [Darrow]71-darrow kept [his]71-darrow head high and [his]71-darrow eyes steady . “ It must be as [you]97-anna wish ; and yet it ’s not like [you]97-anna to be afraid . ”[71-darrow] “ Afraid ? ”[71-darrow] “ To talk things out -- to face [them]2939-them . ”[71-darrow] “ It ’s for [YOU]97-anna to face this -- not [me]71-darrow ! ”[71-darrow] “ All [I]71-darrow ask is to face it -- but with [you]97-anna . ”[71-darrow] Once more [he]71-darrow paused . “ [Wo]2940-wo n’t [you]97-anna tell [me]71-darrow what [Miss Viner]82-miss viner told [you]97-anna ? ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [she]82-miss viner ’s generous -- to the utmost ! ”[71-darrow] The pain caught [her]97-anna like a physical throe . It suddenly came to [her]97-anna how [the girl]297-the girl must have loved [him]71-darrow to be so generous -- what memories there must be between [them]1830-them ! “ Oh , go , please go . It ’s too horrible . Why should [I]97-anna have to see [you]71-darrow ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna stammered , lifting [her]97-anna hands to [her]97-anna eyes . With [her]97-anna face hidden [she]97-anna waited to hear [him]71-darrow move away , to hear the door open and close again , as , a few hours earlier , it had opened and closed on [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . But [Darrow]71-darrow made no sound or movement : [he]71-darrow too was waiting . [Anna]97-anna felt a thrill of resentment : [his]71-darrow presence was an outrage on [her]97-anna sorrow , a humiliation to [her]97-anna pride . [She]97-anna faltered : “ [You]71-darrow must see it ’s useless---- ”[97-anna] “ [I]71-darrow might remind [you]71-darrow that [you]71-darrow ’re dismissing [me]71-darrow without a hearing---- ”[71-darrow] “ Without a hearing ? [I]71-darrow ’ve heard [you]71-darrow both ! ”[71-darrow] ----“but [I]71-darrow wo n’t , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow continued , “ remind [you]97-anna of that , or of anything or any one but [Owen]75-owen . ”[71-darrow] “ [Owen]75-owen ? ”[71-darrow] “ Yes ; if [we]2941-we could somehow spare [him----]75-owen ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna had dropped [her]97-anna hands and turned [her]97-anna startled eyes on [him]71-darrow . It seemed to [her]97-anna an age since [she]97-anna had thought of [Owen]75-owen ! “ [You]97-anna see , do n’t [you]97-anna , ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow continued , “ that if [you]97-anna send [me]97-anna away now---- ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna interrupted : “ Yes , [I]97-anna see---- ”[97-anna] and there was a long silence between [them]1831-them . At length [she]97-anna said , very low : “ [I]97-anna do n’t want [any one else]2854-any one else to suffer as [I]97-anna ’m suffering ... ”[97-anna] “ [Owen]75-owen knows [I]71-darrow meant to leave tomorrow , ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow went on . “ Any sudden change of plan may make [him]71-darrow think ... ”[71-darrow] Oh , [she]97-anna saw [his]71-darrow inevitable logic : the horror of it was on every side of [her]97-anna ! It had seemed possible to control [her]97-anna grief and face [Darrow]71-darrow calmly while [she]97-anna was upheld by the belief that this was [their]1831-them last hour together , that after [he]71-darrow had passed out of [the room]663-the room there would be no fear of seeing [him]71-darrow again , no fear that [his]71-darrow nearness , [his]71-darrow look , [his]71-darrow voice , and all the unseen influences that flowed from [him]71-darrow , would dissolve [her]97-anna soul to weakness . But [her]97-anna courage failed at the idea of having to conspire with [him]71-darrow to shield [Owen]75-owen , of keeping up with [him]71-darrow , for [Owen]75-owen ’s sake , a feint of union and felicity . To live at [Darrow]71-darrow ’s side in seeming intimacy and harmony for another twenty - four hours seemed harder than to live without [him]71-darrow for all the rest of [her]97-anna days . [Her]97-anna strength failed [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna threw [herself]97-anna down and buried [her]97-anna sobs in the cushions where [she]97-anna had so often hidden a face aglow with happiness . “ [Anna----]160-anna---- ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow voice was close to [her]97-anna . “ Let [me]71-darrow talk to [you]97-anna quietly . It ’s not worthy of either of [us]2943-us to be afraid . ”[71-darrow] Words of endearment would have offended [her]97-anna ; but [her]97-anna heart rose at the call to [her]97-anna courage . “ [I]71-darrow ’ve no defense to make , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on . “ The facts are miserable enough ; but at least [I]71-darrow want [you]97-anna to see them as they are . Above all , [I]71-darrow want [you]97-anna to know the truth about [Miss Viner----]2944-miss viner---- ”[71-darrow] The name sent the blood to [Anna]97-anna ’s forehead . [She]97-anna raised [her]97-anna head and faced [him]71-darrow . “ Why should [I]97-anna know more of [her]2944-miss viner---- than what [she]2944-miss viner---- ’s told [me]97-anna ? [I]97-anna never wish to hear [her]2944-miss viner---- name again ! ”[97-anna] “ It ’s because [you]97-anna feel about [her]2944-miss viner---- in that way that [I]71-darrow ask [you]97-anna -- in the name of common charity -- to let [me]71-darrow give [you]97-anna the facts as they are , and not as [you]97-anna ’ve probably imagined them . ”[71-darrow] “ [I]97-anna ’ve told [you]97-anna [I]97-anna do n’t think uncharitably of [her]2944-miss viner---- . [You]97-anna ’ve always said [you]97-anna wanted , above all , to look at life , at the human problem , as it is , without fear and without hypocrisy ; and it ’s not always a pleasant thing to look at . ”[1833-i] [He]1833-i broke off , and then began again : “ Do n’t think this a plea for [myself]1833-i ! [I]1833-i do n’t want to say a word to lessen [my]1833-i offense . [I]1833-i do n’t want to talk of [myself]1833-i at all . Even if [I]1833-i did , [I]1833-i probably could n’t make [you]97-anna understand -- [I]1833-i do n’t , [myself]1833-i , as [I]1833-i look back . Be just to [me]1833-i -- it ’s [your]97-anna right ; all [I]1833-i ask [you]97-anna is to be generous to [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ... ”[1833-i] [She]1834-she stood up trembling . “ [You]1833-i ’re free to be as generous to [her]82-miss viner as [you]1833-i please ! ”[1834-she] “ Yes : [you]1833-i ’ve made it clear to [me]1833-i that [I]1833-i ’m free . [You]1833-i can marry [her]82-miss viner ! ”[1835-you] [His]1835-you face hardened . “ [You]1833-i certainly could n’t wish [her]82-miss viner a worse fate ! ”[1835-you] “ It must have been what [she]82-miss viner expected ... relied on ... ”[1835-you] [He]1835-you was silent , and [she]1836-i broke out : “ Or what is [she]82-miss viner ? What are [you]1835-you ? It ’s too horrible ! On [your]1835-you way here ... to [ME]1836-i ... ”[1836-i] [She]1836-i felt the tears in [her]1836-i throat and stopped . “ That was it , ”[1835-you] [he]1835-you said bluntly . [She]1836-i stared at [him]1835-you . “ [I]1836-i was on [my]1836-i way to [you]1835-you -- after repeated delays and postponements of [your]1835-you own making . At the very last [you]1835-you turned [me]1836-i back with a mere word -- and without explanation . [I]1836-i waited for a letter ; and none came . [I]1836-i ’m not saying this to justify [myself]1836-i . [I]1836-i ’m simply trying to make [you]1835-you understand . [I]1836-i felt hurt and bitter and bewildered . [I]1836-i thought [you]1835-you meant to give [me]1836-i up .
