That , [I]1836-i swear to [you]1835-you , was the way it began . The rest was a moment ’s folly ... a flash of madness ... as such things are . [We]2946-we ’ve never seen [each other]177-each other since ... ”[1836-i] [Anna]97-anna was looking at [him]1837-you coldly . “ [You]1837-you sufficiently describe [her]97-anna in saying that ! ”[97-anna] “ Yes , if [you]1837-you measure [her]97-anna by conventional standards -- which is what [you]1837-you always declare [you]1837-you never do . ”[97-anna] “ Conventional standards ? A girl who---- ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna was checked by a sudden rush of almost physical repugnance . Suddenly [she]97-anna broke out : “ [I]97-anna always thought [her]97-anna an adventuress ! ”[97-anna] “ Always ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna do n’t mean always ... but after [you]1837-you came ... ”[97-anna] “ [She]97-anna ’s not an adventuress . ”[97-anna] “ [You]1837-you mean that [she]97-anna professes to act on the new theories ? The stuff that [awful women]2948-awful women rave about on [platforms]2949-platforms ? ”[97-anna] “ Oh , [I]97-anna do n’t think [she]97-anna pretended to have a theory---- ”[97-anna] “ [She]97-anna had n’t even that excuse ? ”[97-anna] “ [She]97-anna had the excuse of [her]97-anna loneliness , [her]97-anna unhappiness -- of miseries and humiliations that [a woman like [you]2951-you]2950-a woman like you ca n’t even guess . [She]97-anna had nothing to look back to but indifference or unkindness -- nothing to look forward to but anxiety . [She]97-anna saw [I]97-anna was sorry for [her]97-anna and it touched [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna made too much of it -- [she]97-anna exaggerated it . [I]97-anna ought to have seen the danger , but [I]97-anna did n’t . There ’s no possible excuse for what [I]97-anna did . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna listened to [him]1838-he in speechless misery . Every word [he]1838-he spoke threw back a disintegrating light on [their]1839-their own past . [He]1838-he had come to [her]97-anna with an open face and a clear conscience -- come to [her]97-anna from this ! If [his]1838-he security was the security of falsehood it was horrible ; if it meant that [he]1838-he had forgotten , it was worse . [She]97-anna would have liked to stop [her]97-anna ears , to close [her]97-anna eyes , to shut out every sight and sound and suggestion of [a world in which such things could be]1840-a world in which such things could be ; and at the same time [she]97-anna was tormented by the desire to know more , to understand better , to feel [herself]97-anna less ignorant and inexpert in matters which made so much of the stuff of human experience . What did [he]1838-he mean by “ a moment ’s folly , a flash of madness ”[1838-he] ? How did [people]365-people enter on such adventures , how pass out of [them]365-people without more visible traces of [their]365-people havoc ? [Her]97-anna imagination recoiled from the vision of a sudden debasing familiarity : it seemed to [her]97-anna that [her]97-anna thoughts would never again be pure ... “ [I]71-darrow swear to [you]97-anna , ”[71-darrow] [she]97-anna heard [Darrow]71-darrow saying , “ it was simply that , and nothing more . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna wondered at [his]71-darrow composure , [his]71-darrow competence , at [his]71-darrow knowing so exactly what to say . No doubt [men]1842-men often had to make such explanations : [they]1842-men had the formulas by heart ... A leaden lassitude descended on [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna passed from flame and torment into a colourless cold world where everything surrounding [her]97-anna seemed equally indifferent and remote . For a moment [she]97-anna simply ceased to feel . [She]97-anna became aware that [Darrow]71-darrow was waiting for [her]97-anna to speak , and [she]97-anna made an effort to represent to [herself]97-anna the meaning of what [he]71-darrow had just said ; but [her]97-anna mind was as blank as a blurred mirror . Finally [she]97-anna brought out : “ [I]97-anna do n’t think [I]97-anna understand what [you]71-darrow ’ve told [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ No ; [you]97-anna do n’t understand , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow returned with sudden bitterness ; and on [his]71-darrow lips the charge of incomprehension seemed an offense to [her]97-anna . “ [I]71-darrow do n’t want to -- about such things ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow answered almost harshly : “ Do n’t be afraid ... [you]97-anna never will ... ”[71-darrow] and for an instant [they]1843-they faced [each other]177-each other like [enemies]1845-enemies . Then the tears swelled in [her]97-anna throat at [his]71-darrow reproach . “ [You]71-darrow mean [I]71-darrow do n’t feel things -- [I’m]71-darrow too hard ? ”[71-darrow] “ No : [you]71-darrow ’re too high ... too fine ... such things are too far from [you]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow paused , as if conscious of the futility of going on with whatever [he]71-darrow had meant to say , and again , for a short space , [they]1843-they confronted [each other]177-each other , no longer as [enemies]1845-enemies -- so it seemed to [her]97-anna -- but as [beings of different language who had forgotten the few words [they]1843-they had learned of [each other]177-each other ’s speech]1848-beings of different language who had forgotten the few words they had learned of each other ’s speech . [Darrow]71-darrow broke the silence . “ It ’s best , on all accounts , that [I]71-darrow should stay till tomorrow ; but [I]71-darrow need n’t intrude on [you]97-anna ; [we]1843-they need n’t meet again alone . [I]71-darrow only want to be sure [I]71-darrow know [your]97-anna wishes . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow spoke the short sentences in a level voice , as though [he]71-darrow were summing up the results of a business conference . [Anna]97-anna looked at [him]71-darrow vaguely . “ [My]97-anna wishes ? ”[97-anna] “ As to [Owen----]121-owen---- ”[97-anna] At that [she]97-anna started . “ [They]1850-they must never meet again ! ”[97-anna] “ It ’s not likely [they]1850-they will . What [I]97-anna meant was , that it depends on [you]71-darrow to spare [him]71-darrow ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna answered steadily : “ [He]71-darrow shall never know , ”[97-anna] and after another interval [Darrow]71-darrow said : “ This is good - bye , then . ”[71-darrow] At the word [she]97-anna seemed to understand for the first time whither the flying moments had been leading [them]1850-they . Resentment and indignation died down , and all [her]97-anna consciousness resolved itself into the mere visual sense that [he]71-darrow was there before [her]97-anna , near enough for [her]97-anna to lift [her]97-anna hand and touch [him]71-darrow , and that in another instant the place where [he]71-darrow stood would be empty . [She]97-anna felt a mortal weakness , a craven impulse to cry out to [him]71-darrow to stay , a longing to throw [herself]97-anna into [his]71-darrow arms , and take refuge there from the unendurable anguish [he]71-darrow had caused [her]97-anna . Then the vision called up another thought : “ [I]71-darrow shall never know what [that girl]2952-that girl has known ... ”[71-darrow] and the recoil of pride flung [her]97-anna back on the sharp edges of [her]97-anna anguish . “ Good - bye , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said , in dread lest [he]71-darrow should read [her]97-anna face ; and [she]97-anna stood motionless , [her]97-anna head high , while [he]71-darrow walked to the door and went out . BOOK V XXX [Anna Leath]97-anna , three days later , sat in [[Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s drawing - room]1851-miss painter ’s drawing - room in [the rue de Matignon]1852-the rue de matignon . Coming up precipitately that morning from [the country]220-the country , [she]97-anna had reached [Paris]10-paris at one o’clock and [[Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s landing]1854-miss painter ’s landing some ten minutes later . [[Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s mouldy little man - servant , dissembling a napkin under [his]71-darrow arm]1855-miss painter ’s mouldy little man - servant , dissembling a napkin under his arm , had mildly attempted to oppose [her]97-anna entrance ; but [Anna]97-anna , insisting , had gone straight to [the dining - room]185-the dining - room and surprised [[her]97-anna friend]1276-her friend -- who ate as furtively as certain animals -- over a strange meal of cold mutton and lemonade . Ignoring the embarrassment [she]97-anna caused , [she]97-anna had set forth the object of [her]97-anna journey , and [Miss Painter , always hatted and booted for action]1858-miss painter , always hatted and booted for action , had immediately hastened out , leaving [her]97-anna to the solitude of [the bare fireless drawing - room]1859-the bare fireless drawing - room with [its]1859-the bare fireless drawing - room eternal slip - covers and “ bowed ”[1858-miss painter , always hatted and booted for action] shutters . In this inhospitable obscurity [Anna]97-anna had sat alone for close upon two hours . Both obscurity and solitude were acceptable to [her]97-anna , and impatient as [she]97-anna was to hear the result of the errand on which [she]97-anna had despatched [[her]97-anna hostess]1860-her hostess , [she]97-anna desired still more to be alone . During [her]97-anna long meditation in a white - swathed chair before the muffled hearth [she]97-anna had been able for the first time to clear a way through the darkness and confusion of [her]97-anna thoughts . The way did not go far , and [her]97-anna attempt to trace it was as weak and spasmodic as [a convalescent]1243-a convalescent ’s first efforts to pick up the thread of living . [She]97-anna seemed to [herself]97-anna like some one struggling to rise from a long sickness of which it would have been so much easier to die . At [Givre]30-givre [she]97-anna had fallen into a kind of torpor , a deadness of soul traversed by wild flashes of pain ; but whether [she]97-anna suffered or whether [she]97-anna was numb , [she]97-anna seemed equally remote from [her]97-anna real living and doing self . It was only the discovery -- that very morning -- of [Owen]75-owen ’s unannounced departure for [Paris]10-paris that had caught [her]97-anna out of [her]97-anna dream and forced [her]97-anna back to action . The dread of what this flight might imply , and of the consequences that might result from it , had roused [her]97-anna to the sense of [her]97-anna responsibility , and from the moment when [she]97-anna had resolved to follow [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son , and had made [her]97-anna rapid preparations for pursuit , [her]97-anna mind had begun to work again , feverishly , fitfully , but still with something of its normal order . In [the train]167-the train [she]97-anna had been too agitated , too preoccupied with what might next await [her]97-anna , to give [her]97-anna thoughts to anything but the turning over of dread alternatives ; but [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s imperviousness had steadied [her]97-anna , and while [she]97-anna waited for the sound of the latch - key [she]97-anna resolutely returned upon [herself]97-anna . With respect to [her]97-anna outward course [she]97-anna could at least tell [herself]97-anna that [she]97-anna had held to [her]97-anna purpose . [She]97-anna had , as [people]365-people said , “ kept up ”[97-anna] during the twenty - four hours preceding [George Darrow]71-darrow ’s departure ; had gone with a calm face about [her]97-anna usual business , and even contrived not too obviously to avoid [him]71-darrow . Then , the next day before dawn , from behind the closed shutters where [she]97-anna had kept for half the night [her]97-anna dry - eyed vigil , [she]97-anna had heard [him]71-darrow drive off to the train which brought [its passengers]1865-its passengers to [Paris]10-paris in time for [the Calais express]1866-the calais express . The fact of [his]71-darrow taking [that train]1867-that train , of [his]71-darrow travelling so straight and far away from [her]97-anna , gave to what had happened the implacable outline of reality . [He]71-darrow was gone ; [he]71-darrow would not come back ; and [her]97-anna life had ended just as [she]97-anna had dreamed it was beginning . [She]97-anna had no doubt , at first , as to the absolute inevitability of this conclusion . [The man who had driven away from [[her]97-anna house]1869-her house in the autumn dawn was not [the man [she]97-anna had loved]1870-the man she had loved ; [he]71-darrow was [a stranger with whom [she]97-anna had not a single thought in common]1871-a stranger with whom she had not a single thought in common . It was terrible , indeed , that [he]71-darrow wore the face and spoke in the voice of [[her]97-anna friend]1276-her friend]1868-the man who had driven away from her house in the autumn dawn was not the man she had loved ; he was a stranger with whom she had not a single thought in common . it was terrible , indeed , that he wore the face and spoke in the voice of her friend , and that , as long as [he]71-darrow was under one roof with [her]97-anna , the mere way in which [he]71-darrow moved and looked could bridge at a stroke the gulf between [them]1873-them . That , no doubt , was the fault of [her]97-anna exaggerated sensibility to outward things : [she]97-anna was frightened to see how it enslaved [her]97-anna . A day or two before [she]97-anna had supposed the sense of honour was [her]97-anna deepest sentiment : if [she]97-anna had smiled at the conventions of [others]2314-others it was because they were too trivial , not because they were too grave . There were certain dishonours with which [she]97-anna had never dreamed that any pact could be made : [she]97-anna had had an incorruptible passion for good faith and fairness . [She]97-anna had supposed that , once [Darrow]71-darrow was gone , once [she]97-anna was safe from the danger of seeing and hearing [him]71-darrow , this high devotion would sustain [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna had believed it would be possible to separate the image of [the man [she]97-anna had thought [him]71-darrow]1875-the man she had thought him from that of [the man [he]71-darrow was]1876-the man he was . [She]97-anna had even foreseen the hour when [she]97-anna might raise a mournful shrine to the memory of [the Darrow [she]97-anna had loved]1877-the darrow she had loved , without fear that [[his]71-darrow double]1878-his double ’s shadow would desecrate it . But now [she]97-anna had begun to understand that [the two men]1345-the two men were really [one]2308-one . [The Darrow [she]97-anna worshipped]1881-the darrow she worshipped was inseparable from [the Darrow [she]97-anna abhorred]1882-the darrow she abhorred ; and the inevitable conclusion was that [both]371-both must go , and [she]97-anna be left in [the desert]1884-the desert of a sorrow without memories ... But if the future was thus void , the present was all too full . Never had blow more complex repercussions ; and to remember [Owen]75-owen was to cease to think of [herself]97-anna . What impulse , what apprehension , had sent [him]71-darrow suddenly to [Paris]10-paris ? And why had [he]71-darrow thought it needful to conceal [his]71-darrow going from [her]97-anna ? When [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had left , it had been with the understanding that [he]71-darrow was to await [her]97-anna summons ; and it seemed improbable that [he]71-darrow would break [his]71-darrow pledge , and seek [her]97-anna without leave , unless [[his]71-darrow lover]1885-his lover ’s intuition had warned [him]71-darrow of some fresh danger . [Anna]97-anna recalled how quickly [he]71-darrow had read the alarm in [her]97-anna face when [he]71-darrow had rushed back to [[her]97-anna sitting - room]2655-her sitting - room with the news that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had promised to see [him]71-darrow again in [Paris]10-paris . To be so promptly roused , [his]71-darrow suspicions must have been but half - asleep ; and since then , no doubt , if [she]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow had dissembled , so had [he]71-darrow . To [her]97-anna proud directness it was degrading to think that [they]1887-they had been living together like [enemies who spy upon each other]1888-enemies who spy upon each other ’s movements : [she]97-anna felt a desperate longing for the days which had seemed so dull and narrow , but in which [she]97-anna had walked with [her]97-anna head high and [her]97-anna eyes unguarded . [She]97-anna had come up to [Paris]10-paris hardly knowing what peril [she]97-anna feared , and still less how [she]97-anna could avert it . If [Owen]75-owen meant to see [Miss Viner]82-miss viner -- and what other object could [he]71-darrow have?--they must already be together , and it was too late to interfere . It had indeed occurred to [Anna]97-anna that [Paris]10-paris might not be [his]71-darrow objective point : that [his]71-darrow real purpose in leaving [Givre]30-givre without [her]97-anna knowledge had been to follow [Darrow]71-darrow to [London]3-london and exact the truth of [him]71-darrow . But even to [her]97-anna alarmed imagination this seemed improbable . [She]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow , to the last , had kept up so complete a feint of harmony that , whatever [Owen]75-owen had surmised , [he]71-darrow could scarcely have risked acting on [his]71-darrow suspicions . If [he]71-darrow still felt the need of an explanation , it was almost certainly of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner that [he]71-darrow would ask it ; and it was in quest of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner that [Anna]97-anna had despatched [Miss Painter]138-miss painter . [She]97-anna had found a blessed refuge from [her]97-anna perplexities in the stolid [Adelaide]122-adelaide ’s unawareness . [One]2308-one could so absolutely count on [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s guessing no more than [one]2308-one chose , and yet acting astutely on such hints as one vouchsafed [her]97-anna ! [She]97-anna was like [a well - trained retriever whose interest in [his]1891-a well - trained retriever whose interest in his prey ceases when he lays it at his master ’s feet prey ceases when [he]1891-a well - trained retriever whose interest in his prey ceases when he lays it at his master ’s feet lays it at [[his]1891-a well - trained retriever whose interest in his prey ceases when he lays it at his master ’s feet master]1892-his master ’s feet]1891-a well - trained retriever whose interest in his prey ceases when he lays it at his master ’s feet . [Anna]97-anna , on arriving , had explained that [Owen]75-owen ’s unannounced flight had made [her]97-anna fear some fresh misunderstanding between [himself]75-owen and [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . In the interests of peace [she]97-anna had thought it best to follow [him]1893-him ; but [she]97-anna hastily added that [she]97-anna did not wish to see [Sophy]81-sophy viner , but only , if possible , to learn from [her]97-anna where [Owen]75-owen was . With these brief instructions [Miss Painter]138-miss painter had started out ; but [she]138-miss painter was [a woman of many occupations]1894-a woman of many occupations , and had given [[her]138-miss painter visitor]1895-her visitor to understand that before returning [she]138-miss painter should have to call on [a friend who had just arrived from [Boston]48-boston]1896-a friend who had just arrived from boston , and afterward despatch to [another exiled compatriot]1897-another exiled compatriot a supply of cranberries and brandied peaches from [the American grocery in [the Champs Elysees]32-the champs elysees]1898-the american grocery in the champs elysees . Gradually , as the moments passed , [Anna]97-anna began to feel the reaction which , in moments of extreme nervous tension , follows on any effort of the will . [She]97-anna seemed to have gone as far as [her]97-anna courage would carry [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna shrank more and more from the thought of [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s return , since whatever information [the latter]231-the latter brought would necessitate some fresh decision . What should [she]97-anna say to [Owen]75-owen if [she]97-anna found [him]1900-him ? What could [she]97-anna say that should not betray the one thing [she]97-anna would give [her]97-anna life to hide from [him]1900-him ? “ Give [her]97-anna life”--how[97-anna] the phrase derided [her]97-anna ! It was a gift [she]97-anna would not have bestowed on [[her]97-anna worst enemy]1901-her worst enemy . [She]97-anna would not have had [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner live the hours [she]97-anna was living now ... [She]97-anna tried again to look steadily and calmly at the picture that the image of [the girl]297-the girl evoked . [She]97-anna had an idea that [she]97-anna ought to accustom [herself]97-anna to its contemplation . If life was like that , why the sooner one got used to it the better ... But no ! Life was not like that . [Her]97-anna adventure was a hideous accident . [She]97-anna dreaded above all the temptation to generalise from [her]97-anna own case , to doubt the high things [she]97-anna had lived by and seek a cheap solace in belittling what fate had refused [her]97-anna . There was such love as [she]97-anna had dreamed , and [she]97-anna meant to go on believing in it , and cherishing the thought that [she]97-anna was worthy of it . What had happened to [her]97-anna was grotesque and mean and miserable ; but [she]97-anna [herself]97-anna was none of these things , and never , never would [she]97-anna make of [herself]97-anna the mock that fate had made of [her]97-anna ... [She]97-anna could not , as yet , bear to think deliberately of [Darrow]71-darrow ; but [she]97-anna kept on repeating to [herself]97-anna “ By and bye that will come too . ”[97-anna] Even now [she]97-anna was determined not to let [his]71-darrow image be distorted by [her]97-anna suffering . As soon as [she]97-anna could , [she]97-anna would try to single out for remembrance the individual things [she]97-anna had liked in [him]71-darrow before [she]97-anna had loved [him]71-darrow altogether . No “ spiritual exercise ”[97-anna] devised by the discipline of piety could have been more torturing ; but its very cruelty attracted [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna wanted to wear [herself]97-anna out with new pains ... XXXI The sound of [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s latch - key made [her]97-anna start . [She]97-anna was still [a bundle of quivering fears to whom each coming moment seemed a menace]1903-a bundle of quivering fears to whom each coming moment seemed a menace . There was a slight interval , and a sound of voices in [the hall]539-the hall ; then [Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s vigorous hand was on the door . [Anna]97-anna stood up as [she]97-anna came in . “ [You]138-miss painter ’ve found [him]71-darrow ? ”[97-anna] “ [I]138-miss painter ’ve found [Sophy]81-sophy viner . ”[138-miss painter] “ And Owen?--has [she]81-sophy viner seen [him]71-darrow ? Is [he]71-darrow [here]2403-here ? ”[138-miss painter] “ [SHE]81-sophy viner ’S [here]2403-here : in [the hall]539-the hall . [She]81-sophy viner wants to speak to [you]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ Here -- NOW ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna found no voice for more . “ [She]81-sophy viner drove back with [me]138-miss painter , ”[138-miss painter] [Miss Painter]138-miss painter continued in the tone of impartial narrative . “ [The cabman]2956-the cabman was impertinent . [I]97-anna ’ve got [his]2956-the cabman number . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna fumbled in a stout black reticule . “ Oh , [I]97-anna can’t-- ”[97-anna] broke from [Anna]97-anna ; but [she]97-anna collected [herself]97-anna , remembering that to betray [her]97-anna unwillingness to see [the girl]297-the girl was to risk revealing much more . “ [She]81-sophy viner thought [you]138-miss painter might be too tired to see [her]81-sophy viner : [she]81-sophy viner would n’t come in till [I]97-anna ’d found out . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna drew a quick breath . An instant ’s thought had told [her]97-anna that [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner would hardly have taken such a step unless something more important had happened . “ Ask [her]81-sophy viner to come , please , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said . [Miss Painter]138-miss painter , from the threshold , turned back to announce [her]138-miss painter intention of going immediately to [the police station]1906-the police station to report [the cabman]2956-the cabman ’s delinquency ; then [she]138-miss painter passed out , and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner entered . The look in [the girl]297-the girl ’s face showed that [she]297-the girl had indeed come unwillingly ; yet [she]297-the girl seemed animated by an eager resoluteness that made [Anna]97-anna ashamed of [her]97-anna tremors . For a moment [they]1909-they looked at [each other]177-each other in silence , as if the thoughts between [them]1909-they were packed too thick for speech ; then [Anna]97-anna said , in a voice from which [she]97-anna strove to take the edge of hardness : “ [You]81-sophy viner know where [Owen]75-owen is , [Miss Painter]138-miss painter tells [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ Yes ; that was [my]81-sophy viner reason for asking [you]81-sophy viner to see [me]81-sophy viner . ”[81-sophy viner] [Sophy]81-sophy viner spoke simply , without constraint or hesitation . “ [I]97-anna thought [he]2957-him ’d promised [you--]2958-you-- ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna interposed . “ [He]2957-him did ; but [he]2957-him broke [his]2957-him promise . That ’s what [I]97-anna thought [I]97-anna ought to tell [you]81-sophy viner . ”[97-anna] “ Thank [you]81-sophy viner . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna went on tentatively : “ [He]2957-him left [Givre]30-givre this morning without a word . [I]97-anna followed [him]2957-him because [I]97-anna was afraid ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna broke off again and [the girl]297-the girl took up [her]297-the girl phrase . “ [You]97-anna were afraid [he]2957-him ’d guessed ? [He]2957-him HAS ... ”[97-anna] “ What do [you]97-anna mean -- guessed what ? ”[97-anna] “ That [you]97-anna know something [he]2957-him does n’t ... something that made [you]97-anna glad to have [me]97-anna go . ”[97-anna] “ Oh-- ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna moaned . If [she]97-anna had wanted more pain [she]97-anna had it now . “ [He]2957-him ’s told [you]97-anna this ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna faltered . “ [He]2957-him has n’t told [me]97-anna , because [I]97-anna have n’t seen [him]2957-him . [I]97-anna kept [him]2957-him off -- [I]97-anna made [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow get rid of [him]2957-him . But [he]2957-him ’s written [me]97-anna what [he]2957-him came to say ; and that was it . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , poor [Owen]75-owen ! ”[97-anna] broke from [Anna]97-anna . Through all the intricacies of [her]97-anna suffering [she]97-anna felt the separate pang of [his]1912-his . “ And [I]297-the girl want to ask [you]97-anna , ”[297-the girl] [the girl]297-the girl continued , “ to let [me]297-the girl see [him]2957-him ; for of course , ”[297-the girl] [she]297-the girl added in the same strange voice of energy , “ [I]297-the girl would n’t unless [you]97-anna consented . ”[297-the girl] “ To see [him]2957-him ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna tried to gather together [her]97-anna startled thoughts . “ What use would it be ? What could [you]97-anna tell [him]2957-him ? ”[297-the girl] “ [I]81-sophy viner want to tell [him]2957-him the truth , ”[81-sophy viner] said [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [The two women]1809-the two women looked at [each other]177-each other , and a burning blush rose to [Anna]97-anna ’s forehead . “ [I]97-anna do n’t understand , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna faltered . [Sophy]81-sophy viner waited a moment ; then [she]97-anna lowered [her]97-anna voice to say : “ [I]97-anna do n’t want [him]2957-him to think worse of [me]97-anna than [he]2957-him need ... ”[97-anna] “ Worse ? ”[97-anna] “ Yes -- to think such things as [you]97-anna ’re thinking now ... [I]97-anna want [him]2957-him to know exactly what happened ... then [I]97-anna want to bid [him]2957-him good - bye . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna tried to clear a way through [her]97-anna own wonder and confusion . [She]97-anna felt [herself]97-anna obscurely moved . “ Would n’t it be worse for [him]2957-him ? ”[97-anna] “ To hear the truth ? It would be better , at any rate , for [you]97-anna and [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] At the sound of the name [Anna]97-anna lifted [her]97-anna head quickly . “ [I]97-anna ’ve only [[my]97-anna step - son]2959-my step - son to consider ! ”[97-anna] [The girl]297-the girl threw a startled look at [her]97-anna . “ [You]97-anna do n’t mean -- [you’re]97-anna not going to give [him]2957-him up ? ”[297-the girl] [Anna]97-anna felt [her]97-anna lips harden . “ [I]297-the girl do n’t think it ’s of any use to talk of that . ”[297-the girl] “ Oh , [I]297-the girl know ! It ’s [my]297-the girl fault for not knowing how to say what [I]297-the girl want [you]97-anna to hear . [Your]97-anna words are different ; [you]97-anna know how to choose them . [Mine]297-the girl offend [you]97-anna ... and the dread of it makes [me]297-the girl blunder . That ’s why , the other day , [I]297-the girl could n’t say anything ... could n’t make things clear to [you]97-anna . But now MUST , even if [you]97-anna hate it ! ”[297-the girl] [She]297-the girl drew a step nearer , [her]297-the girl slender figure swayed forward in a passion of entreaty . “ Do listen to [me]297-the girl ! What [you]97-anna ’ve said is dreadful . How can [you]97-anna speak of [him]2960-him in that voice ? Do n’t [you]97-anna see that [I]297-the girl went away so that [he]2960-him should n’t have to lose [you]97-anna ? ”[297-the girl] [Anna]97-anna looked at [her]297-the girl coldly . “ Are [you]97-anna speaking of [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow ? Oh , how could [you]97-anna ? [You]97-anna ca n’t really love [him!--And]71-darrow yet , ”[297-the girl] [the girl]297-the girl suddenly added , “ [you]97-anna must , or [you]97-anna ’d be more sorry for [me]297-the girl ! ”[297-the girl] “ [I]97-anna ’m very sorry for [you]97-anna , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna said , feeling as if the iron band about [her]97-anna heart pressed on it a little less inexorably . “ Then why wo n’t [you]97-anna hear [me]297-the girl ? Why wo n’t [you]97-anna try to understand ? It ’s all so different from what [you]97-anna imagine ! ”[297-the girl] “ [I]297-the girl ’ve never judged [you]97-anna . ”[297-the girl] “ [I]297-the girl ’m not thinking of [myself]297-the girl . [He]71-darrow loves [you]97-anna ! ”[297-the girl] “ [I]297-the girl thought [you]97-anna ’d come to speak of [Owen]75-owen . ”[297-the girl] [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner seemed not to hear [her]97-anna . “ [He]71-darrow ’s never loved [any one else]2854-any one else . Even those few days ... [I]81-sophy viner knew it all the while ... [he]71-darrow never cared for [me]81-sophy viner . ”[81-sophy viner] “ Please do n’t say any more ! ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna said . “ [I]97-anna know it must seem strange to [you]97-anna that [I]97-anna should say so much . [I]97-anna shock [you]97-anna , [I]97-anna offend [you]97-anna : [you]97-anna think [me]97-anna [a creature without shame]2963-a creature without shame . So [I]97-anna am -- but not in the sense [you]97-anna think ! [I]97-anna ’m not ashamed of having loved [him]71-darrow ; no ; and [I]97-anna ’m not ashamed of telling [you]97-anna so . It ’s that that justifies [me]97-anna -- and [him]71-darrow too ... Oh , let [me]97-anna tell [you]97-anna how it happened ! [He]71-darrow was sorry for [me]97-anna : [he]71-darrow saw [I]97-anna cared . [I]97-anna KNEW that was all [he]71-darrow ever felt . [I]97-anna could see [he]71-darrow was thinking of [some one else]603-some one else . [I]97-anna knew it was only for a week ... [He]71-darrow never said a word to mislead [me]97-anna ... [I]97-anna wanted to be happy just once -- and [I]97-anna did n’t dream of the harm [I]97-anna might be doing [him]71-darrow ! ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna could not speak . [She]97-anna hardly knew , as yet , what [the girl]297-the girl ’s words conveyed to [her]97-anna , save the sense of [their]1919-their tragic fervour ; but [she]97-anna was conscious of being in the presence of an intenser passion than [she]97-anna had ever felt . “ [I]97-anna am sorry for [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna paused . “ But why do [you]71-darrow say this to [me]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] After another interval [she]97-anna exclaimed : “ [You]71-darrow ’d no right to let [Owen]75-owen love [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] “ No ; that was wrong . At least what ’s happened since has made it so . If things had been different [I]97-anna think [I]97-anna could have made [Owen]75-owen happy . [You]71-darrow were all so good to [me]97-anna -- [I]97-anna wanted so to stay with [you]71-darrow ! [I]97-anna suppose [you]71-darrow ’ll say that makes it worse : [my]97-anna daring to dream [I]97-anna had the right ... But all that does n’t matter now . [I]97-anna wo n’t see [Owen]75-owen unless [you]71-darrow ’re willing . [I]97-anna should have liked to tell [him]2965-him what [I]97-anna ’ve tried to tell [you]71-darrow ; but [you]71-darrow must know better ; [you]71-darrow feel things in a finer way . Only [you]71-darrow ’ll have to help [him]2965-him if [I]97-anna ca n’t . [He]2965-him cares a great deal ... it ’s going to hurt [him]2965-him ... ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna trembled . “ Oh , [I]97-anna know ! What can [I]97-anna do ? ”[97-anna] “ [You]71-darrow can go straight back to [Givre]30-givre -- now , at once ! So that [Owen]75-owen shall never know [you]71-darrow ’ve followed [him]2965-him . ”[81-sophy viner] [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s clasped hands reached out urgently . “ And [you]71-darrow can send for [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow -- bring [him]2965-him back . But first [he]2965-him must see for [himself]2965-him that nothing ’s changed for [you]71-darrow . ”[81-sophy viner] [Anna]97-anna stood motionless , subdued and dominated . [The girl]297-the girl ’s ardour swept [her]97-anna like a wind . “ Oh , ca n’t [I]81-sophy viner move [you]97-anna ? Some day [you]97-anna ’ll know ! ”[81-sophy viner] [Sophy]81-sophy viner pleaded , [her]81-sophy viner eyes full of tears . [Anna]97-anna saw them , and felt a fullness in [her]97-anna throat . Again the band about [her]97-anna heart seemed loosened . [She]97-anna wanted to find a word , but could not : all within [her]97-anna was too dark and violent . [She]97-anna gave [the girl]297-the girl a speechless look . “ [I]97-anna do believe [you]297-the girl , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said suddenly ; then [she]97-anna turned and walked out of [the room]663-the room . XXXII [She]97-anna drove from [[Miss Painter]138-miss painter ’s]1923-miss painter ’s to [[her]97-anna own apartment]1924-her own apartment . [The maid - servant who had it in charge]1925-the maid - servant who had it in charge had been apprised of [her]97-anna coming , and had opened one or two of [the rooms]1926-the rooms , and prepared a fire in [[her]97-anna bedroom]1009-her bedroom . [Anna]97-anna shut [herself]97-anna in , refusing [the woman]2912-the woman ’s ministrations . [She]97-anna felt cold and faint , and after [she]97-anna had taken off [her]97-anna hat and cloak [she]97-anna knelt down by the fire and stretched [her]97-anna hands to it . In one respect , at least , it was clear to [her]97-anna that [she]97-anna would do well to follow [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s counsel . It had been an act of folly to follow [Owen]75-owen , and [her]97-anna first business was to get back to [Givre]30-givre before [him]1929-him . But [the only train]1930-the only train leaving that evening was [a slow one]1931-a slow one , which did not reach [Francheuil]42-francheuil till midnight , and [she]97-anna knew that [her]97-anna taking it would excite [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle ’s wonder and lead to interminable talk . [She]97-anna had come up to [Paris]10-paris on the pretext of finding [a new governess]1932-a new governess for [Effie]74-effie , and the natural thing was to defer [her]97-anna return till the next morning . [She]97-anna knew [Owen]75-owen well enough to be sure that [he]1929-him would make another attempt to see [Miss Viner]82-miss viner , and failing that , would write again and await [her]97-anna answer : so that there was no likelihood of [his]1929-him reaching [Givre]30-givre till the following evening . [Her]97-anna sense of relief at not having to start out at once showed [her]97-anna for the first time how tired [she]97-anna was . [The bonne]1933-the bonne had suggested a cup of tea , but the dread of having any one about [her]97-anna had made [Anna]97-anna refuse , and [she]97-anna had eaten nothing since morning but a sandwich bought at a buffet . [She]97-anna was too tired to get up , but stretching out [her]97-anna arm [she]97-anna drew toward [her]97-anna the arm - chair which stood beside the hearth and rested [her]97-anna head against its cushions . Gradually the warmth of the fire stole into [her]97-anna veins and [her]97-anna heaviness of soul was replaced by a dreamy buoyancy . [She]97-anna seemed to be seated on the hearth in [[her]97-anna sitting - room at [Givre]30-givre]1934-her sitting - room at givre , and [Darrow]71-darrow was beside [her]97-anna , in the chair against which [she]97-anna leaned . [He]71-darrow put [his]71-darrow arms about [her]97-anna shoulders and drawing [her]97-anna head back looked into [her]97-anna eyes . “ Of all the ways [you]97-anna do [your]97-anna hair , that ’s the way [I]71-darrow like best , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said ... A log dropped , and [she]97-anna sat up with a start . There was a warmth in [her]97-anna heart , and [she]97-anna was smiling . Then [she]97-anna looked about [her]97-anna , and saw where [she]97-anna was , and the glory fell . [She]97-anna hid [her]97-anna face and sobbed . Presently [she]97-anna perceived that it was growing dark , and getting up stiffly [she]97-anna began to undo the things in [her]97-anna bag and spread them on the dressing - table . [She]97-anna shrank from lighting the lights , and groped [her]97-anna way about , trying to find what [she]97-anna needed . [She]97-anna seemed immeasurably far off from every one , and most of all from [herself]97-anna . It was as if [her]97-anna consciousness had been transmitted to [some stranger whose thoughts and gestures were indifferent to]1935-some stranger whose thoughts and gestures were indifferent to [her]97-anna ... Suddenly [she]97-anna heard a shrill tinkle , and with a beating heart [she]97-anna stood still in the middle of [the room]663-the room . It was the telephone in [[her]97-anna dressing - room]1937-her dressing - room -- a call , no doubt , from [Adelaide Painter]122-adelaide . Or could [Owen]75-owen have learned [she]97-anna was in [town]225-town ? The thought alarmed [her]97-anna and [she]97-anna opened the door and stumbled across [the unlit room]1939-the unlit room to the instrument . [She]97-anna held it to [her]97-anna ear , and heard [Darrow]71-darrow ’s voice pronounce [her]97-anna name . “ Will [you]97-anna let [me]71-darrow see [you]97-anna ? [I]71-darrow ’ve come back -- [I]71-darrow had to come . [Miss Painter]138-miss painter told [me]71-darrow [you]97-anna were here . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna began to tremble , and feared that [he]71-darrow would guess it from [her]97-anna voice . [She]97-anna did not know what [she]97-anna answered : [she]97-anna heard [him]71-darrow say : “ [I]71-darrow ca n’t hear . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna called “ Yes ! ”[97-anna] and laid the telephone down , and caught it up again -- but [he]71-darrow was gone . [She]97-anna wondered if [her]97-anna “ Yes ”[97-anna] had reached [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna sat in [her]97-anna chair and listened . Why had [she]97-anna said that [she]97-anna would see [him]71-darrow ? What did [she]97-anna mean to say to [him]71-darrow when [he]71-darrow came ? Now and then , as [she]97-anna sat there , the sense of [his]71-darrow presence enveloped [her]97-anna as in [her]97-anna dream , and [she]97-anna shut [her]97-anna eyes and felt [his]71-darrow arms about [her]97-anna . Then [she]97-anna woke to reality and shivered . A long time elapsed , and at length [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [He]71-darrow is n’t coming . ”[97-anna] The door - bell rang as [she]97-anna said it , and [she]97-anna stood up , cold and trembling . [She]97-anna thought : “ Can [he]71-darrow imagine there ’s any use in coming ? ”[97-anna] and moved forward to bid [the servant]1940-the servant say [she]97-anna could not see [him]71-darrow . The door opened and [she]97-anna saw [him]71-darrow standing in [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room . [The room]663-the room was cold and fireless , and a hard glare fell from the wall - lights on the shrouded furniture and the white slips covering the curtains . [He]71-darrow looked pale and stern , with a frown of fatigue between [his]71-darrow eyes ; and [she]97-anna remembered that in three days [he]71-darrow had travelled from [Givre]30-givre to [London]3-london and back . It seemed incredible that all that had befallen [her]97-anna should have been compressed within the space of three days ! “ Thank [you]97-anna , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said as [she]97-anna came in . [She]97-anna answered : “ It ’s better , [I]97-anna suppose---- ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow came toward [her]97-anna and took [her]97-anna in [his]71-darrow arms . [She]97-anna struggled a little , afraid of yielding , but [he]71-darrow pressed [her]97-anna to [him]71-darrow , not bending to [her]97-anna but holding [her]97-anna fast , as though [he]71-darrow had found [her]97-anna after a long search : [she]97-anna heard [his]71-darrow hurried breathing . It seemed to come from [her]97-anna own breast , so close [he]71-darrow held [her]97-anna ; and it was [she]97-anna who , at last , lifted up [her]97-anna face and drew down [his]71-darrow . [She]97-anna freed [herself]97-anna and went and sat on a sofa at the other end of [the room]663-the room . A mirror between the shrouded window - curtains showed [her]97-anna crumpled travelling dress and the white face under [her]97-anna disordered hair . [She]97-anna found [her]97-anna voice , and asked [him]71-darrow how [he]71-darrow had been able to leave [London]3-london . [He]71-darrow answered that [he]71-darrow had managed -- [he’d]71-darrow arranged it ; and [she]97-anna saw [he]71-darrow hardly heard what [she]97-anna was saying . “ [I]71-darrow had to see [you]97-anna , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on , and moved nearer , sitting down at [her]97-anna side . “ Yes ; [we]2966-we must think of [Owen----]121-owen---- ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , [Owen--]154-owen-- ! ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna mind had flown back to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s plea that [she]97-anna should let [Darrow]71-darrow return to [Givre]30-givre in order that [Owen]75-owen might be persuaded of the folly of [his]71-darrow suspicions . The suggestion was absurd , of course . [She]97-anna could not ask [Darrow]71-darrow to lend [himself]71-darrow to such a fraud , even had [she]97-anna had the inhuman courage to play [her]97-anna part in it . [She]97-anna was suddenly overwhelmed by the futility of every attempt to reconstruct [[her]97-anna ruined world]1944-her ruined world . No , it was useless ; and since it was useless , every moment with [Darrow]71-darrow was pure pain ... “ [I]71-darrow ’ve come to talk of [myself]71-darrow , not of [Owen]75-owen , ”[71-darrow] [she]97-anna heard [him]71-darrow saying . “ When [you]71-darrow sent [me]71-darrow away the other day [I]71-darrow understood that it could n’t be otherwise -- then . But it ’s not possible that [you]71-darrow and [I]71-darrow should part like that . If [I]71-darrow ’m to lose [you]71-darrow , it must be for a better reason . ”[71-darrow] “ A better reason ? ”[71-darrow] “ Yes : a deeper one . One that means a fundamental disaccord between [us]2967-us . This one doesn’t -- in spite of everything it does n’t . That ’s what [I]97-anna want [you]71-darrow to see , and have the courage to acknowledge . ”[97-anna] “ If [I]71-darrow saw it [I]71-darrow should have the courage ! ”[71-darrow] “ Yes : courage was the wrong word . [You]71-darrow have that . That ’s why [I]71-darrow ’m here . ”[71-darrow] “ But [I]97-anna do n’t see it , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna continued sadly . “ So it ’s useless , is n’t it?--and so cruel ... ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow was about to speak , but [she]97-anna went on : “ [I]97-anna shall never understand it -- never ! ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow looked at [her]97-anna . “ [You]97-anna will some day : [you]97-anna were made to feel everything ”[71-darrow] “ [I]97-anna should have thought this was a case of not feeling---- ”[97-anna] “ On [my]71-darrow part , [you]97-anna mean ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow faced [her]97-anna resolutely . “ Yes , it was : to [my]71-darrow shame ... What [I]71-darrow meant was that when [you]97-anna ’ve lived a little longer [you]97-anna ’ll see what complex blunderers [we]2968-we all are : how [we]2968-we ’re struck blind sometimes , and mad sometimes -- and then , when [our]2968-we sight and [our]2968-we senses come back , how [we]2968-we have to set to work , and build up , little by little , bit by bit , the precious things [we]2968-we ’d smashed to atoms without knowing it . Life ’s just a perpetual piecing together of broken bits . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna looked up quickly . “ That ’s what [I]97-anna feel : that [you]71-darrow ought to---- ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow stood up , interrupting [her]97-anna with a gesture . “ Oh , don’t -- don’t say what [you]71-darrow ’re going to ! [Men]1842-men do n’t give [their]1842-men lives away like that . If [you]97-anna wo n’t have [mine]97-anna , it ’s at least [my]71-darrow own , to do the best [I]71-darrow can with . ”[71-darrow] “ The best [you]97-anna can -- that ’s what [I]71-darrow mean ! How can there be a ‘ best ’ for [you]97-anna that ’s made of [some one else]603-some one else ’s worst ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow sat down again with a groan . “ [I]97-anna do n’t know ! It seemed such a slight thing -- all on the surface -- and [I]97-anna ’ve gone aground on it because it was on the surface . [I]97-anna see the horror of it just as [you]97-anna do . But [I]97-anna see , a little more clearly , the extent , and the limits , of [my]97-anna wrong . It ’s not as black as [you]97-anna imagine . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna lowered [her]97-anna voice to say : “ [I]97-anna suppose [I]97-anna shall never understand ; but [she]2971-she seems to love [you]71-darrow ... ”[97-anna] “ There ’s [my]97-anna shame ! That [I]97-anna did n’t guess it , did n’t fly from it . [You]97-anna say [you]97-anna ’ll never understand : but why should n’t [you]97-anna ? Is it anything to be proud of , to know so little of the strings that pull [us]2972-us ? If [you]97-anna knew a little more , [I]97-anna could tell [you]97-anna how such things happen without offending [you]97-anna ; and perhaps [you]97-anna ’d listen without condemning [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] “ [I]97-anna do n’t condemn [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna was dizzy with struggling impulses . [She]97-anna longed to cry out : “ [I]97-anna DO understand ! [I]97-anna ’ve understood ever since [you]1945-you ’ve been [here]2403-here ! ”[97-anna] For [she]97-anna was aware , in [her]97-anna own bosom , of sensations so separate from [her]97-anna romantic thoughts of [him]1945-you that [she]97-anna saw [her]97-anna body and soul divided against [themselves]1946-themselves . [She]97-anna recalled having read somewhere that in ancient [Rome]57-rome [the slaves]1947-the slaves were not allowed to wear a distinctive dress lest [they]1947-the slaves should recognize [each other]177-each other and learn [their]1947-the slaves numbers and [their]1947-the slaves power . So , in [herself]97-anna , [she]97-anna discerned for the first time instincts and desires , which , mute and unmarked , had gone to and fro in the dim passages of [her]97-anna mind , and now hailed [each other]177-each other with a cry of mutiny . “ Oh , [I]97-anna do n’t know what to think ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna broke out . “ [You]1945-you say [you]1945-you did n’t know [she]97-anna loved [you]1945-you . But [you]1945-you know it now . Does n’t that show [you]1945-you how [you]1945-you can put the broken bits together ? ”[97-anna] “ Can [you]1945-you seriously think it would be doing so to marry [one woman]2974-one woman while [I]1950-his care for another ? ”[1950-his] “ Oh , [I]1950-his do n’t know ... [I]1950-his do n’t know ... ”[1950-his] The sense of [her]97-anna weakness made [her]97-anna try to harden [herself]97-anna against [his]1950-his arguments . “ [You]97-anna do know ! [We]1952-they ’ve often talked of such things : of the monstrousness of useless sacrifices . If [I]1950-his ’m to expiate , it ’s not in that way . ”[1950-his] [He]1950-his added abruptly : “ It ’s in having to say this to [you]97-anna now ... ”[1950-his] [She]97-anna found no answer . Through [the silent apartment]1951-the silent apartment [they]1952-they heard the sudden peal of the door - bell , and [she]97-anna rose to [her]97-anna feet . “ [Owen]75-owen ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna instantly exclaimed . “ Is [Owen]75-owen in [Paris]10-paris ? ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna explained in a rapid undertone what [she]97-anna had learned from [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . “ Shall [I]71-darrow leave [you]97-anna ? ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow asked . “ Yes ... no ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna moved to the dining - room door , with the half - formed purpose of making [him]1950-his pass out , and then turned back . “ It may be [Adelaide]122-adelaide . ”[97-anna] [They]1952-they heard the outer door open , and a moment later [Owen]75-owen walked into [the room]663-the room . [He]1950-his was pale , with excited eyes : as [they]1952-they fell on [Darrow]71-darrow , [Anna]97-anna saw [his]1950-his start of wonder . [He]1950-his made a slight sign of recognition , and then went up to [[his]1950-his step - mother]233-his step - mother with an air of exaggerated gaiety . “ [[You]97-anna furtive person]2975-you furtive person ! [I]1950-his ran across the omniscient [Adelaide]122-adelaide and heard from [her]122-adelaide that [you]97-anna ’d rushed up suddenly and secretly . ”[1950-his] [He]1950-his stood between [Anna]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow , strained , questioning , dangerously on edge . “ [I]97-anna came up to meet [Mr. Darrow]71-darrow , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna answered . “ [His]1950-his leave ’s been prolonged -- [he]1950-his ’s going back with [me]97-anna . ”[97-anna] The words seemed to have uttered themselves without [her]97-anna will , yet [she]97-anna felt a great sense of freedom as [she]97-anna spoke them . The hard tension of [Owen]75-owen ’s face changed to incredulous surprise . [He]1950-his looked at [Darrow]71-darrow . “ The merest luck ... [a colleague whose wife]2976-a colleague whose wife was ill ... [I]231-the latter came straight back , ”[231-the latter] [she]97-anna heard [the latter]231-the latter tranquilly explaining . [His]1950-his self - command helped to steady [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna smiled at [Owen]75-owen . “ [We]2977-we ’ll all go back together tomorrow morning , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said as [she]97-anna slipped [her]97-anna arm through [his]1950-his . XXXIII [Owen Leath]75-owen did not go back with [[his]1950-his step - mother]233-his step - mother to [Givre]30-givre . In reply to [her]233-his step - mother suggestion [he]1950-his announced [his]1950-his intention of staying on a day or two longer in [Paris]10-paris . [Anna]97-anna left alone by [the first train]2378-the first train the next morning . [Darrow]71-darrow was to follow in the afternoon . When [Owen]75-owen had left [them]1958-them the evening before , [Darrow]71-darrow waited a moment for [her]233-his step - mother to speak ; then , as [she]233-his step - mother said nothing , [he]71-darrow asked [her]233-his step - mother if [she]233-his step - mother really wished [him]1950-his to return to [Givre]30-givre . [She]233-his step - mother made a mute sign of assent , and [he]71-darrow added : “ For [you]233-his step - mother know that , much as [I]71-darrow ’m ready to do for [Owen]75-owen , [I]71-darrow ca n’t do that for [him]71-darrow -- [I]71-darrow ca n’t go back to be sent away again . ”[71-darrow] “ No -- no ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow came nearer , and looked at [her]233-his step - mother , and [she]233-his step - mother went to [him]71-darrow . All [her]233-his step - mother fears seemed to fall from [her]233-his step - mother as [he]71-darrow held [her]233-his step - mother . It was a different feeling from any [she]233-his step - mother had known before : confused and turbid , as if secret shames and rancours stirred in it , yet richer , deeper , more enslaving . [She]233-his step - mother leaned [her]233-his step - mother head back and shut [her]233-his step - mother eyes beneath [his]71-darrow kisses . [She]233-his step - mother knew now that [she]233-his step - mother could never give [him]71-darrow up . Nevertheless [she]233-his step - mother asked [him]71-darrow , the next morning , to let [her]233-his step - mother go back alone to [Givre]30-givre . [She]233-his step - mother wanted time to think . [She]233-his step - mother was convinced that what had happened was inevitable , that [she]233-his step - mother and [Darrow]71-darrow belonged to [each other]177-each other , and that [he]71-darrow was right in saying no past folly could ever put [them]1960-them asunder . If there was a shade of difference in [her]233-his step - mother feeling for [him]71-darrow it was that of an added intensity . [She]233-his step - mother felt restless , insecure out of [his]71-darrow sight : [she]233-his step - mother had a sense of incompleteness , of passionate dependence , that was somehow at variance with [her]233-his step - mother own conception of [her]233-his step - mother character . It was partly the consciousness of this change in [herself]233-his step - mother that made [her]233-his step - mother want to be alone . The solitude of [her]233-his step - mother inner life had given [her]233-his step - mother the habit of these hours of self - examination , and [she]233-his step - mother needed them as [she]233-his step - mother needed [her]233-his step - mother morning plunge into cold water . During the journey [she]233-his step - mother tried to review what had happened in the light of [her]233-his step - mother new decision and of [her]233-his step - mother sudden relief from pain . [She]233-his step - mother seemed to [herself]233-his step - mother to have passed through some fiery initiation from which [she]233-his step - mother had emerged seared and quivering , but clutching to [her]233-his step - mother breast a magic talisman . [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had cried out to [her]233-his step - mother : “ Some day [you]233-his step - mother ’ll know ! ”[81-sophy viner] and [Darrow]71-darrow had used the same words . They meant , [she]233-his step - mother supposed , that when [she]233-his step - mother had explored the intricacies and darknesses of [her]233-his step - mother own heart [her]233-his step - mother judgment of others would be less absolute . Well , [she]233-his step - mother knew now -- knew weaknesses and strengths [she]233-his step - mother had not dreamed of , and the deep discord and still deeper complicities between what thought in [her]233-his step - mother and what blindly wanted ... [Her]233-his step - mother mind turned anxiously to [Owen]75-owen . At least the blow that was to fall on [him]1961-him would not seem to have been inflicted by [her]233-his step - mother hand . [He]1961-him would be left with the impression that [his]1961-him breach with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner was due to one of the ordinary causes of such disruptions : though [he]1961-him must lose [her]233-his step - mother , [his]1961-him memory of [her]233-his step - mother would not be poisoned . [Anna]97-anna never for a moment permitted [herself]97-anna the delusion that [she]97-anna had renewed [her]97-anna promise to [Darrow]71-darrow in order to spare [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son this last refinement of misery . [She]97-anna knew [she]97-anna had been prompted by the irresistible impulse to hold fast to what was most precious to [her]97-anna , and that [Owen]75-owen ’s arrival on the scene had been the pretext for [her]97-anna decision , and not its cause ; yet [she]97-anna felt [herself]97-anna fortified by the thought of what [she]97-anna had spared [him]1961-him . It was as though a star [she]97-anna had been used to follow had shed its familiar ray on ways unknown to [her]97-anna . All through these meditations ran the undercurrent of an absolute trust in [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [She]97-anna thought of [the girl with a mingling of antipathy and confidence]1963-the girl with a mingling of antipathy and confidence . It was humiliating to [her]97-anna pride to recognize kindred impulses in a character which [she]97-anna would have liked to feel completely alien to [her]97-anna . But what indeed was [the girl]297-the girl really like ? [She]297-the girl seemed to have no scruples and a thousand delicacies . [She]97-anna had given [herself]97-anna to [Darrow]71-darrow , and concealed the episode from [Owen Leath]75-owen , with no more apparent sense of debasement than the vulgarest of adventuresses ; yet [she]97-anna had instantly obeyed the voice of [her]97-anna heart when it bade [her]97-anna part from [the one]1965-the one and serve the other . [Anna]97-anna tried to picture what [the girl]297-the girl ’s life must have been : what experiences , what initiations , had formed [her]97-anna . But [her]97-anna own training had been too different : there were veils [she]97-anna could not lift . [She]97-anna looked back at [her]97-anna married life , and its colourless uniformity took on an air of high restraint and order . Was it because [she]97-anna had been so incurious that it had worn that look to [her]97-anna ? It struck [her]97-anna with amazement that [she]97-anna had never given a thought to [[her]97-anna husband]174-her husband ’s past , or wondered what [he]174-her husband did and where [he]174-her husband went when [he]174-her husband was away from [her]97-anna . If [she]97-anna had been asked what [she]97-anna supposed [he]174-her husband thought about when [they]1968-they were apart , [she]97-anna would instantly have answered : [his]174-her husband snuff - boxes . It had never occurred to [her]97-anna that [he]174-her husband might have passions , interests , preoccupations of which [she]97-anna was absolutely ignorant . Yet [he]174-her husband went up to [Paris]10-paris rather regularly : ostensibly to attend sales and exhibitions , or to confer with [dealers]1969-dealers and [collectors]1970-collectors . [She]97-anna tried to picture [him]174-her husband , straight , trim , beautifully brushed and varnished , walking furtively down [a quiet street]1971-a quiet street , and looking about [him]174-her husband before [he]174-her husband slipped into a doorway . [She]97-anna understood now that [she]97-anna had been cold to [him]174-her husband : what more likely than that [he]174-her husband had sought compensations ? [All men]1972-all men were like that , [she]97-anna supposed -- no doubt [her]97-anna simplicity had amused [him]174-her husband . In the act of transposing [Fraser Leath]72-fraser leath into [a Don Juan]1973-a don juan [she]97-anna was pulled up by the ironic perception that [she]97-anna was simply trying to justify [Darrow]71-darrow . [She]97-anna wanted to think that [all men]1972-all men were “ like that ”[97-anna] because [Darrow]71-darrow was “ like that ”[97-anna] : [she]97-anna wanted to justify [her]97-anna acceptance of the fact by persuading [herself]97-anna that only through such concessions could [women like [herself]97-anna]1975-women like herself hope to keep what [they]1975-women like herself could not give up . And suddenly [she]97-anna was filled with anger at [her]97-anna blindness , and then at [her]97-anna disastrous attempt to see . Why had [she]97-anna forced the truth out of [Darrow]71-darrow ? If only [she]97-anna had held [her]97-anna tongue nothing need ever have been known . Sophy [Viner]81-sophy viner would have broken [her]81-sophy viner engagement , [Owen]75-owen would have been sent around [the world]206-the world , and [her]97-anna own dream would have been unshattered . But [she]97-anna had probed , insisted , cross - examined , not rested till [she]97-anna had dragged the secret to the light . [She]97-anna was one of [the luckless women who always have the wrong audacities , and who always know it]1977-the luckless women who always have the wrong audacities , and who always know it ... Was it [she]97-anna , [Anna Leath]97-anna , who was picturing [herself]97-anna to [herself]97-anna in that way ? [She]97-anna recoiled from [her]97-anna thoughts as if with a sense of demoniac possession , and there flashed through [her]97-anna the longing to return to [her]97-anna old state of fearless ignorance . If at that moment [she]97-anna could have kept [Darrow]71-darrow from following [her]97-anna to [Givre]30-givre [she]97-anna would have done so ... But [he]71-darrow came ; and with the sight of [him]71-darrow the turmoil fell and [she]97-anna felt [herself]97-anna reassured , rehabilitated . [He]71-darrow arrived toward dusk , and [she]97-anna motored to [Francheuil]42-francheuil to meet [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna wanted to see [him]71-darrow as soon as possible , for [she]97-anna had divined , through the new insight that was in [her]97-anna , that only [his]71-darrow presence could restore [her]97-anna to a normal view of things . In [the motor]1020-the motor , as [they]1979-they left [the town]1980-the town and turned into [the high - road]1376-the high - road , [he]71-darrow lifted [her]97-anna hand and kissed it , and [she]97-anna leaned against [him]71-darrow , and felt the currents flow between [them]1979-they . [She]97-anna was grateful to [him]71-darrow for not saying anything , and for not expecting [her]97-anna to speak . [She]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [He]71-darrow never makes a mistake -- [he]71-darrow always knows what to do ”[97-anna] ; and then [she]97-anna thought with a start that it was doubtless because [he]71-darrow had so often been in such situations . The idea that [his]71-darrow tact was a kind of professional expertness filled [her]97-anna with repugnance , and insensibly [she]97-anna drew away from [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow made no motion to bring [her]97-anna nearer , and [she]97-anna instantly thought that that was calculated too . [She]97-anna sat beside [him]71-darrow in frozen misery , wondering whether , henceforth , [she]97-anna would measure in this way [his]71-darrow every look and gesture . Neither of [them]1982-them spoke again till [the motor]1020-the motor turned under the dark arch of [the avenue]1076-the avenue , and [they]1982-them saw the lights of [Givre]30-givre twinkling at its end . Then [Darrow]71-darrow laid [his]71-darrow hand on [hers]97-anna and said : “ [I]71-darrow know , [dear--]2978-dear-- ”[71-darrow] and the hardness in [her]97-anna melted . “ [He]71-darrow ’s suffering as [I]97-anna am , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought ; and for a moment the baleful fact between [them]1982-them seemed to draw [them]1982-them closer instead of walling [them]1982-them up in [their]1982-them separate wretchedness . It was wonderful to be once more re - entering the doors of [Givre]30-givre with [him]71-darrow , and as [the old house]1985-the old house received [them]1982-them into [its]1985-the old house mellow silence [she]97-anna had again the sense of passing out of a dreadful dream into the reassurance of kindly and familiar things . It did not seem possible that [these quiet rooms]1986-these quiet rooms , so full of the slowly - distilled accumulations of a fastidious taste , should have been the scene of tragic dissensions . The memory of [them]1982-them seemed to be shut out into the night with the closing and barring of [its]1985-the old house doors . At the tea - table in [the oak - room]1558-the oak - room [they]1982-them found [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle and [Effie]74-effie . [The little girl]858-the little girl , catching sight of [Darrow]71-darrow , raced down [the drawing - rooms]1202-the drawing - rooms to meet [him]71-darrow , and returned in triumph on [his]71-darrow shoulder . [Anna]97-anna looked at [them]1982-them with a smile . [Effie]74-effie , for all [her]74-effie graces , was chary of such favours , and [[her]74-effie mother]221-her mother knew that in according [them]1982-them to [Darrow]71-darrow [she]221-her mother had admitted [him]71-darrow to [the circle where [Owen]75-owen had hitherto ruled]1991-the circle where owen had hitherto ruled . Over the tea - table [Darrow]71-darrow gave [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle the explanation of [his]71-darrow sudden return from [England]8-england . On reaching [London]3-london , [he]71-darrow told [her]111-madame de chantelle , [he]71-darrow had found that [the secretary [he]71-darrow was to have replaced]1992-the secretary he was to have replaced was detained [there]2294-there by the illness of [[his]71-darrow wife]207-his wife . [The Ambassador]1995-the ambassador , knowing [Darrow]71-darrow ’s urgent reasons for wishing to be in [France]4-france , had immediately proposed [his]71-darrow going back , and awaiting at [Givre]30-givre the summons to relieve [[his]71-darrow colleague]1996-his colleague ; and [he]71-darrow had jumped into [the first train]2378-the first train , without even waiting to telegraph the news of [his]71-darrow release . [He]71-darrow spoke naturally , easily , in [his]71-darrow usual quiet voice , taking [his]71-darrow tea from [Effie]74-effie , helping [himself]71-darrow to the toast [she]74-effie handed , and stooping now and then to stroke the dozing terrier . And suddenly , as [Anna]97-anna listened to [his]71-darrow explanation , [she]97-anna asked [herself]97-anna if it were true . The question , of course , was absurd . There was no possible reason why [he]71-darrow should invent a false account of [his]71-darrow return , and every probability that the version [he]71-darrow gave was the real one . But [he]71-darrow had looked and spoken in the same way when [he]71-darrow had answered [her]74-effie probing questions about [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , and [she]74-effie reflected with a chill of fear that [she]74-effie would never again know if [he]71-darrow were speaking the truth or not . [She]74-effie was sure [he]71-darrow loved [her]74-effie , and [she]74-effie did not fear [his]71-darrow insincerity as much as [her]74-effie own distrust of [him]71-darrow . For a moment it seemed to [her]74-effie that this must corrupt the very source of love ; then [she]74-effie said to [herself]74-effie : “ By and bye , when [I]74-effie am altogether [his]71-darrow , [we]2979-we shall be so near [each other]177-each other that there will be no room for any doubts between [us]2979-we . ”[74-effie] But the doubts were there now , one moment lulled to quiescence , the next more torturingly alert . When [the nurse]1998-the nurse appeared to summon [Effie]74-effie , [the little girl]858-the little girl , after kissing [[her]858-the little girl grandmother]2000-her grandmother , entrenched [herself]858-the little girl on [Darrow]71-darrow ’s knee with the imperious demand to be carried up to bed ; and [Anna]97-anna , while [she]97-anna laughingly protested , said to [herself]97-anna with a pang : “ Can [I]97-anna give [her]858-the little girl a father about whom [I]97-anna think such things ? ”[97-anna] The thought of [Effie]74-effie , and of what [she]74-effie owed to [Effie]74-effie , had been the fundamental reason for [her]74-effie delays and hesitations when [she]74-effie and [Darrow]71-darrow had come together again in [England]8-england . [Her]74-effie own feeling was so clear that but for that scruple [she]74-effie would have put [her]74-effie hand in [his]71-darrow at once . But till [she]74-effie had seen [him]71-darrow again [she]74-effie had never considered the possibility of re - marriage , and when it suddenly confronted [her]74-effie it seemed , for the moment , to disorganize the life [she]74-effie had planned for [herself]74-effie and [[her]74-effie child]1290-her child . [She]74-effie had not spoken of this to [Darrow]71-darrow because it appeared to [her]74-effie a subject to be debated within [her]74-effie own conscience . The question , then , was not as to [his]71-darrow fitness to become [the guide and guardian of [[her]74-effie child]1290-her child]2002-the guide and guardian of her child ; nor did [she]74-effie fear that [her]74-effie love for [him]71-darrow would deprive [Effie]74-effie of the least fraction of [her]74-effie tenderness , since [she]74-effie did not think of love as something measured and exhaustible but as a treasure perpetually renewed . What [she]74-effie questioned was [her]74-effie right to introduce into [her]74-effie life any interests and duties which might rob [Effie]74-effie of a part of [her]74-effie time , or lessen the closeness of [their]2004-their daily intercourse . [She]74-effie had decided this question as it was inevitable that [she]74-effie should ; but now another was before [her]74-effie . Assuredly , at [her]74-effie age , there was no possible reason why [she]74-effie should cloister [herself]74-effie to bring up [[her]74-effie daughter]1136-her daughter ; but there was every reason for not marrying [a man in whom [her]74-effie own faith was not complete ... XXXIV]2006-a man in whom her own faith was not complete ... xxxiv When [she]74-effie woke the next morning [she]74-effie felt a great lightness of heart . [She]74-effie recalled [her]74-effie last awakening at [Givre]30-givre , three days before , when it had seemed as though all [her]74-effie life had gone down in darkness . Now [Darrow]71-darrow was once more under the same roof with [her]74-effie , and once more [his]71-darrow nearness sufficed to make the looming horror drop away . [She]74-effie could almost have smiled at [her]74-effie scruples of the night before : as [she]74-effie looked back on them they seemed to belong to the old ignorant timorous time when [she]74-effie had feared to look life in the face , and had been blind to the mysteries and contradictions of the human heart because [her]74-effie own had not been revealed to [her]74-effie . [Darrow]71-darrow had said : “ [You]2981-you were made to feel everything ”[71-darrow] ; and to feel was surely better than to judge . When [she]74-effie came [downstairs]1174-downstairs [he]71-darrow was already in [the oak - room]1558-the oak - room with [Effie]74-effie and [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle , and the sense of reassurance which [his]71-darrow presence gave [her]74-effie was merged in the relief of not being able to speak of what was between [them]2009-them . But there it was , inevitably , and whenever [they]2009-them looked at [each other]177-each other [they]2009-them saw it . In [her]74-effie dread of giving it a more tangible shape [she]74-effie tried to devise means of keeping [the little girl]858-the little girl with [her]74-effie , and , when [the latter]231-the latter had been called away by [the nurse]1998-the nurse , found an excuse for following [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle [upstairs]597-upstairs to [the purple sitting - room]2015-the purple sitting - room . But a confidential talk with [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle implied the detailed discussion of plans of which [Anna]97-anna could hardly yet bear to consider the vaguest outline : the date of [her]97-anna marriage , the relative advantages of sailing from [London]3-london or [Lisbon]59-lisbon , the possibility of hiring [a habitable house at [their]2009-them new post]2016-a habitable house at their new post ; and , when these problems were exhausted , the application of the same method to the subject of [Owen]75-owen ’s future . [[His]2017-his grandmother]991-his grandmother , having no suspicion of the real reason of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s departure , had thought it “ extremely suitable ”[991-his grandmother] of [the young girl]328-the young girl to withdraw to the shelter of [[[her]74-effie old friends]1662-her old friends ’ roof]2021-her old friends ’ roof in the hour of bridal preparation . This maidenly retreat had in fact impressed [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle so favourably that [she]111-madame de chantelle was disposed for the first time to talk over [Owen]75-owen ’s projects ; and as every human event translated itself for [her]111-madame de chantelle into terms of social and domestic detail , [Anna]97-anna had perforce to travel the same round again . [She]97-anna felt a momentary relief when [Darrow]71-darrow presently joined [them]2009-them ; but [his]71-darrow coming served only to draw the conversation back to the question of [their]2009-them own future , and [Anna]97-anna felt a new pang as [she]97-anna heard [him]71-darrow calmly and lucidly discussing it . Did such self - possession imply indifference or insincerity ? In that problem [her]97-anna mind perpetually revolved ; and [she]97-anna dreaded the one answer as much as the other . [She]97-anna was resolved to keep on [her]97-anna course as though nothing had happened : to marry [Darrow]71-darrow and never let the consciousness of the past intrude itself between [them]2009-them ; but [she]97-anna was beginning to feel that the only way of attaining to this state of detachment from the irreparable was once for all to turn back with [him]71-darrow to its contemplation . As soon as this desire had germinated it became so strong in [her]97-anna that [she]97-anna regretted having promised [Effie]74-effie to take [her]97-anna out for the afternoon . But [she]97-anna could think of no pretext for disappointing [the little girl]858-the little girl , and soon after luncheon [the three]1138-the three set forth in [the motor]1020-the motor to show [Darrow]71-darrow [a chateau famous in the annals of [the region]2026-the region]2025-a chateau famous in the annals of the region . During [their]1138-the three excursion [Anna]97-anna found it impossible to guess from [his]71-darrow demeanour if [Effie]74-effie ’s presence between [them]1138-the three was as much of a strain to [his]71-darrow composure as to [hers]97-anna . [He]71-darrow remained imperturbably good - humoured and appreciative while [they]1138-the three went the round of the monument , and [she]97-anna remarked only that when [he]71-darrow thought [himself]71-darrow unnoticed [his]71-darrow face grew grave and [his]71-darrow answers came less promptly . On the way back , two or three miles from [Givre]30-givre , [she]97-anna suddenly proposed that [they]1138-the three should walk [home]1482-home through [the forest]792-the forest which skirted [that side of [the park]765-the park]2029-that side of the park . [Darrow]71-darrow acquiesced , and [they]1138-the three got out and sent [Effie]74-effie on in [the motor]1020-the motor . [Their]1138-the three way led through [a bit of [sober French woodland]2033-sober french woodland]2032-a bit of sober french woodland , flat as a faded tapestry , but with gleams of live emerald lingering here and there among its browns and ochres . The luminous grey air gave vividness to its dying colours , and veiled the distant glimpses of the landscape in soft uncertainty . In such a solitude [Anna]97-anna had fancied it would be easier to speak ; but as [she]97-anna walked beside [Darrow]71-darrow over the deep soundless flooring of brown moss the words on [her]97-anna lips took flight again . It seemed impossible to break the spell of quiet joy which [his]71-darrow presence laid on [her]97-anna , and when [he]71-darrow began to talk of [the place [they]1138-the three had just visited]2034-the place they had just visited [she]97-anna answered [his]71-darrow questions and then waited for what [he]71-darrow should say next ... No , decidedly [she]97-anna could not speak ; [she]97-anna no longer even knew what [she]97-anna had meant to say ... The same experience repeated itself several times that day and the next . When [she]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow were apart [she]97-anna exhausted [herself]97-anna in appeal and interrogation , [she]97-anna formulated with a fervent lucidity every point in [her]97-anna imaginary argument . But as soon as [she]97-anna was alone with [him]71-darrow something deeper than reason and subtler than shyness laid its benumbing touch upon [her]97-anna , and the desire to speak became merely a dim disquietude , through which [his]71-darrow looks , [his]71-darrow words , [his]71-darrow touch , reached [her]97-anna as through a mist of bodily pain . Yet this inertia was torn by wild flashes of resistance , and when [they]1138-the three were apart [she]97-anna began to prepare again what [she]97-anna meant to say to [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna knew [he]71-darrow could not be with [her]97-anna without being aware of this inner turmoil , and [she]97-anna hoped [he]71-darrow would break the spell by some releasing word . But [she]97-anna presently understood that [he]71-darrow recognized the futility of words , and was resolutely bent on holding [her]97-anna to [her]97-anna own purpose of behaving as if nothing had happened . Once more [she]97-anna inwardly accused [him]71-darrow of insensibility , and [her]97-anna imagination was beset by tormenting visions of [his]71-darrow past ... Had such things happened to [him]71-darrow before ? If the episode had been an isolated accident--“a moment of folly and madness ”[71-darrow] , as [he]71-darrow had called it -- [she]97-anna could understand , or at least begin to understand ( for at a certain point [her]97-anna imagination always turned back ) ; but if it were a mere link in a chain of similar experiments , the thought of it dishonoured [her]97-anna whole past ... [Effie]74-effie , in the interregnum between [governesses]2282-governesses , had been given leave to dine [downstairs]1174-downstairs ; and [Anna]97-anna , on the evening of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s return , kept [the little girl]858-the little girl with [her]97-anna till long after [the nurse]1998-the nurse had signalled from the drawing - room door . When at length [she]97-anna had been carried off , [Anna]97-anna proposed a game of cards , and after this diversion had drawn to its languid close [she]97-anna said good - night to [Darrow]71-darrow and followed [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle [upstairs]597-upstairs . But [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle never sat up late , and the second evening , with the amiably implied intention of leaving [Anna]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow to [themselves]2040-themselves , [she]97-anna took an earlier leave of [them]2040-themselves than usual . [Anna]97-anna sat silent , listening to [her]97-anna small stiff steps as they minced down [the hall]539-the hall and died out in the distance . [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle had broken [her]111-madame de chantelle wooden embroidery frame , and [Darrow]71-darrow , having offered to repair it , had drawn [his]71-darrow chair up to a table that held a lamp . [Anna]97-anna watched [him]71-darrow as [he]71-darrow sat with bent head and knitted brows , trying to fit together the disjoined pieces .
