The sight of [him]71-darrow , so tranquilly absorbed in this trifling business , seemed to give to [the quiet room]1260-the quiet room a perfume of intimacy , to fill it with a sense of sweet familiar habit ; and it came over [her]97-anna again that [she]97-anna knew nothing of the inner thoughts of [this man who was sitting by [her]97-anna as [a husband]855-a husband might]2043-this man who was sitting by her as a husband might . The lamplight fell on [his]71-darrow white forehead , on the healthy brown of [his]71-darrow cheek , the backs of [his]71-darrow thin sunburnt hands . As [she]97-anna watched the hands [her]97-anna sense of them became as vivid as a touch , and [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [That other woman]2982-that other woman has sat and watched [him]71-darrow as [I]97-anna am doing . [She]2982-that other woman has known [him]71-darrow as [I]97-anna have never known [him]71-darrow ... Perhaps [he]71-darrow is thinking of that now . Or perhaps [he]71-darrow has forgotten it all as completely as [I]97-anna have forgotten everything that happened to [me]97-anna before [he]71-darrow came ... ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow looked young , active , stored with strength and energy ; not [the man for vain repinings or long memories]2045-the man for vain repinings or long memories . [She]97-anna wondered what [she]97-anna had to hold or satisfy [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow loved [her]97-anna now ; [she]97-anna had no doubt of that ; but how could [she]97-anna hope to keep [him]71-darrow ? [They]2046-they were so nearly of an age that already [she]97-anna felt [herself]97-anna [his]71-darrow senior . As yet the difference was not visible ; outwardly at least they were matched ; but ill - health or unhappiness would soon do away with this equality . [She]97-anna thought with a pang of bitterness : “ [He]71-darrow wo n’t grow any older because [he]71-darrow does n’t feel things ; and because [he]71-darrow does n’t , [I]97-anna SHALL ... ”[97-anna] And when [she]97-anna ceased to please [him]71-darrow , what then ? Had [he]71-darrow the tradition of faith to the spoken vow , or the deeper piety of the unspoken dedication ? What was [his]71-darrow theory , what [his]71-darrow inner conviction in such matters ? But what did [she]97-anna care for [his]71-darrow convictions or [his]71-darrow theories ? No doubt [he]71-darrow loved [her]97-anna now , and believed [he]71-darrow would always go on loving [her]97-anna , and was persuaded that , if [he]71-darrow ceased to , [his]71-darrow loyalty would be proof against the change . What [she]97-anna wanted to know was not what [he]71-darrow thought about it in advance , but what would impel or restrain [him]71-darrow at the crucial hour . [She]97-anna put no faith in [her]97-anna own arts : [she]97-anna was too sure of having none ! And if [some beneficent enchanter]2047-some beneficent enchanter had bestowed them on [her]97-anna , [she]97-anna knew now that [she]97-anna would have rejected the gift . [She]97-anna could hardly conceive of wanting the kind of love that was a state one could be cozened into ... [Darrow]71-darrow , putting away the frame , walked across [the room]663-the room and sat down beside [her]97-anna ; and [she]97-anna felt [he]71-darrow had something special to say . “ [They]2983-they ’re sure to send for [me]71-darrow in a day or two now , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow began . [She]97-anna made no answer , and [he]71-darrow continued : “ [You]97-anna ’ll tell [me]71-darrow before [I]71-darrow go what day [I]71-darrow ’m to come back and get [you]97-anna ? ”[71-darrow] It was the first time since [his]71-darrow return to [Givre]30-givre that [he]71-darrow had made any direct allusion to the date of [their]2049-their marriage ; and instead of answering [him]71-darrow [she]97-anna broke out : “ There ’s something [I]97-anna ’ve been wanting [you]71-darrow to know . The other day in [Paris]10-paris [I]97-anna saw [Miss Viner]82-miss viner . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna saw [him]71-darrow flush with the intensity of [his]71-darrow surprise . “ [You]71-darrow sent for [her]82-miss viner ? ”[97-anna] “ No ; [she]82-miss viner heard from [Adelaide]122-adelaide that [I]71-darrow was in [Paris]10-paris and [she]82-miss viner came . [She]82-miss viner came because [she]82-miss viner wanted to urge [me]71-darrow to marry [you]71-darrow . [I]71-darrow thought [you]71-darrow ought to know what [she]82-miss viner had done . ”[71-darrow] [Darrow]71-darrow stood up . “ [I]71-darrow ’m glad [you]71-darrow ’ve told [me]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow spoke with a visible effort at composure . [Her]2050-she eyes followed [him]71-darrow as [he]71-darrow moved away . “ Is that all ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked after an interval . “ It seems to [me]71-darrow a great deal . ”[71-darrow] “ It ’s what [she]82-miss viner ’d already asked [me]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [His]71-darrow voice showed [her]2050-she how deeply [he]71-darrow was moved , and a throb of jealousy shot through [her]2050-she . “ Oh , it was for [your]71-darrow sake , [I]71-darrow know ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow made no answer , and [she]2050-she added : “ [She]82-miss viner ’s been exceedingly generous ... Why should n’t [we]2984-we speak of it ? ”[2050-she] [She]2050-she had lowered [her]2050-she head , but through [her]2050-she dropped lids [she]2050-she seemed to be watching the crowded scene of [his]71-darrow face . “ [I]2050-she ’ve not shrunk from speaking of it . ”[2050-she] “ Speaking of [her]82-miss viner , then , [I]2050-she mean . It seems to [me]2050-she that if [I]2050-she could talk to [you]71-darrow about [her]82-miss viner [I]2050-she should know better---- ”[2050-she] [She]2050-she broke off , confused , and [he]71-darrow questioned : “ What is it [you]2050-she want to know better ? ”[71-darrow] The colour rose to [her]2050-she forehead . How could [she]2050-she tell [him]71-darrow what [she]2050-she scarcely dared own to [herself]2050-she ? There was nothing [she]2050-she did not want to know , no fold or cranny of [his]71-darrow secret that [her]2050-she awakened imagination did not strain to penetrate ; but [she]2050-she could not expose [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner to the base fingerings of a retrospective jealousy , nor [Darrow]71-darrow to the temptation of belittling [her]81-sophy viner in the effort to better [his]71-darrow own case . [The girl]297-the girl had been magnificent , and the only worthy return that [Anna]97-anna could make was to take [Darrow]71-darrow from [her]97-anna without a question if [she]2050-she took [him]71-darrow at all ... [She]2050-she lifted [her]2050-she eyes to [his]71-darrow face . “ [I]2050-she think [I]2050-she only wanted to speak [her]81-sophy viner name . It ’s not right that [we]2985-we should seem so afraid of it . If [I]2050-she were really afraid of it [I]2050-she should have to give [you]71-darrow up , ”[2050-she] [she]2050-she said . [He]71-darrow bent over [her]2050-she and caught [her]2050-she to [him]71-darrow . “ Ah , [you]2050-she ca n’t give [me]71-darrow up now ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow exclaimed . [She]2050-she suffered [him]71-darrow to hold [her]2050-she fast without speaking ; but the old dread was between [them]2052-them again , and it was on [her]2050-she lips to cry out : “ How can [I]2050-she help it , when [I]2050-she AM so afraid ? ”[2050-she] XXXV The next morning the dread was still there , and [she]2050-she understood that [she]2050-she must snatch [herself]2050-she out of the torpor of the will into which [she]2050-she had been gradually sinking , and tell [Darrow]71-darrow that [she]2050-she could not be [[his]71-darrow wife]207-his wife . The knowledge came to [her]2050-she in the watches of a sleepless night , when , through the tears of disenchanted passion , [she]2050-she stared back upon [her]2050-she past . There it lay before [her]2050-she , [her]2050-she sole romance , in all its paltry poverty , the cheapest of cheap adventures , the most pitiful of sentimental blunders . [She]2050-she looked about [[her]2050-she room]602-her room , [the room where , for so many years , if [her]2050-she heart had been quiescent [her]2050-she thoughts]2055-the room where , for so many years , if her heart had been quiescent her thoughts had been alive , and pictured [herself]2050-she henceforth cowering before [a throng of mean suspicions , of unavowed compromises and concessions]2056-a throng of mean suspicions , of unavowed compromises and concessions . In that moment of self - searching [she]2050-she saw that [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner had chosen the better part , and that certain renunciations might enrich where possession would have left [a desert]2057-a desert . Passionate reactions of instinct fought against these efforts of [her]2050-she will . Why should past or future coerce [her]2050-she , when the present was so securely [hers]2050-she ? Why insanely surrender what the other would after all never have ? [Her]2050-she sense of irony whispered that if [she]2050-she sent away [Darrow]71-darrow it would not be to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , but to [the first woman who crossed [his]71-darrow path]2058-the first woman who crossed his path -- as , in a similar hour , [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner [herself]81-sophy viner had crossed it ... But the mere fact that [she]2050-she could think such things of [him]71-darrow sent [her]2050-she shuddering back to the opposite pole . [She]2050-she pictured [herself]2050-she gradually subdued to such a conception of life and love , [she]2050-she pictured [Effie]74-effie growing up under the influence of [the woman [she]2050-she saw [herself]2050-she becoming]2059-the woman she saw herself becoming -- and [she]2050-she hid [her]2050-she eyes from the humiliation of the picture ... [They]2060-they were at luncheon when the summons that [Darrow]71-darrow expected was brought to [him]71-darrow . [He]71-darrow handed the telegram to [Anna]97-anna , and [she]97-anna learned that [[his]71-darrow Ambassador]1591-his ambassador , on the way to [a German cure]2062-a german cure , was to be in [Paris]10-paris the next evening and wished to confer with [him]71-darrow there before [he]71-darrow went back to [London]3-london . The idea that the decisive moment was at hand was so agitating to [her]97-anna that when luncheon was over [she]97-anna slipped away to [the terrace]2399-the terrace and thence went down alone to [the garden]222-the garden . The day was grey but mild , with the heaviness of decay in the air . [She]97-anna rambled on aimlessly , following under the denuded boughs the path [she]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow had taken on [their]2060-they first walk to [the river]503-the river . [She]97-anna was sure [he]71-darrow would not try to overtake [her]97-anna : sure [he]71-darrow would guess why [she]97-anna wished to be alone . There were moments when it seemed to double [her]97-anna loneliness to be so certain of [his]71-darrow reading [her]97-anna heart while [she]97-anna was so desperately ignorant of [his]71-darrow ... [She]97-anna wandered on for more than an hour , and when [she]97-anna returned to [the house]581-the house [she]97-anna saw , as [she]97-anna entered [the hall]539-the hall , that [Darrow]71-darrow was seated at the desk in [[Owen]75-owen ’s study]2586-owen ’s study . [He]71-darrow heard [her]97-anna step , and looking up turned in [his]71-darrow chair without rising . [Their]2069-their eyes met , and [she]97-anna saw that [his]71-darrow were clear and smiling . [He]71-darrow had a heap of papers at [his]71-darrow elbow and was evidently engaged in some official correspondence . [She]97-anna wondered that [he]71-darrow could address [himself]71-darrow so composedly to [his]71-darrow task , and then ironically reflected that such detachment was a sign of [his]71-darrow superiority . [She]97-anna crossed the threshold and went toward [him]71-darrow ; but as [she]97-anna advanced [she]97-anna had a sudden vision of [Owen]75-owen , standing outside in the cold autumn dusk and watching [Darrow]71-darrow and [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner as [they]2069-their faced [each other]177-each other across the lamplit desk ... The evocation was so vivid that it caught [her]97-anna breath like a blow , and [she]97-anna sank down helplessly on the divan among the piled - up books . Distinctly , at the moment , [she]97-anna understood that the end had come . “ When [he]71-darrow speaks to [me]97-anna [I]97-anna will tell [him]71-darrow ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought ... [Darrow]71-darrow , laying aside [his]71-darrow pen , looked at [her]97-anna for a moment in silence ; then [he]71-darrow stood up and shut the door . “ [I]71-darrow must go to - morrow early , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , sitting down beside [her]97-anna . [His]71-darrow voice was grave , with a slight tinge of sadness . [She]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [He]71-darrow knows what [I]97-anna am feeling ... ”[97-anna] and now the thought made [her]97-anna feel less alone . The expression of [his]71-darrow face was stern and yet tender : for the first time [she]97-anna understood what [he]71-darrow had suffered . [She]97-anna had no doubt as to the necessity of giving [him]71-darrow up , but it was impossible to tell [him]71-darrow so then . [She]97-anna stood up and said : “ [I]97-anna ’ll leave [you]71-darrow to [your]71-darrow letters . ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow made no protest , but merely answered : “ [You]97-anna ’ll come down presently for a walk ? ”[71-darrow] and it occurred to [her]97-anna at once that [she]97-anna would walk down to [the river]503-the river with [him]71-darrow , and give [herself]97-anna for the last time the tragic luxury of sitting at [his]71-darrow side in [the little pavilion]2072-the little pavilion . “ Perhaps , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought , “ it will be easier to tell [him]71-darrow there . ”[97-anna] It did not , on the way [home]1482-home from [their]2074-their walk , become any easier to tell [him]71-darrow ; but [her]97-anna secret decision to do so before [he]71-darrow left gave [her]97-anna a kind of factitious calm and laid a melancholy ecstasy upon the hour . Still skirting the subject that fanned [their]2074-their very faces with its flame , [they]2074-their clung persistently to other topics , and it seemed to [Anna]97-anna that [their]2074-their minds had never been nearer together than in this hour when [their]2074-their hearts were so separate . In the glow of interchanged love [she]97-anna had grown less conscious of that other glow of interchanged thought which had once illumined [her]97-anna mind . [She]97-anna had forgotten how [Darrow]71-darrow had widened [her]97-anna world and lengthened out all [her]97-anna perspectives , and with a pang of double destitution [she]97-anna saw [herself]97-anna alone among [her]97-anna shrunken thoughts . For the first time , then , [she]97-anna had a clear vision of what [her]97-anna life would be without [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna imagined [herself]97-anna trying to take up the daily round , and all that had lightened and animated it seemed equally lifeless and vain . [She]97-anna tried to think of [herself]97-anna as wholly absorbed in [[her]97-anna daughter]1136-her daughter ’s development , like [other mothers [she]97-anna had seen]2076-other mothers she had seen ; but [she]97-anna supposed [those mothers]2077-those mothers must have had stored memories of happiness to nourish [them]2077-those mothers . [She]97-anna had had nothing , and all [her]97-anna starved youth still claimed its due . When [she]97-anna went up to dress for dinner [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ [I]97-anna ’ll have [my]97-anna last evening with [him]71-darrow , and then , before [we]2986-we say good night , [I]97-anna ’ll tell [him]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] This postponement did not seem unjustified . [Darrow]71-darrow had shown [her]97-anna how [he]71-darrow dreaded vain words , how resolved [he]71-darrow was to avoid all fruitless discussion . [He]71-darrow must have been intensely aware of what had been going on in [her]97-anna mind since [his]71-darrow return , yet when [she]97-anna had attempted to reveal it to [him]71-darrow [he]71-darrow had turned from the revelation . [She]97-anna was therefore merely following the line [he]71-darrow had traced in behaving , till the final moment came , as though there were nothing more to say ... That moment seemed at last to be at hand when , at [her]97-anna usual hour after dinner , [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle rose to go [upstairs]597-upstairs . [She]97-anna lingered a little to bid good - bye to [Darrow]71-darrow , whom [she]97-anna was not likely to see in the morning ; and [her]97-anna affable allusions to [his]71-darrow prompt return sounded in [Anna]97-anna ’s ear like the note of destiny . A cold rain had fallen all day , and for greater warmth and intimacy [they]2079-them had gone after dinner to [the oak - room]1558-the oak - room , shutting out the chilly vista of [the farther drawing - rooms]2081-the farther drawing - rooms . The autumn wind , coming up from [the river]503-the river , cried about [the house]581-the house with a voice of loss and separation ; and [Anna]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow sat silent , as if [they]2079-them feared to break the hush that shut [them]2079-them in . The solitude , the fire - light , the harmony of soft hangings and old dim pictures , wove about [them]2079-them a spell of security through which [Anna]97-anna felt , far down in [her]97-anna heart , the muffled beat of an inextinguishable bliss . How could [she]97-anna have thought that this last moment would be the moment to speak to [him]71-darrow , when it seemed to have gathered up into its flight all the scattered splendours of [her]97-anna dream ? XXXVI [Darrow]71-darrow continued to stand by the door after it had closed . [Anna]97-anna felt that [he]71-darrow was looking at [her]97-anna , and sat still , disdaining to seek refuge in any evasive word or movement . For the last time [she]97-anna wanted to let [him]71-darrow take from [her]97-anna the fulness of what the sight of [her]97-anna could give . [He]71-darrow crossed over and sat down on the sofa . For a moment [neither of [them]2079-them]2084-neither of them spoke ; then [he]71-darrow said : “ To - night , [dearest]2795-dearest , [I]71-darrow must have [my]71-darrow answer . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna straightened [herself]97-anna under the shock of [his]71-darrow seeming to take the very words from [her]97-anna lips . “ To - night ? ”[71-darrow] was all that [she]97-anna could falter . “ [I]71-darrow must be off by [the early train]2988-the early train . There wo n’t be more than a moment in the morning . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow had taken [her]97-anna hand , and [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna that [she]97-anna must free it before [she]97-anna could go on with what [she]97-anna had to say . Then [she]97-anna rejected this concession to a weakness [she]97-anna was resolved to defy . To the end [she]97-anna would leave [her]97-anna hand in [his]71-darrow hand , [her]97-anna eyes in [his]71-darrow eyes : [she]97-anna would not , in [their]2085-their final hour together , be afraid of any part of [her]97-anna love for [him]71-darrow . “ [You]97-anna ’ll tell [me]71-darrow to - night , [dear]2291-dear , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow insisted gently ; and [his]71-darrow insistence gave [her]97-anna the strength to speak . “ There ’s something [I]97-anna must ask [you]71-darrow , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna broke out , perceiving , as [she]97-anna heard [her]97-anna words , that they were not in the least what [she]97-anna had meant to say . [He]71-darrow sat still , waiting , and [she]97-anna pressed on : “ Do such things happen to [men]1842-men often ? ”[97-anna] [The quiet room]1260-the quiet room seemed to resound with the long reverberations of [her]97-anna question . [She]97-anna looked away from [him]71-darrow , and [he]71-darrow released [her]97-anna and stood up . “ [I]71-darrow do n’t know what happens to [other men]2991-other men . Such a thing never happened to [me]71-darrow ... ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna turned [her]97-anna eyes back to [his]71-darrow face . [She]97-anna felt like a traveller on a giddy path between [a cliff]1518-a cliff and a precipice : there was nothing for it now but to go on . “ Had it ... had it begun ... before [you]71-darrow met [her]97-anna in [Paris]10-paris ? ”[71-darrow] “ No ; a thousand times no ! [I]71-darrow ’ve told [you]71-darrow the facts as they were . ”[71-darrow] “ All the facts ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow turned abruptly . “ What do [you]71-darrow mean ? ”[71-darrow] [Her]97-anna throat was dry and the loud pulses drummed in [her]97-anna temples . “ [I]97-anna mean -- about [her]97-anna ... Perhaps [you]71-darrow knew ... knew things about [her]97-anna ... beforehand . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna stopped . [The room]663-the room had grown profoundly still . A log dropped to the hearth and broke there in a hissing shower . [Darrow]71-darrow spoke in a clear voice . “ [I]71-darrow knew nothing , absolutely nothing , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said . [She]97-anna had the answer to [her]97-anna inmost doubt -- to [her]97-anna last shameful unavowed hope . [She]97-anna sat powerless under [her]97-anna woe . [He]71-darrow walked to the fireplace and pushed back the broken log with [his]71-darrow foot . A flame shot out of it , and in the upward glare [she]97-anna saw [his]71-darrow pale face , stern with misery . “ Is that all ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow asked . [She]97-anna made a slight sign with [her]97-anna head and [he]71-darrow came slowly back to [her]97-anna . “ Then is this to be good - bye ? ”[97-anna] Again [she]97-anna signed a faint assent , and [he]71-darrow made no effort to touch [her]97-anna or draw nearer . “ [You]97-anna understand that [I]71-darrow sha’n’t come back ? ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow was looking at [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna tried to return [his]71-darrow look , but [her]97-anna eyes were blind with tears , and in dread of [his]71-darrow seeing them [she]97-anna got up and walked away . [He]71-darrow did not follow [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna stood with [her]97-anna back to [him]71-darrow , staring at a bowl of carnations on a little table strewn with books . [Her]97-anna tears magnified everything [she]97-anna looked at , and the streaked petals of the carnations , their fringed edges and frail curled stamens , pressed upon [her]97-anna , huge and vivid . [She]97-anna noticed among the books a volume of verse [he]71-darrow had sent [her]97-anna from [England]8-england , and tried to remember whether it was before or after ... [She]97-anna felt that [he]71-darrow was waiting for [her]97-anna to speak , and at last [she]97-anna turned to [him]71-darrow . “ [I]97-anna shall see [you]71-darrow to - morrow before [you]71-darrow go ... ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow made no answer . [She]97-anna moved toward the door and [he]71-darrow held it open for [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna saw [his]71-darrow hand on the door , and [his]71-darrow seal ring in its setting of twisted silver ; and the sense of the end of all things came to [her]97-anna . [They]2089-they walked down [the drawing - rooms]1202-the drawing - rooms , between the shadowy reflections of screens and cabinets , and mounted the stairs side by side . At the end of [the gallery]1364-the gallery , a lamp brought out turbid gleams in the smoky battle - piece above [it]1364-the gallery . On the landing [Darrow]71-darrow stopped ; [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room was the nearest to the stairs . “ Good night , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , holding out [his]71-darrow hand . As [Anna]97-anna gave [him]71-darrow [hers]97-anna the springs of grief broke loose in [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna struggled with [her]97-anna sobs , and subdued them ; but [her]97-anna breath came unevenly , and to hide [her]97-anna agitation [she]97-anna leaned on [him]71-darrow and pressed [her]97-anna face against [his]71-darrow arm . “ Don’t -- don’t , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow whispered , soothing [her]97-anna . [Her]97-anna troubled breathing sounded loudly in the silence of [the sleeping house]2093-the sleeping house . [She]97-anna pressed [her]97-anna lips tight , but could not stop the nervous pulsations in [her]97-anna throat , and [he]71-darrow put an arm about [her]97-anna and , opening [his]71-darrow door , drew [her]97-anna across the threshold of [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room . The door shut behind [her]97-anna and [she]97-anna sat down on the lounge at the foot of the bed . The pulsations in [her]97-anna throat had ceased , but [she]97-anna knew they would begin again if [she]97-anna tried to speak . [Darrow]71-darrow walked away and leaned against the mantelpiece . The red - veiled lamp shone on [his]71-darrow books and papers , on the arm - chair by the fire , and the scattered objects on [his]71-darrow dressing - table . A log glimmered on the hearth , and [the room]663-the room was warm and faintly smoke - scented . It was the first time [she]97-anna had ever been in [a room [he]71-darrow lived in]2096-a room he lived in , among [his]71-darrow personal possessions and the traces of [his]71-darrow daily usage . Every object about [her]97-anna seemed to contain a particle of [himself]71-darrow : the whole air breathed of [him]71-darrow , steeping [her]97-anna in the sense of [his]71-darrow intimate presence . Suddenly [she]97-anna thought : “ This is what [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner knew”[97-anna] ... and with a torturing precision [she]97-anna pictured [them]2097-them alone in such a scene ... Had [he]71-darrow taken [the girl]297-the girl to [an hotel]2099-an hotel ... where did [people]365-people go in such cases ? Wherever [they]2097-them were , the silence of night had been around [them]2097-them , and the things [he]71-darrow used had been strewn about [the room]663-the room ... [Anna]97-anna , ashamed of dwelling on the detested vision , stood up with a confused impulse of flight ; then a wave of contrary feeling arrested [her]97-anna and [she]97-anna paused with lowered head . [Darrow]71-darrow had come forward as [she]97-anna rose , and [she]97-anna perceived that [he]71-darrow was waiting for [her]97-anna to bid [him]71-darrow good night . It was clear that no other possibility had even brushed [his]71-darrow mind ; and the fact , for some dim reason , humiliated [her]97-anna . “ Why not ... why not ? ”[71-darrow] something whispered in [her]97-anna , as though [his]71-darrow forbearance , [his]71-darrow tacit recognition of [her]97-anna pride , were a slight on other qualities [she]97-anna wanted [him]71-darrow to feel in [her]97-anna . “ In the morning , then ? ”[71-darrow] [she]97-anna heard [him]71-darrow say . “ Yes , in the morning , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna repeated . [She]97-anna continued to stand in the same place , looking vaguely about [the room]663-the room . For once before [they]2103-they parted -- since part [they]2103-they must -- [she]97-anna longed to be to [him]71-darrow all that Sophy [Viner]81-sophy viner had been ; but [she]97-anna remained rooted to the floor , unable to find a word or imagine a gesture that should express [her]97-anna meaning . Exasperated by [her]97-anna helplessness , [she]97-anna thought : “ Do n’t [I]97-anna feel things as [other women]2992-other women do ? ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna eye fell on a note - case [she]97-anna had given [him]71-darrow . It was worn at the corners with the friction of [his]71-darrow pocket and distended with thickly packed papers . [She]97-anna wondered if [he]71-darrow carried [her]97-anna letters in it , and [she]97-anna put [her]97-anna hand out and touched it . All that [he]71-darrow and [she]97-anna had ever felt or seen , [their]2104-their close encounters of word and look , and the closer contact of [their]2104-their silences , trembled through [her]97-anna at the touch . [She]97-anna remembered things [he]71-darrow had said that had been like new skies above [her]97-anna head : ways [he]71-darrow had that seemed a part of the air [she]97-anna breathed . The faint warmth of [her]97-anna girlish love came back to [her]97-anna , gathering heat as it passed through [her]97-anna thoughts ; and [her]97-anna heart rocked like [a boat]2397-a boat on the surge of its long long memories . “ It ’s because [I]97-anna love [him]71-darrow in too many ways , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought ; and slowly [she]97-anna turned to the door . [She]97-anna was aware that [Darrow]71-darrow was still silently watching [her]97-anna , but [he]71-darrow neither stirred nor spoke till [she]97-anna had reached the threshold . Then [he]71-darrow met [her]97-anna there and caught [her]97-anna in [his]71-darrow arms . “ Not to - night -- don’t tell [me]71-darrow to - night ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow whispered ; and [she]97-anna leaned away from [him]71-darrow , closing [her]97-anna eyes for an instant , and then slowly opening them to the flood of light in [his]71-darrow . XXXVII [Anna]97-anna and [Darrow]71-darrow , the next day , sat alone in [a compartment of [the Paris train]2107-the paris train]2106-a compartment of the paris train . [Anna]97-anna , when [they]2108-they entered [it]2106-a compartment of the paris train , had put [herself]97-anna in the farthest corner and placed [her]97-anna bag on the adjoining seat . [She]97-anna had decided suddenly to accompany [Darrow]71-darrow to [Paris]10-paris , had even persuaded [him]71-darrow to wait for [a later train]2109-a later train in order that [they]2108-they might travel together . [She]97-anna had an intense longing to be with [him]71-darrow , an almost morbid terror of losing sight of [him]71-darrow for a moment : when [he]71-darrow jumped out of [the train]167-the train and ran back along [the platform]264-the platform to buy a newspaper for [her]97-anna [she]97-anna felt as though [she]97-anna should never see [him]71-darrow again , and shivered with the cold misery of [her]97-anna last journey to [Paris]10-paris , when [she]97-anna had thought [herself]97-anna parted from [him]71-darrow forever . Yet [she]97-anna wanted to keep [him]71-darrow at a distance , on the other side of [the compartment]396-the compartment , and as [the train]167-the train moved out of [the station]253-the station [she]97-anna drew from [her]97-anna bag the letters [she]97-anna had thrust in it as [she]97-anna left [the house]581-the house , and began to glance over them so that [her]97-anna lowered lids should hide [her]97-anna eyes from [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna was [his]71-darrow now , [his]71-darrow for life : there could never again be any question of sacrificing [herself]97-anna to [Effie]74-effie ’s welfare , or to any other abstract conception of duty . [Effie]74-effie of course would not suffer ; [Anna]97-anna would pay for [her]97-anna bliss as [a wife]1057-a wife by redoubled devotion as [a mother]2117-a mother . [Her]97-anna scruples were not overcome ; but for the time [their]2118-their voices were drowned in the tumultuous rumour of [her]97-anna happiness . As [she]97-anna opened [her]97-anna letters [she]97-anna was conscious that [Darrow]71-darrow ’s gaze was fixed on [her]97-anna , and gradually it drew [her]97-anna eyes upward , and [she]97-anna drank deep of the passionate tenderness in [his]71-darrow . Then the blood rose to [her]97-anna face and [she]97-anna felt again the desire to shield [herself]97-anna . [She]97-anna turned back to [her]97-anna letters and [her]97-anna glance lit on an envelope inscribed in [Owen]75-owen ’s hand . [Her]97-anna heart began to beat oppressively : [she]97-anna was in a mood when the simplest things seemed ominous . What could [Owen]75-owen have to say to [her]97-anna ? Only the first page was covered , and it contained simply the announcement that , in the company of [a young compatriot who was studying at [the Beaux Arts]60-the beaux arts , [he]2119-a young compatriot who was studying at the beaux arts , he had planned to leave for spain the following evening had planned to leave for [Spain]61-spain the following evening]2119-a young compatriot who was studying at the beaux arts , he had planned to leave for spain the following evening . “ [He]2119-a young compatriot who was studying at the beaux arts , he had planned to leave for spain the following evening has n’t seen [her]297-the girl , then ! ”[97-anna] was [Anna]97-anna ’s instant thought ; and [her]97-anna feeling was a strange compound of humiliation and relief . [The girl]297-the girl had kept [her]297-the girl word , lived up to the line of conduct [she]297-the girl had set [herself]297-the girl ; and [Anna]97-anna had failed in the same attempt . [She]97-anna did not reproach [herself]97-anna with [her]97-anna failure ; but [she]97-anna would have been happier if there had been less discrepancy between [her]297-the girl words to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner and the act which had followed [them]2121-them . It irritated [her]97-anna obscurely that [the girl]297-the girl should have been so much surer of [her]297-the girl power to carry out [her]297-the girl purpose ... [Anna]97-anna looked up and saw that [Darrow]71-darrow ’s eyes were on the newspaper . [He]71-darrow seemed calm and secure , almost indifferent to [her]97-anna presence . “ Will it become a matter of course to [him]71-darrow so soon ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna wondered with a twinge of jealousy . [She]97-anna sat motionless , [her]97-anna eyes fixed on [him]71-darrow , trying to make [him]71-darrow feel the attraction of [her]97-anna gaze as [she]97-anna felt [his]71-darrow . It surprised and shamed [her]97-anna to detect a new element in [her]97-anna love for [him]71-darrow : a sort of suspicious tyrannical tenderness that seemed to deprive [it]2123-it of all serenity . Finally [he]71-darrow looked up , [his]71-darrow smile enveloped [her]97-anna , and [she]97-anna felt [herself]97-anna [his]71-darrow in every fibre , [his]71-darrow so completely and inseparably that [she]97-anna saw the vanity of imagining any other fate for [herself]97-anna . To give [herself]97-anna a countenance [she]97-anna held out [Owen]75-owen ’s letter . [He]71-darrow took it and glanced down the page , [his]71-darrow face grown grave . [She]97-anna waited nervously till [he]71-darrow looked up . “ That ’s a good plan ; the best thing that could happen , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said , a just perceptible shade of constraint in [his]71-darrow tone . “ Oh , yes , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna hastily assented . [She]97-anna was aware of a faint current of relief silently circulating between [them]2124-their . [They]2124-their were both glad that [Owen]75-owen was going , that for a while [he]71-darrow would be out of [their]2124-their way ; and it seemed to [her]97-anna horrible that so much of the stuff of [their]2124-their happiness should be made of such unavowed feelings ... “ [I]97-anna shall see [him]71-darrow this evening , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said , wishing [Darrow]71-darrow to feel that [she]97-anna was not afraid of meeting [[her]97-anna step - son]719-her step - son . “ Yes , of course ; perhaps [he]71-darrow might dine with [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] The words struck [her]97-anna as strangely obtuse . [Darrow]71-darrow was to meet [[his]71-darrow Ambassador]1591-his ambassador at [the station]253-the station on [the latter]231-the latter ’s arrival , and would in all probability have to spend the evening with [him]71-darrow , and [Anna]97-anna knew [he]71-darrow had been concerned at the thought of having to leave [her]97-anna alone . But how could [he]71-darrow speak in that careless tone of [her]97-anna dining with [Owen]75-owen ? [She]97-anna lowered [her]97-anna voice to say : “ [I]97-anna ’m afraid [he]71-darrow ’s desperately unhappy . ”[97-anna] [He]71-darrow answered , with a tinge of impatience : “ It ’s much the best thing that [he]71-darrow should travel . ”[71-darrow] “ Yes -- but do n’t [you]71-darrow feel ... ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna broke off . [She]97-anna knew how [he]71-darrow disliked these idle returns on the irrevocable , and [her]97-anna fear of doing or saying what [he]71-darrow disliked was tinged by a new instinct of subserviency against which [her]97-anna pride revolted . [She]97-anna thought to [herself]97-anna : “ [He]71-darrow will see the change , and grow indifferent to [me]97-anna as [he]71-darrow did to [HER]75-owen ... ”[97-anna] and for a moment it seemed to [her]97-anna that [she]97-anna was reliving the experience of [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [Darrow]71-darrow made no attempt to learn the end of [her]97-anna unfinished sentence . [He]71-darrow handed back [Owen]75-owen ’s letter and returned to [his]71-darrow newspaper ; and when [he]71-darrow looked up from it a few minutes later it was with a clear brow and a smile that irresistibly drew [her]97-anna back to happier thoughts . [The train]167-the train was just entering [a station]2130-a station , and a moment later [[their]2131-their compartment]387-their compartment was invaded by [a commonplace couple preoccupied with the bestowal of bulging packages]2133-a commonplace couple preoccupied with the bestowal of bulging packages . [Anna]97-anna , at [their]2131-their approach , felt the possessive pride of [the woman in love when [strangers]2412-strangers are between [herself]97-anna and [the man [she]97-anna loves]2136-the man she loves]2134-the woman in love when strangers are between herself and the man she loves . [She]97-anna asked [Darrow]71-darrow to open the window , to place [her]97-anna bag in the net , to roll [her]97-anna rug into a cushion for [her]97-anna feet ; and while [he]71-darrow was thus busied with [her]97-anna [she]97-anna was conscious of a new devotion in [his]71-darrow tone , in [his]71-darrow way of bending over [her]97-anna and meeting [her]97-anna eyes . [He]71-darrow went back to [his]71-darrow seat , and [they]2131-their looked at [each other]177-each other like [lovers]2138-lovers smiling at a happy secret . [Anna]97-anna , before going back to [Givre]30-givre , had suggested [Owen]75-owen ’s moving into [[her]97-anna apartment]2139-her apartment , but [he]71-darrow had preferred to remain at [the hotel to which [he]71-darrow had sent [his]71-darrow luggage]2140-the hotel to which he had sent his luggage , and on arriving in [Paris]10-paris [she]97-anna decided to drive [there]2294-there at once . [She]97-anna was impatient to have the meeting over , and glad that [Darrow]71-darrow was obliged to leave [her]97-anna at [the station]253-the station in order to look up [a colleague at [the Embassy]250-the embassy]2143-a colleague at the embassy . [She]97-anna dreaded [his]71-darrow seeing [Owen]75-owen again , and yet dared not tell [him]71-darrow so , and to ensure [his]71-darrow remaining away [she]97-anna mentioned an urgent engagement with [[her]97-anna dress - maker]2145-her dress - maker and a long list of commissions to be executed for [Madame de Chantelle]111-madame de chantelle . “ [I]97-anna shall see [you]71-darrow to - morrow morning , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said ; but [he]71-darrow replied with a smile that [he]71-darrow would certainly find time to come to [her]97-anna for a moment on [his]71-darrow way back from meeting [the Ambassador]1995-the ambassador ; and when [he]71-darrow had put [her]97-anna in [a cab]1761-a cab [he]71-darrow leaned through the window to press [his]71-darrow lips to [hers]97-anna . [She]97-anna blushed like [a girl]218-a girl , thinking , half vexed , half happy : “ Yesterday [he]71-darrow would not have done it ... ”[218-a girl] and a dozen scarcely definable differences in [his]71-darrow look and manner seemed all at once to be summed up in the boyish act . “ After all , [I]97-anna ’m engaged to [him]71-darrow , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna reflected , and then smiled at the absurdity of the word . The next instant , with a pang of self - reproach , [she]97-anna remembered [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s cry : “ [I]81-sophy viner knew all the while [he]71-darrow did n’t care ... ”[81-sophy viner] “ [Poor thing]2993-poor thing , oh poor thing ! ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna murmured ... At [[Owen]75-owen ’s hotel]2149-owen ’s hotel [she]97-anna waited in a tremor while [the porter]195-the porter went in search of [him]71-darrow . Word was presently brought back that [he]71-darrow was in [[his]71-darrow room]542-his room and begged [her]97-anna to come up , and as [she]97-anna crossed [the hall]539-the hall [she]97-anna caught sight of [his]71-darrow portmanteaux lying on the floor , already labelled for departure . [Owen]75-owen sat at a table writing , [his]71-darrow back to the door ; and when [he]71-darrow stood up the window was behind [him]71-darrow , so that , in the rainy afternoon light , [his]71-darrow features were barely discernible . “ [Dearest]162-dearest -- so [you]71-darrow ’re really off ? ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said , hesitating a moment on the threshold . [He]71-darrow pushed a chair forward , and [they]2153-they sat down , each waiting for [the other]2387-the other to speak . Finally [she]97-anna put some random question about [[his]71-darrow travelling - companion]2155-his travelling - companion , [a slow shy meditative youth whom [he]71-darrow had once or twice brought down to [Givre]30-givre]2156-a slow shy meditative youth whom he had once or twice brought down to givre . [She]97-anna reflected that it was natural [he]71-darrow should have given [this uncommunicative comrade]2157-this uncommunicative comrade the preference over [[his]71-darrow livelier acquaintances]2158-his livelier acquaintances , and aloud [she]97-anna said : “ [I]97-anna ’m so glad [Fred Rempson]163-fred rempson can go with [you]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] [Owen]75-owen answered in the same tone , and for a few minutes [their]2153-they talk dragged itself on over a dry waste of common - places . [Anna]97-anna noticed that , though ready enough to impart [his]71-darrow own plans , [Owen]75-owen studiously abstained from putting any questions about [hers]97-anna . It was evident from [his]71-darrow allusions that [he]71-darrow meant to be away for some time , and [he]71-darrow presently asked [her]97-anna if [she]97-anna would give instructions about packing and sending after [him]71-darrow some winter clothes [he]71-darrow had left at [Givre]30-givre . This gave [her]97-anna the opportunity to say that [she]97-anna expected to go back within a day or two and would attend to the matter as soon as [she]97-anna returned . [She]97-anna added : “ [I]97-anna came up this morning with [George]71-darrow , who is going on to [London]3-london to - morrow , ”[97-anna] intending , by the use of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s Christian name , to give [Owen]75-owen the chance to speak of [her]97-anna marriage . But [he]71-darrow made no comment , and [she]97-anna continued to hear the name sounding on unfamiliarly between [them]2159-them . [The room]663-the room was almost dark , and [she]97-anna finally stood up and glanced about for the light - switch , saying : “ [I]97-anna ca n’t see [you]71-darrow , [dear]2291-dear . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , don’t -- [I]75-owen hate the light ! ”[75-owen] [Owen]75-owen exclaimed , catching [her]97-anna by the wrist and pushing [her]97-anna back into [her]97-anna seat . [He]71-darrow gave a nervous laugh and added : “ [I]71-darrow ’m half - blind with neuralgia . [I]71-darrow suppose it ’s this beastly rain . ”[71-darrow] “ Yes ; it will do [you]71-darrow good to get down to [Spain]61-spain . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna asked if [he]71-darrow had the remedies [the doctor]1434-the doctor had given [him]71-darrow for a previous attack , and on [his]71-darrow replying that [he]71-darrow did n’t know what [he]71-darrow ’d done with the stuff , [she]97-anna sprang up , offering to go to [[the chemist]2162-the chemist ’s]2163-the chemist ’s . It was a relief to have something to do for [him]71-darrow , and [she]97-anna knew from [his]71-darrow “ Oh , thanks -- would [you]97-anna ? ”[97-anna] that it was a relief to [him]71-darrow to have a pretext for not detaining [her]97-anna . [His]71-darrow natural impulse would have been to declare that [he]71-darrow did n’t want any drugs , and would be all right in no time ; and [his]71-darrow acquiescence showed [her]97-anna how profoundly [he]71-darrow felt the uselessness of [their]2164-their trying to prolong [their]2164-their talk . [His]71-darrow face was now no more than a white blur in the dusk , but [she]97-anna felt its indistinctness as a veil drawn over aching intensities of expression . “ [He]71-darrow knows ... [he]71-darrow knows ... ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna , and wondered whether the truth had been revealed to [him]71-darrow by some corroborative fact or by the sheer force of divination . [He]71-darrow had risen also , and was clearly waiting for [her]97-anna to go , and [she]97-anna turned to the door , saying : “ [I]97-anna ’ll be back in a moment . ”[97-anna] “ Oh , do n’t come up again , please ! ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow paused , embarrassed . “ [I]71-darrow mean -- [I]71-darrow may not be [here]2403-here . [I]71-darrow ’ve got to go and pick up [Rempson]163-fred rempson , and see about some final things with [him]71-darrow . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna stopped on the threshold with a sinking heart . [He]71-darrow meant this to be [their]2165-their leave - taking , then -- and [he]71-darrow had not even asked [her]97-anna when [she]97-anna was to be married , or spoken of seeing [her]97-anna again before [she]97-anna set out for [the other side of [the world]206-the world]2166-the other side of the world . “ [Owen]75-owen ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna cried , and turned back . [He]71-darrow stood mutely before [her]97-anna in the dimness . “ [You]97-anna have n’t told [me]71-darrow how long [you]97-anna ’re to be gone . ”[71-darrow] “ How long ? Oh , [you]71-darrow see ... that ’s rather vague ... [I]71-darrow hate definite dates , [you]71-darrow know ... ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow paused and [she]97-anna saw [he]71-darrow did not mean to help [her]97-anna out . [She]97-anna tried to say : “ [You]71-darrow ’ll be here for [my]97-anna wedding ? ”[97-anna] but could not bring the words to [her]97-anna lips . Instead [she]97-anna murmured : “ In six weeks [I]97-anna shall be going too ... ”[97-anna] and [he]71-darrow rejoined , as if [he]71-darrow had expected the announcement and prepared [his]71-darrow answer : “ Oh , by that time , very likely ... ”[71-darrow] “ At any rate , [I]97-anna wo n’t say good - bye , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna stammered , feeling the tears beneath [her]97-anna veil . “ No , no ; rather not ! ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow declared ; but [he]71-darrow made no movement , and [she]97-anna went up and threw [her]97-anna arms about [him]71-darrow . “ [You]71-darrow ’ll write [me]97-anna , wo n’t [you]71-darrow ? ”[97-anna] “ Of course , of course---- ”[97-anna] [Her]97-anna hands slipped down into [his]71-darrow , and for a minute [they]2168-they held each other dumbly in the darkness ; then [he]71-darrow gave a vague laugh and said : “ It ’s really time to light up . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow pressed the electric button with one hand while with the other [he]71-darrow opened the door ; and [she]97-anna passed out without daring to turn back , lest the light on [his]71-darrow face should show [her]97-anna what [she]97-anna feared to see . XXXVIII [Anna]97-anna drove to [the chemist ’s]2163-the chemist ’s for [[Owen]75-owen ’s remedy]2170-owen ’s remedy . On the way [she]97-anna stopped [[her]97-anna cab]2171-her cab at [a book - shop]2172-a book - shop , and emerged from [it]2172-a book - shop laden with literature . [She]97-anna knew what would interest [Owen]75-owen , and what [he]71-darrow was likely to have read , and [she]97-anna had made [her]97-anna choice among the newest publications with the promptness of [a discriminating reader]2173-a discriminating reader . But on the way back to [the hotel]443-the hotel [she]97-anna was overcome by the irony of adding this mental panacea to the other . There was something grotesque and almost mocking in the idea of offering a judicious selection of literature to [a man setting out on such a journey]2175-a man setting out on such a journey . “ [He]71-darrow knows ... [he]71-darrow knows ... ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna kept on repeating ; and giving [the porter]195-the porter the parcel from [the chemist ’s]2163-the chemist ’s [she]97-anna drove away without leaving the books . [She]97-anna went to [[her]97-anna apartment]2139-her apartment , whither [[her]97-anna maid]1821-her maid had preceded [her]97-anna . There was a fire in [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room and the tea - table stood ready by the hearth . The stormy rain beat against the uncurtained windows , and [she]97-anna thought of [Owen]75-owen , who would soon be driving through [it]2181-it to [the station]253-the station , alone with [his]2175-a man setting out on such a journey bitter thoughts . [She]97-anna had been proud of the fact that [he]2175-a man setting out on such a journey had always sought [her]97-anna help in difficult hours ; and now , in the most difficult of all , [she]97-anna was the one being to whom [he]2175-a man setting out on such a journey could not turn . Between [them]2183-them , henceforth , there would always be the wall of an insurmountable silence ... [She]97-anna strained [her]97-anna aching thoughts to guess how the truth had come to [him]2175-a man setting out on such a journey . Had [he]2175-a man setting out on such a journey seen [the girl]297-the girl , and had [she]97-anna told [him]2175-a man setting out on such a journey ? Instinctively , [Anna]97-anna rejected this conjecture . But what need was there of assuming an explicit statement , when every breath [they]2183-them had drawn for the last weeks had been charged with the immanent secret ? As [she]97-anna looked back over the days since [Darrow]71-darrow ’s first arrival at [Givre]30-givre [she]97-anna perceived that at no time had [any one]2525-any one deliberately spoken , or anything been accidentally disclosed . The truth had come to light by the force of its irresistible pressure ; and the perception gave [her]97-anna a startled sense of hidden powers , of a chaos of attractions and repulsions far beneath the ordered surfaces of intercourse . [She]97-anna looked back with melancholy derision on [her]97-anna old conception of life , as [a kind of well - lit and well policed suburb to dark places one need never know about]2186-a kind of well - lit and well policed suburb to dark places one need never know about . [Here]2403-here [they]2403-here were , [these dark places]2188-these dark places , in [her]97-anna own bosom , and henceforth [she]97-anna would always have to traverse [them]2403-here to reach [the beings [she]97-anna loved best]2189-the beings she loved best ! [She]97-anna was still sitting beside the untouched tea - table when [she]97-anna heard [Darrow]71-darrow ’s voice in [the hall]539-the hall . [She]97-anna started up , saying to [herself]97-anna : “ [I]97-anna must tell [him]71-darrow that [Owen]75-owen knows ... ”[97-anna] but when the door opened and [she]97-anna saw [his]71-darrow face , still lit by the same smile of boyish triumph , [she]97-anna felt anew the uselessness of speaking ... Had [he]71-darrow ever supposed that [Owen]75-owen would not know ? Probably , from the height of [his]71-darrow greater experience , [he]71-darrow had seen long since that all that happened was inevitable ; and the thought of it , at any rate , was clearly not weighing on [him]71-darrow now . [He]71-darrow was already dressed for the evening , and as [he]71-darrow came toward [her]97-anna [he]71-darrow said : “ [The Ambassador]1995-the ambassador ’s booked for an official dinner and [I]71-darrow ’m free after all . Where shall [we]2191-we dine ? ”[71-darrow] [Anna]97-anna had pictured [herself]97-anna sitting alone all the evening with [her]97-anna wretched thoughts , and the fact of having to put them out of [her]97-anna mind for the next few hours gave [her]97-anna an immediate sensation of relief . Already [her]97-anna pulses were dancing to the tune of [Darrow]71-darrow ’s , and as [they]2191-we smiled at [each other]177-each other [she]97-anna thought : “ Nothing can ever change the fact that [I]97-anna belong to [him]71-darrow . ”[97-anna] “ Where shall [we]2191-we dine ? ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow repeated gaily , and [she]97-anna named [a well - known restaurant for which [she]97-anna had once heard [him]71-darrow express a preference]2193-a well - known restaurant for which she had once heard him express a preference . But as [she]97-anna did so [she]97-anna fancied [she]97-anna saw a shadow on [his]71-darrow face , and instantly [she]97-anna said to [herself]97-anna : “ It was THERE [he]71-darrow went with [her]97-anna ! ”[97-anna] “ Oh , no , not there , after all ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna interrupted [herself]97-anna ; and now [she]97-anna was sure [his]71-darrow colour deepened . “ Where shall it be , then ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna noticed that [he]71-darrow did not ask the reason of [her]97-anna change , and this convinced [her]97-anna that [she]97-anna had guessed the truth , and that [he]71-darrow knew [she]97-anna had guessed it . “ [He]71-darrow will always know what [I]97-anna am thinking , and [he]71-darrow will never dare to ask [me]97-anna , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought ; and [she]97-anna saw between [them]2194-them the same insurmountable wall of silence as between [herself]97-anna and [Owen]75-owen , a wall of glass through which [they]2194-them could watch [each other]177-each other ’s faintest motions but which no sound could ever traverse ... [They]2194-them drove to [a restaurant on [the Boulevard]62-the boulevard]2196-a restaurant on the boulevard , and there , in [their]2194-them intimate corner of the serried scene , the sense of what was unspoken between [them]2194-them gradually ceased to oppress [her]97-anna . [He]71-darrow looked so light - hearted and handsome , so ingenuously proud of [her]97-anna , so openly happy at being with [her]97-anna , that no other fact could seem real in [his]71-darrow presence . [He]71-darrow had learned that [the Ambassador]1995-the ambassador was to spend two days in [Paris]10-paris , and [he]71-darrow had reason to hope that in consequence [his]71-darrow own departure for [London]3-london would be deferred . [He]71-darrow was exhilarated by the prospect of being with [Anna]97-anna for a few hours longer , and [she]97-anna did not ask [herself]97-anna if [his]71-darrow exhilaration were a sign of insensibility , for [she]97-anna was too conscious of [his]71-darrow power of swaying [her]97-anna moods not to be secretly proud of affecting [his]71-darrow . [They]2198-they lingered for some time over the fruit and coffee , and when [they]2198-they rose to go [Darrow]71-darrow suggested that , if [she]97-anna felt disposed for the play , [they]2198-they were not too late for the second part of the programme at [one of [the smaller theatres]2200-the smaller theatres]2199-one of the smaller theatres . [His]71-darrow mention of the hour recalled [Owen]75-owen to [her]97-anna thoughts . [She]97-anna saw [[his]71-darrow train]2201-his train rushing southward through the storm , and , in a corner of [the swaying compartment]2202-the swaying compartment , [his]71-darrow face , white and indistinct as it had loomed on [her]97-anna in the rainy twilight . It was horrible to be thus perpetually paying for [her]97-anna happiness ! [Darrow]71-darrow had called for a theatrical journal , and [he]71-darrow presently looked up from it to say : “ [I]71-darrow hear the second play at [the Athenee]63-the athenee is amusing . ”[71-darrow] It was on [Anna]97-anna ’s lips to acquiesce ; but as [she]97-anna was about to speak [she]97-anna wondered if it were not at the Athenee that [Owen]75-owen had seen [Darrow]71-darrow with [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner . [She]97-anna was not sure [he]71-darrow had even mentioned [the theatre]237-the theatre , but the mere possibility was enough to darken [her]97-anna sky . It was hateful to [her]97-anna to think of accompanying [Darrow]71-darrow to places where [the girl]297-the girl had been with [him]71-darrow . [She]97-anna tried to reason away this scruple , [she]97-anna even reminded [herself]97-anna with a bitter irony that whenever [she]97-anna was in [[Darrow]71-darrow ’s arms]2205-darrow ’s arms [she]97-anna was where [the girl]297-the girl had been before [her]97-anna -- but [she]97-anna could not shake off [her]97-anna superstitious dread of being with [him]71-darrow in any of the scenes of the Parisian episode . [She]97-anna replied that [she]97-anna was too tired for the play , and [they]2207-they drove back to [[her]97-anna apartment]2139-her apartment . At the foot of [the stairs]1007-the stairs [she]97-anna half - turned to wish [him]71-darrow good night , but [he]71-darrow appeared not to notice [her]97-anna gesture and followed [her]97-anna up to [her]97-anna door . “ This is ever so much better than [the theatre]237-the theatre , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said as [they]2207-they entered [the drawing - room]289-the drawing - room . [She]97-anna had crossed [the room]663-the room and was bending over the hearth to light the fire . [She]97-anna knew [he]71-darrow was approaching [her]97-anna , and that in a moment [he]71-darrow would have drawn the cloak from [her]97-anna shoulders and laid [his]71-darrow lips on [her]97-anna neck , just below the gathered - up hair . These privileges were [his]71-darrow and , however deferently and tenderly [he]71-darrow claimed [them]2212-them , the joyous ease of [his]71-darrow manner marked a difference and proclaimed a right . “ After [the theatre]237-the theatre [they]2999-they came [home]1482-home like this , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna thought ; and at the same instant [she]97-anna felt [his]71-darrow hands on [her]97-anna shoulders and shrank back . “ Don’t -- oh , do n’t ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna cried , drawing [her]97-anna cloak about [her]97-anna . [She]97-anna saw from [his]71-darrow astonished stare that [her]97-anna face must be quivering with pain . “ [Anna]97-anna ! What on earth is the matter ? ”[97-anna] “ [Owen]75-owen knows ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna broke out , with a confused desire to justify [herself]97-anna . [Darrow]71-darrow ’s countenance changed . “ Did [he]71-darrow tell [you]97-anna so ? What did [he]71-darrow say ? ”[71-darrow] “ Nothing ! [I]97-anna knew it from the things [he]71-darrow did n’t say . ”[97-anna] “ [You]97-anna had a talk with [him]71-darrow this afternoon ? ”[71-darrow] “ Yes : for a few minutes . [I]97-anna could see [he]71-darrow did n’t want [me]97-anna to stay . ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna had dropped into a chair , and sat there huddled , still holding [her]97-anna cloak about [her]97-anna shoulders . [Darrow]71-darrow did not dispute [her]97-anna assumption , and [she]97-anna noticed that [he]71-darrow expressed no surprise . [He]71-darrow sat down at a little distance from [her]97-anna , turning about in [his]71-darrow fingers the cigar - case [he]71-darrow had drawn out as [they]2213-they came in . At length [he]71-darrow said : “ Had [he]71-darrow seen [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna shrank from the sound of the name . “ No ... [I]97-anna do n’t think so ... [I’m]97-anna sure [he]71-darrow had n’t ... ”[97-anna] [They]2213-they remained silent , looking away from [one another]1764-one another . Finally [Darrow]71-darrow stood up and took a few steps across [the room]663-the room . [He]71-darrow came back and paused before [her]97-anna , [his]71-darrow eyes on [her]97-anna face . “ [I]71-darrow think [you]97-anna ought to tell [me]71-darrow what [you]97-anna mean to do . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna raised [her]97-anna head and gave [him]71-darrow back [his]71-darrow look . “ Nothing [I]97-anna do can help [Owen]75-owen ! ”[97-anna] “ No ; but things ca n’t go on like this . ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow paused , as if to measure [his]71-darrow words . “ [I]71-darrow fill [you]97-anna with aversion , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow exclaimed . [She]97-anna started up , half - sobbing . “ No -- oh , no ! ”[97-anna] “ [Poor child]608-poor child -- [you]71-darrow ca n’t see [your]71-darrow face ! ”[97-anna] [She]97-anna lifted [her]97-anna hands as if to hide it , and turning away from [him]71-darrow bowed [her]97-anna head upon the mantel - shelf . [She]97-anna felt that [he]71-darrow was standing a little way behind [her]97-anna , but [he]71-darrow made no attempt to touch [her]97-anna or come nearer . “ [I]71-darrow know [you]97-anna ’ve felt as [I]71-darrow ’ve felt , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow said in a low voice--“that [we]3002-we belong to [each other]177-each other and that nothing can alter that . But other thoughts come , and [you]97-anna ca n’t banish them . Whenever [you]97-anna see [me]71-darrow [you]97-anna remember ... [you]97-anna associate [me]71-darrow with things [you]97-anna abhor ... [You’ve]97-anna been generous -- immeasurably . [You]97-anna ’ve given [me]71-darrow all the chances [a woman]406-a woman could ; but if it ’s only made [you]97-anna suffer , what ’s the use ? ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna turned to [him]71-darrow with a tear - stained face . “ [It]3005-it has n’t only done that . ”[71-darrow] “ Oh , no ! [I]71-darrow know [...]164-... There’ve been moments ... ”[71-darrow] [He]71-darrow took [her]97-anna hand and raised it to [his]71-darrow lips . “ [They]3006-they ’ll be with [me]71-darrow as long as [I]71-darrow live . But [I]71-darrow ca n’t see [you]97-anna paying such a price for [them]3006-they . [I]71-darrow ’m not worth what [I]71-darrow ’m costing [you]97-anna . ”[71-darrow] [She]97-anna continued to gaze at [him]71-darrow through tear - dilated eyes ; and suddenly [she]97-anna flung out the question : “ Was n’t it the Athenee [you]71-darrow took [her]97-anna to that evening ? ”[97-anna] “ [Anna]97-anna -- [Anna]97-anna ! ”[97-anna] “ Yes ; [I]2216-she want to know now : to know everything . Perhaps that will make [me]2216-she forget . [I]2216-she ought to have made [you]97-anna tell [me]2216-she before . Wherever [we]3007-we go , [I]2216-she imagine [you]97-anna ’ve been there with [her]97-anna ... [I]2216-she see [you]97-anna together . [I]2216-she want to know how it began , where [you]97-anna went , why [you]97-anna left [her]97-anna ... [I]2216-she ca n’t go on in this darkness any longer ! ”[2216-she] [She]2216-she did not know what had prompted [her]2216-she passionate outburst , but already [she]2216-she felt lighter , freer , as if at last the evil spell were broken . “ [I]2216-she want to know everything , ”[2216-she] [she]2216-she repeated . “ It ’s the only way to make [me]2216-she forget . ”[2216-she] After [she]2216-she had ceased speaking [Darrow]71-darrow remained where [he]71-darrow was , [his]71-darrow arms folded , [his]71-darrow eyes lowered , immovable . [She]2216-she waited , [her]2216-she gaze on [his]71-darrow face . “ Are n’t [you]71-darrow going to tell [me]2216-she ? ”[2216-she] “ No . ”[2216-she] The blood rushed to [her]2216-she temples . “ [You]71-darrow wo n’t ? Why not ? ”[2216-she] “ If [I]2216-she did , do [you]71-darrow suppose [you]71-darrow ’d forget THAT ? ”[2216-she] “ Oh-- ”[2216-she] [she]2216-she moaned , and turned away from [him]71-darrow . “ [You]2216-she see it ’s impossible , ”[71-darrow] [he]71-darrow went on . “ [I]71-darrow ’ve done a thing [I]71-darrow loathe , and to atone for it [you]2216-she ask [me]71-darrow to do another . What sort of satisfaction would that give [you]2216-she ? It would put something irremediable between [us]3008-us . ”[71-darrow] [She]2216-she leaned [her]2216-she elbow against the mantel - shelf and hid [her]2216-she face in [her]2216-she hands . [She]2216-she had the sense that [she]2216-she was vainly throwing away [her]2216-she last hope of happiness , yet [she]2216-she could do nothing , think of nothing , to save it . The conjecture flashed through [her]2216-she : “ Should [I]2216-she be at peace if [I]2216-she gave [him]2217-him up ? ”[2216-she] and [she]2216-she remembered the desolation of the days after [she]2216-she had sent [him]2217-him away , and understood that that hope was vain . The tears welled through [her]2216-she lids and ran slowly down between [her]2216-she fingers . “ Good - bye , ”[2217-him] [she]2216-she heard [him]2217-him say , and [his]2217-him footsteps turned to the door . [She]2216-she tried to raise [her]2216-she head , but the weight of [her]2216-she despair bowed it down . [She]2216-she said to [herself]2216-she : “ This is the end ... [he]2217-him wo n’t try to appeal to [me]2216-she again ... ”[2216-she] and [she]2216-she remained in a sort of tranced rigidity , perceiving without feeling the fateful lapse of the seconds . Then the cords that bound [her]2216-she seemed to snap , and [she]2216-she lifted [her]2216-she head and saw [him]2217-him going . “ Why , [he]2217-him ’s [mine]2216-she -- [he]2217-him ’s mine ! [He]2217-him ’s [no one else]3009-no one else ’s ! ”[2216-she] [His]2217-him face was turned to [her]2216-she and the look in [his]2217-him eyes swept away all [her]2216-she terrors . [She]2216-she no longer understood what had prompted [her]2216-she senseless outcry ; and the mortal sweetness of loving [him]2217-him became again the one real fact in [the world]206-the world . XXXIX [Anna]97-anna , the next day , woke to a humiliated memory of the previous evening . [Darrow]71-darrow had been right in saying that [their]2219-their sacrifice would benefit [no one]325-no one ; yet [she]2216-she seemed dimly to discern that there were obligations not to be tested by that standard . [She]2216-she owed it , at any rate , as much to [his]2217-him pride as to [hers]2216-she to abstain from the repetition of such scenes ; and [she]2216-she had learned that it was beyond [her]2216-she power to do so while [they]2219-their were together . Yet when [he]2217-him had given [her]2216-she the chance to free [herself]2216-she , everything had vanished from [her]2216-she mind but the blind fear of losing [him]2217-him ; and [she]2216-she saw that [he]2217-him and [she]2216-she were as profoundly and inextricably bound together as two trees with interwoven roots . For a long time [she]2216-she brooded on [her]2216-she plight , vaguely conscious that the only escape from it must come from some external chance . And slowly the occasion shaped itself in [her]2216-she mind . It was [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner only who could save [her]2216-she -- [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner only who could give [her]2216-she back [her]2216-she lost serenity . [She]2216-she would seek [the girl]297-the girl out and tell [her]297-the girl that [she]2216-she had given [Darrow]71-darrow up ; and that step once taken there would be no retracing it , and [she]2216-she would perforce have to go forward alone . Any pretext for action was a kind of anodyne , and [she]2216-she despatched [[her]2216-she maid]1821-her maid to [the Farlows]94-the farlows ’ with a note asking if [Miss Viner]82-miss viner would receive [her]297-the girl . There was a long delay before [the maid]1826-the maid returned , and when at last [she]1826-the maid appeared it was with a slip of paper on which an address was written , and a verbal message to the effect that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner had left some days previously , and was staying with [[her]82-miss viner sister]2224-her sister in [a hotel near [the Place de l’Etoile]2226-the place de l’etoile]2225-a hotel near the place de l’etoile . [The maid]1826-the maid added that [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow , on the plea that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner ’s plans were uncertain , had at first made some difficulty about giving this information ; and [Anna]97-anna guessed that [the girl]297-the girl had left [[her]297-the girl friends]460-her friends ’ roof , and instructed [them]460-her friends to withhold [her]297-the girl address , with the object of avoiding [Owen]75-owen . “ [She]297-the girl ’s kept faith with [herself]297-the girl and [I]97-anna have n’t , ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna mused ; and the thought was a fresh incentive to action . [Darrow]71-darrow had announced [his]71-darrow intention of coming soon after luncheon , and the morning was already so far advanced that [Anna]97-anna , still mistrustful of [her]97-anna strength , decided to drive immediately to the address [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow had given . On the way [there]2294-there [she]97-anna tried to recall what [she]97-anna had heard of [[Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner ’s sister]2231-sophy viner ’s sister , but beyond [the girl]297-the girl ’s enthusiastic report of the absent [Laura]92-laura ’s loveliness [she]97-anna could remember only certain vague allusions of [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow ’s to [her]81-sophy viner artistic endowments and matrimonial vicissitudes . [Darrow]71-darrow had mentioned [her]297-the girl but once , and in the briefest terms , as having apparently very little concern for [Sophy]81-sophy viner ’s welfare , and being , at any rate , too geographically remote to give [her]297-the girl any practical support ; and [Anna]97-anna wondered what chance had brought [her]97-anna to [[her]97-anna sister]2224-her sister ’s side at this conjunction . [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow had spoken of [her]297-the girl as [a celebrity]2234-a celebrity ( in what line [Anna]97-anna failed to recall ) ; but [[Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow ’s celebrities]2235-mrs. farlow ’s celebrities were legion , and the name on the slip of paper -- [Mrs. McTarvie - Birch]165-mrs. birch -- did not seem to have any definite association with fame . While [Anna]97-anna waited in [the dingy vestibule of [the Hotel Chicago]2237-the hotel chicago]2236-the dingy vestibule of the hotel chicago [she]97-anna had so distinct a vision of what [she]97-anna meant to say to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner that [the girl]297-the girl seemed already to be before [her]97-anna ; and [her]97-anna heart dropped from all the height of its courage when [the porter]195-the porter , after a long delay , returned with the announcement that [Miss Viner]82-miss viner was no longer in [the hotel]443-the hotel . [Anna]97-anna , doubtful if [she]97-anna understood , asked if [he]195-the porter merely meant that [the young lady]269-the young lady was out at the moment ; but [he]195-the porter replied that [she]269-the young lady had gone away the day before . Beyond this [he]195-the porter had no information to impart , and after a moment ’s hesitation [Anna]97-anna sent [him]195-the porter back to enquire if [Mrs. McTarvie - Birch]165-mrs. birch would receive [her]269-the young lady . [She]97-anna reflected that [Sophy]81-sophy viner had probably pledged [[her]81-sophy viner sister]2224-her sister to the same secrecy as [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow , and that a personal appeal to [Mrs. Birch]165-mrs. birch might lead to less negative results . There was another long interval of suspense before [the porter]195-the porter reappeared with an affirmative answer ; and a third while an exiguous and hesitating lift bore [her]97-anna up past a succession of shabby landings . When the last was reached , and [[her]97-anna guide]2244-her guide had directed [her]97-anna down [a winding passage]2245-a winding passage that smelt of sea - going luggage , [she]97-anna found [herself]97-anna before a door through which a strong odour of tobacco reached [her]97-anna simultaneously with the sounds of a suppressed altercation . [Her]97-anna knock was followed by a silence , and after a minute or two the door was opened by [a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder led [her]97-anna to conclude that [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder had just risen from a long - limbed sprawl on a sofa strewn with tumbled cushions . This sofa , and a grand piano bearing a basket of faded roses , a biscuit - tin and a devastated breakfast tray , almost filled [the narrow sitting - room]2247-the narrow sitting - room , in the remaining corner of which [another man]2248-another man , short , swarthy and humble , sat examining the lining of [his]2248-another man hat . [Anna]97-anna paused in doubt ; but on [her]97-anna naming [Mrs. Birch]165-mrs. birch [the young man]217-the young man politely invited [her]97-anna to enter , at the same time casting an impatient glance at [the mute spectator in the background]2250-the mute spectator in the background . The latter , raising [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder eyes , which were round and bulging , fixed them , not on [the young man]217-the young man but on [Anna]97-anna , whom , for a moment , [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder scrutinized as searchingly as the interior of [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder hat . On the threshold [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder glance crossed that of [the young man]217-the young man in an exchange of intelligence as full as it was rapid ; and this brief scene left [Anna]97-anna so oddly enlightened that [she]97-anna felt no surprise when [[her]97-anna companion]395-her companion , pushing an arm - chair forward , sociably asked [her]97-anna if [she]97-anna would n’t have a cigarette . [Her]97-anna polite refusal provoked the remark that [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder would , if [she]97-anna ’d no objection ; and while [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder groped for matches in [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder loose pockets , and behind the photographs and letters crowding the narrow mantel - shelf , [she]97-anna ventured another enquiry for [Mrs. Birch]165-mrs. birch . “ Just a minute , ”[2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder] [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder smiled ; “ [I]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder think [the masseur]3010-the masseur ’s with [her]165-mrs. birch . ”[2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder] [He]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder spoke in a smooth denationalized English , which , like the look in [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder long - lashed eyes and the promptness of [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder charming smile , suggested a long training in all the arts of expediency . Having finally discovered a match - box on the floor beside the sofa , [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder lit [his]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder cigarette and dropped back among the cushions ; and on [Anna]97-anna ’s remarking that [she]97-anna was sorry to disturb [Mrs. Birch]165-mrs. birch [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder replied that that was all right , and that [she]165-mrs. birch always kept [everybody]312-everybody waiting . Before a reply was possible there was a convulsive stir beneath the pink expanse , and something that resembled another powder - puff hurled itself at [Anna]97-anna with a volley of sounds like the popping of Lilliputian champagne corks . [Mrs. Birch]165-mrs. birch , flinging [herself]165-mrs. birch forward , gasped out : “ If [you]97-anna ’d just give [him]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder a caramel ... there , in that box on the dressing - table ... it ’s the only earthly thing to stop [him]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder ... ”[165-mrs. birch] and when [Anna]97-anna had proffered this sop to [[her]97-anna assailant]2265-her assailant , and [he]2265-her assailant had withdrawn with it beneath the bedspread , [[his]2265-her assailant mistress]2266-his mistress sank back with a laugh . “ Is n’t [he]2246-a handsome young man whose ruffled hair and general air of creased disorder [a beauty]3011-a beauty ? In the roseate penumbra of the bed - curtains [she]97-anna presented to [Anna]97-anna ’s startled gaze an odd chromo - like resemblance to [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner , or a suggestion , rather , of what [Sophy Viner]81-sophy viner might , with the years and in spite of the powder - puff , become . Larger , blonder , heavier - featured , [she]97-anna yet had glances and movements that disturbingly suggested what was freshest and most engaging in [the girl]297-the girl ; and as [she]97-anna stretched [her]97-anna bare plump arm across the bed [she]97-anna seemed to be pulling back the veil from dingy distances of family history . “ Do sit down , if there ’s a place to sit on , ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna cordially advised ; adding , as [Anna]97-anna took the edge of a chair hung with miscellaneous raiment : “ [My]97-anna singing takes so much time that [I]97-anna do n’t get a chance to walk the fat off -- that ’s the worst of being [an artist]3013-an artist . ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna murmured an assent . “ [I]97-anna hope it has n’t inconvenienced [you]231-the latter to see [me]97-anna ; [I]97-anna told [Mr. Birch--]3014-mr. birch-- ”[97-anna] “ [Mr. WHO]166-mr. who ? ”[97-anna] [the recumbent beauty]2269-the recumbent beauty asked ; and then : “ Oh , [JIMMY]87-jimmy brance ! ”[97-anna] [she]97-anna faintly laughed , as if more for [her]97-anna own enlightenment than [Anna]97-anna ’s . [The latter]231-the latter continued eagerly : “ [I]231-the latter understand from [Mrs. Farlow]96-mrs. farlow that [[your]231-the latter sister]3015-your sister was with [you]231-the latter , and [I]231-the latter ventured to come up because [I]231-the latter wanted to ask [you]231-the latter when [I]231-the latter should have a chance of finding [her]3015-your sister . ”[231-the latter] [Mrs. McTarvie - Birch]165-mrs. birch threw back [her]165-mrs. birch head with a long stare . “ Do [you]231-the latter mean to say [the idiot at the door]3016-the idiot at the door did n’t tell [you]231-the latter ? [Sophy]81-sophy viner went away last night . ”[165-mrs. birch] “ Last night ? ”[97-anna] [Anna]97-anna echoed . A sudden terror had possessed [her]97-anna .
